Response 4: Secure all drains prior to admitting any steam to avoid damage to traps.

Question: The net positive suction head of a boiler centrifugal feed pump should be calculated to include the feed water vapor pressure and the __________.
The boiler main feed pump aboard ship can operate with high temperature water without becoming vapor bound because the __________.
Response 1: pump operates at a high discharge pressure
Response 2: constant-pressure governor controls the discharge pressure
Response 3: area above the impeller eye is vented to the main condenser
Response 4: minimum required net positive suction pressure is provided by the DC heater

Question: During initial starting of the standby turbine-driven feed pump which of the listed valves should remain closed?
When starting a turbine driven boiler feed pump care should be taken to insure that the recirculating valve is open. Which of the following valves should be closed when starting?
If a centrifugal main feed pump were operated at shutoff head with the recirculating line closed which of the following conditions could occur?
Response 1: A decreased water level in the DC heater.
Response 2: An increased water level in the steam drum.
Response 3: Flashing at the suction side of the pump.
Response 4: Excessive diaphragm seal wear in the feed water regulator.

Question: A turbine-driven centrifugal feed pump used for boiler feed service should normally be stopped by __________.
Response 1: hand activating the over speed trip
Response 2: closing off the steam via the excess pressure pump governor
Response 4: opening wide the recirculating valve and then manually closing the throttle

Question: An auxiliary turbine boiler feed pump should normally be stopped by __________.
Response 2: actuating the throttle hand tripping device
Response 3: rotating the hand lube oil pump backwards
Response 4: increasing the load on the driven unit

Question: An excess pressure governor would normally be used on a __________.
The constant pressure governor of a turbine-driven feed pump maintains which of the following pressures at a constant value for all capacities?
Which of the listed items are the two most commonly used opposing forces involved in the operation of a constant pressure boiler feed pump governor?
Response 1: Steam inlet pressure and pump discharge pressure.
Response 2: Pilot valve steam pressure and control valve spring pressure.
Response 3: Steam inlet pressure and adjusting spring tension.
Response 4: Pump discharge pressure and adjusting spring compression.

Question: When operating with the auxiliary feed line feed water flow is controlled __________.
Response 1: manually by throttling the auxiliary feed stop-check valve
Response 2: automatically by the main feed water regulator
Response 3: manually by adjustment of the auxiliary feed water regulator spring setting

Question: Which system should be tested and used when required to raise the water level in an idle boiler?
Which system should be used when required to raise the water level in an idle boiler?
Under EMERGENCY operating conditions the proper valve positions for controlling feed water to the boiler should be the __________.
Response 1: auxiliary stop-check valve fully open and the auxiliary stop valve used to regulate the amount of flow
Response 2: auxiliary stop valve fully open and the auxiliary stop-check valve used to regulate the amount of flow
Response 3: auxiliary stop and stop-check valves fully open and the feed pump speed used to regulate the amount of flow
Response 4: auxiliary stop-check valve fully open and the auxiliary stop valve regulated by the feed water regulator

Question: The main feed check valve functions to __________.
Response 1: check pressure pulsations in the feed line
Response 2: prevent backflow of water from the boiler in the event of a feed pump failure
Response 3: provide feed pump positive discharge head
Response 4: reduce feed pump discharge pressure loading

Question: Which of the following is the advantage of operating a typical closed feed water system for a marine boiler when compared to an open feed water system?
Response 1: Reduced steam requirement for feed water heating.
Response 2: Increased capability of removing and controlling dissolved oxygen.
Response 4: Allows for lower feed pump operating pressures.

Question: Which piping system is described in the illustration provided. See illustration SG-0010.
Deaeration of condensate primarily occurs in what section of the illustration shown. See illustration SG-0010.
A boiler feed stop-valve must be mounted __________.
Response 1: between the feed check valve and the boiler drum
Response 2: between the feed pump and the feed check valve
Response 3: upstream of the feed water regulator
Response 4: at or near the engine room operating platform

Question: Which of the listed order of valves represents the proper installation of the main feed water supply line to a marine propulsion boiler?
The boiler main feed stop check valve is located nearest the __________.
Response 2: first stage feed water heater outlet

Question: A boiler feed stop-check valve would be located at the __________.
Response 2: first stage feed water heater outlet

Question: In the boiler steam and water system pressure is highest in the __________.
The pressure in the feed water system must exceed boiler steam drum pressure in order to __________.
Response 1: prevent water hammer in the lines
Response 2: prevent air leakage into the feed water system
Response 3: force the feed water into the boiler
Response 4: remove the steam from the steam drum

Question: Which of the following statements describes those portions of the piping maintained under positive pressure when a pressure-closed feed system is in operation?
Response 1: All condensate and feed piping except for a short section between the condenser and condensate pump.
Response 2: Only the section between the condensate pump and deaerating feed tank.
Response 3: Only the section between the deaerating feed tank and the boiler.
Response 4: Only the section between the condenser and the condensate pump.

Question: If it is necessary to operate a turbine driven main feed pump at shut off head or at less than 20% of its rated capacity what will prevent the pump from overheating?
Response 1: Throttling of the steam supply valve.
Response 2: Throttling of the liquid discharge valve.
Response 3: A bypass or recirculating line led back to the pump impeller eye or suction.
Response 4: A bypass or recirculating line led back to the source of suction supply.

Question: Recirculation of the feed water ensures a flow of water through the __________.
The purpose of the recirculating line between the turbine driven feed pump and the DC heater is to __________.
Response 1: ensure a steady boiler water level at all loads
Response 2: seal the labyrinth packing on the pump
Response 3: ensure sufficient flow through the feed pump at low load

Question: To prevent pulsations from developing in the boiler feed water lines the discharge side of a reciprocating feed pump is equipped with a/an __________.
Makeup feed water is brought into an operating closed feed system via the __________.
Which of the devices listed is used to keep overheated condensate from flowing to the deaerating feed tank?
Response 3: Recirculating line to the main condenser
Response 4: Recirculating line to the main feed pump

Question: Which of the listed components would be considered the dividing line separating the condensate system from the feed water system?
Discharging an excessive amount of make-up feed water into the DC heater during normal steaming conditions could cause __________.
Excessive water loss from the main feed system can be caused by __________.
Response 1: an atmospheric drain tank trap frozen in the closed position
Response 2: excessive recirculation of condensate from the outlet of the air ejector condenser to the main condenser
Response 3: a vapor bound main condensate pump
Response 4: a leak in the desuperheater internal gasket

Question: To properly sound a reserve feed water tank you should use a/an__________.
Response 3: manila line with an attached weight

Question: Using a dry uncoated sounding rod or tape to measure the depth of water in a reserve feed water tank will __________.
Response 4: be satisfactory if a small amount of oil is floating on the surface

Question: Which piping system is described in the illustration provided. See illustration SG-0010.
From where does the air ejector take its suction on a Soloshell double effect distilling unit?
If a flash-type evaporator is operating in extremely cold seawater temperatures the engineer may expect that __________.
Response 1: the evaporator feed heater will require less steam
Response 2: the capacity will remain the same regardless of the evaporator shell temperature
Response 3: the average salinity of the distillate may increase due to excessive vacuum
Response 4: the average salinity of the distillate may decrease due to excessive vacuum

Question: While at sea the flash type evaporator is discharging the output to the distill tanks. If it becomes necessary to reduce the feed water temperature below 165F you should __________.
Response 2: dump the evaporator to the bilge
Response 3: secure the evaporator until the feed water temperature can be raised to 165F or more
Response 4: raise the tripping point at the salinity indicating panel for the three-way valve

Question: While at sea the flash type evaporator is discharging the output to the boiler water reserve feed tanks. If it becomes necessary to reduce the evaporator feed water temperature to below 165F you should _______.
Response 1: decrease the steam pressure to the air ejectors
Response 2: dump the distillate to the bilge
Response 3: secure the evaporator until the feed water temperature can be raised to 165F or more
Response 4: lower the feed water trip point temperature at the indicating panel for the three-way dump valve

Question: During the operation of a flash-type evaporator the distillate flow meter indicates the output has significantly decreased from the previous day. Although all shell pressures appear normal which of the following could be the probable cause for the decrease in output?
Response 1: A leak has developed in the distillate collection tray.
Response 2: Excessive L.P. extraction steam is flowing to the feed water heater.
Response 3: Feed water temperature is being introduced at 170F.
Response 4: Distillate output temperature is being discharged at 100F.

Question: If the evaporator feed temperature from a flash type evaporator falls below 160F __________.
Response 1: the distillate may be directed to the storage tanks
Response 2: the automatic three-way solenoid dump valve should direct distillate to the bilge
Response 4: priming will occur in the first-effect

Question: In a two-stage flash-type evaporator excess brine in the first stage automatically passes __________.
Response 1: directly to the second stage feed heater
Response 2: directly overboard through the brine cooler
Response 3: into the second stage flash chamber
Response 4: into the second stage vapor condenser

Question: Which of the listed conditions will cause the feed water that has not flashed to vapor in the first-stage of a flash evaporator to flow into the second-stage?
Response 3: Difference in brine density between first and second stages

Question: When a flash evaporator is being operated in extremely cold water you may need to throttle the seawater supply to __________.
Response 2: maintain the feed water temperature above the required minimum input temperature

Question: A flash type evaporator is designed to operate in 75F sea water if operated in 50F sea water __________.
Response 1: the absolute pressures will be slightly below the predicted design absolute pressures
Response 2: absolute pressure in the evaporator stages will be higher
Response 3: the unit will operate at reduced capacity
Response 4: thermal efficiency will decrease but brine density will increase

Question: In a flash type evaporator all saltwater headers are vented through individual vent cocks to the __________.
In a flash type evaporator all saltwater headers are vented through individual vent cocks to the __________.

Where a two-stage air ejector set is used in a two-stage flash evaporator the first-stage air ejector takes suction from the second stage of the evaporator and the second stage air ejector __________.
Response 1: takes suction from the first stage of the evaporator
Response 2: takes suction from the second stage of the evaporator as well
Response 3: takes suction from the first stage ejector discharge
Response 4: is normally idle and used mainly as a standby unit

Question: For optimum non-condensable gas removal from a low pressure evaporator the air ejector suction is usually taken directly from __________.
Response 1: the salt water feed heater shell
Response 2: anywhere on the second stage shell of the evaporator
Response 3: the shell of the first stage distilling condenser
Response 4: the shell of the second stage distilling condenser

Question: The function of the loop seal as typically provided on a flash type evaporator is to __________.
Response 1: aid in establishing a vacuum in the first stage via the second stage
Response 2: transfer the distillate produced in the first stage to the second stage
Response 3: aid in establishing a vacuum in the second stage via the first stage
Response 4: aid in developing a vacuum in the shell of the salt water feed heater

Question: A vacuum differential is maintained in the distillate circuit between any two stages of a multiple stage distilling plant by the use of a/an __________.
While in operation the function of the orifice in the flash evaporator loop seal is to __________.
Response 1: maintain the absolute pressure difference between the first and second stages
Response 2: allow vacuum to be drawn from the first stage shell to the second stage shell
Response 3: allow vacuum to be drawn from the second stage shell to the first stage shell
Response 4: aid in maintaining the difference in absolute pressure between the second stage shell and the salt water feed heater

Question: If the orifice in the loop seal of a flash evaporator were to become significantly enlarged through erosion the __________.
Response 1: distillate produced in the second stage would flow towards the first stage
Response 2: evaporator absolute pressure would eventually equalize in both stages to that of the first stage
Response 3: evaporator absolute pressure could eventually equalize in both stages to that of the second stage
Response 4: salt water feed heater absolute pressure would increase to that of the evaporator second stage

Question: The size of the loop seal orifice for a flash-type evaporator is important for maintaining the control of __________.
Response 1: the vacuum differential developed between both stages
Response 2: the absolute pressure differential developed between both stages
Response 3: the absolute pressure developed in the salt water feed heater shell
Response 4: maintaining distillate flow between the first and second stage in order to avoid dry seal operation of the loop

Question: In a two stage flash distilling plant which of the pumps listed is vented to the shell of the second stage in order to remove vapor from the pump suction?
In the operation of a two-stage flash-type distilling plant which of the pumps listed should be vented to the second stage shell in order to remove vapors from the pump suction?
In the event of a power failure to the salinity panel on a flash-type evaporator the three-way solenoid valve will __________.
Response 1: be frozen in its last position
Response 2: direct distillate to the fresh water tank
Response 4: dump distillate to the makeup feed tank

Question: The distillate produced by a flash evaporator has a salinity of 0.21 grains per gallon with a feed water temperature entering the first-stage of the evaporator at 170F. Under these conditions the three-way solenoid valve will __________.
Response 2: direct distillate to the freshwater tanks
Response 3: recirculate distillate to the first-stage feed inlet
Response 4: recirculate distillate to the distiller saltwater heater

Question: If the distillate temperature is 150F and the distillate salinity is 0.35 grains per gallon the three-way solenoid trip valve should direct the distillate to the __________.
Which of the following statements describes the operation of a three-way solenoid trip/dump valve on a two stage flash-type evaporator?
Response 1: The valve normally requires a manual latch reset after tripping.
Response 2: The valve is set to trip if the sea water feed temperature exceeds 180F.
Response 3: The valve will only trip when the solenoid is energized.
Response 4: The valve will trip if the distillate salinity is excessively low.

Question: Steam supply for the operation of the low pressure evaporators may be obtained directly from the __________.
The temperature of the steam supply to the saltwater feed heater in a flash type evaporator can be manipulated by a/an __________.
Response 1: pressure regulator within the supply orifice
Response 3: attemporator in the steam supply piping
Response 4: sensor wired in with the three-way salinity dump valve

Question: The second stage feed water temperature and shell absolute pressure in a multistage flash type distilling plant is __________.
Response 1: higher than the first stage feed water temperature and absolute shell pressure
Response 2: lower than the first stage feed water temperature and absolute shell pressure
Response 3: the same as the first stage feed water temperature and absolute shell pressure
Response 4: not related to the feed water temperature and absolute shell pressure

Question: The first stage feed water temperature and shell absolute pressure in a multistage flash evaporator is __________.
Response 1: equal to the second stage feed water temperature and shell absolute pressure
Response 2: higher than the second stage feed water temperature and shell absolute pressure
Response 3: lower than the feed water temperature and shell absolute pressure in the second stage
Response 4: higher than the second stage feed water temperature but at a lower shell absolute pressure

Question: In a two stage flash evaporator operating conditions in the second stage as compared to the first stage are __________.
Response 1: higher temperature and higher absolute pressure
Response 2: higher temperature and lower absolute pressure
Response 3: lower temperature and higher absolute pressure
Response 4: lower temperature and lower absolute pressure

Question: The efficiency of a flash type evaporator can be increased by __________.
Response 2: decreasing the absolute pressure of each stage
Response 3: increasing the saltwater feed heater temperature
Response 4: increasing the pressure at the spray pipe

Question: The efficiency of a flash type evaporator can be increased by __________.
Response 2: decreasing the absolute pressure of each stage
Response 4: increasing the pressure at the spray pipe

Question: In the operation of a flash type evaporator equipped with air ejectors the air and non-condensable gases are evacuated directly from the __________.
A vacuum is initially created in a flash type distilling plant by __________.
Response 1: the flashing of the feed water
Response 2: the condensation of the saltwater feed
Response 3: air ejectors eductors or a separate vacuum pump

Question: Why would a flash type distilling unit be more efficient when operated in cooler seawater temperatures?
Response 1: Steam carryover between stages is reduced.
Response 3: The amount of available flash steam is decreased.
Response 4: Feed water flow from the feed water heater is increased.

Question: Why will a two stage flash type distilling plant tend to operate more efficiently when operating in cold seawater?
Response 1: The colder seawater passing through the condenser tube bundles of the various stages increases evaporator vacuum.
Response 2: The amount of heated feed water discharged from the feed water heater after condenser is increased.
Response 3: Fewer non-condensable gases are created by the flow of colder seawater.
Response 4: More seawater is allowed to pass through the first stage overflow weir.

Question: The quantity of heating steam supplied to the feed water heater of a two-stage flash type distilling plant is held relatively constant by a/an __________.

A fixed orifice plate is generally installed in the live steam supply to a flash evaporator. One of the functions of this orifice is to control the quantity of the supplied steam. A second function is to __________.
Response 1: reduce pressure fluctuations of the steam supply in the salt water feed heater
Response 2: produce more useful desuperheated supply steam
Response 3: guarantee that the steam supply will remain saturated
Response 4: produce a low salt water feed heater shell absolute pressure

Question: The condensers located in the various stages of a flash evaporator are cooled by __________.
In a two-stage flash evaporator the sea water feed temperature is increased as it passes through the __________.
In a flash distilling unit evaporator feed (seawater) first absorbs heat in the __________.
The heated feed water entering any flash chamber of a flash-type evaporator will __________.
Response 1: vaporize with the unflashed water remaining at the temperature at which it entered the flash chamber
Response 2: vaporize with the unflashed water equalizing to the saturation conditions existing in the flash chamber
Response 3: vaporize with the remaining water at a temperature greater than it entered the flash chamber
Response 4: boil allowing steam bubbles to rise through the brine at the bottom of the flash chamber

Question: The absolute pressure maintained in the shell of the salt water feed heater on most flash evaporators used on steam propelled vessels is __________.
Response 1: slightly less than the absolute pressure of the L.P. extraction
Response 2: slightly more than the supplied live steam pressure at the reducing valve outlet
Response 3: slightly higher than the second stage vacuum
Response 4: slightly lower than the first stage vacuum

Question: The vacuum maintained in the salt water feed heater shell of a flash-type evaporator is generally accomplished by __________.
Response 2: a direct unimpeded connection between second stage and salt water feed heater
Response 3: by an external line from the first stage via a fixed orifice
Response 4: the fixed orifice provided in the steam supply line

Question: Early models of the flash-type evaporators used a separate shell-and-tube heat exchanger as the air ejector condenser. More recent models use a combined air ejector condenser with the __________.
The final heating of the feed water in a flash type distilling plant is carried out by __________.
Response 1: low pressure steam admitted to the feed water heater
Response 2: heat exchange in the first-stage feedbox
Response 3: vaporization in the first-stage flash chamber
Response 4: heat exchange in each stage distiller condenser

Question: Under normal operating conditions the highest temperature and pressure conditions existing for flash-type evaporators will occur in the __________.
In the unit illustrated the feed water temperature is required to be increased to 165F or greater and must exist at this temperature when leaving __________. See illustration GS-0053.
In a two stage flash evaporator heated feed water is vaporized in the __________.
Response 3: first and second stage flash chambers
Response 4: first and second stage vapor separators

Question: Which of the following descriptions best identifies the operating principal of a flash-type evaporator?
Response 1: Sea water is heated to boiling temperature while under a vacuum.
Response 2: Sea water is passed over heated plates in a thin film.
Response 3: Heated sea water is injected into a vacuum chamber.
Response 4: Sea water is forced through a heated eductor.

Question: In a flash evaporator heated water under pressure is converted into vapor by suddenly __________.
Vapor is produced in a flash evaporator by introducing __________.
Response 3: heated water into a high pressure area
Response 4: heated water into a low pressure area

Question: Feed water supplied to a flash type distilling plant will flash to vapor in the first-stage due to the flash chamber __________.
Response 1: pressure being lower than the saturation pressure corresponding to the feed water temperature
Response 2: temperature being higher than the evaporation temperature of the supplied feed water
Response 3: heat exchange surfaces being directly in the path of the entering feed water
Response 4: orifices finely atomizing the heated feed water entering the flash chamber

Question: A flash type distilling plant is more efficient than a high pressure evaporator as __________.
Feed water supplied to a flash type distilling plant will flash to vapor in the first-stage due to __________.
Response 1: flash chamber pressure being lower than the saturation pressure corresponding to the feed water temperature
Response 2: temperature being higher than the evaporation temperature of the supplied feed water
Response 3: heat exchange surfaces being directly in the path of the entering feed water
Response 4: orifices finely atomizing the heated feed water entering the flash chamber

Question: The flash chamber of a soloshell evaporator is typically an external chamber used for the combining of the distillate produced at two different absolute pressures. On a multistage flash-type evaporator the flash chamber is __________.
Response 1: combined as part of the salt water feed heater
Response 2: the open area above the brine levels in the first and second stages
Response 3: combined as part of the distillate cooler
Response 4: another term used to describe the vapor feed heater

Question: On a multistage flash-type evaporator the flash chamber is __________.
Response 1: combined as part of the salt water feed heater
Response 2: the open area above the brine levels in the first and second stages
Response 3: combined as part of the distillate cooler
Response 4: another term used to describe the vapor feed heater

Question: If a hole were to form in the division plate between stages of a flash type evaporator __________.
If a hole were to form in the division plate between stages of a flash type evaporator __________.
If a hole were to form in the division plate between stages of a flash type evaporator __________.
Response 1: vaporization of the feed water would continue at second stage designed saturation conditions
Response 2: all of the distillate produced would be certain to be contaminated by salt water carry over

Question: The efficiency and output capacity of a low pressure distilling plant will be greatly reduced if __________.
Response 1: the second effect shell pressure is lower than the first effect

Question: In which of the areas listed would you expect to find the highest salt concentration in a flash evaporator?
The brine level in the second-stage of a flash-type evaporator is determined in part by the feed rate the rate of evaporation in both stages and the __________.
Response 1: steam flow rate to the air ejectors
Response 2: float controlled level of the feed heater
Response 4: throughput of the brine overboard pump

Question: In a two stage flash type evaporator the brine overboard pump is vented directly to the __________.
Scale formation in a flash-type evaporator is usually found in the __________.
Response 2: tubes of the salt water feed heater
Response 3: tubes of the air ejector condenser

Question: In the operation of a two-stage flash type distilling plant the rate of scale formation is greatly reduced by __________.
Response 1: operating the unit at its rated capacity
Response 2: maintaining a relatively high feed water temperature
Response 3: the fact that the first-stage regulator keeps the heater shell at a constant pressure
Response 4: the fact that no boiling occurs on heat transfer surfaces anywhere in the unit

Question: The rate of scale formation in a flash type distilling plant is greatly reduced by __________.
Response 1: operating the unit at its rated capacity
Response 2: maintaining a relatively high feed water temperature
Response 3: water flashing into vapor rather than boiling on the heat transfer surfaces
Response 4: operating the first-stage regulator to maintain a constant shell pressure

Question: The thickest deposit of scale in a flash evaporator is most likely to occur in the tubes of the __________.
One distinct advantage of flash type evaporators as compared to most other evaporators is that in a flash evaporator shell __________.
Response 1: high temperature distillate can be recirculated to induce additional flashing
Response 2: scale formation is not a severe problem
Response 3: cold shocking is more effective in removing scale
Response 4: water purity is greatly increased at high capacity

Question: Small droplets of water entrained in the flashed vapor produced in a flash-type evaporator are removed by the __________.
In a two-stage flash-type distilling plant the mesh-type vapor separators function to __________.
Response 4: direct flash steam into the cooler

Question: The demisters installed in a flash-type evaporator serve to __________.
Response 3: deaerate the first and second effect distillate
Response 4: remove small water droplets entrained in the flashed vapor

Question: The mesh type steam separators located in a two-stage flash distilling plant function to __________.
In order to prevent salt water contamination of the distillate in a flash-type evaporator it is important to provide a positive seal around the __________.
Early models of the flash-type evaporators required a pump to drain the steam condensate from the salt water feed heater. This pump would normally discharge to the __________.
When conducting a hydrostatic test on the distillate cooler shell of a flash type evaporator liquid appears well inside one of the tubes. In order to correct this you should __________.
Response 4: all of the above would be considered satisfactory as a temporary repair until permanent repairs may be conducted

Question: When securing a flash-type evaporator for an extended period of time you should __________.
Response 2: fill the unit with descaling compound
Response 4: tightly seal the unit to exclude air

Question: When a flash-type evaporator is to be secured for an extended period of time the entire unit should be drained cleaned and __________.
Air leaking into a flash type distilling plant could occur through __________.
Irregular feeding or surging of the feed water supply to a flash evaporator may be attributed to __________.
Response 1: erratic water flow through the air eductor
Response 2: a clogged vent line from the air eductor condenser
Response 3: excessive pressure in the seawater feed heater
Response 4: a dirty strainer in the saltwater feed pump suction line

Question: High salinity distillate being discharged from a flash-type distilling plant may be the result of __________.
Response 1: maintaining the proper distilling plant heat balance
Response 2: carrying the brine level below normal
Response 4: venting of the saltwater heater drain pump

Question: Tube leaks in the distillate cooler of a two stage flash evaporator will result in __________.
Response 4: contamination of the second stage condenser

Question: A high reading at a salinity cell located in the loop seal between two stages of a flash type evaporator would indicate __________.
Response 1: chill shocking is necessary to remove scale
Response 3: faulty operation of the brine overboard pump

Question: A high reading is indicated at the salinity cells labeled "Y" "Q" and "6" shown in the illustration. This would be the probable result of __________. See illustration GS-0053.
A high reading is only indicated at the salinity cells labeled "W" and "6" shown in the illustration. This would be the probable result of __________. See illustration GS-0053.
Response 1: a tube leak in item 'IV' which contributes to a surging absolute pressure in "III"
Response 2: a faulty cell at location "6" and a tube leak in item 'IV'
Response 3: erosion of item "3" or the valve opened too wide if used

Question: A high reading is only indicated at the salinity cell labeled "6" shown in the illustration. This would be the probable result of __________. See illustration GS-0053.
Response 1: a minor tube leak in the distillate condenser in item "III"
Response 2: a faulty cell at this location
Response 3: the compensating temperature is set too low for this cell location

Question: If a higher than normal water level is observed through the inspection port of a flash evaporator you should suspect __________.
Response 1: a leak in the feed water heater

Question: An excessively high brine level in a flash evaporator can be caused by __________.
Response 2: an excessive brine blow down rate

Question: Carryover in a flash type distilling plant can be a result of __________.
Response 1: faulty operation of the brine overboard pump
Response 2: a pressure drop through the loop seal

Question: In a flash type distilling plant a screen is fitted over the suction connection to the brine overboard pump in order to prevent __________.
Response 2: excessively large salt crystals from damaging the pump
Response 3: scale from passing into the brine pump and clogging impeller passages
Response 4: electrolysis from occurring in the pump

Question: In the illustrated 8000 GPD evaporator the salt water feed pump and pump "N" are identically constructed. If the vapor pressure in chamber "II" is 2.1 psia with a feed temperature of 170F; operating pump "N" with the discharge valve 100% open will __________. See illustration GS-0053.
Response 1: produce the designed quantity of distillate
Response 2: contribute to chamber "II" and "III" operating at the same absolute pressure
Response 3: increase the purity of the distillate
Response 4: produce a higher than normal brine concentrate

Question: Partially clogged or scored nozzles in a two stage air ejector unit of a flash distilling plant could result in a __________.
Response 1: fluctuating vacuum in the flash chamber
Response 3: high water level in the air ejector after condenser
Response 4: malfunctioning check valve in the air ejector discharge

Question: A multistage flash evaporator will be unable to produce consistently pure distillate if the __________.
Response 2: tubes of the saltwater feed heater are flooded internally

Question: Which of the listed problems could produce a high absolute pressure within a flash type evaporator?
Response 3: a leak in the first stage demister
Response 4: a cracked distillate pump vent line

Question: Fluctuating pressures and temperatures in a low pressure fresh water evaporator will __________.
Response 1: eliminate most of the scale formation in the first effect
Response 2: increase the heat level in all effects

Question: Excessive scale formation in a distilling plant may result from __________.
When any low pressure distilling plant is operated at less than the designed vacuum (higher absolute pressure) what happens?
Response 3: the rate of scale formation increases

Question: On which of the following heated surfaces of a flash type evaporator would you be more likely to find soft scale formation?
Response 1: Feed water heater internal tube surfaces.

Question: In a flash evaporator scale as a result of higher than normal temperatures is most likely to occur in the __________.
While the illustrated system is operated at sea the strainer in line "4" becomes fouled this will result in __________. See illustration GS-0053.
Response 1: a significant reduction in distillate production
Response 3: the temperature regulated by "L" difficult to maintain
Response 4: nothing unusual for the area of operation indicated

Question: While the illustrated system is operated using the steam supply through "F" the strainer in line "4" becomes fouled this will result in __________. See illustration GS-0053.
Response 3: the temperature regulated by "L" difficult to maintain
Response 4: nothing unusual for the type of operation indicated as this line was unnecessary in the installation

Question: While operating a two-stage flash-type evaporator designed to operate in sea water of 70F the current seawater temperature is 50F while the salt water feed temperature is maintained at 170F. The three-way solenoid valve trips directing the distillate pump discharge to the bilge. Which of the following conditions is the probable cause for this occurrence?
Response 1: Excessive and violent flashing in each stage.
Response 2: Insufficient vacuum developed as a result of the sea temperature.
Response 3: Excessive amount of feed water being supplied to the first stage.
Response 4: Insufficient brine density being maintained in the second stage.

Question: Indicated high salinity of the distillate discharged from a flash-type distilling plant will be a result of __________.
Response 2: carrying the brine level below normal

Question: An excessively high brine level in a flash evaporator can be caused by __________.
Response 1: excessive vacuum in the first effect shell
Response 2: an excessive brine blow down rate

Question: While standing watch in the engine room you suspect air leaking into a flash type distilling plant. The most probable cause(s) of the air leak could occur through __________.

Standing watch in the engine room a high reading is only indicated at the salinity cell labeled "6" shown in the illustration. This would be the probable result of __________. See illustration GS-0053.
Response 1: a minor tube leak in the distillate condenser in section III
Response 2: a faulty cell at this location
Response 3: the compensating temperature is set too low for this cell location

Question: An indication of high salinity in the distillate discharged from a low pressure distilling plant can be the result of __________.
Response 1: maintaining the proper distilling plant heat balance
Response 2: carrying the brine level below normal
Response 4: venting of the saltwater heater drain pump

Question: If a higher than normal water level is observed through the inspection port of a low pressure distilling plant you should suspect __________.
Response 1: a leak in the feed water heater

Question: An excessively high brine level in a low pressure distilling plant can be caused by __________.
Response 2: an excessive brine blow down rate

Question: While standing watch in the engine room you suspect an air leak while checking a low pressure distilling plant. Which of the following should be checked as a possible cause of the air leak?
While standing watch underway if the brine level of a low pressure distilling plant is above the sight glass which action should be taken?
Response 1: Do nothing as this is the normal operating level.
Response 2: Reduce the feed rate and check the brine eductor system.
Response 3: The brine overflow weir should be raised to allow greater outflow.
Response 4: The brine section should be drained down a minimum of 6 inches below the seawater heater bundle.

Question: The efficiency of a flash type evaporator can be increased by ______.
Response 1: increasing the saltwater feed heater temperature
Response 2: decreasing the absolute pressure of each stage
Response 4: increasing the pressure at the spray pipe

Question: What is the function of device "A" shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: It aids in removing condenser tube bundles.
Response 2: It provides a conduit for incoming feed water.
Response 3: It is only used as a lifting beam during installation.
Response 4: It serves as a hinge for ease of opening the shell.

Question: The primary function of line 'J' shown in the illustration is to ______. See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: remove air and non-condensable gases from the unit
Response 2: remove condensable gases from the unit
Response 3: allow for removal of produced distillate

Question: The function of device "O" shown in the illustration is to ______. See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: provide a positive suction head for the brine pump
Response 2: regulate the amount of brine entering the unit
Response 3: control the amount of brine exiting the evaporator
Response 4: control the amount of feed water entering the evaporator

Question: Scale formation in a flash-type evaporator is usually found in the ______.
Response 3: tubes of the salt water feed heater
Response 4: tubes of the air ejector condenser

Question: A vacuum is initially created in a flash type distilling plant by ______.
Response 1: the flashing of the feed water
Response 2: air ejectors eductors or a separate vacuum pump
Response 3: the condensation of the saltwater feed

Question: Early models of the flash-type evaporators used a separate shell -and-tube heat exchanger as the air ejector condenser. More recent models use a combined air ejector condenser with the ______.
What would be the first indication that a tube leak has occurred in area "23"? See illustration MO-0111.
Response 1: The level in area "3" would decrease.
Response 2: The level in area "3" would increase.
Response 3: The level in area "1" would increase.
Response 4: The level in area "1" would decrease.

Question: When securing a jacket-water heated submerged tube evaporator for an extended period of time you should ______.
Response 2: fill the unit with descaling compound
Response 4: tightly seal the unit to exclude air

Question: Which of the following acids is preferable and most commonly used for scale removal from the heating surfaces of the jacket-water heated submerged-tube evaporator?
What occurs in the space labeled "G" of the device shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: Jacket water is heated in the boiling chamber.
Response 2: The feed water enters the device and vaporizes under vacuum conditions.
Response 3: The feed water is cooled prior to being pumped into section "F".

Question: What is the function of device "B" shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: It serves to boil off incoming feed water.
Response 2: It condenses the vapors formed in section "G".
Response 3: It removes sensible heat from the jacket water.
Response 4: It serves to cool incoming feed water.

Question: What is the function of device 'C' shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: The division plate creates a pressure drop between the two stages.
Response 2: It allows for access into section 'F'.
Response 3: It controls the amount of vapor produced in section 'F'.
Response 4: It removes moisture entrained in the vapors produced in section 'G'.

Question: What is the function of item 'D' shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0110.
Response 2: It heats the entering feed water.
Response 3: It causes the jacket water to evaporate.
Response 4: It heats the jacket water entering the device.

Question: Which of the freshwater generators listed below requires a source of heat and evaporates sea water at a location other than a heat exchanger surface?
Other than taking a scale thickness through a zinc plug opening of the water box of a feed water heater of a flash evaporator what would be the BEST indication for a need to remove scale build-up?
Response 1: A drop in the feed water heater shell temperature and a rise in the feed water heater shell absolute pressure (decrease in vacuum).
Response 2: A rise in the feed water heater shell temperature and a drop in the feed water heater shell absolute pressure (increase in vacuum).
Response 3: A drop in the feed water heater shell temperature and a drop in the feed water heater shell absolute pressure (increase in vacuum).
Response 4: A rise in the feed water heater shell temperature and a rise in the feed water heater shell absolute pressure (decrease in vacuum).

Question: While circulating heated sulfuric acid through a feed water heater of a flash evaporator for the purposes of scale removal what would be the indication of the continued presence of scale?
Response 1: Change in color (turning to orange with a pH of 4.0) and no more venting of carbon dioxide gas.
Response 2: No change in color (remaining at red with a pH of 2.0) and continued venting of carbon dioxide gas.
Response 3: No change in color (remaining at red with a pH of 2.0) and no more venting of carbon dioxide gas.
Response 4: Change in color (turning to orange with a pH of 4.0) and continued venting of carbon dioxide gas.

Question: When should mechanical cleaning of feed water heater tubes be accomplished?
Response 1: Any time when increased steam flow to the feed water heater shell is required to maintain distillate production capacity.
Response 2: Only when chemical cleaning fails to restore distillate production capacity to normal.
Response 4: Any time there is a drop-off on distillate production capacity.

Question: What procedure can be used to reduce the rate of scale formation on the heating surfaces of a flash evaporator while still maintaining the desired rate of distillate production?
Response 1: Decreasing the feed water heater shell absolute pressure (increase in vacuum).
Response 2: Increasing the feed water heater shell absolute pressure (decrease in vacuum).
Response 3: Chemically treating the incoming feed water.

Question: While circulating heated sulfuric acid through a feed water heater of a flash evaporator for the purposes of scale removal what would be the indication of successful removal of the scale?
Response 1: No change in color (remaining at red with a pH of 2.0) and continued venting of carbon dioxide gas.
Response 2: No change in color (remaining at red with a pH of 2.0) and no more venting of carbon dioxide gas.
Response 3: Change in color (turning to orange with a pH of 4.0) and continued venting of carbon dioxide gas.
Response 4: Change in color (turning to orange with a pH of 4.0) and no more venting of carbon dioxide gas.

Question: Device '27' shown in the illustration is used to ______. See illustration MO-0111.
Response 3: regulate maximum vacuum during normal operation
Response 4: purge the unit of non-condensable gases

Question: What is a function of the device labeled "1" shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0111.
Response 1: It provides a low pressure point for combustion air filtration.
Response 2: It relieves the excessive pressure developed in the jacket water cooler.
Response 3: It aids in the removal of combustible gases formed in the crankcase.
Response 4: It provides a low pressure point for adding chemicals into the jacket water system.

Question: What is the function of the device labeled "3" shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0111.
Response 1: The heat exchanger serves to heat the jacket water during cold water operation.
Response 2: The cooler removes sensible heat from the jacket water.
Response 3: The jacket water cooler is used to raise the temperature of the sea water flowing through it.
Response 4: The device specifically serves to remove the latent heat of vaporization from the jacket water.

Question: The temperature of the steam flow to the saltwater feed heater in a flash type evaporator can be manipulated by a/an ______.
Response 1: sensor wired in with the three-way salinity dump valve
Response 2: pressure regulator within the supply orifice
Response 3: attemporator in the steam supply piping

Question: Carryover in a flash type distilling plant can be a result of ______.
Response 2: faulty operation of the brine overboard pump
Response 4: a pressure drop through the loop seal

Question: Which of the following statements describes the proper operation of a three-way solenoid trip/dump valve on a two stage flash-type evaporator?
Response 1: The valve normally requires a manual reset.
Response 2: The valve will trip if the distillate is too warm.
Response 3: The valve is interlocked to trip only on de-energization of the solenoid.
Response 4: The valve will trip if the sea water feed temperature drops below 175F.

Question: In a double-effect distilling unit the brine in the second-effect is additionally heated by __________.
One function of the vapor feed heater in a double-effect submerged tube distilling unit is to __________.
Response 1: condense part of the vapor given off in the first-effect
Response 2: preheat distillate circulating to the second-effect tube nest
Response 3: cool the incoming first-effect evaporator feed
Response 4: condense all the distillate in the second-effect tube nest

Question: Fluctuations in the pressure and temperature of the steam supplied to the first-effect of a low pressure distilling plant will cause __________.
Response 1: increased heat levels throughout the entire unit
Response 2: decreased priming and lower distillate salinity
Response 3: first effect scale formation to be lessened
Response 4: pressure and temperature fluctuations in the entire unit

Question: The brine density in a submerged tube evaporator should be maintained at __________.
Response 1: 1.0 pounds of salt per 32 pounds of water
Response 2: 1.5 pounds of salt per 32 pounds of water
Response 3: 2.0 pounds of salt per 32 pounds of water
Response 4: 3.5 pounds of salt per 32 pounds of water

Question: In a double-effect submerged tube evaporator the brine density should be prevented from falling below 1.5/32nds to minimize __________.
Response 1: scale formation on the tube nests
Response 2: loss in capacity and maintain plant efficiency

Question: The quantity and density of brine discharged from the last effect of a flash type evaporator should be kept at a constant value so as to __________.
Response 1: prevent scale accumulation in the first effect heat exchanger surfaces
Response 2: maintain a constant distillate outlet temperature
Response 3: ensure distillate quality and distilling plant efficiency
Response 4: prevent any salinity in the distillate produced

Question: For efficient and proper operation the brine density in a submerged tube evaporator should be maintained at __________.
Response 1: 3.5 pounds of salt per 32 pounds of water
Response 2: 1.5 pounds of salt per 32 pounds of water
Response 3: 1 pound of salt per 32 pounds of water to prevent excessive heat loss
Response 4: 1 pound of salt per 32 pounds of water to minimize excessive scale formation

Question: One advantage of a triple-effect low pressure submerged tube distilling plant over a double-effect unit is __________.
Brine density in a distilling plant is measured with a/an __________.
In a double-effect distilling plant the brine particles remaining entrained with the vapor produced in the evaporator first effect are separated by __________.
The vapor separators installed in some distilling plants consist of several rows of vertical hooked vanes which remove entrained moisture from the vapor by __________.
Response 1: directing the vapor through a fine metallic mesh
Response 2: condensing water droplets on the metal vanes
Response 3: trapping water droplets in the metallic mesh
Response 4: abruptly changing the direction of vapor flow

Question: In a double-effect distilling plant liquid moisture remaining entrained in the first-effect vapor is removed by __________.
The purpose of chill shocking an evaporator is to __________.
Response 3: break loose scale deposits formed on the tubes
Response 4: test for leaks in the tubes

Question: The steam coils in a high pressure evaporator used for saltwater service should be descaled with __________.
Rapid fluctuation of the last effect shell vacuum in a submerged tube evaporator can cause __________.
Response 2: air leaks in the tube nest

Question: Rapid fluctuations of absolute pressure in the last effect of a multi-effect submerged tube distilling plant will tend to cause __________.
Response 1: scale formation with increased heat transfer
Response 2: priming with increased salinity of distillate
Response 3: slight foaming at the distillate feed pump
Response 4: improved operating conditions at the brine pump

Question: An unsteady vacuum in a submerged tube evaporator may be caused by __________.
Response 1: air leaks in the tube nests
Response 2: improper venting of the tube nests
Response 3: inadequate steam quality to the air ejector nozzles
Response 4: high water level in the shell

Question: Which of the listed problems is occurring if a coil type high pressure evaporator constantly requires an increase in the coil steam pressure in order to maintain capacity?
Response 2: Heat transfer surfaces are being layered with scale.
Response 4: Shell vapor pressure is constantly decreasing.

Question: If the rated distillate production of a submerged tube type evaporator cannot be maintained with the supplied maximum steam flow rate the evaporator __________.
If the rated distillate production of a submerged tube type evaporator cannot be maintained with the supplied maximum steam pressure the evaporator __________.
Response 4: heating surfaces have excessive scale buildup

Question: If the rated distillate production of a submerged tube type evaporator cannot be maintained with the maximum jacket water flow rate the evaporator __________.
In a jacket-water heated submerged tube evaporator what is the primary factor that determines the rate of scale build-up on the submerged tube bundle?
Response 1: The chemical composition of the jacket water coolant additive package.
Response 2: The jacket water inlet temperature to the submerged tube bundle.
Response 3: The sea water inlet temperature to the evaporator section.
Response 4: The salt content of the sea water inlet to the evaporator section.

Question: Which of the following statements is correct relative to distillation plant operation?
Response 1: Distillation is the process of boiling seawater to produce vapor which is condensed into fresh water.
Response 2: Evaporation is the second part of the distillation process where brine is removed.
Response 3: Brine is the result of condensed sea water vapor.
Response 4: Distillate is the product resulting from the evaporation of fresh water vapor.

Question: A vacuum is initially established in the first and second stages of a low pressure evaporator by the use of __________.
Response 1: vacuum drag from the auxiliary condensate system

Question: Where auxiliary steam supply is not used in the process of maintaining vacuum in a distilling unit the vacuum is usually attained by __________.
Response 3: increasing the rate of condensation in the distiller condensers
Response 4: a separate suction connection to the brine overboard pump

Question: Regarding the low pressure evaporator steam control orifice in the live steam supply line the steam at the outlet of the orifice if not properly conditioned will be developed as __________.
Steam passing through the control orifice installed in the live steam supply to a low pressure evaporator will develop significant superheat as a result of __________.
If the fixed orifice in the evaporator steam supply line were to be removed the steam pressure reducing valve located upstream would __________.
Response 1: be unable to maintain steam flow unless the proper range spring were to be installed
Response 2: be suitable for maintaining the required steam flow under all load conditions
Response 3: handle the operation satisfactorily as the control orifice develops an impedance to the steam flow

Question: In which of the following types of evaporators is the control of brine density least important?
Why is a self-sealing pump generally not satisfactory for service as a brine overboard pump?
Response 1: Hot brine tends to form scale on the impeller peripheral edge.
Response 2: Brine density at 1.5/32 cannot by maintained.
Response 3: Hot concentrated brine tends to clog the sealing lines and gland seal rings.
Response 4: Hot brine tends to clog the brine pump suction line strainer.

Question: The primary reason low pressure evaporators produce distillate more efficiently and with less scale formation than high pressure evaporators is __________.
Response 1: evaporation is accomplished in a vacuum
Response 2: due to the higher temperature of the incoming feed
Response 3: due to the latent heat of evaporation principle
Response 4: evaporation in a submerged medium produces more distillate

Question: Less scale formation occurs in a flash evaporator than in a submerged tube evaporator because __________.
Response 1: the distillate produced has greater purity
Response 2: no boiling occurs on heat transfer surfaces
Response 3: evaporation occurs at a higher rate
Response 4: the incoming feed is at a higher temperature

Question: The advantages of flash type evaporators as compared to submerged tube type evaporators include __________.
Response 1: less internal corrosion because of lower brine density
Response 2: higher temperature evaporation for lower salinity of the distillate produced
Response 3: less hard scale formation in a flash evaporator
Response 4: less feed water required for a flash evaporator

Question: One advantage of a flash distilling plant when compared to a submerged tube distiller is __________.
Response 1: greater distillate purity through high temperature evaporation
Response 2: cold shocking for scale removal is not required
Response 3: less internal corrosion because of lower brine density
Response 4: less feed water is required for equal plant capacity

Question: According to Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) a fresh water evaporator is classified as a/an __________.
The process of boiling seawater in order to separate it into freshwater vapor and brine is usually defined as __________.
In the production of freshwater from seawater through a process of heating and cooling the cooling phase of production is usually called __________.
The steam coils in a high pressure evaporator used for saltwater service should be descaled with __________.
When performing a hydrostatic test on a low pressure evaporator to determine the source of suspected air leaks you should use __________.
Response 1: fresh water at or above the ambient temperature
Response 2: circulated cold fresh water while maintaining all normal unit operating pressures
Response 3: air and a soap solution to test all joints
Response 4: phosphorescent hydrazine bisodium solution visible under a black light source

Question: If the distilling plant first stage absolute pressure is higher than normal while the second stage absolute pressure remains satisfactory the probable fault is due to __________.
Response 1: loss of the distillate loop seal between the stages
Response 4: an air leak through a vacuum gage line in the first stage

Question: A fluctuating and unsteady vacuum in an evaporator may be caused by __________.
Response 1: wet steam entering the air ejector nozzle
Response 2: pinhole leaks in the evaporator tube nests
Response 3: rapid scaling on the evaporator tube nests
Response 4: high water levels in the last effect

Question: Evaporator priming can be caused by high water level fluctuating steam pressure or __________.
Response 4: a brine overflow weir set too low

Question: When any low pressure distilling plant is operated with less than the designed vacuum the __________.
If 'wet' steam is supplied to the air ejectors of a low pressure evaporator the passage of the mixture through the nozzles will __________.
Response 2: cause the potential level of kinetic energy to be partially converted to thermal energy
Response 3: cause the existing level of thermal energy to be totally converted to kinetic energy
Response 4: cause the level of thermal energy to be converted to potential energy

Question: Scale accumulation on evaporator heat exchange surfaces __________.
Scale accumulation on evaporator heating surfaces will cause __________.
Diesel engine jacket water is used in the fresh water distillation process as the __________.
Response 3: means of heating the feed water
Response 4: primary means of producing a vacuum within the distiller

Question: What would cause a coil type evaporator to require consistently higher steam coil pressure to maintain its output capacity?
Response 2: Heat transfer surfaces are being layered with scale.
Response 4: Shell vapor pressure is constantly decreasing.

Question: A solenoid-operated distillate three-way valve is installed in the discharge line between the distilling plant and the potable water tanks. This valve will trip and dump the distillate discharge if the __________.
Response 3: potable water tank has been filled with raw water
Response 4: potable water tank has become contaminated

Question: A three-way solenoid operated dump valve installed on a flash-type evaporator unit will divert impure distillate to the bilge __________.
Response 1: only if the cell selector switch is positioned to monitor the first stage distillate outlet
Response 2: only if the cell selector switch is positioned to monitor the final stage distillate outlet
Response 3: regardless of the cell selector switch position
Response 4: only if power to the salinity panel is interrupted

Question: The purpose of a three-way solenoid dump valve on an evaporator is to __________.
Response 1: prevent excessively saline distillate from entering the freshwater system
Response 4: allow the evaporator's first- and second-effects to be drained with one valve

Question: A solenoid operated distillate bypass valve is installed in the discharge line between a distilling plant and the potable water tanks to prevent __________.
Response 1: excessively warm distillate from entering the potable tanks
Response 2: salty distillate from reaching the potable tanks
Response 3: overfilling and overflowing the potable tanks
Response 4: contaminated water from leaving the potable tanks

Question: In a submerged tube evaporator the automatic solenoid dump valve will trip if the salinity exceeds __________.
Which of the following statements is true concerning low pressure distilling units?
Response 1: High conductivity of the distillate indicates distillate salinity is excessive.
Response 2: Increasing the absolute pressure of the shell will increase the distiller's capacity.
Response 3: Mesh separators are used in evaporators to filter the distillate.
Response 4: Reducing the brine density will reduce the heat lost overboard.

Question: A salinity indicator is used to determine the __________.
A salinity indicating system functions on the basic principle of measuring the __________.
Which of the following statements represents the basic principle of operation of an electrical salinity indicator?
Response 2: Measures the electrical resistance of the water.
Response 3: Determines the conductivity of the dissolved oxygen.
Response 4: Measures the voltage of the chloride ions.

Question: The instrument always used in conjunction with a salinometer is a __________.
Where would a salinity cell be installed in a double-effect distilling plant?
In a flash-type evaporator an electrical salinity cell would be installed in the __________.
Response 1: distillate outlet from the distillate cooler
Response 2: distillate inlet to the distillate cooler
Response 3: condensate drains from the distiller feed water heater

Question: The average density of brine discharged from the last stage of a fresh water evaporator should not exceed __________.
Salinity cells are strategically installed in distilling units to indicate the __________.
Salinity cells are strategically installed in flash type distilling units to indicate the __________.
A salinity indicator cell is located in the __________.
Response 1: seawater side of the main condenser

Question: Salinity cells are strategically installed in distilling units to indicate the __________.
Response 3: presence of leaks in the flash chambers

Question: While standing watch in the engine room you notice a high reading at a salinity cell located in the loop seal between two stages of a flash type evaporator. This would indicate __________.
Response 1: chill shocking is necessary to remove scale
Response 3: faulty operation of the brine overboard pump

Question: While standing watch underway at sea you notice salinity carryover in the low pressure distilling plant. This can be a result of __________.
Response 2: a pressure drop through the loop seal

Question: Salinity cells are strategically installed in distilling units to indicate the __________.
Response 3: presence of saltwater leaks into the flash chamber

Question: What statement is true concerning the operation of a distilling plant or boiler feed water salinometer?
Response 1: The greater the salt content of water the greater the conductivity of the water and temperature correction is unnecessary because conductivity does not change with changes in temperature.
Response 2: The greater the salt content of water the lower the conductivity of the water and temperature correction is necessary because conductivity decreases with a rise in temperature.
Response 3: The greater the salt content of water the lower the conductivity of the water and temperature correction is necessary because conductivity increases with a rise in temperature.
Response 4: The greater the salt content of water the greater the conductivity of the water and temperature correction is necessary because conductivity increases with a rise in temperature.

Question: An automatic solenoid dump valve should be set to trip if the evaporator produces distillate with salt content exceeding ______.
A salinity indicator system such as that used to measure the salt content of potable water systems and boiler feed and condensate systems uses what technology?
Response 1: a salinity cell that senses the pH of water
Response 2: a salinity cell that senses the brine density of water
Response 3: a salinity cell that senses the electrical conductivity of water
Response 4: a salinity cell that senses the optical refraction of water

Question: Regarding a freshwater generator of the reverse-osmosis type what statement is true?
Response 1: The solute is salt and the solvent is fresh water.
Response 2: The solute is fresh water and the solvent is salt.
Response 3: The solute is saltwater and the solvent is salt.
Response 4: The solute is salt and the solvent is saltwater.

Question: Reverse-osmosis freshwater generators usually feature multiple membrane modules typically of the spiral-wound membrane type. How are these multiple membrane modules piped?
Response 1: The multiple membrane modules are always connected in parallel.
Response 2: The multiple membranes may be connected in series parallel or in some combination of series and parallel.
Response 3: The multiple membrane modules are always connected in series.
Response 4: The multiple membranes may be connected in series or parallel but never in some combination of series and parallel.

Question: Regarding a reverse-osmosis type freshwater generator using multiple spiral-wound membrane modules what statement is true?
Response 1: Modules may be piped in series to increase the freshwater throughput.
Response 2: Modules may be piped in series to increase the freshwater purity.
Response 3: Modules may be piped in parallel to increase the freshwater purity.
Response 4: Modules may be piped in series to decrease the likelihood of fouling.

Question: To ensure potable water of drinking quality chemical treatment is required for reverse-osmosis freshwater generators. What is the purpose of chemical pre-treatment?
Response 1: Chemical pre-treatment removes particulate matter and suspended solids from the sea water inlet to the unit to prevent fouling of the membrane modules.
Response 2: Chemical pre-treatment removes particulate matter and suspended solids from the freshwater leaving the unit prior to distribution to the various freshwater storage tanks.
Response 3: Chemical pre-treatment sterilizes the sea water entering the unit to prevent bacteria from becoming resident in the reverse-osmosis unit filters and membrane modules.
Response 4: Chemical pre-treatment sterilizes the freshwater leaving the unit prior to distribution to the various freshwater storage tanks.

Question: Regarding the operating principle of a reverse-osmosis type freshwater generator what statement is true?
Response 1: External pressure is applied to the side of strong concentration forcing salt through the semi-permeable membrane to the side of weak concentration.
Response 2: External pressure is applied to the side of weak concentration forcing salt through the semi-permeable membrane to the side of strong concentration.
Response 3: External pressure is applied to the side of weak concentration forcing freshwater through the semi-permeable membrane to the side of strong concentration.
Response 4: External pressure is applied to the side of strong concentration forcing freshwater through the semi-permeable membrane to the side of weak concentration.

Question: Regarding the high-pressure pump of a reverse-osmosis freshwater generator what statement is true?
Response 1: The high-pressure pump is typically a two-stage centrifugal pump but may be a two-stage rotary pump.
Response 2: The high-pressure pump is typically a single-cylinder reciprocating pump but may be a single-stage centrifugal pump.
Response 3: The high-pressure pump is typically a multiple-cylinder reciprocating pump but may be a multi-stage centrifugal pump.
Response 4: The high-pressure pump is typically a two-stage rotary pump but may be a two-stage centrifugal pump.

Question: For the successful operation of a reverse-osmosis freshwater generator why is the high pressure pump required to operate in the 750 to 1200 psig range for a discharge pressure?
Response 1: To overcome the pore size of the semi-permeable membrane.
Response 2: To successfully force the salt water through the chemical pre-treatment device.
Response 3: To overcome the osmotic pressure generated by the difference in solution concentrations.
Response 4: To successfully force the salt water through the pre-filter (or pre-filters).

Question: For the successful operation of a reverse-osmosis freshwater generator the setting of the brine back pressure regulator is critical. What statement regarding the set point of this regulator is true?
Response 1: If the regulator setting is set too high the membrane modules may be damaged. If the regulator setting is too low the freshwater production will be too low.
Response 2: If the regulator setting is set too low the membrane modules may become fouled. If the regulator setting is too high the freshwater production will be too low.
Response 3: If the regulator setting is set too high the membrane modules may become fouled. If the regulator setting is too low the freshwater production will be too low.
Response 4: If the regulator setting is set too low the membrane modules may be damaged. If the regulator setting is too high the freshwater production will be too low.

Question: If a reverse-osmosis freshwater generating unit has a high salinity alarm associated with the freshwater outlet what should be done?
Response 1: The pre-filters should be serviced by cleaning or replacement.
Response 2: The post-treatment sterilizer should be serviced.
Response 3: The pre-treatment chemical doser should be serviced.
Response 4: The membrane modules should be flushed and cleaned.

Question: What is the BEST indication that the pre-treatment filter (or filters) of a reverse-osmosis freshwater generator must be serviced by cleaning or replacement?
Response 1: An insufficient freshwater production by the unit.
Response 2: An excessive pressure drop across the membrane modules.
Response 3: An excessive pressure drop across the pre-treatment filter.
Response 4: An excessive salinity of the freshwater output.

Question: What component of a reverse-osmosis freshwater generator could be isolated and replaced with the unit remaining in service?
What is the BEST indication that the membrane modules of a reverse-osmosis freshwater generator must be serviced by flushing or cleaning?
Response 1: A lower than normal feed pressure.
Response 2: An insufficient pressure drop across the membrane modules.
Response 3: An excessive pressure drop across the membrane modules.
Response 4: An excessive pressure drop across the pre-treatment filter.

Question: Under what conditions would the pre-treatment capabilities of a reverse-osmosis freshwater generator MOST likely be overloaded and as a result these conditions should generally be avoided?
What is the BEST indication that the membrane module is damaged and is no longer semi-permeable and allowing the solute to pass through?
Response 1: Higher than normal brine overboard back pressure.

Question: When a reverse-osmosis freshwater generator is shutdown what must be accomplished?
Response 1: The unit must be flushed with freshwater and treated with an anti-bacterial growth inhibitor.
Response 2: The unit must be flushed with freshwater if anti-bacterial growth inhibitor is unavailable.
Response 3: The unit is left filled with saltwater and treated with anti-bacterial growth inhibitor.
Response 4: The unit must be treated with an anti-bacterial growth inhibitor if the unit is not flushed with freshwater.

Question: Which of the freshwater generators listed below is operated without a source of heat?
Which of the following freshwater generators has an operating principle that requires it to run under a substantially positive pressure?
In which of the following freshwater generators would an air ejector be unnecessary?

In order for a reverse-osmosis freshwater generator to be able to overcome the osmotic pressure without damaging the spiral-wound membrane modules the pressure must be controlled. What is the location of the pressure regulator?
Response 1: Freshwater outlet from the membrane modules.
Response 2: Brine outlet from the membrane modules.
Response 3: Discharge side of the high-pressure pump.
Response 4: Suction side of the high-pressure pump.

Question: If a reverse-osmosis freshwater generator has fouled membrane modules what statement is true?
Response 1: The freshwater production rate would be higher than normal and the feed pressure would be higher than normal.
Response 2: The freshwater production rate would be higher than normal and the feed pressure would be lower than normal.
Response 3: The freshwater production rate would be lower than normal and the feed pressure would be higher than normal.
Response 4: The freshwater production rate would be lower than normal and the feed pressure would be lower than normal.

Question: In order for the hydraulic system to operate with fewer contaminants from the system's operating fluid the illustrated device may __________. See illustration GS-0118.
Response 1: be increased in height with all other dimensions remaining the same

Response 4: be increased in length and have the width narrowed
