Response 4: Although the control handle position was set the pump displacement will fluctuate from zero to maximum flow rate until the handle is placed in its neutral position.

Question: If the device shown in the illustration is used to control the output of a variable displacement pump and the handle is displaced 50% from 'zero' stroke which of the following statements will be correct? See illustration GS-0039.
Response 1: Pump discharge will be 100% until the effects of lost motion in the associated linkages is eliminated.
Response 2: Once the pump achieved a corresponding output of 50% the pump would automatically return to neutral stroke.
Response 3: The pump would develop a 50% discharge rate and remain at that condition until the control handle position is changed.
Response 4: The system unloading valve will open to guarantee a pump discharge of no more than 50%.

Question: In the device illustrated if part "D" rotates clockwise then part "E" will rotate __________. See illustration GS-0040.
A variable displacement pump is fitted with the illustrated device the discharge flow rate will be reduced as described by which of the following statements? See illustration GS-0040.
Response 1: Part "H" will move to block the replenishing pump oil flow across part "G" as flow across hydraulic motor decreases.
Response 2: When part "D" rotates counterclockwise part "E" will rotate clockwise allowing part "G" to slide towards the set point spring 'F.'
Response 3: As high side pressure increases part "A" "B" and "C" will work together to reestablish the original tilting box angle.
Response 4: The increase in high side pressure will gradually increase the tilting box angle of the variable displacement pump.

Question: An axial piston hydraulic motor is caused to rotate by fluid flow from a comparably designed variable displacement pump fitted with the illustrated device. If the motor stalls due to excess load the pump tilting box will seek neutral stroke until the high side pressure equalizes or is less than the set point pressure established by part __________. See illustration GS-0040.
Which of the following problems will occur if the internal drain at either end of a hydraulic two-way spool-type directional control valve cylinder were to become plugged?
Response 1: The reservoir would become vapor bound.
Response 2: The valve would be placed in hydraulic lock.
Response 3: The spring loaded relief ports would open.
Response 4: The buffering chambers would be unable to function.

Question: Which of the following statements represents a disadvantage associated with a spool-type solenoid direct operating directional control valves?
Response 1: Back pressure on the outlet line must be steady to drain the lower spool chamber.
Response 2: The valve sealing surface is often damaged through excessive throttling action.
Response 3: The spool does not have hydro cushion capabilities to handle shock.
Response 4: Close fitting spools occasionally stick due to the accumulation of hydraulic oil residues.

Question: A solenoid direct-acting three-position spring-centered directional control valve is used in a hydraulic system to control a linear actuator. When the remote push button is depressed to extend the actuator it fails to move even though the pump is in operation. Which of the following statements represents the cause?
Response 1: A spring at one spool end has broken and jammed preventing the spool from shifting.
Response 2: The 'extend' solenoid coil has developed an open.
Response 3: The pump coupling is damaged and pump is unable to turn at its required speed.
Response 4: Any one of the above will cause the actuator to not move.

Question: A solenoid direct-acting three-position spring-centered directional control valve is used in a hydraulic system to control a linear actuator. Midway through extension the push button is released but the actuator continues to extend slowly. Which of the following conditions represents the probable cause?
Response 1: A centering spring has broken and jammed the spool movement preventing the spool from recentering.
Response 2: One of the two solenoids has sustained an open in its respective coil.
Response 3: The pump coupling has been damaged preventing the pump from developing its required operating speed.
Response 4: The detent mechanism has failed preventing the valve from operating.

Question: A solenoid direct-acting three-position spring-centered directional control valve is used in a hydraulic system to control a linear actuator. With the actuator under load there is no movement. However when the load is removed the actuator can be cycled in both directions although slower than normal. Which of the statements listed is the probable cause?
Response 1: One or both of the centering springs has broken and the spool has jammed in the valve body.
Response 2: One or both of the solenoid coils has sustained an open.
Response 3: The pump coupling is damaged and the pump is unable to attain its rated speed of rotation.
Response 4: The pump coupling has sheared and the motor is over speeding.

Question: Setting the relief valve opening pressure in a hydraulic system lower than the required operating pressure will result in __________.
Response 1: accelerated action of the system components
Response 3: over speeding of the hydraulic pump

Question: If the relief valve on the discharge side of a hydraulic pump lifts the cause could be __________.
Response 1: a low load on the unit
Response 3: a blockage in the line between the pump and hydraulic motor
Response 4: the hydraulic motor turning too fast

Question: During the repair and overhaul of the pump relief valve used in a hydraulic system the set point was reduced by 100 psi. Which of the following statements describes the result of the set point being lowered?
Response 1: The pump discharge pressure will remain at the same pressure prior to the relief valve being repaired.
Response 2: The solenoid controlled three-position spring centered control valve response will be quicker.
Response 3: The fluid viscosity will increase during operation.
Response 4: The movement of any system actuator will now be slower.

Question: Which of the conditions listed will cause the hydraulic pump relief valve to remain open during the operation of the system? See illustration GS-0106.
Response 1: Bleeding the gas charge from the accumulator.
Response 2: Reducing the relief valve spring compression.
Response 3: Removing the restrictor valve check-valve spring.
Response 4: Opening the restrictor valve variable orifice by one third of a turn.

Question: Which of the following statements describes the functions of a reservoir used in a hydraulic system?
A reservoir is used in a hydraulic system to __________.
Response 1: store fluid until required by the system
Response 2: provide a place for air to separate out of the fluid
Response 3: provide a place for contaminants to settle out

Question: A reservoir as used in hydraulic systems aboard ship is used to store hydraulic oil. Another function is to __________.
Response 2: maintain the stored oil under pressure
Response 3: act as a base or foundation for the power unit
Response 4: eliminate pressure surges in the system

Question: Return lines in a non-pressurized hydraulic system reservoir should enter the tank well below the fluid surface level to __________.
Return lines to hydraulic systems reservoirs should________.
Response 1: end the return line as far as practicable from the pump suction
Response 2: end the return line as close to the pump suction as possible
Response 3: provide a "P" or "S" trap in the return line as close to the reservoir as possible to trap sediment from entering the tank
Response 4: connect the return lines directly to the cleanout and inspection plates to limit the number of openings on the reservoir

Question: In a typical hydraulic system return lines to the reservoir are terminated below the normal oil level to prevent __________.
In a typical hydraulic system a baffle is installed in the reservoir to __________.
In a typical hydraulic system a baffle is installed in the reservoir to __________.
The baffle plates installed in the oil reservoir of a hydraulic system serve to __________.
Response 1: reduce fluid turbulence at the pump suction
Response 2: minimizes the chance of return line contamination deposits from entering the pump suction
Response 3: minimizes the probability of air being drawn into the pump suction

Question: Hydraulic system reservoirs should be maintained at recommended normal levels to reduce __________.
As a general rule of thumb the reservoir used in a hydraulic system should have a capacity when at the normal level approximately equal to __________.
Response 1: two to three times the normal flow rate through the system
Response 2: the flow rate through the system
Response 3: ten times the flow rate through the system

Question: An internal bypass is provided on some hydraulic system suction strainers to help reduce the possibility of __________.
The component which is used to thoroughly separate small fine dust-like particulate contamination from hydraulic fluid is a/an __________.
Modern trends show that full flow filters used in multi-operation hydraulic systems would most likely be located __________.
Response 2: on the relief valve discharge line
Response 3: between the control valves and the actuators

Question: An improperly maintained filter used in a hydraulic system can __________.
Response 1: reduce or stop the output action of the actuator
Response 2: cause leaking of the flexible line connections

Question: Some fluid filters used in hydraulic systems are designed to cope with increasing pressure differentials by __________.
Response 1: diverting the flow automatically to the standby filter of the duplex unit
Response 2: automatically bypassing the fluid via an internal valve arrangement
Response 4: diverting the pump discharge directly back to the suction

Question: Strainers are commonly used in hydraulic systems to __________.
Response 1: protect the pump from fine soluble contaminants
Response 2: prevent solid particles from entering the pump
Response 3: prevent air from entering the pump

Question: Which component in a hydraulic system is commonly used to prevent the stray movements of a vertical load until required?
The device shown in the illustration is commonly known as a/an __________. See illustration GS-0071.
Which of the labeled parts would be considered as the 'dynamic seal ring' portion of the illustrated device? See illustration GS-0071.
In application which of the listed sealing devices is most similar to an O-ring?
In which of the listed hydraulic system components could an O-ring seal be satisfactorily used in providing a seal?
In hydraulics the graphic symbol illustrated in Fig. A is used to represent a/an __________. See illustration GS-0068.
The hydraulic graphic symbol illustrated as Fig. C is used to depict a/an __________. See illustration GS-0068.
Response 3: variable output single direction flow pump

Question: The hydraulic graphic symbol illustrated in Fig. B is used to represent a/an __________. See illustration GS-0068.
Item "B" shown in the illustrated hydraulic circuit is used to __________. See illustration GS-0103.
Response 1: act as a power source to operate the pumps indicated as "F"
Response 2: act as a power source to operate the pump indicated as "E"
Response 3: shut down the remotely operated electric motor driven pump when the watertight door has closed
Response 4: shut down the operation of pump "E" when the watertight door has closed

Question: In a six month period the illustrated device has needed to be replaced twice due to excessive grinding of part "E". Which of the listed aids might assist in reducing this problem? See illustration GS-0071.
Response 1: Use a softer material for part "D".
Response 2: Increase the contact surface area of part "F".
Response 3: Increase the contact surface area of part "E".
Response 4: Increase the thickness of the cover gasket at point "H".

Question: The device shown in the illustration has displayed a continuing tendency to leak despite using extreme care in its installation during numerous repair efforts. Which of the following conditions might be used to prevent the pump shaft leakage from reoccurring with this device? See illustration GS-0071.
Response 1: Apply an adhesive between the shaft and part "D".
Response 2: Apply an adhesive between parts "D" and "E".
Response 4: Apply an adhesive between part "F" and the shaft.

Question: An O-ring seal in a hydraulic system will begin to leak when it has lost its interference fit due to __________.
Leakage of hydraulic fluid from around the shaft of a hydraulic motor may be caused by __________.
Response 3: high level in the oil sump

Question: Hydraulic system reservoirs are often fitted with a combined filler/breather cap. If the breather element becomes fouled the __________.
Response 2: reservoir will be subjected to a partial vacuum
Response 3: flow through the return lines will be stopped
Response 4: actuator response time will be halved

Question: Which of the following devices is not considered to be a pressure vessel? (46 CFR)
Strainers are commonly used in hydraulic systems to ______.
Response 1: prevent solid particles from entering the filter
Response 2: protect the pump from fine soluble contaminants
Response 4: prevent solid particles from entering the pump

Question: An improperly maintained filter used in a hydraulic system can ______.
Response 2: reduce or stop the output action of the actuator
Response 3: cause leaking of the flexible line connections

Question: Plug valves installed in hydraulic systems are most suitable for use as ______.
Which of the listed pressure- control valves would be used in a hydraulic system to temporarily divert some or all of the pump discharge until the additional flow was required?
The baffle plate used in the reservoir of a hydraulic system serves to ______.
Response 1: minimize the amount of contamination deposited from return lines entering the system
Response 2: reduce fluid turbulence at the pump suction
Response 3: minimize the entrance of entrained air through the pump inlet line

Question: If a hydraulic system is in continuous operation and is equipped with an air cooled heat exchanger the fan should ______.
Response 1: be in continuous operation as long as the main pump prime mover is in operation
Response 2: come on only after the main pump prime mover is secured
Response 3: be controlled by a thermostat to maintain the oil temperature at less than 190F (87.8C)
Response 4: never be needed except when the ambient temperature exceeds 90F (32.2C)

Question: In a typical hydraulic system return lines to the reservoir are __________.
The component of the illustrated compression fitting figure "C" used to seal and eliminate leaks between the tubing and the fitting is part __________. See illustration GS-0100.
The components used to 'lock' the hydraulic tubing in place when assembling the illustrated compression fitting "C" are items __________. See illustration GS-0100.
Dry seal threads typically used for tubing to pipe connectors and threaded piping in hydraulic systems are __________.
Response 1: the same as National Pipe threads
Response 2: different than NPT as the crest of a matching thread is in contact with the trough of the opposing thread
Response 3: different than NPT as the flanks of the matching threads are in contact with the opposing threads
Response 4: the same as National Fine threads

Question: Copper is sometimes used for fluid power lines because it __________.
Response 1: has good resistance to high temperatures
Response 3: withstands heavy vibration under heavy system loads

Question: Hydraulic system tubing should be anchored every three or four feet to prevent __________.
Response 2: expansion and contraction of the tubing
Response 3: tube fitting leaks from vibration and pressure surges
Response 4: tube flexing at right angles to the applied fluid pressure

Question: The size of flexible hose used in a hydraulic system is indicated by __________.
Response 1: the outside diameter of the hose
Response 2: the numerical designation found on the 'skin' of the hose
Response 3: a color code on the armor
Response 4: the thickness of the tube wall

Question: If the numerical designation indicated on the outside of a hydraulic hose is BXP-10 the "dash size" 10 indicates that the inside diameter of the hose is _______.
The portion of a hydraulic hose that determines its overall strength is the __________.
The determining factor for the strength of a flexible rubber hydraulic hose is the __________.
When installing a hydraulic hose which of the following precautions should be taken?
Response 1: The hose should not be twisted.
Response 2: The hose should be protected with a sleeve if it is subjected to rubbing.
Response 3: There should be some slack in the hose.

Question: The striped flexible hose installation shown is incorrect and will probably fail under pressure because the hose will __________. See illustration GS-0064.
Response 1: expand under pressure and split along the axis of the stripe
Response 2: flex and rupture at the twist indicated by the stripe
Response 3: expand in diameter and rupture in the twisted area
Response 4: pull out of the fittings as the hose contracts in length

Question: Which of the listed illustrations correctly represents the installation of a hydraulic hose? See illustration GS-0063.
Which of the listed illustrations shows the INCORRECT method for installing hydraulic tubing? See illustration GS-0065.
Figure "D" in the illustration is an improperly installed hose with a restriction developed at the __________. See illustration GS-0063.
Response 1: right hand fitting being smaller than required
Response 3: sharp bend formed at the left

Question: Figure "C" in the illustration is an improperly installed hose with the restriction developed at the __________. See illustration GS-0063.
Response 1: right hand fitting being small than required
Response 3: sharp bend formed at the left
Response 4: 90 bend as required of the installation

Question: Figure "B" in the illustration is improperly installed. A restriction will develop in this hose __________. See illustration GS-0063.
Response 1: at the right hand end regardless of the direction of flow
Response 2: at the left hand end regardless of the direction of flow
Response 3: ahead of the direction of flow

Question: Regarding the hydraulic hose installation illustrated the hose __________. See illustration GS-0064.
Response 1: will expand under pressure to the left of center with flow from left to right
Response 2: will expand under pressure to the right of center with flow from left to right
Response 4: can pull away from the right hand pipe fitting with flow from left to right

Question: Flexible hose under pressure in a hydraulic system will __________.
Response 1: tend to twist about its long axis
Response 2: expand in length and in diameter
Response 3: contract in length and expand in diameter
Response 4: flex at right angles to the applied pressure

Question: If you install a hydraulic hose on a unit and fail to leave sufficient room for expansion which of the following problems will develop?
Response 1: The hose may pull loose from its fittings.
Response 2: The components connected by the hose will be damaged.
Response 3: The hydraulic unit will fail to acquire any power.
Response 4: The hydraulic fluid will overheat and breakdown.

Question: If you install a new hydraulic hose in a hydraulic system the hose must be long enough to allow for contraction to prevent __________.
Response 1: failure of the hydraulic hose connection
Response 3: friction in other areas of the hydraulic system

Question: The hydraulic tubing installation shown as figure "D" is INCORRECT and will probably leak when in operation because the tubing __________. See illustration GS-0065.
Response 1: will contract in diameter and expand in length under pressure
Response 2: and its fittings cannot be properly installed and tightened
Response 3: will stretch and overstress the male threads on the fitting
Response 4: cannot flex at right angles to the pressure applied by the fluid because it is not properly twisted

Question: The hydraulic tubing installation shown as figure D in the illustration will probably leak when operating because the tubing __________. See illustration GS-0065.
Response 1: will contract in diameter and expand in length under pressure
Response 2: has no provision to compensate for strain due to expansion and contraction
Response 3: will stretch and overstress the male threads on the fitting
Response 4: cannot properly twist when pressure is applied

Question: Flanged joints in high pressure hydraulic system piping are commonly made leak proof by ________.
Response 2: incorporating the use of neoprene O-rings

Question: If the hydraulic compression type tubing fitting shown as figure "C" in the illustration begins to leak you should __________. See illustration GS-0100.
Response 1: apply more thread seal and retighten part 'IV'
Response 2: apply thread seal tape around the threads between part "II" and 'IV' then reassemble and tighten

Question: When new piping sections have been fabricated for installation in a hydraulic system prior to installation the piping should be __________.
Response 2: descaled by using a pickling solution
Response 3: hydrostatically tested to 100% of maximum working pressure

Question: New piping and tubing to be installed in a hydraulic system can be safely degreased by using __________.
In the design of hydraulic piping and equipment consideration is given to minimize turbulence in the hydraulic fluid as this will cause __________.
According to Coast Guard Regulations flexible hoses used as supply and return lines to hydraulic system components must have __________.
Response 1: the working pressure of the system stamped on one of the end fittings
Response 2: the working pressure of the system stamped on both of the end fittings
Response 3: an inner tube constructed of seamless reinforced polyester braid
Response 4: a designed bursting pressure of at least four times the maximum working pressure of the system

Question: Hydraulic hose assemblies are permitted by 46 CFR to be installed between two points of relative motion __________.
Response 1: provided proper releasing mechanisms are available to enable quick disconnect capabilities
Response 2: but shall not be subjected to torsional deflection under any conditions of operation
Response 3: provided the entire length of the device is visible to the operator at all times
Response 4: to prevent the formation of loading stresses

Question: Of the hydraulic tubing fittings illustrated the flared fitting for high pressure use is represented by figure ______. See illustration GS-0100.
The portion of a hydraulic hose that determines its overall strength is the ______.
Of the hydraulic tubing fittings illustrated the flared fitting for high pressure use is represented by figure ______. See illustration GS-0100.
A flare-type tubing connector is used in the hydraulic hatch-cover system and has developed a slight leak. To stop the leak you should ______.
Response 1: shut down the power unit and use two wrenches to avoid damaging the tubing when tightening
Response 2: replace both the tubing sections and the fitting
Response 3: keep the system in operation and tighten the flare nut
Response 4: stop the system and use only one wrench to tighten the flare nut

Question: The purpose of an accumulator in a hydraulic system is to __________.
Response 1: collect any dirt in the system
Response 2: collect fluid from any small leak
Response 3: preheat the fluid during cold weather
Response 4: store potential energy in the form of hydraulic fluid under pressure in the system

Question: A hydraulic accumulator used in a hydraulic system aboard a MODU is designed to __________.
Response 2: act as the main fluid reservoir
Response 3: provide the only means of overpressure relief
Response 4: act as the singular source of fluid replenishment to a system

Question: The component used in a hydraulic system to store potential energy in the form of hydraulic fluid under pressure is the __________.
Energy imparted to the hydraulic fluid in an operating hydraulic system is stored in the __________.
The rubber bladder or separator bag installed in a hydraulic accumulator should only be filled with __________.
Which of the listed components of a hydraulic system would enable the pump to be temporarily shutdown and yet still provide an instantaneous source of hydraulic force?
One function provided by a hydraulic accumulator is to __________.
Response 1: provide an area where air can separate from the oil
Response 2: provide an area to separate solid contaminants from the oil
Response 3: act as an oil and water separator
Response 4: absorb shocks occurring in the system

Question: One function provided by a hydraulic accumulator is to __________.
Response 1: provide an area where air can separate from the oil
Response 2: provide an area to separate solid contaminants from the oil
Response 3: act as an oil and water separator
Response 4: absorb sudden changes in hydraulic fluid flow occurring in the system

Question: Before doing any work on a hydraulic system equipped with accumulators you should __________.
Response 1: drain the accumulators and purge with oxygen
Response 2: bleed off all stored energy from the accumulators
Response 3: completely charge the accumulators to prevent system energy loss
Response 4: pump the hydraulic fluid into the accumulators to prevent fluid loss

Question: Before performing any maintenance on a hydraulic system storing energy in an accumulator you should __________.
Response 1: pressurize the system to test for leaks
Response 2: bleed off all pressure within the system
Response 3: operate the machine until it reaches normal temperature
Response 4: disconnect the pump pressure control switch

Question: To charge a bladder type hydraulic accumulator __________.
Response 1: remove all hydraulic system pressure and bring the pneumatic pressure to the accumulator preload pressure
Response 2: remove all hydraulic system pressure and bring the pneumatic pressure to the system's design pressure
Response 3: increase the pneumatic pressure until the hydraulic system reaches its design pressure
Response 4: allow the accumulator to completely fill with gas charge at atmospheric pressure shut off the air chamber and add hydraulic fluid until proper pressure is reached

Question: According to Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) an accumulator is a/an __________.
Response 1: device in which bilge water may be stored prior to being pumped ashore
Response 2: unfired pressure vessel in which energy is stored under high pressure in the form of a gas or a gas and a hydraulic fluid.
Response 3: industry accepted term for the equipment which is used to collect oily bilge liquids
Response 4: test procedure in which the relieving capacity of the safety valves are verified

Question: A precharged bladder-type accumulator used in a hydraulic system can be potentially dangerous if ______.
Response 1: the bladder contacts the top of the poppet
Response 2: the inert gas is exposed to hydraulic oil
Response 3: it is precharged with dry nitrogen
Response 4: the charging valve stem breaks while at normal working pressure

Question: To charge a bladder type hydraulic accumulator ______.
Response 1: remove all hydraulic system pressure and bring the pneumatic pressure to the system's design pressure
Response 2: increase the pneumatic pressure until the hydraulic system reaches its design pressure
Response 3: remove all hydraulic system pressure and bring the pneumatic pressure to the accumulator preload pressure
Response 4: allow the accumulator to completely fill with gas charge at atmospheric pressure shut off the air chamber and add hydraulic fluid until proper pressure is reached

Question: The output volume of a positive fixed displacement pump can be changed only by __________.
Response 1: changing the angle of the tilting plate
Response 2: changing the speed of the pump
Response 3: moving the slide block and rotor

Question: Which of the following statements is/are true regarding hydraulic pumps in general?
Response 1: Variable volumes can be obtained with gear pumps only by variation of the pump drive speed.
Response 2: A radial piston pump houses sliding pistons in a stationary cylinder block through which passes a rotating pintle or ported shaft.
Response 3: The amount of fluid displaced per revolution of an axial piston rotary pump is maximum when the angle of the tilting box is at right angles to the shaft.

Question: In order for the hydraulic pump installed in a constant flow system to maintain adequate flow the pump suction should __________.
Response 1: be taken directly off the reservoir bottom without regard to filters or strainers
Response 2: be arranged to develop a maximum vacuum of approximately 10" of mercury
Response 3: be arranged to develop the theoretically maximum attainable vacuum
Response 4: be provided with three to five 1/2 inch holes in the vertical suction line to prevent pump starvation should the strainer become fouled

Question: One function of a replenishing pump installed in many pressure-closed hydraulic systems is to supply fluid flow to __________.
Response 4: the main system accumulators under all operating conditions

Question: In the hydraulic schematic illustrated the pump symbol indicates the use of a __________. See illustration GS-0041.
Response 2: constant flow pump of indefinite construction

Question: A casing drain is provided for axial piston and bent axis variable stroke pumps to __________.
Response 1: vent off any accumulated air from the system
Response 2: drain off any accumulated water from the pump casing prior to its being started
Response 3: assist the complete removal of hydraulic oil from the system prior to opening for major or minor repairs
Response 4: prevent damage due to agitation and overheating of oil accumulated in the casing as a result of normal internal leakage

Question: A bent axis variable stroke axial piston pump produces a greater capacity than a comparable tilting box-type axial piston pump because the __________.
Response 4: discharge/return line diameter are arranged differently

Question: The device illustrated would be best used as a __________. See illustration GS-0058.
Response 3: power take-off driven lube oil pump

Question: The discharge capacity of the axial piston hydraulic pump shown in the illustration is __________. See illustration GS-0058.
Response 1: fixed by the pump housing angle
Response 2: increased by adding a longer cylinder block
Response 3: decreased by adding a longer cylinder block
Response 4: increased by adding a shorter cylinder block

Question: When the tilting box of a variable stroke axial-piston pump is perpendicular to the pump shaft which of the following conditions will exist?
The torque rating of a fluid power motor is expressed in __________.
Response 1: RPMs under a given load condition

Question: In a fixed displacement axial piston hydraulic motor the speed is varied by __________.
Response 1: regulating the ratio between torque and speed via the torque limiter at the motor
Response 2: directing the motor output flow through a bypass line
Response 3: maintaining a constant flow and pressure input

Question: The speed of a fixed-displacement radial piston hydraulic MOTOR is controlled by varying the __________.
Response 1: amount of cylinder block offset with respect to the rotor
Response 2: fluid flow rate discharged to the motor
Response 3: length of the motor piston stroke on the power cycle
Response 4: pintle discharge rate to the suction side of the pump

Question: With regards to axial piston hydraulic pump/motor power units motor speed is a function of fluid flow rate generated by the pump. Which of the following statements describes why the motor is NOT manipulated as is the pump?
Response 1: The designers of the equipment have never considered the use of the tilting box with a hydraulic motor.
Response 2: A comparable pump tilting box if used in a hydraulic motor would eliminate the hydraulic lock to the system when the motor is placed in neutral stroke.
Response 3: Reduction gears would be required if a hydraulic motor were designed with a tilting box.
Response 4: A tilting box hydraulic motor could never produce more than one horsepower.

Question: The usual number of single-acting pistons used in a variable stroke axial-piston pump is __________.
An axial piston pump differs from a radial piston pump as the pistons of an axial piston pump are positioned __________.
Response 2: parallel to each other and to the shaft
Response 3: parallel to each other but at a right angle to the shaft
Response 4: at an angle to each other and to the shaft

Question: The delivery rate of an axial piston hydraulic pump is controlled by varying the position of the __________.
The delivery rate of a variable stroke axial piston hydraulic pump is controlled by varying the position of the __________.
The delivery rate of an axial-piston hydraulic pump is controlled by varying the position of the __________.
In the hydraulic transmission shown in the illustration the "B" end is a __________. See illustration GS-0057.
Regarding the hydraulic transmission illustrated the "A" end is a __________. See illustration GS-0057.

If the "B" end were driven by an electric motor and the "A" end were disconnected from the line terminals of the motor controller the unit illustrated could then be used as a __________. See illustration GS-0057.
Which of the following statements describes the actions of an axial piston motor with a full deflection variable position tilting box?
Response 1: Control over speed direction and stopping would be better than having the pump equipped with the tilting box.
Response 2: Maximum speed when rotated in the 'hauling in' direction would be obtained with the tilting box just prior to neutral stroke while 'pay out' would be the opposite.
Response 3: Maximum torque when rotated in the 'pay out' direction would be obtained with the tilting box just prior to neutral stroke while 'hauling in' would be the opposite.
Response 4: Maximum speed in either direction of rotation would be achieved just beyond of neutral stroke making reversal of direction difficult.

Question: Hydraulic pumps most commonly used in steering systems are of the __________.
Which of the following types of hydraulic pumps would be used in a steering system?
The device illustrated is considered to be a pump. Which of the following statements is true if it is to be used as a hydraulic motor? See illustration GS-0074.
Response 1: Pressurized fluid would have to be supplied to the existing indicted casing outlet.
Response 2: Roller vanes would have to be exchanged for sliding vanes.
Response 3: The diameter of the rotor would have to be increased.
Response 4: Nothing could be done to convert this device to a hydraulic motor.

Question: An axial piston variable stroke pump is used in a vessel's hydraulic steering gear. Under pressure the oil leakoff from between the valve plate and cylinder barrel will ______.
Response 1: cause loss of hydraulic oil from the system
Response 2: result in extreme damage to the pump
Response 3: cause damage to the pump if not continually drained from the pump casing
Response 4: result in the system low side pressure to substantially drop off

Question: Theoretically if the "B" end of the hydraulic transmission illustrated were provided with a variable position tilting box and the "A" end displacement were to be constant the __________. See illustration GS-0057.
Response 1: speed output of the "B" end would decrease in proportion as the tilting box would approach zero stroke
Response 2: available horsepower at the "B" end would increase in proportion as the tilting box would approach zero stroke
Response 3: speed output of the "B" would increase in proportion to increasing the "B" end tilting box angle
Response 4: available horsepower at the "B" end would increase in proportion to the increasing angle of the "B" end tilt box angle

Question: If the "B" end of the hydraulic transmission illustrated were provided with a variable position tilting box and the 'A: end displacement were to be constant the __________. See illustration GS-0057.
Response 1: speed output of the "B" end would increase in proportion as the tilting box angle would approach zero
Response 2: available horsepower at the "B" end would increase in proportion as the tilting box angle would approach zero stroke
Response 3: speed output of the "B" end would increase in proportion to increasing the "B" end tilting box angle
Response 4: available horsepower at the "B" end would increase in proportion to decreasing the angle of the "B" end tilting box towards zero

Question: Theoretically if the "B" end of the hydraulic transmission illustrated were provided with a variable position tilting box and the "A" end displacement were to be constant the __________. See illustration GS-0057.
Response 1: speed output of the "B" end would decrease in proportion as the tilting box would approach zero stroke
Response 2: available horsepower at the "B" end would increase in proportion as the tilting box would approach zero stroke
Response 3: available torque at the "B" end would increase in proportion to the increasing angle of the "B" end tilt box
Response 4: speed output of the "B" would increase in proportion to increasing the "B" end tilting box angle

Question: If the flow rate and pressure from a variable capacity pump was increased while supplying the device illustrated the __________. See illustration GS-0058.
Response 1: speed would increase horsepower and torque would decrease
Response 2: speed would decrease horsepower and torque would increase
Response 3: horsepower torque and speed would increase proportionally
Response 4: horsepower torque and speed would decrease proportionally

Question: The pressure side of the radial piston hydraulic motor as shown in the illustration is aligned to piston number __________. See illustration GS-0059.
In the radial piston pump shown in the illustration oil will enter the cylinder as the piston travels from position __________. See illustration GS-0060.
Oil is returned to the illustrated radial piston hydraulic pump piston(s) numbered as __________. See illustration GS-0059.
In the illustration control over the direction and quantity of fluid flow is attained by __________. See illustration GS-0059.
Response 1: changing the eccentricity between the reaction ring and the cylinder block
Response 2: moving the cylinder block off center from the reaction (floating) ring
Response 3: varying the direction of rotation and speed of the prime mover
Response 4: varying the prime mover direction of rotation and throttling pump output

Question: Regarding the pump shown in the illustration the quantity and direction of fluid flow is controlled by __________. See illustration GS-0059.
Response 1: varying the direction of rotation and size of the pintle valve
Response 2: varying the direction of rotation of the prime mover and throttling the pump output
Response 3: moving the cylinder block off center from the reaction ring
Response 4: moving the reaction ring off center from the cylinder block

Question: Both the direction of flow and fluid flow rate of a variable displacement radial piston pump are determined by the relative positions of the __________.
In a radial piston pump reversal and control of fluid flow are accomplished by moving the __________.
The amount of the cushioning effect developed within a hydraulic cylinder is determined by the __________.
Response 1: position of the directional port in the cushion cavity
Response 2: adjustment of the cushion cavity check valve
Response 3: design shape of the cylinder ends
Response 4: setting of the cushioning adjustment needle valve

Question: Why is a hydraulic linear actuator fitted with a cushioning device?
Response 1: To regulate actuator speed through the entire stroke length.
Response 2: To slow the action of the piston preventing shock and damage due to hammering effects.
Response 3: To allow the pump to temporarily operate at a pressure 10% above the relief valve setting without lifting the relief valve.

Question: If the flow rate to a linear actuator is reduced by half of the original amount the __________.
Response 1: pump discharge pressure will be reduced by a proportional amount
Response 2: speed of the actuator will be reduced
Response 3: speed of the actuator will be increased

Question: When a linear actuator (cylinder) is being retracted without an applied load the pressure on the oil leaving the 'cap end' will be __________.
Response 2: inversely proportional to the speed of retraction
Response 3: inversely proportional to the flow rate at the rod end
Response 4: increased as the speed of retraction increases

Question: Which of the following statements concerning the operation of a single-acting hydraulic ram is correct?
Response 1: Hydraulic force is applied simultaneously in two directions against the ram by directional ports.
Response 2: The single-acting ram is both extended and retracted by means of hydraulic force.
Response 3: The single-acting ram is not retracted by means of hydraulic force.
Response 4: Hydraulic force applied to a single-acting ram results in a pulling motion.

Question: Operation of a hydraulic pump in a cavitating condition can cause __________.
Response 1: the hydraulic fluid to become overheated
Response 2: the fluid motor to become overloaded

Question: If a radial piston hydraulic pump fails to deliver rated fluid volume the cause can be __________.
Obstructed suction passages in the casing or pintle of a radial piston hydraulic pump will cause the __________.
Response 2: pump return and discharge pressures to equalize
Response 4: pump discharge flow to drop to zero

Question: When the hydraulic control lever for a deck winch is placed in the neutral or off position the spring set brake on the fluid motor drive shaft is __________.
Response 1: engaged by spring action and only released by hydraulic pressure
Response 2: released by spring action and hydraulically locks the winch when the drum ceases rotating
Response 3: engaged by spring action plus hydraulic pressure
Response 4: opened hydraulically and held open by spring action whenever the electrical supply is secured

Question: The illustrated hydraulic pump graphic symbol is used to depict a ______. See illustration GS-0098.
Item "F" shown in the illustration represents two hydraulic pumps that are ______. See illustration GS-0103.
Response 1: motor operated with one pump located in the engine room at the shaft alley door and the other in a common passage way
Response 2: manually operated with one pump located at the shaft alley door and the other in a common passage way
Response 3: motor operated with one pump located on the engine room side and the other on the shaft alley side of the water tight door
Response 4: manually operated with one located in the engine room and the other in the shaft alley of the water tight door

Question: The illustrated hydraulic pump graphic symbol is used to depict a/an ______. See illustration GS-0097.
To convert a vane type hydraulic pump to a hydraulic motor which of the following would have to be done?
Response 1: Provide one additional slot and vane.
Response 2: Provide small springs between the vanes and the base of the vane slots.
Response 3: Install an enlarged control ring around the rotor.

Question: The device illustrated would be best used as a ______. See illustration GS-0058.
Response 1: power take-off driven lube oil pump

Question: If the flow rate and pressurized oil from a variable capacity pump were supplied to the device illustrated the ______. See illustration GS-0058.
Response 1: speed would decrease horsepower and torque would increase
Response 2: horsepower torque and speed would increase proportionally
Response 3: horsepower torque and speed would decrease proportionally
Response 4: speed would increase horsepower and torque would decrease

Question: A two stage hydraulic pump unit is used to ______.
Response 1: produce twice the flow rate than if only one element were to be used
Response 2: supply two individual flows to the same segments of the system if one of the pump elements were to fail
Response 3: develop the same flow rate across both pump elements with the discharge pressure of the second pump element being substantially higher than that of the first stage
Response 4: establish two individual flows to segregated segments of one system

Question: When changing to a fire resistant hydraulic fluid in a system it is important to check the compatibility of the new fluid with the system's __________.
When fire safe or fire resistant fluid is to be used in a hydraulic system it is important that __________.
Response 1: the resultant pressure due to the increase in fluid viscosity is not excessive
Response 2: the fluid does not dissipate too much heat
Response 3: the fluid be compatible with all seal materials used
Response 4: separate lube oil supply be furnished for the hydraulic pump

Question: Which of the following precautions should be observed concerning the introduction of a fire resistant fluid into a hydraulic system?
Response 1: Deterioration of paints seals metals and electrical insulation may occur.
Response 2: Fluid viscosity always increases as a normal result of its use.
Response 3: Decreased wear rates of components is an advantage of its use.
Response 4: Only chemically active filters may be used.

Question: When normal operating pressure is applied to the hydraulic oil used in a high-pressure system the oil __________.
As a rule of thumb when pressure is applied to hydraulic oil the oil will __________.
Response 1: not be compressed as liquids are not compressible
Response 2: reduce in volume by 1% for every 100 psi increment
Response 3: increase in volume by 1% for every 1000 psi increment
Response 4: reduce in volume by 1/2% for every 1000 psi increment

Question: How can the chance of contaminating hydraulic fluid be decreased when working on hydraulic systems?
Response 1: Clean the fittings before they are disconnected.
Response 2: Place drip pans under leaky fittings.
Response 3: Seal any cracks in lines with Permatex.
Response 4: Coat all threads with graphite oil.

Question: With an increase in temperature the volume of hydraulic fluid __________.
When normal operating pressure is applied to the hydraulic oil in a high-pressure system the oil __________.
Which of the following problems occurring in a hydraulic system can be caused by using an oil having a viscosity lower than specified?
The hydraulic oil most likely to thin out when hot and thick when cold would have a viscosity index of __________.
Which characteristic or condition will have the greatest effect on increasing a hydraulic oil's viscosity?
Increased internal leakage in addition to poor hydraulic system response and inadequate lubrication is the result of __________.
Response 3: broken directional control valve centering springs

Question: The by-products of oxidation as a result of water contamination of hydraulic oil are generally __________.
Response 4: harmless and have no effect on system components

Question: The major source of chemical contaminants in hydraulic fluid is __________.
Water allowed to accumulate in the hydraulic system oil will cause an oxidation process producing by-products which are normally __________.
What is the lowest permissible flashpoint of the oil used in a hydraulic valve actuating system that operates at 145 psi (1000kPa)? (46 CFR Part 58)
What is the lowest permissible flashpoint of the oil used in a hydraulic valve actuating system that operates at 145 psi? (46 CFR)
If you are given the job of adding hydraulic fluid to a mooring winch and are not certain as to the type of fluid to use you should __________.
Response 1: add fluid that is the same color as the fluid in the reservoir
Response 2: add turbine oil because it is always a good substitute
Response 3: add any oil that has the same viscosity as the hydraulic fluid
Response 4: check the winch manufacturer's instruction book

Question: With an increase in temperature the volume of hydraulic fluid ______.
The approximate quantity of hydraulic oil available to the system can be determined by __________. See illustration GS-0118.
Response 1: removing "G" and measuring the level in the sump
Response 3: removing "D" and measuring the height of the remaining liquid
Response 4: removing the cap from "A" and measuring the height of the hydraulic oil

Question: The approximate quantity of hydraulic oil available to the system can be determined by __________. See illustration GS-0118.
Response 1: removing "G" and measuring the level in the sump with a 'dip stick'
Response 2: observing the color change of the column in "J" and its comparative height
Response 3: removing "D" and measuring the height of the remaining liquid with a float stick
Response 4: removing the cap from "A" and measuring the height of the hydraulic oil

Question: Which of the statements is true concerning the illustrated hydraulic circuit when the directional control valve is centered? See illustration GS-0105.
Response 1: The oil pressure will equalize at both ends of the actuator and the pump will discharge through the reducing valve to the sump.
Response 2: The load on the actuator may cause a difference in pressure to exist between the rod and cap end and oil discharging to the sump across the relief valve with the pump operating.
Response 3: A pressure differential will exist between the two ends of the actuator with pump discharge lower than normal due to flow across the unloading valve.
Response 4: Oil pressure to both sides of the actuator will be equal as the pump discharge flow is directed across the relief valve.

Question: If it becomes necessary to start an axial piston hydraulic motor under conditions where the hydraulic fluid is colder than the lowest temperature recommended for proper operation you should operate the system at __________.
Response 1: minimum speed until the normal operating pressure is reached
Response 2: neutral stroke until all of the air has been vented
Response 3: no load until the normal operating temperature is reached
Response 4: maximum torque to attain rapid warm-up

Question: In which of the listed hydraulic systems will the installation of an oil cooler be necessary?
Response 4: Internal combustion engine hydraulic starter system

Question: If you attempt to tighten a leaking hydraulic fitting with pressure on the system you will __________.
Response 2: find that the pressure will prevent the components from being tightened
Response 4: dislodge any scale in the tubing and it will damage the system

Question: Lint from cleaning rags can be harmful to hydraulic systems because the lint __________.
Response 1: can cause rusting of internal parts
Response 3: can clog filters and promote component leakage

Question: After installing a new hydraulic pump in a system what special attention should be given to the hydraulic system?
Response 1: The relief valves in the system should be readjusted.
Response 2: The filters and strainers should be checked frequently.
Response 3: All system pressure should be readjusted.
Response 4: The system should be drained and renewed with a fluid of different operating characteristics.

Question: After installing a new hydraulic pump in a system what special attention should be given to the hydraulic system?
Response 1: The relief valves in the system should be readjusted.
Response 2: The filters and strainers should be checked frequently.
Response 3: System return pressure should be readjusted.
Response 4: The system should be drained and renewed with a fluid of different operating characteristics.

Question: Purging air from a hydraulic system is necessary when __________.
Response 1: adding small amounts of oil to the system
Response 3: the system has been drained and then filled with new oil
Response 4: the system has been idle for a long period of time

Question: Which of the following problems may be encountered by using an oil having a viscosity higher than that specified for an operating hydraulic system?
Sluggish response or action of the hydraulic actuators may be a result of __________.
Response 4: reservoir level being maintained two inches above normal

Question: Overheating of a hydraulic system may be a result of __________.
Response 1: changing pump discharge pressure in response to normal load variations
Response 4: continued slow recirculation of the oil

Question: Cavitation in a hydraulic pump is indicated by noisy pump operation and can be caused by a/an __________.
Response 1: high fluid level in the reservoir
Response 3: excessive discharge pressure from the pump
Response 4: clogged suction strainer in the reservoir

Question: Overheating of the hydraulic fluid in an electro-hydraulic anchor windlass may indicate pump cavitation caused by __________.
Response 2: low oil level in the reservoir
Response 3: low fluid viscosity existing only around the shaft seal
Response 4: high oil level in the sump

Question: Cavitation in a hydraulic pump is ________.
Response 1: the compression and collapse of vapor bubbles in the pump internal components
Response 2: caused by pitting of the pump internals due to galvanic action
Response 3: caused by pitting of the pump internals due to operation with acidic oil
Response 4: a result of a clogged discharge filter

Question: If a hydraulic pump sounds like it is pumping rocks when in operation the problem is most likely ________.
Air trapped in one end of a hydraulic actuator may be indicated by __________.
Response 1: erratic or jerky motion of the actuator
Response 2: a pump discharge pressure that is consistent but higher than normal
Response 3: consistently faster response or movement of the actuator

Question: Air entrained in the hydraulic fluid or trapped in an actuator will cause the actuators to move with a jerky motion. This action is a result of __________.
Response 1: the trapped air being compressed to a pressure above the maximum pump discharge pressure then re-expanding and lowering in pressure after the actuator moves
Response 2: the trapped air being compressed to operating system pressure then dropping in pressure as the actuator moves allowing the air to re-expand then repeating the process
Response 3: air being capable of moving loads more effectively than a liquid
Response 4: air providing better lubrication of internal components found in Hydraulic Systems than hydraulic fluids

Question: Air entrained in the hydraulic fluid or trapped in an actuator will cause the actuators to move with a jerky motion. This action is a result of __________.
Response 1: the trapped air being compressed to a pressure above the maximum pump discharge pressure then re-expanding and lowering in pressure after the actuator moves
Response 2: the cyclic expansion and contraction of air due to the motion of the actuator
Response 3: air being capable of moving loads more effectively than a liquid
Response 4: air providing better lubrication of internal components found in Hydraulic Systems than hydraulic fluids

Question: Overheating of the oil in a hydraulic system can be caused by __________.
Response 1: continuous leakage through the pressure relief valve
Response 2: an increase in the number of the hydraulic fluid film layers
Response 4: fluctuating pump discharge pressure in response to normal load variations

Question: If a hydraulic pump is overheating the cause may be __________.
Response 1: excessive internal slippage in the pump
Response 2: low discharge pressure and fluid flow
Response 3: excessive fluid level in the hydraulic reservoir
Response 4: operation of the pump at 100% efficiency

Question: Hydraulic machinery failures are commonly caused by contamination of the hydraulic fluid and __________.
Hydraulic machinery failures are commonly caused by misalignment of the system components and by __________.

A simple hydraulic system is made up of a pump relief- valve manual-control valve and a linear actuator. If the piping connected to the actuator 'cap end' is accidentally crushed to one half of its diameter this will result in __________. See illustration GS-0107.
If the pump in a hydraulic system produces a low rumbling noise while in operation this is a probable indication of __________.

Response 1: the four-way control valve failing to shift
Response 2: the bleeder valve sticking in the open position
Response 4: a clogged air vent filter on the oil reservoir

Question: If a hydraulic pump is producing a noisy whine when in operation the cause may be __________.
Response 1: an air leak in the pump suction line above the oil level in the reservoir
Response 2: low viscosity in the hydraulic fluid
Response 3: an oil leak across the pump shaft packing
Response 4: due to the wrong direction of rotation of the hydraulic motor

Question: If dirt is allowed to contaminate the sump of a hydraulic deck crane which of the following problems will occur?
Response 1: All the seals in the hydraulic lines will immediately blow out.
Response 2: The lifting capacity of the crane will be immediately reduced by 70%.
Response 3: The sheathing on the hydraulic lines will fracture.
Response 4: The internal parts of the pump and hydraulic motor will wear excessively.

Question: If the boom shown in the illustration can be raised but not lowered the problem is most likely with the "Topping Circuit" ________. See illustration GS-0161.
Response 4: counterbalance valve ball check  failed to close

Question: If the operating pressure is determined to be normal in the system shown in the illustration yet the crane does not swing (slew) in either direction when the directional control valve is operated the problem could be ________. See illustration GS-0161.

Question: The counter balance valve (5) in the winch circuit shown in the illustration ________. See illustration GS-0161.

Response 3: prevents over-travel of the winch when retrieving
Response 4: aligns the pump's discharge to the winch's hydraulic motor

Question: You press start button on the hydraulic power unit shown in the illustration and the motor does not start. The first thing you should check is the ________. See illustration GS-0161.
Response 3: pump discharge relief valve setting is too low

Question: The directional control valves as shown in the illustration are ________. See illustration GS-0161.
Response 1: three-position spring loaded and closed centered
Response 2: three-position spring loaded and open centered

Question: A hydraulic system gear pump being fed from a reservoir frequently indicates signs of excessive pitting after two months of service. Which of the following would most likely contribute to this condition?
Response 1: Abnormal pressurization is occurring in the reservoir.
Response 2: A partial restriction in the return line has developed.
Response 3: A vacuum condition has developed in the reservoir.
Response 4: Operating oil temperature is determined to be below normal.

Question: A hydraulic system gear pump being fed from a reservoir indicates signs of excessive pitting after two months of service. Which of the following would most likely contribute to this condition?
Response 1: Excessive dust conditions have clogged the reservoir breather cap.
Response 2: A partial restriction in the return line has developed.
Response 3: Abnormal pressurization is occurring in the reservoir.
Response 4: Operating oil temperature is determined to be below normal.

Question: Energy losses occurring in a hydraulic system are ultimately absorbed by the __________.
The direction and rate of rotation for the cab in the hydraulic crane circuit shown is controlled by the __________. See illustration GS-0161.

Response 1: slightly shifting the hoist valve into position "I" to hold the load in a steady position
Response 2: the installation of a braking valve in line "K" to the hydraulic motor
Response 3: the use of a spring set electric solenoid released brake

Question: Which component in the illustrated hydraulic crane circuit acts to prevent the wire rope drum from accidentally paying out? See illustration GS-0161.
The safety feature which assists the hydraulic crane circuit illustrated to maintain the required boom angle is a function of item __________. See illustration GS-0161.

Response 2: testing the hydraulic fluid for proper pH
Response 3: checking the reservoir for proper level

Question: A check run on a hydraulic anchor windlass during long periods of inactivity should be carried out to __________.

Response 2: remove condensation from the fluid reservoir
Response 3: prevent the anchor from seizing in the hawsepipe
Response 4: renew the internal coating of lubrication

Question: The hydraulic system of a deck winch has been drained flushed and refilled with hydraulic fluid. An erratic knocking noise from the hydraulic motor when the winch is started would indicate __________.

Question: Overheating of the hydraulic fluid in an electro-hydraulic anchor windlass can result from a/an __________.
Response 2: low fluid level in the reservoir
Response 3: low fluid viscosity around the shaft seal
Response 4: high oil level in the sump

Question: If the pump for a hydraulic anchor windlass is overheating the cause may be __________.
Response 3: too low of a tilting box angle

Question: If the pump for a hydraulic anchor windlass is over-heating the cause may be __________.
Response 3: too low of a tilting box angle

Question: While starting a hydraulic anchor windlass you observe that hydraulic pressure does not develop in spite of the proper operation of the electric drive motor. Which of the following actions should you take FIRST to restore pressure?
Response 1: Make certain that the hydraulic reservoir is filled to the proper level.
Response 2: Inspect the disc brake on the electric motor for proper operation.
Response 3: Check the electric motor for an open overload relay contact.
Response 4: Check for full voltage supply to the electric motor.

Question: In the hydraulic crane circuit illustrated which would be the correct hydraulic configuration required to raise the boom? See illustration GS-0161.
Response 1: activate directional valve 9 and shift spool valve to area 3
Response 2: activate directional valve 9 and shift spool valve to area 1

Response 4: activate directional valve 8 and shift spool valve to area 1

Question: In the hydraulic crane circuit illustrated what is the function of the component labeled #18? See illustration GS-0161.
Response 1: Provide additional control when lowering the boom.
Response 2: Provide additional control when swiveling the platform.
Response 3: Control the lowering speed of the winch cable.
Response 4: Provide a pressure relief if the boom becomes overloaded.

Question: Purging air from a hydraulic system is necessary when ______.
Response 1: the system has been idle for a long period of time
Response 2: adding small amounts of oil to the system
Response 4: the system has been drained and then filled with new oil

Question: The device shown in the illustration is a/an __________. See illustration GS-0116.
Response 3: oil scraper ring stuffing box for a crosshead engine

Question: If oil under pressure is supplied to the space between "N" and "I" in the illustration __________. See illustration GS-0116.

Question: The steering gear shown in the illustration when compared to the more conventional linear actuator ram units is/are __________. See illustration GS-0116.

Question: Oil is supplied to the illustrated steering gear __________. See illustration GS-0116.

Question: Rudder position is shown on the bridge by the __________.

Question: A command signal input to the steering gear has initiated rudder movement for 20 right rudder. The follow-up mechanism at the beginning of the rudder movement will __________. See illustration GS-0123.

Response 4: be in motion providing an input to place the variable stroke pump on null stroke

Question: When the steering wheel is turned oil is directed to the steering gear rams by __________.

Question: When the port power unit is started as shown in the illustration the unloading valve "C" __________. See illustration GS-0123.

Response 3: shifts blocking the replenishing pump flow to the service tank thus building the required pilot pressure to shift the distributor valve "A"
Response 4: shifts to block the servo pump discharge from the starboard unit when started thus building pilot pressure to shift the starboard unit distributor valve

Question: When the desired rudder angle is attained by a typical double ram electro-hydraulic steering gear the __________.

Response 4: follow-up gear takes the hydraulic pump off stroke

Question: When responding to a 'left rudder' command from the amidships position which parts of the steering gear system illustrated will be subjected to the highest pressure? See illustration GS-0137.

Question: When there is no movement of the rams on an electro-hydraulic steering gear the tilting box of the running pump is __________.

Question: The figures shown in the illustration shows two different positions of the same steering gear hydraulic pump. Which of the following statements is correct? See illustration GS-0102.

The device shown in the illustration is a/an ______. See illustration GS-0116.
Response 4: oil scraper ring stuffing box for a crosshead engine

Question: If it is necessary to prevent the rudder from moving while a repair is made on the steering system using the illustrated actuator ______. See illustration GS-0116.

Response 3: secure the valves in the supply and return lines

Question: Rudder position is shown on the bridge by the ______.
If oil under pressure is supplied to the area noted as "N" on the vane in the illustration ______. See illustration GS-0116.
Response 1: "O" will be hydraulically locked in place even though oil is returned to the main pump from the area between "M" and "I"
Response 2: "O" will rotate clockwise as oil is returned from the area between "M" and "I"
Response 3: "O" will rotate counter-clockwise as oil is returned from the area between "M" and "I"

Question: The operation of the device shown in the illustration is dependent upon ______. See illustration GS-0116.
Response 1: all items similar to "I" move as the rudder stock rotates
Response 2: all items similar to "N" move as the rudder stock rotates
Response 3: both "I" and "N" move as the rudder stock rotates
