To increase the blow down of a nozzle reaction safety valve __________.
Response 4: raise the blow down ring and then lower the nozzle ring

Question: The principal means of increasing the amount of blow down for safety valve shown in the illustration remove the set screw labeled __________. See illustration SG-0019.
Response 1: "A" and raise the position of the ring
Response 2: "A" and lower the position of the ring
Response 3: "B" and raise the position of the ring
Response 4: "B" and lower the position of the ring

Question: The popping pressure of the safety valve shown in the illustration is controlled by the __________. See illustration SG-0018.
To change the lifting pressure of the safety valve shown in the illustration you must readjust the part labeled __________. See illustration SG-0018.
To increase the popping pressure of the safety valve shown in the illustration __________. See illustration SG-0018.
Which of the following statements concerning the safety valve shown in the illustration is correct? See illustration SG-0018.
Response 1: When the drop lever is raised the safety valve spring is compressed.
Response 2: When a gag is placed on the valve it should be installed only finger tight to prevent damage to the spindle.
Response 3: The safety valve operates with a "huddling chamber" principle.

Question: A boiler accumulation test is used to measure the __________.
Response 1: lifting pressure of the boiler safety valves
Response 2: total relieving capacity of the boiler safety valves
Response 3: steam generating capacity of the boiler
Response 4: blow down pressure of the boiler

Question: Accumulation tests are conducted in order to determine the __________.
Response 1: steam generating capacity of an individual boiler
Response 2: steam relieving capacity of safety valves
Response 3: maximum combined oil consumption of all oil burners installed on a single boiler
Response 4: maximum combined steam generating capacity for all propulsion boilers of a single plant

Question: Proper bracing and support of the boiler safety valve escape piping is necessary to __________.
Response 1: prevent condensate from accumulating in lines
Response 2: prevent stressing of the safety valves
Response 3: allow for back pressure formation in the line
Response 4: prevent scale from lodging on the valve seat

Question: On a boiler equipped with pilot actuated safety valves which of the valves listed will be actuated first?
Response 3: Pilot actuated safety valve for the superheater safety valve
Response 4: Pilot actuated safety valve for the drum safety valve

Question: One of the important functions of the superheater safety valves is to __________.
Response 1: maintain a constant steam flow in the desuperheater
Response 4: maintain a constant steam flow in the auxiliary steam line

Question: Once a huddling chamber type safety valve has begun to initially open it will then pop open due to the __________.
Coast Guard regulations require that the superheater safety valves __________.
The relieving capacity of the superheater safety valves is considered to be insufficient when the working pressure of the boilers is __________.
The relieving pressure of the superheater safety valves is permitted to be reset without exchanging the valves when the working pressure of the boilers is __________.
The safety valve hand lifting gear should not be used if the boiler pressure is less than 75% of the safety valve popping pressure in order to __________.

On an operating boiler the superheater safety valve shown in the illustration is set to lift at 670 psi and reseat at 630 psi. To increase the lifting pressure to 700 psi but maintain the previous reseat pressure you would turn the compression screw __________. See illustration SG-0018.
Response 3: clockwise direction and lower adjusting ring
Response 4: counterclockwise direction and raise the adjusting ring

Question: When testing boiler safeties those valves not being tested are prevented from lifting by __________.
Response 3: temporarily increasing the valve spring pressure

Question: To prevent safety valves from lifting when a boiler is being hydrostatically tested you should __________.
Response 1: tie down the hand lifting gear

Question: Which of the precautions listed should be taken when gagging a boiler safety valve?
Response 1: Do not allow the gag to contact the safety valve stem.
Response 2: Tighten the gag only with the special wrench supplied with the gag.
Response 3: Ensure that all moving parts of the safety valve are free to move before installing the gag.
Response 4: Tighten the gag only finger tight to prevent damage to the valve stem disc or seat.

Question: Safety valve gags should only be installed hand tight in order to prevent __________.
When placing a gag on the safety valve shown in the illustration it is necessary to remove the __________. See illustration SG-0019.
When installing new safety valve escape piping precautions should include assuring that __________.
Response 1: bends or elbows in the line do not exist
Response 2: no stress is transmitted to the valve
Response 4: the piping leads directly to the bilge

Question: While your vessel is underway at normal speed a steam drum safety valve develops a significant leak. Your first corrective action should be to __________.
Response 1: attempt to reseat the valve using the hand releasing gear
Response 2: secure the boiler and check the valve spring compression
Response 3: inspect the escape piping for binding on the valve body
Response 4: secure the boiler and blank off the valve flange

Question: If a boiler superheater safety valve is leaking at normal working pressure the quickest method of determining and possibly solving the problem is to __________.
Response 1: blow out the valve by several short lifts with the hand lifting gear
Response 2: fully open the superheater safety drain valve for several seconds
Response 3: lower the firing rate until the leakage stops
Response 4: raise the firing rate until the leakage stops

Question: Which of the conditions will occur FIRST if the steam flow to the main engine when at full power is suddenly stopped?
Response 2: Dual element automatic feed water regulator will compensate for boiler water swell.
Response 4: Combustion control system will automatically secure all of the burners.

Question: Which of the conditions listed could be the cause of chattering in a boiler safety valve?
Coast Guard regulations require that the relieving capacity of boiler safety valves must be checked __________.
Response 3: when the generating capacity of the boiler is increased
Response 4: when repairs have been made to the safety valves

Question: Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) permit repairs and adjustments to boiler safety valves while installed on a main propulsion boiler and may be made by ________.
Response 1: the chief engineer in an emergency
Response 2: any competent person on the ship

Question: According to Coast Guard Regulations boiler safety valves __________.
Response 1: shall not have valves on drain lines
Response 2: will only be set and sealed by the Chief Engineer
Response 3: will be provided with a suitable lifting device operated only from the fire room

Question: Coast Guard Regulations 46 CFR Part 54 require steam safety and relief valves to be provided with a substantial lifting device capable of lifting the disc from its seat at what percentage of the set pressure?
If the maximum steam generating capacity of a boiler is increased Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require that the safety valve's __________.
If the maximum steam generating capacity of a boiler is increased Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require that the safety valves' __________.
In accordance with Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) which of the following statements is true concerning safety valve construction and/or operation used on propulsion boilers?
Response 1: Not have threaded inlets for valves larger than 2".
Response 2: Gagging a safety valve by means of a set screw through the cap when gags are unavailable is acceptable only when conducting a hydrostatic test.
Response 3: After the valve is set and adjusted the tolerance in popping and reseating pressures shall not vary more than plus or minus 1 1/2%.

Question: Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require that the final setting of boiler safety valves be conducted in presence of the __________.
Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) for boiler safety valves require that __________.
Response 1: no valves of any type shall be installed in the leak off from drains or drain headers
Response 2: all safety valve gags or clamps must be carried on board the vessel at all times
Response 3: the final setting of the safety valves shall be checked and adjusted under steam pressure
Response 4: All of the above are correct.

Question: The MAWP of a boiler is 900 psi and the normal drop across the superheater is 20 psi. If the superheater safety valve is set to lift at 825 psi the minimum settings of the drum safety valves allowed by Coast Guard Regulations would be _______.

A boiler superheater safety valve is set to lift at 450 psi (3102 kPa). Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require that if there is a pressure drop of 10 psi (69 kPa) across the superheater the drum safety valve should set to lift at a pressure of __________.
According to 46 CFR which of the following statements is true concerning main boiler safety valve escape piping?
Response 1: Expansion joints or flexible pipe connections are prohibited.
Response 2: The piping shall be led as near vertical as possible to the atmospheric drain tank.
Response 3: The piping should be supported and installed so that no stress is transmitted to the valve body.

Question: Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) concerning superheater safety valves require that the valve __________.
Response 1: be set at a pressure higher than the drum safety valves
Response 2: can only be operated by a pilot valve
Response 3: nominal size is not less than 1.5 inches nor more than 4 inches
Response 4: is not set at a pressure less than the feed pump relief valve

Question: Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR Part 52) concerning boiler superheater safety valves require that the valve ________.
Response 1: be set at a lifting pressure that is higher than the drum safety valve
Response 2: have a drain opening tapped for not less than 1/4 in. NPS
Response 3: be constructed with a cast iron body
Response 4: have a threaded inlet connection if greater than 2 in. NPS

Question: The safety valve nominal size for propulsion boilers and superheaters must be not less than 1 1/2 inches and not more than 4 inches. The term 'nominal size' refers to the __________.
A properly adjusted safety valve for an auxiliary boiler will __________.
Response 1: attain maximum lift when it pops below its set pressure
Response 2: open with a sharp clear pop at its set pressure
Response 3: close sharply when the pressure drops to its set pressure
Response 4: operate most effectively when it has zero blow down

Question: The maximum allowable working pressure on a packaged auxiliary boiler is 200 psig. The normal working pressure for one particular packaged boiler is 175 psig. Which of the following safety relief valve settings would be proper for this boiler?
A safety valve on an auxiliary boiler simmers constantly and can not be stopped by several quick blow-offs using the hand relieving gear. The problem may be __________.
Which of the listed types of safety valves is shown in the illustration? See illustration SG-0018.
The variable capacity pressure atomizing fuel oil burner functions to __________.
Response 2: provide a wide range of combustion
Response 3: provide a constant fuel return pressure

Question: The process of breaking up fuel oil into fine particles to ensure good combustion is called __________.
Fuel oil atomizers are used in boilers to __________.
Response 1: control the temperature of fuel entering the furnace
Response 2: control the amount of air entering the furnace
Response 4: break fuel oil into a fine spray

Question: Fuel oil passing through the burners is divided into fine particles by the __________.
The degree of fuel oil atomization is dependent upon the __________.
In addition to a nozzle a fuel oil atomizer uses which of the listed parts?
In addition to a orifice plate a fuel oil atomizer uses which of the listed parts?
The primary purpose of the sprayer plate in a mechanical atomizing oil burner is to __________.
Response 1: completely mix air with the fuel
Response 2: assist in mixing atomizing steam with the fuel
Response 3: produce a fine swirling uniform fuel mist
Response 4: prevent primary air mixing with the fuel

Question: What is indicated by the code number 32Y20 stamped on a burner sprayer plate?
Response 1: Sprayer plate orifice area is 0.32 square inch.
Response 2: Sprayer plate requires a size 20 tip.
Response 3: Sprayer plate orifice was made with a size 32 drill.
Response 4: Sprayer plate requires a minimum of 20 psi fuel pressure.

Question: Which group of numbers would indicate the largest fuel capacity for a sprayer plate in a mechanical fuel oil atomizer?
Which atomizing sprayer plate has the largest capacity?
Which of the following statements is true concerning the burner atomizer shown in the illustration? See illustration SG-0022.
Response 1: The annular groove imparts the initial swirling motion to the oil.
Response 2: The operating range or 'turndown ratio' of this type of burner is almost unlimited.
Response 3: The bore of the sprayer plate orifice has a standard drill size of "38".

Question: The number '29' on a fuel oil burner sprayer plate marked '2909' indicates the __________.
The last two digits stamped on a fuel oil atomizer sprayer plate represents the cross-sectional area ratios of the tangential slots and orifice. This ratio determines the __________.
The illustrated burner atomizer assembly is __________. See illustration SG-0022.
Response 2: used only for variable load steam atomization
Response 3: an example of a rotary cup type atomizer
Response 4: used in a return flow type burner management system

Question: In a marine boiler equipped with mechanically atomized burner assemblies proper combustion depends on the __________.
Response 1: design and mechanical construction of the atomizers
Response 2: speed of the forced draft fan and quantity of excess air
Response 3: centrifugal force imparted to the oil in the atomizer

Question: In a marine boiler equipped with mechanically atomized burner assemblies proper combustion depends on the __________.
Response 2: speed of the forced draft fan and quantity of excess air

Question: To obtain the best mixing of air and fuel with a fuel oil atomizer you need to adjust the __________.
Response 1: atomizer position using the distance piece
Response 3: primary and secondary air cones for desired air flow
Response 4: total air volume admitted to the boiler furnace

Question: The amount of oil atomized by a straight mechanical fuel oil burner depends on the sprayer plate size and the __________.
Which of the fuel atomizers listed has the greatest firing range or turndown ratio?
A boiler has a steam delivery capacity of 100000 pounds per hour and is equipped with four steam atomizing burners. If the load range of the burners is 4 to 1 this means that __________.
Response 1: the boiler may be operated down to 25000 pounds per hour without securing any burners
Response 2: the boiler may be operated down to 25000 pounds per hour only after three burners are secured
Response 3: if two burners are operating steam output will be a minimum of 50000 pounds per hour
Response 4: all four burners combined can supply up to 400000 pounds of steam per hour

Question: Boilers equipped with steam atomizers can operate over a wide load range without cutting burners in and out because __________.
Response 1: steam maintains the oil at the fire point temperature
Response 2: atomizing steam pressure is held constant for all load ranges
Response 3: it is not necessary to regulate fuel oil pressure at the burners with this system
Response 4: steam velocity aids in the atomizing of fuel oil over a wide range of fuel pressures

Question: Boilers equipped with steam atomized burners can be operated without changing burner tips because steam atomization __________.
Response 1: maintains the oil at ignition temperature
Response 2: finely atomizes fuel oil over a band of fuel oil system pressures
Response 3: automatically cleans the burner tips and eliminates fouling
Response 4: regulates itself by responding to the position of the main engine throttles

Question: Boilers equipped with steam atomizers can operate over a wide load range without cutting burners in and out because __________.
Response 1: steam maintains the oil at the fire point temperature
Response 2: atomizing steam pressure is held constant for all load ranges
Response 3: it is not necessary to regulate fuel oil pressure at the burners with this system
Response 4: the degree of atomization is not dependent upon fuel oil pressure

Question: In most installations the firing rate of a boiler using steam atomization is indicated by the __________.
The firing range of a steam assisted fuel atomizer is regulated to cope with changes in the steam demand by varying the __________.
Response 4: shape of the atomized fuel cone

Question: The amount of fuel oil atomized by a steam atomization burner depends on the atomizing steam pressure the fuel pressure and the __________.
An advantage of steam atomization compared to mechanical atomization is __________.
Response 2: improved heat transfer in the boiler
Response 3: the ability of the system to maintain the proper ratio of fuel and air at all rates of combustion
Response 4: bleed steam is utilized thereby increasing plant efficiency

Question: A secondary function of atomization steam in a fuel oil burner is to __________.
Response 1: maintain a constantly high fuel pressure
Response 2: prevent overheating of the atomizer when not firing during maneuvering
Response 3: maintain a constantly high fuel temperature
Response 4: vary the viscosity of the fuel oil

Question: A primary function of burner atomization steam is to __________.
Response 1: maintain a constantly high fuel pressure
Response 2: prevent overheating of the air register when secured
Response 3: maintain a constantly high fuel temperature
Response 4: impart a swirling motion in the oil spray for efficient combustion

Question: In a steam assist atomizer the fuel oil/steam mix takes place entirely within the __________.
Compared to the return flow oil burner system an internally mixed steam atomizer requires __________.
Response 4: greater turbulence in the air/oil stream

Question: In a steam assist fuel oil atomizer the steam pressure is higher than the oil pressure at __________.
Steam assist fuel atomizers are converted to straight mechanical atomizers in order to __________.
Response 1: raise steam on the idle boiler
Response 2: cold start a boiler with diesel oil

Question: Which of the following procedures represents the proper care of unused burners during low load conditions?
Response 1: They should be removed cleaned refitted with smaller tips and reinstalled to be ready for immediate use.
Response 2: They should be removed cleaned and stored in the rack on the burner bench.
Response 3: They may be left in place with fuel and steam secured as long as they are not fouled.
Response 4: They may be left in place but only if they are clean and if fuel oil is recirculated to provide cooling.

Question: Boiler fuel oil atomizer parts should be cleaned by soaking in 'tip cleaner' or diesel fuel and __________.
Response 4: scraped with a modified table knife

Question: To properly clean a burner tip you should use __________.
To properly remove the burner tip nut from the burner barrel the barrel should be __________.
Response 1: clamped in a machinist's vice on the work bench
Response 2: fixed in the burner stowage rack
Response 3: held by the fixture on the burner cleaning bench
Response 4: removed from the gooseneck before removing the tip nut

Question: Improper atomization can be caused by __________.
Response 2: using the same size burner tips in all burners

Question: Which of the listed conditions would indicate a dirty atomizer sprayer plate?
Response 2: Carbon deposits on the register doors.
Response 3: Dark streaks in the burner flame.

Question: Improper fuel oil burner atomization can be generally attributed to __________.
Response 2: using the same size burner tips in all burners

Question: If the temperature of the fuel oil entering an atomizer is too low the burner will __________.
Response 3: produce heavy black smoke at any load condition
Response 4: require more excess air for combustion

Question: If a burner were inserted too far into the boiler furnace it could cause carbon deposits on the __________.
Which of the conditions listed could be responsible for the flame of a mechanical atomizer to blow out when attempting to light off?
Response 1: The openings in the diffuser are improperly adjusted.
Response 2: The radial air doors are closed.
Response 3: The distance piece is improperly adjusted.
Response 4: The viscosity of the fuel oil is too low.

Question: Poor atomization accompanied by an elongated flame from a steam atomization burner is MOST likely caused by __________.
Response 1: the fuel oil temperature being too low
Response 2: improper operation of traps in atomizing steam return piping
Response 3: the forced draft fan too slow for the boiler load

Question: Accumulation of fuel oil in the boiler double casing could be caused by __________.
Fuel oil accumulation in a boiler double front is generally caused by __________.
Fluctuations in the atomizing steam pressure at the burners could be caused by a/an __________.
Response 1: malfunctioning steam trap in the atomizing steam system

Question: Fluctuations in the atomizing steam pressure at the burners could be caused by a/an __________.
Response 1: malfunctioning condensate drain in the atomizing steam system

Question: In a multi-burner firebox a burner tip with a worn and enlarged orifice will __________.
Response 1: have no effect on the flow of oil if the proper pressure is maintained
Response 2: result in an uneven flow of oil through the burner
Response 3: cause a high fuel oil return line back pressure

Question: In a multi-burner firebox a burner tip with a worn and enlarged orifice will __________.
Response 1: have no effect on the flow of oil if the proper pressure is maintained
Response 2: result in an uneven heating of the furnace
Response 3: cause a high fuel oil return line back pressure

Question: Excessive accumulation of carbon deposits on a boiler burner throat ring and diffuser could result in __________.
Response 2: a reduced boiler fuel oil pressure

Question: Carbon deposits on the boiler burner throat ring is usually caused by __________.
Response 4: the burner cycling on and off

Question: When preparing to light off a cold boiler equipped with a return flow fuel oil system the recirculating valve directs the flow of oil __________.
Response 1: directly to the fuel oil heater inlet for further warm-up
Response 2: back to the fuel oil settler for further filtration
Response 3: back to the suction side of the service pump

Question: A variable capacity pressure atomizing fuel oil burner functions to __________.
Response 2: provide a wide range of combustion
Response 3: provide a constant fuel return pressure

Question: Variations in the amount of fuel oil burned in a return flow type burner of an auxiliary boiler are controlled by the __________.
Response 3: back pressure in the fuel oil return line

Question: A sprayer plate marked 32Y20 as used in a return flow fuel oil system should only be used with a/an __________.
In comparison to straight flow mechanical atomizers return flow atomizers provide relatively uniform atomization over a wide firing range due to the __________.
Response 1: back pressure regulation resulting in more complete combustion at high firing rates
Response 2: oil supply pressure not having to be reduced at low loads to the point where poor atomization occurs
Response 3: return flow atomizer being designed for best combustion at low firing rates
Response 4: rotational motion imparted by the tangential slots being greater in the return flow atomizer

Question: The amount of oil consumed by a return flow-type fuel atomization system fitted with both supply and return meters can be determined by the __________.
Response 3: sum of the supply and return meter readings
Response 4: difference between the supply and return meter readings

Question: Subtracting the return flow meter reading from the supply flow meter reading on a boiler equipped with a return flow fuel oil system determines the amount of oil __________.
The firing range of a variable capacity return flow-type fuel atomizer is regulated to meet steam demand by varying the __________.
The amount of fuel oil atomized by a return flow oil burner is directly controlled by the __________.
A sprayer plate used in a return flow fuel oil atomizer is correctly installed if the oil __________.
Response 1: passes through the whirling chamber before passing through the tangential slots
Response 2: passes through the tangential slots before passing through the whirling chamber
Response 3: leaves the burner as a straight stream until mixed with the primary flow of combustion air
Response 4: leaves the burner as a straight stream until mixed with the swirling atomizing steam

Question: The amount of oil atomized by the return flow variable capacity atomizer used with some automatically fired boilers is controlled by the __________.
Response 1: amount of air admitted to the atomizer
Response 2: oil pressure in the oil return line
Response 3: quantity of oil delivered by the service pump
Response 4: proportioning device in the atomizer fuel valve

Question: Which of the following conditions is responsible for the fuel oil to atomize when using a steam atomizer in an auxiliary boiler?
Response 1: Expansion of the steam in the furnace.
Response 2: Expansion of the steam in the whirling chamber.
Response 3: Expansion of the steam in the orifice plate.

Question: Which of the following statements describes how the fuel oil enters the whirling chambers of the sprayer plates used in a auxiliary boiler return flow fuel oil system?
Response 2: Through the sprayer plate drilled passages.
Response 3: Through tangential slots in the sprayer plate.
Response 4: Through baffles in the orifice plate.

Question: Excessive return oil pressure from a variable capacity return flow fuel oil burner system on an automatic auxiliary boiler will cause __________.
The illustrated burner atomizer assembly is ______. See illustration SG-0022.
Response 1: an example of a rotary cup type atomizer
Response 2: used only for variable load steam atomization
Response 3: used in a return flow type burner management system

Question: Regarding the boiler shown in the illustration the burners are to be placed at __________. See illustration SG-0007.
The component labeled "F" as shown in the illustration is __________. See illustration SG-0007.
Response 1: one of the retractable soot blower elements
Response 3: one of the main burner assemblies

Question: The entire unit which houses the burner air scoop air doors and bladed cone is correctly called the __________.
The measured gap between the face of the burner atomizer tip nut and the diffuser plate is determined by the setting of the __________.
The distance piece in a boiler burner register assembly provides for adjustment of the __________.
Response 1: diffuser to attain the desired amount of secondary air flow
Response 2: atomizer position to obtain the best mixing of air and oil
Response 3: quantity of the primary and secondary air cones for best air flow
Response 4: total volume of air and fuel admitted through the register

Question: The distance piece in a boiler burner register assembly provides for adjustment of the __________.
Response 1: burner throat opening to attain the desired amount of secondary air flow
Response 2: diffuser position with relation to the atomizer tip
Response 4: total volume of air admitted through the register

Question: Which of the following represents the function of the diffuser used with a mechanical atomizing oil burner?
Response 1: Provide flame stability at the atomizer tip.
Response 2: Control the amount of secondary combustion air.
Response 3: Complete the vaporization of the fuel for combustion.
Response 4: Finely divide the fuel particles into a cone-shaped spray.

Question: The purpose of the diffuser in a boiler burner assembly is to __________.
Response 1: break up fuel oil into a fine spray
Response 2: assist combustion by heating incoming air
Response 3: shield the flame from the incoming air blast while allowing some mixing of fuel and air
Response 4: diffuse flame to all corners of the furnace

Question: The diffuser of a burner register assembly __________.
Response 1: acts as a shield to prevent flare back
Response 2: shapes the fuel particles into a cone
Response 3: serves to make the air mix evenly with the oil
Response 4: adds heat to the fuel particle cone

Question: In an air register assembly the majority of air passes through the __________.
Response 3: stationary air foil or blade cone

Question: What is the purpose of the movable air doors in an air register?
Response 1: Regulate the temperature of air entering the furnace.
Response 2: Function to open and close the register.
Response 3: Maintain airflow across the forced draft fan.

Question: According to the illustration what part number identifies the "diffuser"? See illustration SG-0016.
According to the illustration what part number identifies the "air doors"? See illustration SG-0016.
According to the illustration what part number identifies the "air door handle"? See illustration SG-0016.
According to the illustration what part number identifies the "igniter"? See illustration SG-0016.
When securing a boiler the burner registers are to be left open for a few minutes to __________.
A burner atomizer improperly positioned in the distance piece may cause __________.
Response 2: slag formation on the screen tubes
Response 3: erosion of the screen tube baffles
Response 4: the ends of the flame farthest from the atomizers to be a yellowish orange or golden shade

Question: Throttling the burner air register of a lit burner could result in __________.
Response 1: carbon deposits on the register doors
Response 2: carbon deposits on the furnace walls
Response 3: too much excess air for combustion
Response 4: excess combustion temperature in the furnace

Question: The main reason for keeping an operating boiler burner register fully open while steaming is to prevent __________.
Why are the burner registers closed a few minutes after a boiler has been secured to be cooled?
Response 1: To prevent cracking the furnace refractory.
Response 3: To allow more rapid furnace cooling.

Question: Shortly after shutting off the fuel to a boiler which is to be secured the __________.
Which of the conditions listed can cause the flame of a mechanically atomized burner to be blown away from the burner tip when you are attempting to light off?
Response 1: Insufficient excess air is being supplied to the furnace.
Response 2: Fuel oil viscosity is too low.
Response 4: The secondary air cone is improperly adjusted.

Question: Carbon deposits on the diffuser and register throat ring of a burner __________.
Response 1: interfere with air flow around the burner
Response 2: cause pre-ignition of the atomized fuel
Response 3: allow heat loss to the boiler casing
Response 4: are of no consequence and may be left in place until a fireside inspection allows time for removal

Question: According to the illustration what part number identifies the "igniter"? See illustration SG-0016.
According to the illustration what part number identifies the "diffuser"? See illustration SG-0016.
The components lettered "O" shown in the illustration function to __________. See illustration SG-0007.
Response 1: clean soot off the surrounding tubes
Response 3: provide viewing of the generating tubes
Response 4: acid clean the surrounding tubes during cold plant maintenance

Question: The boiler shown in the illustration arrow "O" indicates the __________. See illustration SG-0007.
The tubes projecting horizontally through the generating tube bank shown in the illustration are __________. See illustration SG-0008.
The purpose of the cam-actuated steam valve used in a boiler soot blower system is to __________.
Response 1: rotate the element through a predetermined blowing arc
Response 2: automatically blow the elements in the proper sequence
Response 3: automatically secure steam to the blower head any time the element stops turning
Response 4: prevent steam from entering the soot blower when the element holes are directed toward the refractory

Question: The arc through which a steam soot blower element blows is regulated by the __________.
Combustion gases can leak into the fire room through __________.
Response 4: soot blower swivel tube packing glands

Question: The scavenging air for soot blowers is supplied by the __________.
Scavenging air is supplied to steam soot blower elements to __________.
Response 1: prevent back up of combustion gases into soot blower heads
Response 2: provide cooling air when soot blower elements are rotating through blowing arcs
Response 3: prevent build up of soot on the element

Question: Scavenging air is supplied to steam soot blower elements to __________.
Response 1: provide cooling air when soot blower elements are rotating through blowing arcs
Response 2: prevent buildup of soot on the element
Response 4: prevent the backup of combustion gases into soot blower heads

Question: Scavenging air is supplied to steam soot blowers to __________.
Response 1: prevent the backup of combustion gases into soot blower heads
Response 2: provide cooling air when soot blower elements are rotating through blowing arcs
Response 3: prevent the escape of steam into the inner casing
Response 4: prevent warping of the cams when exposed to high temperature steam

Question: The purpose of the pressure control disk installed in the multi-nozzle soot blower as shown in the illustration is to __________. See illustration SG-0023.
Response 1: control the pressure exerted on the steam valve disk when the cam secures the steam supply
Response 2: reduce the steam supply pressure to the soot blower element
Response 3: control the pressure exerted on the valve spring retainer
Response 4: increase the pressure in the steam supply line for proper soot blower operation

Question: If the pressure control disk in the soot blower illustrated is moved to a higher position the result will __________. See illustration SG-0023.
Response 1: cause the soot blower to rotate faster
Response 2: cause the soot blower to rotate slower
Response 3: decrease the amount of steam valve travel
Response 4: increase the steam pressure in the rotating blower element

Question: The purpose of the pressure control disk installed in the soot blower illustrated is to __________. See illustration SG-0023.
Response 1: control the velocity and distance of the steam valve passing from the soot blower element
Response 2: reduce the steam supply pressure to the soot blower element
Response 3: control the amount of arc during rotation of the soot blower element
Response 4: assist in the initial opening of the valve at the beginning of the soot blower operation

Question: Before blowing tubes in a boiler equipped with steam soot blowers you should __________.
Response 3: reduce the forced draft fan speed

Question: Before using the steam soot blowers to blow tubes at sea you should __________.
In preparing to blow tubes at sea you should __________.
Boiler forced draft pressure should be increased before blowing tubes to __________.
Response 4: prevent a drop in steam pressure

Question: Which of the listed operational precautions is necessary before blowing tubes?
Response 2: Open all drains in soot blower steam supply piping.
Response 3: Thoroughly warm all soot blower steam supply piping.

Question: Before using a boiler compressed air soot blower system you should __________.
Response 3: decrease the forced draft fan speed
Response 4: drain the soot blower pneumatic operating lines

Question: To avoid acid corrosion of the economizer tubes when blowing tubes __________.
The steam soot blower piping should be thoroughly drained before operating to prevent __________.
The steam soot blower piping should be thoroughly drained before operating to prevent __________.
The steam soot blower piping should be thoroughly drained before operating to prevent __________.
The combustion air pressure is increased when using the steam soot blowers to 'blow tubes' in order to __________.
Scavenging air pressure is provided to the steam soot blowers to __________.
Steam soot blower piping should be thoroughly drained before operating to prevent __________.
Response 3: water hammer damage and nozzle/element erosion

Question: Excessive soot accumulations on boiler generating tube surfaces can result in __________.
Response 3: reverse circulation of the steam and water mixture

Question: An indication of a faulty superheater soot blower element is a __________.
If a soot blower element does not revolve freely the most likely cause would be __________.
Response 2: an improper blowing arc cam setting
Response 3: warpage of the soot blower element
Response 4: insufficient steam pressure to the soot blower element

Question: Boiler firesides must be kept free of soot accumulations because __________.
Response 1: soot interferes with the flow of feed water
Response 2: the steam drum internals will become clogged
Response 3: the fuel oil heaters will become overloaded
Response 4: soot insulates the boiler heating surfaces

Question: An indication of excessive soot accumulation on boiler water tubes and economizer surfaces is __________.
After routine blowing of tubes at sea there should be a decrease in the __________.
Response 3: excess air required for complete combustion

Question: Which of the following conditions must exist before the superheating of saturated steam can occur in a steam propulsion boiler?
Response 1: The firing rate of the boiler must be increased.
Response 2: The flow of feed water to the boiler must be increased.
Response 3: The steam must be directed to an area separate from the steam drum.
Response 4: The economizer must be on line.

Question: In a boiler equipped with a convection type superheater the superheater tubes are located __________.
Response 1: in the path of the radiant heat of combustion
Response 2: between the downtake nipple and circulator tube
Response 3: in a position screened from the furnace
Response 4: between the economizer and generating tubes

Question: Superheaters of the convection type are heated __________.
Response 1: by direct contact with the flame

Question: In a boiler equipped with a convection type superheater the superheater tubes are located __________.
Response 1: in a position screened from the furnace flame
Response 2: in the direct path of radiant heat flow
Response 3: in a separately fired convection furnace
Response 4: on the fireside of the screen tubes

Question: The boiler superheater shown in the illustration is a/an __________. See illustration SG-0007.
What type of boiler superheater is shown in the illustration? See illustration SG-0008.
The boiler superheater vent shown in the illustration is connected to the part labeled '____'. See illustration SG-0007.
Where is the superheater located in the boiler shown in the illustration? See illustration SG-0008.
Boiler superheaters are designed to __________.
Response 1: raise the sensible heat of the steam
Response 2: increase the overall mechanical efficiency of the plant
Response 3: provide continuous steam flow to the control desuperheater
Response 4: raise the latent heat of the steam

Question: The purpose of the division plates installed in boiler superheater headers is to __________.
Response 1: limit the maximum temperature rise of the superheater outlet to 15F
Response 2: ensure proper steam flow thus preventing 'short circuiting' of superheater loops
Response 3: provide a means of controlling steam passage in response to throttle demands

Question: Which of the types of superheaters listed has the flattest superheat temperature curve?
A convection type superheater in a D-type boiler is protected from radiant heat by __________.
Desuperheated steam from the control desuperheater is returned to the main superheater to control the outlet temperature by the action of __________.
Response 3: an orifice in the superheater inlet header

Question: Under steady steaming conditions the superheater outlet temperature is regulated by the __________.
The plugging of an excessive number of superheater tubes will result in __________.
The plugging of an excessive number of superheater tubes will result in __________.
If a pressure drop does not exist across the superheater in a steaming boiler __________.
Response 2: the drum safety valve is about to lift ahead of the superheater safety
Response 3: there is no steam flow through the superheater
Response 4: the feed water temperature is too low

Question: Warping of superheater screen tubes can be caused by __________.
Response 4: sudden cooling of tubes after being overheated

Question: Fireside burning of boiler tubes is usually the direct result of __________.
Response 1: soot accumulations on a tube bank
Response 2: overheating due to poor heat transfer

Question: Fireside burning of boiler tubes is usually the direct result of __________.
Response 4: overheating due to poor heat transfer

Question: The most serious fireside burning of the boiler superheater tubes is the result of __________.
Response 1: combustion gases impinging on the tubes
Response 2: fuel droplets striking the hot tubes
Response 3: carbon steel tubes being heated above 750F
Response 4: the tubes becoming steam bound or dry

Question: Fireside burning of boiler superheater tubes is a direct result of __________.
Response 1: combustion gases impinging on the tubes
Response 2: fuel droplets striking the hot tubes

Question: Fireside burning of boiler tubes can be a result of __________.
The most common cause of abnormal fireside burning of the boiler superheater tubes can "indirectly" be the result of _________.
Response 1: combustion gases impinging on the tubes
Response 2: fuel droplets striking the hot tubes
Response 4: the tubes being subjected to excessive vibration

Question: The most serious fireside burning of the boiler superheater tubes can be INDIRECTLY attributed to __________.
Response 1: combustion gases impinging on the tubes
Response 2: fuel droplets striking the hot tubes
Response 4: the tubes being subjected to excessive vibration

Question: A heavy accumulation of soot on the fireside of the superheater can cause a __________.
Response 1: low superheater outlet temperature because of the insulating effect of soot
Response 2: high superheater outlet temperature because of reduced steam flow
Response 3: high superheater inlet temperature because of decreased heat transfer
Response 4: high superheater outlet temperature because of gas laning

Question: Dirty generating tube surfaces may cause higher than normal superheater outlet temperatures because __________.
Response 1: the boiler must be over fired to maintain the required rate of steam generation
Response 2: the temperature of the gas leaving the generating banks will be lower than normal
Response 3: the screen tubes absorb excessive heat and transfer the increased temperature to the superheater
Response 4: gas laning will result causing overheating of the superheater

Question: Excessive soot deposits on the heating surfaces of a boiler uncontrolled interdeck superheater would be indicated by __________.
Response 1: decreased fuel oil and air requirements

Question: After steam has been raised and a boiler is being placed on the line the superheater vent can be closed when __________.
Response 1: main and auxiliary steam line drains are opened
Response 2: the boiler steam stops have been warmed up
Response 3: boiler pressure is 5 psi above line pressure
Response 4: the boiler is supplying auxiliary steam

Question: When a boiler is up to pressure and is being placed on the line you should secure the __________.
Which of the listed actions should be carried out with the superheater vent valve during the time steam is being raised in a boiler?
Response 1: The valve must be wide open all the time until the boiler is on the line.
Response 2: The valve may be closed when all air is vented.
Response 3: The valve may be partially throttled as the pressure increases until the boiler is on the line at which time it is closed.
Response 4: The valve need only be open if the superheater temperature approaches 850F.

Question: When raising steam on a boiler the superheater drains should __________.
Response 1: be opened to remove condensate and then closed when the first burner is lit
Response 2: be closed until just before line pressure is reached and then given a short blow period
Response 3: be closed until after the air cock is closed and then opened until the boiler is placed on line
Response 4: remain open or partially open until steam blows through the lines and then the valves should be closed

Question: The superheater vents should always be open when __________.
Response 4: the water level is lower than normal

Question: Increasing the amount of excess air to a boiler equipped with an uncontrolled interdeck superheater will cause the steam temperature at the superheater outlet to __________.
An excessively high superheater temperature could be the result of __________.
Which statement is true concerning operational factors affecting the degree of superheat in a single furnace boiler?
Response 1: As the rate of combustion increases the degree of superheat increases throughout the entire firing range.
Response 2: With a constant firing rate and steam consumption equal to generation a decrease in the incoming feed water temperature results in a superheat temperature decrease.
Response 3: With large amounts of excess air superheater outlet temperature will decrease due to the lack of sufficient time for heat transfer to take place.
Response 4: Carrying boiler water total dissolved solids higher than normal could result in a decrease in the degree of superheat.

Question: On a boiler equipped with an uncontrolled interdeck superheater reducing the feed water temperature to the steam drum will cause the superheater outlet temperature to __________.
When operating under constant load the superheated steam temperature may rise above normal if the __________.
Response 2: feed water temperature is too low
Response 3: feed water temperature is too high

Question: Under constant boiler load the superheated steam temperature may rise above normal for the existing load if __________.
Response 2: feed water temperature is too low
Response 3: boiler water level is too high

Question: In a "D" type marine boiler operating under constant load which of the following conditions could cause the superheated steam temperature to rise above normal?
A cause of high superheater outlet temperature is _________
Response 3: excessive fuel oil temperature at the settlers

Question: Should the superheater outlet thermometer indicate an excessively high temperature on a single furnace boiler the cause could be __________.
Response 3: the fuel oil being too viscous

Question: Under otherwise normal steaming conditions an abnormally high temperature at the superheater outlet of a single furnace boiler would indicate __________.
Response 1: poor heat transfer in feed water heaters
Response 4: excessive steam supply to fuel oil heaters

Question: The temperature of steam at the superheater outlet is influenced by the __________.
Response 3: amount of moisture contained in the steam

Question: High temperature at the superheater outlet would NOT be caused by __________.
High temperature at the superheater outlet would be caused by __________.
When answering a full astern bell from half ahead the superheater outlet temperature on a single furnace boiler will __________.
Response 1: increase sharply with the increased firing rate
Response 2: decrease due to the increase steam volume used
Response 3: decrease momentarily and then increase proportionately with load demand

Question: Under normal operating conditions a drop in the steam temperature leaving an uncontrolled interdeck superheater could be caused by a __________.
Response 1: decrease in combustion gas velocity through the superheater
Response 2: decrease in steam velocity through the superheater
Response 3: drop in the feed water temperature

Question: Increasing the temperature of the feed water entering the steam drum will ultimately result in a/an __________.
Response 3: decrease in the degree of superheat
Response 4: decrease in the quality of steam entering the superheater

Question: In an automatically fired boiler increasing the temperature of the feed water entering the steam drum will ultimately result in a/an __________.
Response 1: increase in the quality of superheated steam
Response 3: decrease in the degree of superheat
Response 4: decrease in the quality of steam entering the superheater

Question: Under normal firing rates a reduction of the steam outlet temperature from an uncontrolled superheater could be caused by __________.
Under normal operating conditions a drop in the steam temperature leaving an interdeck-type superheater can be caused by a decrease in the velocity of the __________.
Response 1: combustion gas flowing around the superheater tubes
Response 2: steam flowing through the superheater tubes

Question: Under otherwise normal operating conditions a drop in the steam temperature leaving an uncontrolled interdeck-type superheater could be caused by a/an __________.
Response 1: increase in combustion gas velocity through the superheater
Response 2: decrease in steam velocity through the superheater

Question: Under normal operating conditions a drop in the steam temperature at the outlet of an interdeck superheater could be caused by a decrease in __________.
Response 3: combustion gas velocity through the superheater
Response 4: the pressure differential across the fuel oil strainers

Question: If there is a sudden drop in the outlet temperature of an uncontrolled superheater you should __________.
Response 3: check for high water level in the drum
Response 4: reduce the forced draft fan speed

Question: A sudden unexplainable drop has occurred in the outlet temperature of an uncontrolled interdeck superheater on a boiler carrying a higher than normal TDS (total dissolved solids) reading. Which of the actions listed is required?
Response 1: Immediate increase in the firing rate.
Response 2: Reduction in the forced draft fan speed.
Response 3: Lowering the steam drum water level.

Question: Which of the listed conditions can cause high superheater outlet steam temperature in an automated boiler?
Response 1: High water level in the steam drum.
Response 2: Excessive heat transfer in the control desuperheater.

Question: Which of the listed conditions can cause excessively high superheater outlet steam temperature in an automated boiler?
Response 1: High water level in the steam drum.
Response 2: Excessive heat transfer in the control desuperheater.
Response 4: Excessive air flow through the furnace

Question: Severe priming in a boiler can cause damage to the __________.
Rapid fluctuation of the superheater outlet temperature can be caused by __________.
A rapid fluctuation of the superheater outlet temperature on a steady steaming boiler could indicate __________.
Response 2: excessive steam flow through the superheater
Response 4: failure of the internal auxiliary desuperheater

Question: Damaging scale can form on the interior of superheater tubes as a result of __________.
Response 3: insufficient steam flow through the superheater

Question: Which of the following statements represents the Coast Guard Regulation regarding a boiler installation in which the superheater outlet temperature exceeds 850F?
Response 1: Safety valves are to be set at 110% of the highest setting of the safety valves on the drum.
Response 2: Visible and audible alarms indicating excessive superheat shall be provided.
Response 3: All mountings fittings valves or other superheater attachments must be of malleable cast iron.
Response 4: A device actuated by inlet static pressure and designed to function by the bursting of a pressure retaining disk must be fitted at the outlet of the superheater.

Question: Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require that alarm systems be provided for superheaters whose operating outlet temperature is capable of exceeding __________.
Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) concerning marine boilers require the installation of a safety valve on the __________.
In the boiler shown in the illustration the arrow "E" indicates a ______. See illustration SG-0008.
Where is the superheater located in the boiler shown in the illustration? See illustration SG-0008.
Which of the devices listed is shown in the boiler illustration? See illustration SG-0008.
In a boiler water gage glass a ball check valve is installed on the __________.
The phrase 'boiler water column' as defined in the regulations refers to the __________.
Response 3: pressure head to the feed water pump suction
Response 4: pressure gauge reading in feet of water

Question: The glass used in a flat-type boiler water gage is protected from the hot steam and water by a/an __________.
Bi-color water level indicators connected directly to the boiler drum operate on the principle of __________.
Response 1: different refractive properties of steam and water
Response 3: different chemical properties of steam and water
Response 4: different densities which result from the comparison of the varying steam pressure in the drum

Question: The purpose of the mica used in a boiler water gage glass assembly is to prevent __________.
Which of the following actions if any should be taken if the water gage glass on a steaming boiler breaks?
Response 2: Close in on the feed stop-check valve.
Response 3: Close the gage glass cutout valves.
Response 4: No action is necessary since checks in the cutout valves automatically seat to stop loss of steam and water.

Question: Thin sheets of mica are installed in boiler gage glasses to __________.
Thin sheets of mica are installed in boiler gage glasses to __________.
Response 1: reduce the possibility of the glass from becoming etched
Response 2: limit the possibility of glass being blown out into the fire room
Response 3: lower the conductivity of the water in the glass

Question: The boiler gage glasses should be periodically blown down to __________.
Response 1: test the feed water stop-check valve
Response 2: provide accurate water samples for the second assistant
Response 3: maintain the proper water level in the steam drum
Response 4: remove any sediment buildup in the gage glass

Question: The boiler water gage glasses should be blown down __________.
Response 1: when you are in doubt about the water level
Response 2: twice each day on the midnight and afternoon watches
Response 3: every 12 hours of steady boiler steaming operation
Response 4: when the boiler water level changes in a steaming boiler

Question: You should blow down a gage glass periodically to __________.
Response 1: remove any sediment from the glass
Response 2: maintain the proper water level in the steam drum
Response 3: provide water samples for the second assistant
Response 4: test the feed water stop-check valve

Question: To properly blow down a boiler gage glass you should __________.
Response 1: blow through the top (steam) connection first
Response 2: blow through the bottom (water) connection first
Response 3: never disconnect the chains that connect the upper and lower cut out valves
Response 4: take up snugly on upper and lower gage glass packing nuts prior to blowing down

Question: In the absence of the manufacturer's instructions a good procedure in reassembling a high pressure boiler gage glass is to tighten the nuts in pairs and __________.
Response 1: begin with the center bolts and work toward the ends
Response 2: begin with the end bolts and work toward the center
Response 3: start at the top and work down
Response 4: start at the bottom and work up

Question: The items labeled "D" and "M" as indicated on the illustration are commonly called ________. See illustration SG-0020.
The items labeled "C" and "L" as indicated on the illustration are commonly called ________. See illustration SG-0020.
If the engineer on watch has reason to doubt the accuracy of the water level shown in the boiler gage glass he should __________.
Response 1: speed up the main feed pump

Question: If the gage glass water level remains constant in a steaming boiler while maneuvering the most probable cause is a __________.
An obstruction in the top connection of a boiler gage glass will cause the __________.
Response 1: water level to remain constant in the glass
Response 2: water level to rise slowly in the glass
Response 3: gage glass to overheat and break
Response 4: gage glass to be blown empty

Question: While the vessel is rolling in heavy seas the level in the boiler gage glass remains steady this is an indication that __________.
Response 1: the gage glass is functioning normally
Response 2: there is most likely an obstruction in the lower valve
Response 3: the steam drum is adequately baffled
Response 4: the water level in the steam drum is too low

Question: If the engineer on watch has reason to doubt the accuracy of the water level showing in the boiler gage glass he should FIRST __________.
Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) permit tubular type water gage glasses on auxiliary boilers provided the maximum allowable working pressure does not exceed __________.

According to Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) the maximum allowable boiler pressure in which a tubular gage glass may be installed is __________.
According to Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) the highest boiler pressure where a tubular type gage glass may be installed is __________.
Proper lagging of a single-element feed water regulator is accomplished by applying the insulation material __________.
Response 1: to the steam connection but not water connection
Response 2: to the water connection but not steam connection
Response 3: to both connections including finned areas
Response 4: only as necessary to prevent possible injury

Question: Which of the operating principles listed would apply to a single-element thermo-hydraulic feed water regulator?
Response 1: A failure of the regulator pressure actuating system closes the valve.
Response 2: The regulator maintains a constant water level throughout the boiler load range.
Response 3: The cooling fins on the generator prevent the formation of steam in the closed system.
Response 4: The pressure in the inner tube acts upon the bellows of the regulator.

Question: Which of the following statements is true concerning the operation of a boiler thermo-hydraulic feed water regulator?
Response 1: A failure in the regulator pressure actuating system opens the feed valve wide.
Response 2: The regulator maintains constant water level throughout all boiler load ranges.
Response 3: The inner tube of the generator is open to the steam and water in the steam drum.
Response 4: The outer tube of the generator transfers heat to the inner tube of the closed system.

Question: In a single-element feed water regulator the amount of valve opening and closing is controlled by the __________.
Response 4: feed water flow to the boiler

Question: Single-element automatic feed water regulators are controlled by the __________.
Response 2: water level in the steam drum
Response 4: feed water flow to steam drum

Question: Which of the operating principles listed would apply to a single-element thermo-hydraulic feed water regulator?
Response 1: A failure of the regulator pressure actuating system such as from a leaky bellows will tend to close the feed water valve.
Response 2: The regulator is designed to always maintain a constant water level throughout the entire boiler load range.
Response 3: The water side line leading to the inner tube is normally insulated.
Response 4: The pressure in the inner tube acts upon the bellows of the regulator.

Question: Which type of feed water regulator listed provides the MOST effective regulation of boiler water level under all operating conditions?
A two-element boiler feed water regulator is controlled by __________.
Response 1: steam flow and feed water flow
Response 2: steam flow and drum water level
Response 3: drum water level and feed water flow
Response 4: drum water level and drum pressure

Question: A two-element feed water regulator responds directly to changes in __________.
Response 1: feed water flow to the boiler

Question: Two-element feed water regulators operate by sensing __________.
Response 1: boiler water level and steam flow
Response 2: boiler water level and steam pressure
Response 3: boiler water level and feed water flow
Response 4: feed water flow and steam pressure

Question: A two-element feed water regulator reacts to changes in the steam drum water level and the __________.
One of the operating conditions sensed by a two-element feed water regulator is __________.
A two-element feed water regulator not only responds to changes in water level but is also designed to react to __________.
The two-element feed water regulator functions similarly to the three-element feed water regulator but does not utilize __________.
A pneumatic dual element main propulsion boiler feed water regulating system commonly used aboard ship utilizes __________.
A triple element main propulsion boiler feed water regulating system commonly used aboard ship utilizes __________.
Response 4: proportional plus reset plus rate action

Question: A single element boiler feed water regulating system used aboard ship utilizes __________.
Response 4: proportional plus reset plus rate action

Question: The boiler feed water control valve varies the unity relationship between steam and water flow during periods of __________.
If the entire pneumatic control to a multi-element feed water regulator fails the feed water valve is controlled by __________.
In the event of a failure of the pneumatic control system a multi-element feed water regulator is designed to operate as a __________.
If the feed water flow sensor of a multi-element feed water regulator fails the valve will be controlled as a __________.
If the steam flow input device to a two-element feed water regulator valve fails the regulator operates as a __________.
A major difference between the two element and the three element feed water regulator control systems is that a three element system will additionally measure and incorporate the __________.
Response 1: drum water level to the feed water regulator
Response 2: steam flow to the feed water regulator
Response 3: feed water flow as sensed variable
Response 4: fuel oil flow to the feed water regulator

Question: If the bellows in a thermo-hydraulic feed water control valve ruptures the boiler water level will __________.
If the bellows in a thermo-hydraulic feed water control valve ruptures the boiler water level will __________.
The chemical substance initially responsible for heat loss in the combustion process is __________.
Boiler stack gas temperature could be higher than normal if __________.
Response 1: leakage exists in the inner and outer casing
Response 2: defects exist in the burner cone refractory
Response 3: fuel oil temperature is excessively high
Response 4: secondary combustion occurs in the gas passages

Question: In a steaming boiler higher than normal stack gas temperature can be caused by __________.
Response 4: delayed burning due to inadequate excess air

Question: Boiler stack gas temperatures will be higher than normal when __________.
Response 1: fuel temperature at the burners is excessively high
Response 2: not enough excess air is being supplied for combustion
Response 3: secondary combustion is occurring in the gas passages
Response 4: internal water wall refractory baffles have failed

Question: Corrosion of the flue gas side of the economizer can be a result of the __________.
If the theoretical quantity of dry air required to burn one pound of fuel oil is 13.75 pounds what is the weight of air per pound of fuel when operating a boiler at 5% excess air?

If the theoretical quantity of dry air required to burn one pound of fuel oil is 13.75 pounds what will be the weight of the air necessary to burn one pound of fuel when operating a boiler at 15% excess air?

If the theoretical quantity of dry air required to burn one pound of fuel oil is 13.75 pounds what will be the weight of the air necessary to burn one pound of fuel to operate a boiler at 20% excess air?
If the theoretical quantity of dry air required to burn one pound of fuel oil is 13.75 pounds what weight of air will be necessary to burn one pound of fuel to operate a boiler at 10% excess air?
Excess air must be provided to an operating boiler to allow for __________.
If the stack temperature is higher than normal this could indicate __________.
Which of the terms listed represents the ratio between the highest and lowest fuel oil pressure at which the burners will remain ignited?
Which of the following represents the proper color of the flame end farthest from the boiler burner during normal operations?
Black smoke issuing from the boiler stack can be caused by an improper fuel/air ratio and by __________.
If a boiler is smoking black and increasing the boiler front air box pressure does not reduce the smoke the cause can be __________.
If a boiler is smoking black and increasing the boiler front air box pressure does not reduce the smoke the cause can be __________.
Air leaks through the inner or outer casings of a boiler will __________.
Air leaks through the inner or outer casing of a boiler could result in __________.
Response 3: higher fuel consumption for normal steaming conditions

Question: In an oil fired water-tube boiler inner casing air leaks can cause __________.
Response 1: oxidation of the exposed furnace walls

Question: In addition to being hazardous to personnel gas leaks through the boiler casing can also __________.
Response 2: impair the effectiveness of the air purge cycle
Response 3: cause improper atomization of fuel oil
Response 4: impair the operation of the high steam pressure limit switch

Question: The major heat loss in an oil fired boiler is the heat __________.
Response 1: used in the economizer and air heater
Response 4: required to change water into steam

Question: When too much excess air is supplied to an operating boiler the __________.
Response 3: flame will impinge on the burner cone
Response 4: flame will be a deep red color

Question: Too much excess air in a steaming boiler may be indicated by __________.
Under normal operating conditions of constant load and combustion rates which of the following will occur when the amount of excess air to the furnace is increased?
Response 1: The superheater inlet temperature will decrease.
Response 2: The rate of heat transfer will decrease.
Response 3: The superheater inlet temperature will increase.
Response 4: The superheater outlet temperature will increase.

Question: Which color burner flame would indicate too much excess air?
An incandescent white flame in a boiler firebox would indicate __________.
A lower than normal boiler stack gas temperature usually indicates __________.
Which of the following boiler stack (smoke color) conditions indicates efficient combustion?
Efficient combustion in a boiler is indicated by a __________.
Economy and efficiency in the operation of a marine boiler have traditionally been characterized by __________.
Response 2: maintaining the fuel oil temperature as high as possible
Response 3: a light brown haze from the stack
Response 4: a slight wisp of white smoke from the stack

Question: A light brown haze issuing from the boiler smoke stack generally indicates __________.
The greatest single overall loss of efficiency in a marine propulsion steam plant cycle results from __________.
Response 1: heat lost in the main condenser
Response 2: poor heat transfer in feed water heaters
Response 3: mechanical losses in the atomization process
Response 4: heat loss required for fuel oil heating

Question: Excessive combustion air in a boiler is indicated by the flame ends appearing as a/an __________.
White smoke coming from the stack of a main propulsion boiler indicates __________.
Response 2: partially burned fuel particles are leaving the stack
Response 3: excessive air velocity through the air registers

Question: White stack smoke from a main propulsion boiler could indicate __________.
Lower boiler efficiency results from carrying too much excess air because __________.
Response 1: it varies the degree of deposits on heat absorbing surfaces
Response 2: it increases the volume and temperature of the furnace gas leaving the stack
Response 3: it decreases the volatility of the fuel

Question: Insufficient combustion air supply to the furnace would cause __________.
Insufficient combustion air supply to a boiler furnace can cause __________.
In a boiler furnace incomplete combustion due to insufficient air yields an excess amount of __________.
Insufficient combustion air supply will cause an atomizer flame to appear as a __________.
Response 3: dull red flame with black streaks
Response 4: light yellow flame with white streaks

Question: Insufficient air for combustion in a boiler furnace could result in a __________.
A higher than normal stack gas temperature could indicate __________.
Before an explosion can occur in a boiler furnace there must be an accumulation of unburned fuel sufficient air to form an explosive mixture and a __________.
Response 1: space large enough for the explosion to occur
Response 2: ground in the burner ignition electrode
Response 3: high steam demand on the boiler
Response 4: source of ignition for the explosive mixture

Question: Prior to relieving the watch at sea you notice black smoke coming from the stack. What would this indicate?
Response 3: Soot blowers need to be operated

Question: Underway on watch in the fire room the bridge reports black smoke coming from the stack. This would indicate __________.
Regarding main propulsion boilers what condition would normally be indicated if the bridge reported that white smoke was observed coming from the stack?
Low stack gas temperatures due to light boiler loads should be avoided in order to reduce the __________.
Response 1: percentage of carbon monoxide in the stack gas
Response 2: formation of dew point sulfuric acid

Question: Low stack gas temperature should be avoided to reduce __________.
If an analysis of boiler flue gas determines there is no excess air for combustion you should expect the nitrogen content of the flue gas to be approximately __________.
If an analysis of boiler flue gas determines there is 100% excess air for combustion you should expect the flue gas to have a nitrogen content of approximately __________.
If an analysis of boiler flue gas determines there is 50% excess air for combustion you should expect the nitrogen content of the flue gas to be approximately __________.
A flue gas analysis is performed to determine the __________.
Response 2: correct fuel/air ratio for efficient combustion
Response 3: carbon content of the fuel being burned

Question: A chemical based analysis of boiler stack gases is taken to __________.
Response 1: determine the volume of the SO<sub>2</sub> products of combustion
Response 2: estimate the amount of noncombustible solids present in fuel oil
Response 3: estimate the BTU content of a quantity of fuel oil
Response 4: measure the percentage volume of CO<sub>2</sub>

Question: Assuming all burners are clean and the fuel oil is at the correct temperature it is considered good practice to adjust the excess air until a light brown haze is obtained. With the aid of a chemical based flue gas analyzer the percentage readings (not necessarily in order) should indicate __________.
Response 1: no CO low O<sub>2</sub> and high CO<sub>2</sub>
Response 2: low CO<sub>2</sub> no O<sub>2</sub> and high CO
Response 3: high CO high CO<sub>2</sub> and no O<sub>2</sub>
Response 4: high O<sub>2</sub> low CO and low CO<sub>2</sub>

Question: In which order should the chemical test analysis of boiler flue gas samples be made?
The efficiency of boiler combustion can be measured by the relative proportions of certain elements in the flue gases. The elements measured are __________.
Response 3: carbon dioxide oxygen and carbon monoxide
Response 4: nitrogen carbon dioxide and carbon monoxide

Question: A mechanical carbon dioxide recorder operates by detecting the difference between air and the __________.
Response 3: soot content of the flue gases
Response 4: specific weight of the flue gases

Question: Generally a 12% to 14% content of carbon dioxide in boiler flue gases indicates __________.
Response 2: a high vanadium content in the fuel oil
Response 3: proper combustion of the fuel oil

Question: What percentage of CO<sub>2</sub> in a boiler flue gas analysis would indicate perfect combustion?
Efficient boiler operation is indicated when the percentage by volume of carbon dioxide present in combustion gases is between __________.
When testing boiler flue gas with a chemical absorption apparatus to obtain accurate results __________.
Response 1: prevent any air from contaminating the gas sample
Response 2: analyze for nitrogen content before oxygen content
Response 3: run each analysis for at least 3 minutes
Response 4: purge the apparatus with air before use

Question: The absence of carbon monoxide in the flue gas of a boiler indicates __________.
Which of the following chemicals is used in an Orsat apparatus to absorb carbon dioxide?
When burning fuel oil in a boiler a high CO<sub>2</sub> content is desired in the stack gas because __________.
Response 1: more heat is liberated by the production of CO<sub>2</sub> than CO
Response 2: less excess air is required to produce CO<sub>2</sub> than CO
Response 3: efficient combustion is indicated even though the heat liberated is less than the heat produced by burning to CO
Response 4: efficient combustion is indicated and the heat liberated is equal to the heat produced by the formation of CO

Question: Which of the stack emissions listed represents a heat loss from the furnace?
Response 4: All of the above are correct.

Question: As the percentage of CO<sub>2</sub> in the stack gas decreases you can assume that __________.
Response 1: the fuel to air ratio is increasing
Response 2: fuel is being burned with increasing economy

Question: A high percentage of carbon dioxide in boiler flue gases indicates __________.
Response 4: nearly complete combustion of fuel oil

Question: A high carbon monoxide content in the flue gases of a boiler indicates __________.

Results of a flue gas analysis indicate a high percentage of carbon monoxide and an extremely low percentage of carbon dioxide. This condition coincides with which area on the graph shown in the illustration? See illustration SG-0021.

Results of a flue gas analysis indicate a high percentage of carbon dioxide and a low percentage of carbon monoxide approaching maximum efficiency. This condition coincides with which area(s) on the graph shown in the illustration? See illustration SG-0021.

The results of a flue gas analysis indicate a very high percentage of oxygen and a low percentage of carbon dioxide. This condition coincides with which area on the graph shown in the illustration? See illustration SG-0021.
Which of the flue gas components listed contributes to the greatest heat loss in a boiler?
If the flue gas oxygen content is too high you should __________.
Response 2: adjust the fuel oil service system
Response 3: increase the forced draft fan speed

Question: According to regulations (46 CFR Part 58) a boiler combustion control system may be tested at __________.
Response 1: a pressure not less than 1.25 times the maximum allowable working pressure
Response 2: a pressure not less than 1.5 times the maximum allowable working pressure
Response 3: the maximum allowable working pressure of the system
Response 4: the normal operating pressure of the system provided full loading is accomplished

Question: All oil-fired main propulsion burners with automatic safety control systems must automatically close the burner valve when _________.
Response 1: the flame in boiler furnace is confirmed
Response 4: actuated by a boiler safety trip

Question: All oil-fired main propulsion boilers with automatic safety control systems must automatically close the burner valve when ________.
Response 1: flame in boiler furnace is confirmed

Question: All oil-fired main boilers with automatic safety control systems must be provided with _______.
Response 1: a modulating pressuretrol sensing both steam and temperature
Response 2: a pyrostat measuring decreased steam temperature
Response 3: one flame detector for each burner
Response 4: one flame detector in each furnace

Question: According to 46 CFR's all oil-fired main propulsion boilers with automatic burner safety control systems must be provided with _______.
Response 3: one flame detector for each burner
Response 4: one flame detector in each furnace

Question: The turndown ratio an automatic combustion control system is the ratio __________.
Response 1: of air to fuel for a given firing rate
Response 2: of forced draft fan speed to feed water flow
Response 3: between the highest and lowest oil pressure at which the burner will remain lit
Response 4: between fuel oil pressure and atomizing steam pressure at a given firing rate

Question: Which of the following statements is true concerning the operation of the automatic shut down solenoid valve in the fuel oil service manifold of an automatically fired boiler?
Response 1: The valve should secure the fires if the main propulsion turbine over speeds.
Response 2: The valve must be manually reset to the open position prior to relighting burners after a safety shutdown.
Response 3: The valve will automatically reopen from a low water shutdown once water level is restored.
Response 4: The valve will automatically close if boiler pressure drops 20% below normal working pressure.

Question: A combustion control system diaphragm type air flow transmitter receives its high pressure signal from the boiler __________.
A combustion control system diaphragm-type air volume regulator receives its low pressure signal from the boiler __________.
As found in a basic pneumatic automatic combustion control system the function of a standardizing relay is to __________.
Response 1: provide a backup means for manual control of the system
Response 2: control the boiler drum water level within acceptable limits regardless of the load
