Response 3: introduce a control for maintaining constant superheated steam temperature regardless of boiler load
Response 4: introduce a control for maintaining constant steam pressure regardless of boiler load

Question: Fine adjustments to a boiler combustion control system to bring about near perfect combustion should be made by manually adjusting the __________.
When firing a boiler in local manual control an increase in boiler load must be accompanied by a/an __________.
Response 1: increase in the fuel oil flow before an increase in the forced draft pressure
Response 2: decrease in the forced draft air pressure before a decrease in the fuel oil flow
Response 3: increase in the forced draft air pressure before an increase in the fuel oil flow
Response 4: increase or a decrease in the fuel oil flow and forced draft air pressure simultaneously

Question: In an automatically fired boiler the steam pressure regulator controls the supply of fuel oil to the burners by responding to variations in the __________.
Response 3: master fuel oil solenoid valve position

Question: In automated boiler operations a dirty flame scanner will most likely result in __________.
Response 2: securing fuel oil to the burner

Question: Which of the listed devices may trip due to total flame failure in both boilers of an automated plant?
When the flame scanner senses flame failure during boiler operation which of the listed events will occur FIRST?
Response 1: The fuel oil service pump is stopped.
Response 3: The fuel oil solenoid valve is de-energized.

Question: Which of the following statements is true concerning a photocell flame scanning system?
Response 1: The photocell requires a large amount of voltage.
Response 2: The scanner head must be adjusted to sight the sensitivity link.
Response 3: The scanner works in conjunction with the burner fuel oil (solenoid controlled) shut off valves.
Response 4: The scanner window must be isolated from the forced draft fan air.

Question: Flame scanners are used with boiler combustion control systems to monitor flame quality and to __________.
Response 1: shut off the fuel supply if flame failure is detected
Response 2: secure the fuel oil service pump in the event of a floor fire
Response 3: secure the forced draft fan in the event of a flame failure
Response 4: regulate the fuel/air ratio controller for more efficient combustion

Question: In addition to monitoring flame quality flame scanners are used in combustion control systems to __________.
Response 1: regulate the air/fuel ratio controller for more efficient combustion
Response 2: secure the forced draft fans upon flame failure
Response 3: automatically open the fuel oil solenoid valves
Response 4: secure the fuel supply in the event of a flame failure

Question: The photoelectric cell installed as part of the combustion safety controls of an automatically fired boiler will __________.
Response 1: sense light from the burner flame
Response 2: control the modulating pressure control circuit
Response 3: open the control circuit upon sensing an intense flame
Response 4: close the control circuit upon sensing a flame failure

Question: Ultraviolet light sensing flame scanners installed on an automated main propulsion boiler are designed so they __________.
Response 1: might be misled by glowing brickwork
Response 2: will be sensitive to the outer portion of flames
Response 3: are sensitive only to the center of the ultraviolet portion of the flame from a particular burner
Response 4: cannot be used with steam atomizing burners

Question: A flame scanner installed in modern boiler combustion control systems functions to __________.
Response 1: monitor the intensity of the burner flame
Response 2: monitor the stack for soot fires
Response 4: regulate the air flow to the furnace

Question: Which of the following represents a significant system limitation to be aware of when a burner management system is operated in the 'HAND' mode?
Response 1: Some boiler safety interlocks are bypassed when the boiler is 'HAND' fired.
Response 2: The burner is not capable of maintaining a high firing rate when the boiler is in the 'HAND' mode.
Response 3: The flame failure alarm cannot function when the boiler is 'HAND' fired.
Response 4: The burner sequence control is fully automatic even in the 'HAND' mode.

Question: Which of the following represents a significant system limitation to be aware of when a burner management system is operated in the "Manual" mode?
Response 1: Some boiler safety interlocks are bypassed when the boiler is being fired in "Manual" mode.
Response 2: The burner is not capable of maintaining a high firing rate when the boiler is in "Manual" mode.
Response 3: The flame failure alarm cannot function when the boiler is in "Manual" mode.
Response 4: The burner sequence control is fully automatic even in the "Manual" mode.

Question: In automatic combustion control systems increasing or decreasing a loading pressure by a set amount is called __________.
While your vessel is steaming with one boiler the automatic combustion control system sensing line for the idle boiler is accidentally opened. How will this effect the steaming boiler?
If the control air pressure for an automatic combustion control system is lost during maneuvering you should immediately __________.
Response 3: attempt to restart the air compressor

Question: When the automatic combustion control fails what should you do to control the air supply to a boiler?
Response 2: Open the forced draft fan crossover damper.
Response 3: Manually control the fan discharge damper position.
Response 4: Manually control the fan inlet damper position.

Question: Modern day boiler automation allows bypassing the "flame safeguard" system to permit a burner to have a "trial for ignition" period during burner light-off. This period may not exceed ______.
In a boiler automation system if a burner fuel oil solenoid valve continually trips closed under normal steaming conditions you should __________.
Response 1: wedge the valve in the open position and report it to the chief engineer
Response 2: bypass the solenoid valve and enter the fact in the logbook
Response 3: secure the burner and determine the cause of the valve failure
Response 4: wedge the valve in the open position and reduce the fuel oil pressure at that burner

Question: When a vessel is in port and the boiler automation system continually trips the burner fuel oil solenoid valve you should __________.
Response 1: wedge the valve in the open position and report it to the chief engineer
Response 2: bypass the solenoid valve and enter the fact in the logbook
Response 3: change the burner and check the flame safeguard system
Response 4: wedge the valve in the open position and reduce the fuel oil pressure at that burner

Question: In accordance with Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR Part 62) for vessels propelled by steam turbines the navigation bridge primary control system must include safety limit controls for ____________.
According to Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) when an automatically fired boiler has a flameout which of the following actions should occur FIRST?
Response 1: The fuel valve should be de-energized.
Response 4: The fuel oil pump should stop.

Question: In a regenerative air heater air is bypassed around the heater while __________.
Stack type air heaters are bypassed when a vessel is in port in order to prevent __________.
Response 1: insufficient air supply to the fires due to the pressure drop across the heater
Response 2: interference with the operation of the soot blowers
Response 3: corrosion of the heater due to the low stack temperatures
Response 4: localized heat stressing of air heater surfaces

Question: One function of the air and flue gas bypass dampers installed in regenerative type air heaters is to __________.
Response 1: avoid excessive cooling of the stack gases during low load operation
Response 2: regulate combustion air temperature at normal firing rates
Response 3: reduce the load on the element drive motor
Response 4: reduce the temperature of the double undulated heating elements

Question: A regenerative type air heater should be bypassed at low load in order to __________.
Response 1: prevent chipping of the ceramic coating
Response 2: prevent condensation in the steam baffling
Response 3: avoid excessive cooling and condensation of the exhaust gases
Response 4: maintain a positive seal on the replaceable basket

Question: When a vessel is in port stack type air heaters are bypassed in order to prevent __________.
Response 1: insufficient air supply to the fires due to the pressure drop across the heater
Response 2: corrosion of the heater due to low stack temperatures
Response 3: excessive back pressure in the furnace due to low flow rates
Response 4: localized heat stressing of air heater surfaces

Question: Air for combustion is bypassed around the boiler air heater when the __________.
Response 3: combustion control system is in manual
Response 4: boiler is steaming at low rates

Question: A flue gas air heater when installed in a boiler would be accompanied by the operating characteristic(s) of __________.
A flue gas air heater when installed in a boiler would be accompanied by the operating characteristic(s) of __________.
Boiler fuel savings gained by the use of an economizer can amount to __________.
Response 1: three percent for each 5F rise in feed water temperature
Response 2: one percent for each 10F rise in feed water temperature
Response 3: one half percent for each 15F rise in feed water temperature
Response 4: three percent for each 20F rise in feed water temperature

Question: Whenever operating a boiler whose economizer is bypassed always keep in mind that __________.
Response 1: it is necessary to fire more fuel to maintain the required evaporative rating
Response 2: there is always the danger of metal oxidation in the economizer
Response 3: less heat is actually being transferred to the steam because of the decrease in the ratio of gas to steam weight

Question: If a boiler is being operated with the inlet feed water bypassing the economizer which of the following is true?
Response 1: The fuel consumption will increase for the same boiler load.
Response 2: There is always the danger of burning the economizer tubes.
Response 3: Less heat is actually being transferred to the superheated steam because of the decrease in feed water flow

Question: Which of the devices listed is indicated by arrow "H" shown in the illustration? See illustration SG-0008.
The boiler economizer provides additional heat to the __________.
A check valve is located between the economizer and the steam drum to __________.
Response 1: assure a positive feed water flow through the economizer
Response 2: assure a positive feed water flow to the steam drum
Response 3: prevent the feed pump from becoming vapor bound
Response 4: prevent steam and water flow reversal from the drum should an economizer casualty occur

Question: Which of the conditions listed could cause steam formation in the economizer?
Response 2: Sudden large increase in the firing rate.
Response 3: Soot buildup on the gill rings.
Response 4: An open main feed pump recirculating line.

Question: The minimum feed water inlet temperature to a boiler economizer is determined by the __________.
Response 1: dew point temperature of the stack gas
Response 3: surface area of the third stage heater
Response 4: radiant heat transfer in the furnace

Question: A boiler economizer should be bypassed whenever the _______.
Response 1: temperature of the stack gas is low enough to reach dew point
Response 2: superheater outlet temperature is too high
Response 3: DC heater outlet temperature is too high
Response 4: main turbine is operating at half power

Question: When installed the economizer relief valve should always be set __________.
Response 1: at the same pressure as the superheater safety valve
Response 2: at the same pressure as the drum safety valve
Response 3: 50 pounds higher than the superheater safety valve plus the water pressure drop through the economizer
Response 4: 50 pounds higher than the drum safety valve plus the water pressure drop through the economizer

Question: Which of the conditions listed could cause a boiler economizer to leak?
When a soot fire occurs damage to an economizer can be minimized if you __________.
Response 1: maintain feed water flow through the economizer while extinguishing the fire
Response 2: secure the economizer and open the drain valve to prevent steam pressure buildup
Response 3: increase the forced draft fan speed to blow out the fire
Response 4: secure the fires and inject CO<sub>2</sub> into the furnace

Question: Which of the conditions listed would indicate excessive soot buildup on the economizer?
Response 1: High feed water temperature entering the boiler
Response 2: Low air temperature entering the boiler
Response 4: Lower than usual air pressure in the furnace

Question: Which of the problems listed will occur when the economizer temperature is below the acid dew point of the flue gases?
Which of the valves listed should be closed before lighting off a boiler?
The major heat loss in a marine boiler is from the heat __________.
Response 1: used in the economizer and air heater
Response 3: of combustion gases leaving the stack
Response 4: required to change water into steam

Question: The greatest heat loss in an oil fired boiler is from __________.

Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require that the design pressure of an economizer integral with the boiler and connected to the boiler drum without intervening stop valves shall be at least equal to __________.
Response 1: the feed pump shut off head pressure
Response 2: 110% of the drum safety valves highest set pressure
Response 3: 125% of the boiler hydrostatic test pressure
Response 4: 150% of the boiler design test pressure

Question: When a boiler economizer is fitted with a valve bypass Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require which of the following devices to be installed?
Response 1: A sentinel valve is to be fitted on the superheater outlet.
Response 2: A stop check valve is to be located at the economizer outlet.
Response 3: A stop check valve is to be located at the economizer inlet.
Response 4: An emergency drain line must be provided to the reserve feed tank.

Question: The volatility of any oil may be indicated by __________.
The viscosity of an oil is a measure of its __________.
The device shown in the illustration is used to determine the __________. See illustration GS-0069.
Response 4: lubricating qualities and film strength of oil

Question: The ash content of a fuel oil is significant to the operating engineer because it __________.
Response 1: is an indication of the amount of noncombustible material present in the oil
Response 2: indicates the quantity of energy released by burning a unit amount of the fuel
Response 3: is useful for determining proper atomization temperatures
Response 4: reflects the overall thermal efficiency of the fuel oil service system

Question: The ash content of a fuel oil is significant to the operating engineer because it __________.
Response 1: indicates the quantity of energy released by burning a unit amount of fuel
Response 2: is useful for determining proper atomization temperatures
Response 3: reflects the overall thermal efficiency of the fuel oil service systems
Response 4: is an indication of the amount of noncombustible material present in the oil

Question: What is the harmful effect of sulfur in a fuel?
Response 1: It causes excessive smoking and soot at low firing rates.
Response 2: It doesn't readily burn when combined with oxygen.
Response 3: It clogs fuel oil strainers more often.
Response 4: It forms a corrosive acid when mixed with water or water vapor.

Question: The percentage of impurities in a specific fuel oil sample is determined by __________.
Slag caused by water in the fuel oil will __________.
Response 1: form a protective coating thus increasing its life
Response 2: seal refractory joints thereby improving its function
Response 3: expand at a different rate and result in damaged refractory
Response 4: increase the furnace efficiency because of reduced firebox turbulence

Question: The BTU value of fuel oil is determined by a/an __________.
A desirable property of boiler fuel oil is __________.
Response 1: low carbon content per pound of fuel
Response 2: high sulphur content for complete combustion
Response 3: high BTU content per pound of fuel

Question: The property of a fuel oil which is a measurement of its available energy is known as its __________.
Which of the significant combustible elements of fuel oil is a major source of boiler corrosion?
The presence of sulphur in fuel oil will most likely cause __________.
Response 1: a decrease in the ability of the oil to be properly atomized
Response 2: an excessive heat content per unit volume
Response 3: heavy slag formation on the refractory
Response 4: corrosion on the firesides of the boiler

Question: Which combustible element in fuel oil is considered a significant and major source of air pollution?
Which constituent of fuel oil determines the specific heat?
What is the main constituent in fuel oil which determines its heat value?
When heated fuel oil will __________.
Fuel oil is heated before atomizing to __________.
The most harmful slag forming compounds found in fuel oils are __________.
According to Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) what is the minimum flash point of oil to be used as fuel for the boilers?
The flash point of a residual fuel oil should be used to determine the highest temperature to which the oil may be heated __________.
The flash point of a residual fuel oil should be used to determine the __________.
Response 1: highest temperature to which the oil may be heated for atomization
Response 2: minimum temperature to which the oil should be heated for transferring
Response 3: highest temperature to which the oil may be heated in a storage tank
Response 4: minimum temperature to which the oil should be heated in the fuel oil heater

Question: When heating heavy fuel oil for use in main propulsion boilers aboard ship the flash point may be exceeded only when __________.
Response 1: it is necessary to transfer the fuel
Response 2: the boiler is being fired under maximum load
Response 3: the superheater temperature has been higher than normal
Response 4: it is required for proper atomization

Question: The minimum temperature requirements for fuel oil in storage tanks is related to the _________.
Response 3: size of the containment area in case of overflow

Question: Which characteristic of fuel oil is the most significant when determining the temperature to which the fuel oil must be heated for proper atomization?
Using an oil temperature-viscosity chart you can determine the recommended __________.
Response 1: fuel oil flash point for best combustion

Question: The viscosity of a residual fuel oil is measured in Saybolt __________.
Modern fuel oil temperature control devices are regulated to obtain a desired viscosity rather than a specific fuel oil temperature because __________.
Response 1: residual fuel oils have the same viscosity characteristics regardless of where they are refined
Response 2: the temperature of the fuel oil varies with the flow rate through the heater
Response 3: the relationship between temperature and viscosity varies with different fuels
Response 4: viscosity regulation eliminates the need for close control of the fuel/air ratio

Question: Bunker "C" fuel oil is heated prior to atomization to __________.
Fuel oil viscosity to the atomizer can be reduced by __________.
Response 1: increasing the fuel oil heater steam supply
Response 2: mixing heavier oil with the fuel

Question: If the fuel oil temperature flowing to the burners is too low the __________.
Response 1: fuel service pump will lose suction
Response 2: boiler will produce heavy black smoke
Response 3: boiler will produce dense white smoke
Response 4: fuel service strainers will become clogged

Question: Sediment in fuel oil will cause __________.
Sediment in fuel oil will cause __________.
Response 1: wear in the fuel oil pumps
Response 2: clogging of the fuel oil heaters

Question: Water emulsified in the fuel oil when supplied to a boiler is indicated by __________.
Response 2: lower than normal fuel oil pressure

Question: The rate of expansion of heated fuel oil is __________.
The rate of expansion of heated fuel oil varies with the __________.
Which of the following systems according to Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) must have an emergency stop protected with a glass enclosure and located outside of the machinery space?
Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require remote controls for stopping fuel oil service pumps. These controls shall be __________.
Machinery driving fuel oil transfer and fuel oil service pumps must be fitted with a remote means of stopping the machinery from __________.
Which of the following intervals do Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require the remote cutout for the fuel oil service pumps to be tested?
Response 3: At each fire and boat drill

Question: An internal leak in a fuel oil heater can result in __________.
Response 1: water contamination of the fuel oil
Response 2: oil contamination of the heater drains

Question: If oil is found in the main fuel oil heater steam drain system which of the actions listed should be taken first?
Response 1: Change over fuel supply to diesel fuel.
Response 2: Shift over to the standby heater and monitor contaminated drain tank for additional traces of oil.
Response 3: Bottom blow the boiler using the continuous blow line.
Response 4: Shift over to the low fuel oil suction on the day tank.

Question: When you are transferring fuel oil to the settling tanks precautions to be observed should include __________.
Response 1: plugging gooseneck tank vents to prevent accidental overflow
Response 2: maintaining a high transfer rate until a slight trickle of oil is observed flowing from the overflow line
Response 3: sounding the tanks frequently and reducing the transfer rate as the level approaches maximum fill
Response 4: maintaining a supply of chemical dispersant to cleanup minor oil spills adjacent to the ship

Question: When you are transferring fuel oil from one double bottom tank to another precautions to be observed should include __________.
Response 1: plugging gooseneck tank vents to prevent accidental overflow
Response 2: maintaining a high transfer rate until a slight trickle of oil is observed flowing from the overflow line
Response 3: sounding the tanks frequently and reducing the transfer rate while topping off
Response 4: maintaining a supply of chemical dispersant to cleanup minor oil spills adjacent to the ship

Question: Which of the pumps listed takes fuel oil suction from the double bottom tanks and discharges it to the settling tanks?
Fuel oil settling tanks are used to __________.
Response 3: facilitate the stripping of sludge and water

Question: Fuel oil settling tanks are used to __________.
Response 2: separate water and solids from the fuel
Response 3: make stripping of sludge and water from fuel oil easier

Question: Fuel oil is transferred to the settling tanks for __________.
Response 1: the purpose of removing any volatile gases present in the fuel
Response 2: purging of any large air bubbles that have formed
Response 3: heating to allow water and sediment to settle out
Response 4: heating to the correct temperature for proper burner atomization

Question: Fuel oil is transferred from storage tanks to the settling tanks to allow for __________.
Response 2: purging of any large air bubbles that have formed
Response 3: heating to separate water and sediment
Response 4: heating to the correct temperature for proper atomization

Question: The main reason for having a low suction line on the fuel oil service or settling tanks is to __________.
Response 1: prevent loss of suction during rough weather
Response 2: decrease suction head on the pump
Response 3: increase the amount of fuel available for use

Question: Which of the following actions should be taken FIRST when water is found in the fuel oil settling tank?
Response 1: Shift pump suction to an alternate settling tank.
Response 2: Shift to alternate or standby fuel oil service pump.
Response 3: Sound the settling tank with water indicating paste.
Response 4: Determine the extent of water contamination by reading the pneumercators.

Question: Pumps normally used for fuel oil service are __________.
Which of the pumps listed is normally used in fuel oil service systems?
Which precaution should be observed to prevent damage to the fuel oil service pump when warming up the fuel service system?
Response 1: Strip all water from the fuel oil settlers.
Response 2: Close the recirculating valve when the proper atomization temperature is reached.
Response 3: Heat the fuel oil in the settlers to the atomization temperature.
Response 4: Bypass the fuel oil meter so that recirculating oil does not register.

Question: All fuel oil service pumps are equipped with a __________.
Response 1: relief valve on the suction side
Response 2: combustion control valve on the discharge side
Response 3: remote means of stopping the pump
Response 4: direct suction to the double bottom tanks

Question: Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) requires machinery driving the fuel oil transfer and fuel oil service pumps to be fitted with a remote means of stopping that machinery __________.
You can secure the fuel supply to the boilers from outside the fire room by __________.
Response 2: operating the double bottom sluice valves with the reach rod
Response 3: closing the master oil valve with the reach rod
Response 4: closing the oil recirculating valve with the remote control

Question: The relief valve on the discharge side of the fuel oil service pump may discharge directly to the suction side of the pump or to the __________.
The relief valve on the discharge side of the fuel oil service pump may discharge directly to the settler or to the __________.
The purpose of the relief valve in a fuel oil service system is to __________.
Response 1: protect the service pump from high discharge pressure
Response 4: supply constant pressure to the burner combustion control valves

Question: Relief valves in the fuel oil service system discharge to either the service pump suction or the __________.
The purpose of the relief valve in a fuel oil service system is to __________.
Response 1: protect the system from high discharge pressure
Response 4: supply constant pressure to the burner combustion control valves

Question: The boiler fuel oil service pump normally takes suction from the __________.
The boiler fuel oil service pump normally takes suction from the __________.
Response 2: fuel oil settler tank high suction
Response 3: fuel oil settler tank low suction

Question: The fuel oil meter in the fuel oil service system should be bypassed when __________.
Response 1: transferring fuel from storage to settler tank to avoid erroneous fuel consumption readings
Response 2: conducting programmed routine maintenance of the meter while underway
Response 3: warming the oil in the burner headers by recirculation prior to boiler light off
Response 4: finished with engines is given by the bridge

Question: When recirculating fuel oil prior to cold boiler start-up which of the listed actions should be carried out?
Response 3: Open the fuel oil meter bypass.
Response 4: Open the fuel oil heater bypass.

Question: Why are two fuel oil heaters "E" provided in the fuel oil system shown in the illustration? See illustration SG-0009.
Response 1: Each heater supplies fuel to a different boiler.
Response 2: To allow fuel of different temperatures to be provided to be provided to each boiler.
Response 3: To provide a backup in case one of the heaters becomes inoperable.
Response 4: Two heaters are necessary when both boilers steam at full load.

Question: In the majority of marine power plants the fuel oil heater installations are divided into several units because __________.
Response 1: more heating is required for lower loads
Response 2: auxiliary steam is better utilized in this system
Response 3: plant operation can be continued while repairs are being made to a defective unit
Response 4: oil leakage into the condensate system is less likely with multiple system

Question: Why are two fuel oil heaters "E" provided in the fuel oil system shown in the illustration? See illustration SG-0009.
Response 1: Each heater supplies fuel to a different boiler.
Response 2: To allow fuel of different temperatures to be provided to be provided to each boiler.
Response 3: To provide a backup in case one of the heaters becomes inoperable.
Response 4: To provide series operation at high firing rates.

Question: The boiler fuel oil system 'hot' strainers are also known as __________.
The boiler fuel oil system suction strainers are also known as the __________.
Strainers are installed in boiler fuel oil service lines to __________.
Strainers are installed in boiler fuel oil service lines to __________.
Strainers are installed in boiler fuel oil service lines to __________.
Which of the listed types of strainers are installed between the fuel oil heater and the burner manifold?
When warming up a fuel oil service system you should open the steam supply to the fuel oil heaters __________.
Response 1: before you start the fuel oil service pump
Response 2: after you start the fuel oil service pump
Response 3: only if the settlers are incapable of heating the oil
Response 4: before you open the recirculating valve

Question: When securing a fuel oil heater you should __________.
Response 1: open the fuel oil temperature regulator bypass widely
Response 2: cut out the steam before securing the oil flow
Response 3: stop the oil flow and then cut out the steam
Response 4: remove all fuel oil pressure from the system by securing the service pump

Question: According to Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) a 'oil fuel unit' is correctly described by which of the following statements?
Response 1: The amount of heat released by burning a 'unit' amount of fuel oil.
Response 2: Equipment used for the preparation of fuel oil for delivery to an oil fired boiler.
Response 3: The amount of thermal units required to raise the temperature to the flash point in an open cup tester.
Response 4: The amount of thermal units necessary to cause a liquefied flammable gas to exceed a certain Reid vapor pressure.

Question: The valve located between the fuel oil header and the burner valve is known as the __________.
The advantage of a counterflow fuel oil heater as compared to a parallel flow fuel oil heater is that the counterflow heater __________.
Response 1: produces a higher oil temperature at any given steam temperature
Response 2: has a larger heat transfer area providing greater heat transfer
Response 3: has thinner tube walls providing greater heat transfer
Response 4: is not subject to coking if overheated

Question: The fins on the tubes of a fin type fuel oil heater are provided to __________.
The primary purpose of the heater used in a pressurized fuel oil system is to __________.
Response 1: reduce fuel oil viscosity for proper atomization
Response 2: reduce fuel oil specific gravity for better combustion
Response 3: increase the fire point of the fuel oil
Response 4: improve the flash point of the fuel oil

Question: Fuel oil is heated before it reaches the burners to __________.
Valve "H" shown in the illustration functions to __________. See illustration SG-0009.
Response 1: regulate the amount of fuel burned
Response 2: provide a quick shut off of fuel to the boiler
Response 3: prevent a backflow from the manifold

Question: What is the function of valve "H" of the system shown in the illustration? See illustration SG-0009.
Response 1: To regulate the amount of fuel burned.
Response 2: To prevent fuel backflow from the manifold.
Response 3: To provide for quick fuel shut off.
Response 4: To recirculate fuel when lighting off.

Question: What is the quickest way to shutoff the boiler fuel oil supply from inside the fire room?
Response 1: Closing the settling tank suction valves.
Response 3: Close the double bottom suction valves.

Question: A solenoid valve in the boiler fuel oil supply line will close when the __________.
Response 1: main turbine throttle valve is closed
Response 2: boiler is operating at low pressures

Question: Fuel oil solenoid valves at the burner fronts should be of the manual reset type to __________.
Response 1: permit the operator to secure each burner during a blackout
Response 2: permit the operator to secure each burner after a blackout
Response 3: prevent the furnace filling with oil during a power failure
Response 4: prevent the furnace filling with oil after restoration of power

Question: Many steam plants are designed so that diesel oil can be provided to the burners when __________.
Response 3: a heavy fuel must be blended

Question: In a propulsion boiler diesel oil is generally supplied to the burners when __________.
Response 3: a heavy fuel must be blended
Response 4: it is necessary to compensate for overload capacity

Question: Why should the fuel oil be recirculated before lighting off a cold boiler?
Response 1: To allow the fuel strainers to thoroughly clean the fuel.
Response 2: To heat the fuel enough for proper atomization.
Response 3: To ensure that all water is removed from the fuel.
Response 4: To allow fuel pressure to buildup gradually.

Question: The fuel oil has been raised to the proper temperature for the straight mechanical atomization system of the boiler shown in the illustration and is ready to light off. Which of the valves listed must be closed just prior to igniting the fuel? See illustration SG-0009.
Which normally closed valve would have to be at least partially open prior to actually lighting off a cold boiler as shown in the illustration? See illustration SG-0009.
The recirculating valve provided in a straight mechanical boiler fuel oil service system should be opened when __________.
Response 2: the service pump relief valve lifts
Response 3: bypassing one bank of fuel oil heaters
Response 4: preparing to light off a cold boiler

Question: A leaky fuel oil heater relief valve could be indicated by an increase in the __________.
What causes carbon to adhere to the inside surfaces of a fuel oil heater?
Response 1: Too much carbon in the fuel

Question: Carbon deposits in a fuel oil heater are caused by __________.
Heating the fuel oil to an excessively high a temperature in a fuel oil heater will cause __________.
Response 1: a loss of fuel oil suction

Question: The overheating of fuel oil in the fuel oil heaters may result in __________.
Response 3: ineffective straining of the fuel oil
Response 4: low fuel oil service pump discharge pressure

Question: If the fuel oil temperature in the fuel oil heater attains an excessive temperature what will happen?
Response 1: Carbon deposits will build up on the heating surfaces.
Response 2: The fuel heater relief valve will open immediately.
Response 3: The fuel oil pump will lose suction.
Response 4: The fuel oil recirculating valve will automatically close.

Question: Carbonization of the conductive surfaces of a fuel oil heater results in reduced heating capacity because __________.
Response 1: a fluid film layer covers the solid contaminants and increases heat transfer
Response 2: the relative velocities of the fluids must be decreased causing a corresponding loss of heat transfer
Response 3: the thermal conductivity of solidified contaminants is poor
Response 4: radiational heat transfer becomes severely impaired

Question: Condensate accumulation in the steam side of a fuel oil heater could result in __________.
Response 1: scale accumulation in an operating heater
Response 2: water contamination of the fuel oil
Response 3: reduced heating capacity in an operating heater
Response 4: annealing of the heater tube bundles

Question: Condensate accumulating in the steam side of a fuel oil heater could result in __________.
Response 4: immediate oil contamination of the condensate

Question: What will occur if the fuel oil heater condensate returns are not opened or are partially plugged?
Response 3: Fuel may not be heated sufficiently for proper combustion.

Question: The rate of fouling on the oil side of a fuel oil heater is inversely related to the __________.
Response 1: quality of steam flowing through the heater
Response 2: flow rate of fuel oil through the heater
Response 3: shape of the heating coils in the heater
Response 4: pressure on the oil in the heater

Question: The rate of fouling on the oil side of fuel oil heaters is mostly affected by the __________.
Response 1: quality of the steam flow through the heater
Response 2: shape of the heating coils in the heater
Response 3: pressure on the oil in the heater
Response 4: rate of oil flow through the heater

Question: The rate of fouling on the oil side of fuel oil heaters is directly related to the __________.
Response 2: shape of the heating coils in the heater
Response 4: rate of oil flow through the heater

Question: Which of the conditions listed would indicate a dirty fuel oil strainer?
Response 2: Dirt and sediment deposits in the atomizers
Response 3: Decreasing pressure drop across the strainer
Response 4: Decreasing fuel oil pressure at the burner manifold

Question: If you noted a large difference in the pressures indicated by a duplex pressure gage to the fuel oil system strainer you should __________.
Response 1: increase the fuel pump discharge pressure
Response 2: reduce the firing rate of the boilers
Response 3: shift to a clean fuel oil strainer
Response 4: secure the fuel oil service pump

Question: Failure of the fuel oil service pump to maintain fuel oil flow to the burner could be caused by __________.
Automatic fuel shutoff to the burners of a main propulsion boiler could result from __________.
Response 2: carbon deposits on the ignition electrode

Question: Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require the duplex fuel oil discharge strainers installed in boiler fuel oil service systems to be __________.
Response 1: located so as to preclude the possibility of spraying oil on the burner or boiler casing
Response 2: as close to the fuel oil service manifold as practicable
Response 3: enclosed in a drip-proof vented enclosure to reduce the possibility of fire
Response 4: a positive venting system that will return any vapors to the pump suction

Question: Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) for boiler fuel oil service systems require that __________.
Response 1: discharge piping from the service pumps to the burners must be of schedule 60 seamless steel
Response 2: the return line from the burners must be arranged so that suction piping cannot be subject to discharge pressure
Response 3: the fuel oil service pump relief valve must discharge to a wing tank
Response 4: the suction strainer must be a simplex type

Question: Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR Part 56) require that new fuel oil service piping between pumps and burners be subjected to __________.
Response 1: a hydrostatic test of 1.5 times the maximum allowable pressure but not less than 500 psi (3447 kPa)
Response 2: a hydrostatic test of 1.25 times the maximum allowable pressure with the relief valves closed
Response 3: spot radiographic examination of portions of the finished weld joints
Response 4: a hydrostatic leak test to the design pressure specified by the Coast Guard

Question: In accordance with Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) all vessels having oil fired main propulsion boiler(s) must be equipped with __________.
Response 1: at least two fuel service pumps
Response 2: at least two fuel oil heaters
Response 3: a suction and discharge duplex strainer

Question: In accordance with Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR Part 56) all vessels having oil fired boilers must be equipped with __________.
Response 1: one positive-displacement type fuel service pump
Response 2: Suction and discharge strainers capable of being cleaned without interrupting the oil supply
Response 3: one fuel oil heater if shown that the normally used fuel oil will be of low viscosity

Question: Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require that quick-closing valves on a fuel oil service system should be installed as close as is practicable to the __________.
Response 1: suction side of the fuel oil pump

Question: In accordance with Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) all fuel oil service piping in the vicinity of the burners must __________.
Response 1: utilize leak proof gaskets in all joints
Response 3: have wrap around deflectors on all bolted flanged joints
Response 4: be provided with coamings or drip pans

Question: In accordance with Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) which of the following materials may be used in short lengths between the fuel oil boiler front header manifold and the atomizer head to provide flexibility?
According to Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) which of the following is permitted in boiler fuel oil service system discharge piping?
Response 1: Screwed bonnet valves of the union bonnet type.
Response 2: Pipe unions one inch or greater in diameter.
Response 4: Street ells made of carbon steel.

Question: Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) for boiler fuel oil service systems require __________.
Response 1: fuel oil heaters for boilers burning fuels with low viscosity
Response 2: fuel oil service tanks to overhang boilers to utilize heat radiated from the boilers for greater efficiency
Response 3: machinery driving fuel oil service pumps to be fitted with remote controls so that they may be stopped in the event of a fire
Response 4: all piping between service pumps and burner fronts to be located below the floor plates to eliminate fire hazards

Question: According to Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) the fuel strainer installation located in the supply lines to the fuel pump of an auxiliary boiler can be provided with __________.
Response 2: single strainers of the self-cleaning type

Question: Valve "H" shown in the illustration functions to ______. See illustration SG-0009.
Response 1: provide a quick shut off of fuel to the boiler
Response 3: prevent a backflow from the manifold
Response 4: regulate the amount of fuel burned

Question: Which of the casualties listed is apt to occur immediately after a high water casualty?
High boiler water level can cause carryover and __________.
In the prevention of moisture carryover from a marine boiler one important consideration is to __________.
Response 1: properly treat the boiler water with hydrazine
Response 2: control the amount of boiler water solids
Response 3: maintain a high boiler water level
Response 4: add foaming agents to the boiler water

Question: Foaming in boiler water is a result of __________.
Rapid fluctuation in the superheater temperature of a steady steaming boiler indicates __________.
In a steadily steaming boiler carryover is indicated by a/an __________.
Response 2: sudden increase in superheater outlet temperature
Response 3: sudden decrease in superheater outlet temperature

Question: Oil accumulation in boiler water would __________.
Response 1: cause foaming and carryover from the boiler
Response 3: prevent acid attack on the boiler tubes

Question: Foaming and moisture carryover in a boiler can be caused by an __________.
Response 1: excessive amount of dissolved solids in the boiler water
Response 2: excessive acidity level in the boiler water
Response 3: inadequate amount of dissolved oxygen in the boiler water
Response 4: inadequate alkalinity content in the boiler water

Question: Carryover in a marine boiler can be caused by __________.
Response 3: a high concentration of hydrazine in the boiler water
Response 4: operating under low load conditions for extended periods

Question: The most likely result of water slugging in the steam supply to a ship service turbo generator is __________.
Water carryover in the steam entering a turbine could result in __________.
An unusual vibration in the main propulsion turbine unit accompanied by a rumbling sound in the reduction gear could be caused by __________.
Which of the conditions listed would indicate water carryover to a turbine?
Response 2: High steam temperature in the high pressure turbine steam chest.
Response 4: Noise and vibration in the turbine.

Question: Excessive priming in a propulsion boiler can cause severe damage to the_________.
Excessive priming in a propulsion boiler can lead to severe damage of the __________.
Which of the following statements describes the effects that dissolved oxygen has on boiler internal surfaces with changes in temperature and pressure?
Response 1: It decreases the corrosive effect when both pressure and temperature are increased.
Response 2: It increases the corrosive effect with increased pressure and decreases its corrosive effect with increased temperature.
Response 3: It increases the corrosive effect with lowered pressure and increases its corrosive effect with increased temperature.
Response 4: Temperature and pressure have no effect on the corrosive effect of dissolved oxygen.

Question: Which of the listed conditions will always result in dissolved oxygen being carried over from the main condenser?
Response 3: Dumping auxiliary exhaust steam to the main condenser

Question: Dissolved oxygen in the condensate can result from __________.
Response 1: steam leaks into the gland leakoff
Response 2: air leaks through the turbine glands
Response 3: improper operation of the gland exhauster
Response 4: vapor lock in the condensate pump

Question: Dissolved oxygen in the condensate is generally attributed to _________.
Response 1: steam leaks into the gland leakoff
Response 2: improper operation of the gland exhauster
Response 4: vapor lock in the condensate pump

Question: A malfunction in the DC heater is indicated by __________.
Response 1: the boiler requiring excessive amounts of oxygen scavenging chemicals
Response 2: water and steam entering the DC heater at different temperatures
Response 3: condensate coming in contact with steam inside the heater
Response 4: air flowing from vent condenser vent

Question: Excessive carbon dioxide formed by improper chemical treatment in the boiler may cause corrosion in the __________.
A common gas dissolved in water contributing to the greatest amount of corrosion in a condensate system is __________.
As the pH of the boiler water approaches zero the water becomes increasingly __________.
Phenolphthalein is used as an indicator to test boiler water for __________.
Phenolphthalein indicator is used in the boiler water test for __________.
The amount of sodium phosphate in treated boiler water can be measured by a/an __________.

What boiler water test would be given to insure that the boiler water contains sufficient chemicals to transform hard scale forming salts into harmless sludge which would eventually be removed with blow downs?
Any feed water testing done on a routine basis would normally include testing for __________.
A test of boiler water for chloride content indicates the amount of __________.
Testing boiler water for chloride content will indicate the amount of __________.
Response 3: methyl orange that should be added

Question: A unit of measure used to express the chloride content of boiler water is __________.
A boiler water sample being collected for analysis should be circulated through a cooling coil because _________.
Response 1: this keeps the water from flashing into steam as it is drawn from the higher pressure of the boiler into atmospheric conditions
Response 2: it reduces the amount of suspended matter that frequently finds its way into the dead end lines
Response 3: the cool sample has a higher conductivity measurement and the total dissolved solids in the water are easier to identify
Response 4: the degree of acidity as measured on the pH recorder is amplified by cool water temperatures

Question: Boiler water samples should be circulated through a cooling coil prior to analysis because __________.
Response 1: this prevents the boiler water from flashing into steam as the sample is collected
Response 2: it reduces the amount of suspended matter that frequently finds its way into the dead end lines
Response 3: the cool sample has a higher conductivity measurement and the total dissolved solids in the water are easier to identify
Response 4: the degree of acidity as measured on the pH recorder is amplified by cool water temperatures

Question: A sample of boiler water can be chemically tested for alkalinity by initially adding a few drops of phenolphthalein and then slowly titrating the water sample until the __________.
Response 1: sample color changes from clear to pink
Response 2: sample color changes from pink to clear
Response 4: entire concentration of chlorides have been neutralized

Question: Normally a boiler water sample should be taken __________.
Response 1: after the boiler has been blown down
Response 2: before the boiler has been blown down or chemicals added
Response 3: when the boiler has been refilled with makeup
Response 4: from the highest point in the feed system

Question: A sodium sulfite test is performed on a boiler water sample to determine if __________.
Response 1: there is any excess sulfite present
Response 2: the pH of the boiler water is within the prescribed limits
Response 3: the dissolved oxygen in the boiler water is within tolerable limits
Response 4: the hardness factor is maintained as close to zero as possible

Question: A sulfite test is conducted on boiler water to check for __________.
Sodium sulfite is added to boiler water to chemically react with any __________.
Response 1: dissolved oxygen present in the water
Response 2: dissolved carbon dioxide present in the water
Response 3: potassium phosphate present in the water

Question: Eight (8) ounces of oxygen dissolved in 500000 pounds of water is a concentration of __________.
A dissolved oxygen concentration of 8.0 ppm represents __________.
Response 1: 8 lbs of oxygen dissolved in 1000000 tons of water
Response 2: 8 tons of oxygen dissolved in 1000000 pounds of water
Response 3: 8 ounces of oxygen dissolved in 1000000 ounces of water
Response 4: 80 ounces of oxygen dissolved in 100000 ounces of water

Question: When a boiler water test indicates a pH value of 6 you should __________.
Response 1: check the DC heater for possible malfunction
Response 2: begin a continuous boiler blow down
Response 3: chemically treat to lower the pH to normal level
Response 4: chemically treat to raise the pH to normal level

Question: Ferrous sulfate tends to go into solution in boiler water when the value of the hydrogen ion concentration increases. Consequently the water in a 900 psi boiler should be _______.
Response 2: pure and treated to a pH value of 4.0 to 4.5
Response 3: maintained at a pH value of 7.0
Response 4: pure and treated to a pH value of 10.5 to 11.0

Question: A boiler with a water capacity of 10 tons generates steam at the rate of 30 tons per hour. If the feed water quality is 0.5 ppm the concentration of solids will increase 1.5 ppm every hour. What would be the increase in the concentration of solids within 24 hours?

A boiler with a water capacity of 10 tons generates steam at the rate of 30 tons per hour. If the feed water concentration of solids was initially 0.5 PPM and will increase at a rate of 1.5 ppm every hour what would be the increase in the feed water concentration of solids after 24 hours?
Dissolved and suspended solids in boiler water are kept at minimum levels by __________.
Response 3: treating the boiler water with phosphates
Response 4: the introduction of oxygen scavenging chemicals

Question: The end product of reactions occurring when boiler water is chemically treated remain in the boiler and increase the need for __________.
The most effective way to eliminate sludge from the water drum of a boiler is to __________.
Response 4: give the boiler a bottom blow

Question: The end products of reactions occurring when boiler water is chemically treated remain in the boiler and increase the need for __________.
If a routine boiler water test indicates high salinity you should blow down the boiler to reduce salinity and then __________.
Response 2: treat the boiler water with phosphates
Response 3: reduce the firing rate to prevent scaling
Response 4: increase the firing rate to prevent foaming

Question: In addition to the repeated use of surface blow to control boiler water chemistry caustic soda may be used to treat high salinity as well as __________.
Response 2: phosphate to aid in scale prevention
Response 3: calcium carbonate to assist in precipitating solids

Question: An increase in the concentration of total dissolved solids in boiler water can result from __________.
Phosphates are used in the chemical treatment of boiler water to __________.
Response 2: convert scale forming salts to relatively harmless sludges
Response 3: neutralize the harmful effects of hydrogen embrittlement

Question: What boiler water chemistry is necessary to ensure the precipitation of hard scale forming calcium?
Response 1: Hydrazine concentrations should be at the proper level.
Response 2: Boiler water hardness should be high.
Response 3: Boiler water should be slightly acidic.
Response 4: Boiler water should have a reserve of phosphates.

Question: Scale prevention in boiler water is accomplished by adding treatment chemicals to __________.
Response 1: precipitate scale forming salts into sludge
Response 4: cause the water to be neutral

Question: The concentration of total dissolved solids in boiler water could increase as a result of __________.
The primary difference between sludge and scale deposits in boiler tubes is __________.
Response 1: scale forms only on the cooler boiler tubes whereas sludge forms on all tubes
Response 2: scale forms as the result of the crystallization of salts whereas sludge may consist of reaction products from boiler treatment
Response 3: sludge is hard and non-adherent at operating temperatures whereas scale can be deposited at any boiler temperature range
Response 4: scale is heavier than water and forms in lower drums and headers whereas sludge is more likely to form along the steam drum waterline

Question: Calcium minerals in boiler water are precipitated out of solution by the use of which of the listed chemicals?
High salinity can be reduced in a steaming boiler by adding caustic soda phosphate and then __________.
Response 2: steaming at a low firing rate for 24 hours
Response 3: adding hydrazine to control dissolved oxygen
Response 4: adding calcium carbonate to precipitate solids

Question: Which of the following statements is true concerning the use of hydrazine in boiler water treatment?
Response 1: A reserve is maintained by continually adding it to the condensate and feed water system rather than the boiler water.
Response 2: It removes free oxygen from the boiler without significantly increasing total dissolved solid content.
Response 3: It aids in maintaining the pH of the boiler water within the prescribed limits.

Question: Dissolved oxygen can be removed from the boiler water by __________.
Response 2: dumping and refilling the boiler weekly
Response 3: passing the water through absorbent filters
Response 4: treating the water with chemical scavengers

Question: Chemicals are added to boiler water in order to __________.
Response 2: reduce the total dissolved solids content
Response 3: decrease the necessity for blow downs

Question: Although accurate tests of boiler water for dissolved oxygen are difficult to obtain on board ship you can be fairly certain of proper oxygen removal by __________.
Response 1: testing frequently for total dissolved solids
Response 3: giving the boiler frequent surface blows
Response 4: maintaining a normal level of scavenging agents

Question: What are the two most common gases that dissolve in boiler water and cause corrosion on the internal parts of the boiler?
The most troublesome corrosive substances in boiler water are oxygen and __________.
Chemicals are added to boiler feed water to __________.
Response 1: reduce the frequency of blow downs

Question: Chemicals are added to boiler water by injecting them __________.
Response 1: as a powder into the mud drum
Response 2: as a powder into the steam drum
Response 3: in solution into the main feed line
Response 4: in solution through the chemical feed pipe

Question: In order for you to operate your vessel's crude oil wash system the cargo tanks to be washed must be __________.
Response 1: opened to the atmosphere for ventilation

Question: When a cargo oil tank is being cleaned by crude oil washing while in port __________.
Response 1: the inert gas system must be properly operating in that tank
Response 2: water should be allowed to settle on top before discharging
Response 3: filters should be installed in bilge strainers to absorb oil before discharge overboard
Response 4: the dock supervisor need not be notified before discharging oily mixtures overboard

Question: Fire hydrant valves on a crude oil tanker shall be isolated from the crude oil washing system by __________.

In a crude oil washing system according to Coast Guard regulations (33 CFR) each cargo tank shall be fitted with a sufficient number of machines such that those areas unwashed by direct impingement shall not exceed 10% for horizontal areas and __________.
Sufficient portable drive heads for a crude oil washing system must be provided in order to avoid one head being used during the tank washing procedure more than __________.

To avoid excessive electrostatic effect in the crude oil washing process due to the presence of water in the crude oil washing fluid the contents of any tank to be used as a source of crude oil for washing must first reduce a portion of the tank contents by a vertical height equal to __________.
Both crude oil washing and water washing use direct impingement to remove residue from tanks. Crude oil washing has an additional advantage in utilizing __________.
Response 2: the solvent effect of the crude oil

Question: Bottom mounted crude oil washing machines are primarily used for _________.
Response 1: the majority of crude oil tank cleaning
Response 2: washing the entire bottom of the tank
Response 3: areas where direct impingement from deck mounted machines cannot be satisfactorily reached

Question: When tanks have been washed with crude oil and ballasted without being water rinsed the ballast is referred to as _________.
Crude oil washing has which of the following disadvantages?
Response 1: Its cleaning ability is very poor.
Response 2: Allows buildup of cargo residue on tank walls.
Response 3: It requires following additional work procedures and close attention by the crew during cargo operations.
Response 4: When completed more cargo is retained aboard the ship than with water washing.

Question: Water ballast placed in a tank that has been crude oil washed but not water rinsed shall be regarded as __________.
In port after chemically cleaning a fuel oil tank you should dispose of the waste oil by __________.
Response 1: pumping it into the sewer connection
Response 3: circulating it through an oil and water separator
Response 4: discharging it into a slop barge or holding tank

Question: What is NOT a requirement for the safe and effective use of a crude oil washing system?
Response 1: Strip all tanks and remove the bottom residue.
Response 2: Use an inert gas system while washing tanks.
Response 3: Use portable washing machines to reach areas obscured by structural members in the tanks.
Response 4: Decant one meter from the source tank for the tank cleaning machines.

Question: You are planning to use a crude oil washing system. What precaution must be taken with the source tank for the washing machines?
Response 1: At least one meter must be decanted from the source tank.
Response 2: The oil in the source tank must be sampled for compatibility.
Response 3: The source tank must have been crude oil washed at least once in the past 150 days.
Response 4: The inert gas system must lower the oxygen content in the source tank to a maximum of 12%.

Question: You are planning to use the crude oil washing system on your tankship. What is required to prevent electrostatic buildup in the tanks?
Response 1: The portable machines must be set at the proper drop for the first wash before the fixed machines are used.
Response 2: The source tank for the tank cleaning machines must have least one meter decanted from it.
Response 3: The inert gas system must reduce the oxygen content in the tanks to a maximum of 18%.
Response 4: The fixed machines must be operated simultaneously with the portable machines to equalize the electrostatic potential.

Question: The complete details of a crude oil washing system aboard your vessel including the operating sequences and procedures design characteristics a description of the system and required personnel will be found in the __________.
Response 2: Crude Oil Washing Operations and Equipment Manual
Response 4: Crude Oil Washing addendum to the Certificate of Inspection

Question: Before a tank is to be crude oil washed the oxygen content in the tank must be measured at a position __________.
Response 1: immediately above the level of the oil
Response 2: at the top of the tank

Question: You have completed a crude oil wash. What action should be taken with the oil in the lines running to the washing machines?
Response 1: Open a COW nozzle forward and one aft and drain the line into the after tank by gravity
Response 2: Blow the line out using compressed air
Response 3: Pull a suction using the supply line pump
Response 4: Close off all valves in the system and leave the oil in the line primed for the next crude oil wash

Question: You have water washed your cargo tanks using the fixed machines. What should you do before using portable machines to clean areas screened from the wash of the fixed machine by structural members?
Response 1: Ventilate the tank to eliminate any electro-statically charged mist.
Response 2: Attach the water supply hose to the portable machine after the cleaning head is positioned inside the tank.
Response 3: Insure that the tanks are not stripped until the final wash is started.
Response 4: Ground the fixed machines to eliminate any electrostatic buildup on the cleaning head.

Question: Which step is NOT generally taken when gas-freeing a tank?
Response 1: Washing the tank interior with sea water
Response 3: Removal of corrosion products and sludge

Question: When tank cleaning with a portable machine how is the weight of the machine is suspended?
Response 1: solid metal bars clamped to the Butterworth opening
Response 4: a natural fiber tag line saddle and hose

Question: Portable oil tank cleaning machines are usually provided with a water supply from the ______.
When water washing epoxy-coated cargo tanks the temperature and pressure of the wash water should generally not exceed ______.
The flame screens installed on tank vents that may contain combustible gases are designed to prevent explosions by __________.
Response 1: allowing the escape of flammable vapors
Response 2: dissipating the heat of an external flame
Response 3: absorbing any flammable vapors in the vicinity
Response 4: preventing flammable vapors from entering the tank

Question: Which of the devices listed below is designed to prevent flames from entering through fuel tank vents?
Which of the devices listed is designed to prevent flames from entering a fuel tank through tank vents?
Flame screens must be maintained in good condition and fitted in the opening they protect in order to __________.
Response 1: prevent flammable vapors from entering the tank
Response 2: allow the escape of flammable vapors
Response 3: contain flammable vapors within the tank
Response 4: allow dissipation of heat from any flame

Question: Flame screens must be maintained in good condition and fitted properly in the vent opening they protect in order to __________.
Response 1: prevent flammable vapors from entering the tank
Response 2: allow the escape of flammable vapors
Response 3: contain flammable vapors within the tank
Response 4: allow proper dissipation of heat from a flame

Question: Tank vent flame screens must be maintained in good condition and properly fitted in the opening they protect in order to __________.
Response 1: prevent flammable vapors from entering the tank
Response 2: allow the escape of flammable vapors
Response 3: contain flammable vapors within the tank
Response 4: allow dissipation of heat from open flame

Question: Why are flame screens on tank vents an important safety device?
Response 1: They provide a 'dead air space' within a fuel tank.
Response 2: They accelerate the dispersal of fuel vapors.
Response 3: They help prevent the passage of flames from or into the vent line.
Response 4: They smother flames once a fire has been started.

Question: Fuel oil tank vents must be fitted with corrosion resistant screens to prevent __________.
Fuel oil tank vents are fitted with corrosion resistant screens to prevent __________.
Response 1: flames entering through the tank vent

Question: Fuel oil tank vents are fitted with a corrosion resistant wire mesh screen to __________.
Response 1: prevent dirt from entering the tank
Response 3: prevent flames from entering the tank

Question: A corrosion resistant fine mesh wire screen is commonly fitted to the end of tank vent piping to prevent ________.
Response 1: passage of flames into the tank
Response 2: entry of rodents into the tank
Response 3: debris stopping up the vent pipe

Question: According to 46 CFR a single layer of tank vent flame screen must be composed of corrosion resistant wire and at least a mesh of __________.

To comply with the Pollution Prevention Regulations (33 CFR Part 155) regarding fuel oil discharge containment a vessel of 300 or more but less than 1600 gross tons must have a fixed container or enclosed deck area under or around each fuel oil tank vent that has at least a __________.
Response 3: 2 barrel capacity which may be bolted in place below the loading manifold valves

Question: In order for the vessel to discharge its cargo to a shore facility from #6 centerline tank with the #7 main deck manifold valve open which of the listed valve combinations shown in the illustration must be opened and which of the valves must be closed? See illustration GS-0139.
Response 4: All valves are open to gravitate

Question: How often should cargo oil pump relief valves on tank vessels to be tested?
Response 1: Prior to each cargo discharge operation.

Question: A chief engineer's responsibilities include making logbook entries whenever fuel oil is received. In accordance with Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) this log entry must include the __________.
Response 3: flash point (closed cup method) of the fuel oil certified by the producer

Question: In accordance with the Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) which of the following situations requires an official logbook entry and is considered the responsibility of the chief engineer?
Response 1: Ensuring that the emergency lighting and power systems are operated and inspected at least once in each week the vessel is navigated.
Response 2: Seeing that all lifeboat winch control apparatus including motor controllers limit switches etc. are examined at least once in each 3 months.
Response 3: Obtaining a sample of all fuel oil received on board to be used as fuel along with ascertaining all particulars such as vendor producer flash point etc.

Question: In accordance with Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) it is the duty of the Chief Engineer to acquire and seal a sample of fuel oil received whenever fuel oil bunkers are taken. This sample must be preserved until __________.
Response 2: that particular supply of oil is exhausted
Response 3: it can be sent ashore to the proper oil company personnel for testing and the results entered in the Oil Record Book CG-480
Response 4: return to the first U.S. port where upon it must be sent ashore for chemical analysis and the findings submitted to the nearest Officer in Charge Marine Inspection

Question: You are transferring fuel from a supply vessel to your MODU. If you close off one tank in the line of tanks being filled the flow rate to the other open tanks on the same line will __________.
When fueling it is important to ground the ship with regard to static electricity. Therefore you must connect the __________.
Response 1: fuel hose before the bonding cable
Response 2: bonding cable only if sparks are seen
Response 3: bonding cable before the fuel hose has been connected
Response 4: bonding cable through a ground fault circuit breaker

Question: How can the build up of static electricity be prevented so that a static spark does not ignite flammable vapors?
Response 1: Each machine and hose involved in the operation should be grounded.
Response 2: All electrical circuits near and around the fueling operations should be opened.
Response 3: A dehumidifier used in spaces containing flammable liquids will significantly reduce the possibility of static charges being generated.
Response 4: Static neutralizers can be used to reduce ionization in the air.

Question: Bonding cables are used to reduce the possibility of accidental spark discharge when __________.
Response 1: transferring flammable liquids to or from a vessel
Response 2: transferring dry mud to or from a vessel
Response 3: transferring fuel oil from storage to day tanks

Question: To minimize the possibility of an explosion caused by the discharge of static electricity the vessel should __________.

Question: According to 33 CFR Part 155 to prevent the overflow of cargo tanks due to thermal expansion to what is the maximum level that cargo tanks are allowed to be filled for topping-off purposes?

Question: Why is it important for double bottom fuel oil tanks not to be topped off when loading fuel at cold temperatures?

Question: Why is it important for fuel oil tanks not to be topped off when loading cold oil?
Response 1: Increased viscosity of the product needs higher loading pressure which increases the chance of a spill.
Response 2: Air pockets may cause the fuel to bubble out of the ullage hole.
Response 3: The change in its specific volume when heated may cause an overflow.
Response 4: The fueling valve may become stuck closed and cause the fuel oil to spill before the valve can be opened.

Question: During fueling operations which of the listed precautions should be taken when topping off fuel tanks?

Question: The terminal indicates to you that they are going to use a booster pump to assist the discharging operation. You start the discharge and in a few minutes the pressure drops sharply. This could be a result of the __________.

Question: When stripping a tank excessive air in the suction line may cause __________.

Response 2: using a center tank near the bow discharging as necessary
Response 3: using wing tanks near the longitudinal center discharging as necessary
Response 4: using the after peak tank loading as necessary

Question: While discharging a cargo the stripping of the tanks falls behind schedule. This would indicate the __________.

Response 2: main pumps are leaving too much oil in the tanks
Response 4: stripping line is cross-connected to the main line

Question: When discharging an oil cargo the first consideration is to __________.
Response 3: discharge from the centerline tanks first

Question: Which tanker discharge pattern would be the safest and most efficient?
Response 1: Empty the forward tanks and start working aft emptying each tank in sequence
Response 2: Start discharging with most of the discharge coming from forward but include some from midships and after tanks
Response 3: Start pumping from forward midships and aft with the discharge distributed equally among the tanks
Response 4: Start pumping from midships and then work forward and aft simultaneously as the midships tank is emptied

Question: You are on a tankship discharging oil. When all of the oil that the main cargo pumps can handle is pumped out of a tank the remainder is __________.

Response 2: stripped to one tank and then pumped out with the main pumps
Response 3: stripped out and pumped directly ashore after all the tanks have been emptied by the main pumps
Response 4: gravitated to the centers from the wings and pumped out with the main pumps

Question: What is meant by "thieving" a petroleum cargo?

Response 2: Determining the amount of water (if any) in each cargo tank.
Response 3: Adjusting the cargo figures to coincide with the draft.
Response 4: Reducing the gross cargo calculations to net amounts.

Question: When measuring the oxygen content of the cargo tanks prior to loading cargoes requiring vapor recovery check it __________.
Response 1: one meter from the tank bottom and one meter below the tank top
Response 2: one half the ullage of the tank and one meter below the tank top
Response 3: one half the ullage of the tank and one meter above the tank bottom
Response 4: at three meter intervals from the tank top to the bottom

Question: 33 CFR 156 deals with matters concerning __________.

Question: The sign used to caution persons approaching the gangway of a tank barge during cargo transfer reads __________.

Question: The person in charge on the vessel and the person in charge at the facility must hold a meeting before starting the transfer of oil. Who must decide to start the transfer?

Question: The transfer procedures required to be followed on tankships shall contain __________.

Question: While discharging cargo the cargo tank pressures are falling too low. What can the Cargo Officer do to correct the problem?

Question: Reliquification plants are provided to perform which of the following functions __________.

Response 2: The manager of the shore facility
