The fuel oil strainers located in the fuel oil service system of an automatic auxiliary heating boiler are either the duplex type or the __________.
Which type of pump is typically used to supply fuel to a unit type auxiliary boiler?
The burner assembly on an automatically fired auxiliary boiler fitted with variable capacity pressure atomizing burners maintains steam pressure by __________.
Response 3: changing the speed of a rotary cup
Response 4: varying air pressure supplied to the nozzle

Question: The variation in the amount of fuel oil burned in the operation of an auxiliary boiler utilizing a return flow type atomization system is a function of the __________.
An auxiliary boiler is equipped with a return flow fuel atomization system which uses a/an __________.
An auxiliary boiler equipped with a return flow fuel atomization system has a __________.
The purpose of try-cocks used on an auxiliary boiler is to __________.
Response 1: provide an alternate means of determining the water level if the gage glass fails
Response 2: provide a means of adding chemical feed to the boiler water
Response 3: provide a means for blowing down the gage glass
Response 4: act as a steam sentinel valve if any of the fusible plugs should melt

Question: According to Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) which of the following statements is true concerning the water level indicating device for the auxiliary boiler shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0093.
Response 1: The illustrated arrangement may be used on any steam boiler for any steam pressure up to 300 psig.
Response 2: The minimum size of the piping connecting the water column to the steam drum is to be one inch.
Response 3: The shutoff valve on the boiler drum must be of cast iron.
Response 4: A minimum of three test cocks may serve as the primary water level indicator on boilers under 250 psig.

Question: You are preparing to undertake the re-piping of a water column for an auxiliary fire-tube boiler exceeding a 15 psig operating pressure and is piped similarly to the arrangement shown in the illustration. According to Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR Part 52) which of the following statements is true? See illustration MO-0093.
Response 1: It is permissible to locate water column piping in the uptake smoke box or boiler casing.
Response 2: The minimum size of the piping connecting the water column to the boiler is to be 1.5 inches (3.8 cm).
Response 3: The various fittings used must be of cast iron construction.
Response 4: The shut off valves on the boiler must be locked or sealed open.

Question: The safety valve installed on a coil-type auxiliary boiler is located on the __________.
The purpose of the safety relief valves installed on an auxiliary boiler is to __________.
Response 1: relieve excess fuel oil pressure during the 'off' fire cycle
Response 2: admit water to the dry pipe
Response 3: throttle the forced draft fan output for proper combustion
Response 4: reduce excess steam pressure in the boiler

Question: It is desirable for an auxiliary boiler safety valve to pop open and reseat firmly to __________.
Response 1: give warning that excessive boiler pressure has been reached
Response 2: prevent wire drawing of the disc and seat

Question: When replacing tubes in a water-tube auxiliary boiler to eliminate the possibility of leaks at the tube seats the replacement tubes should be __________.
Response 1: stress relieved to ensure expansion when rolled
Response 2: annealed to prevent cracking when rolled
Response 3: fitted with a welded backing ring in the seat area
Response 4: rolled beaded and seal welded around the bead edge

Question: Which of the listed parts on a fire-tube auxiliary boiler requires a written report to the Officer-in-Charge of Marine Inspection when renewed?
According to 46 CFRs which of the following devices is prohibited for use on automatic auxiliary boilers?

Coast Guard Regulation (46 CFR) requires that after undergoing extensive repairs an auxiliary boiler with a maximum allowable working pressure of 60 psig (411.89 kPa) should be hydrostatically tested at a pressure of __________.
Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require electric hot water supply boilers to be provided with a/an __________.
Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require electric hot water supply boilers to be provided with a/an __________.
Response 3: pressure relief valve set at the MAWP

Question: Bottom blow valves are installed on auxiliary water-tube boilers to ______.
Response 1: completely drain the boiler in an emergency
Response 2: prevent sludge from forming in the steam drum
Response 3: remove floating impurities from the boiler water surface
Response 4: remove settled solids from the water drum

Question: The purpose of try-cocks used on an auxiliary boiler is to ______.
Response 1: provide an alternate means of determining the water level if the gage glass fails
Response 2: provide a means of adding chemical feed to the boiler water
Response 3: provide a means for blowing down the gage glass
Response 4: act as a steam sentinel valve if any of the fusible plugs should melt

Question: In accordance with 46 CFR 61 for a passenger vessel what is the interval in years between when hydrostatic tests must be performed on an oil-fired water-tube auxiliary boiler as witnessed by a marine inspector?
The boiler shown in the illustration would be classed as ______. See illustration MO-0064.
Excessive vibration from an auxiliary boiler could be caused by ______.
Heavy soot accumulations in an auxiliary boiler could be caused by ______.
A feed pump for an auxiliary boiler might lose suction if the ______.
A safety valve on an auxiliary boiler simmers constantly and cannot be stopped by several quick blow-offs using the hand relieving gear. The problem may be ______.
If a tube ruptures in a water-tube auxiliary boiler due to low water you should ______.
Response 1: secure the fires and maintain feed water to boiler to keep up the water level
Response 2: not secure the fires until water level falls out of sight in the gage glass
Response 3: secure both the fires and the feed inlet valve
Response 4: secure the fires when the pressure drops to 50% of the maximum allowable working pressure

Question: The gage glass on a coil-type auxiliary boiler is connected to the ______.
According to 46 CFR Part 61 which of the following statements is true concerning the inspection of water-tube boilers?
Response 1: All mountings shall be opened up and examined by a Coast Guard inspector at eight year intervals after the initial inspection.
Response 2: All boiler mounting studs or bolts shall be removed for examination by a Coast Guard inspector every 4 years after initial inspection.
Response 3: Boiler mountings attached to boiler nozzles must be opened and removed for examination every 8 years.
Response 4: Boiler mountings attached directly to the boiler plating by screwed studs and nuts shall be removed and examined every 10 years.

Question: Which of the listed problems will happen when the water level of a fire-tube type auxiliary boiler approaches the crown sheet?
Which of the listed fuel oil ignition methods are commonly found on automatically fired auxiliary boilers aboard merchant vessels?
Why should the main steam stop valve of an auxiliary boiler be eased off its seat and then gently closed before lighting off?
Response 1: To examine the valve stem for scars or nicks.
Response 2: To check for a tight bonnet seal.
Response 3: To ensure that the valve will not be seized shut when hot.

Question: The concentration of total dissolved solids in the water of an auxiliary boiler can increase as a result of __________.
The concentration of dissolved solids in the boiler water of an auxiliary boiler could increase as a result of __________.
The correct procedure for giving an auxiliary boiler a bottom blow is to begin __________.
Response 1: when the boiler has been secured long enough for most solids to settle
Response 2: when the boiler has been cooled to ambient temperature
Response 3: only after raising the water level to within 1/2 inch of the high water cutout
Response 4: only after bypassing the low pressure pressuretrol

Question: Which of the following procedures decreases the total dissolved solids concentration in the water of an auxiliary boiler?
The procedures recommended for auxiliary boilers having high salinity include __________.
Response 2: securing the boiler and giving it a bottom blow

Question: The amount of chloride content in the water of an auxiliary boiler can be reduced by __________.
The water in an auxiliary boiler should be tested for chloride content to determine __________.
The water in a steaming auxiliary boiler should be tested daily for __________.
The water in an auxiliary boiler should be chemically tested daily for alkalinity and __________.
The water in an operating auxiliary boiler should be tested for alkalinity and chloride content each __________.
For proper operation auxiliary boiler feed water must have which of the following characteristics?
If an operating auxiliary boiler has a water pH reading of 7 you should __________.
Response 2: treat the water with caustic soda
Response 3: treat the water with chemical scavengers
Response 4: reduce the water alkalinity to recommended readings

Question: Before an auxiliary boiler is shutdown for an extended period of time the water in the boiler should have a pH value of __________.
The boiler water alkalinity in a coil-type auxiliary boiler should be maintained at the pH recommended by the boiler manufacturer to __________.
Response 2: reduce corrosion in the heating coil
Response 3: prevent clogging and erosion in the coil

Question: A coil-type automatically fired auxiliary boiler is to be laid up wet for an indefinite period. The boiler water should be treated to ensure that __________.
Response 1: the manufacturer's recommended pH is maintained
Response 2: there is no excess of oxygen scavenging chemicals
Response 3: sludge formation cannot occur in the steam separator
Response 4: waterside blow down will not be required

Question: When checking for the presence of sulfite in the feed water of an auxiliary boiler you are in essence checking __________.
Response 1: the hardness of the makeup feed water
Response 2: to ensure the compound additions are adequate for control of pH
Response 3: to ensure the compound additions are adequate for controlling dissolved oxygen
Response 4: to ensure the automatic or manual blow down rate and frequency is adequate for control of total dissolved solids

Question: How is the concentration of dissolved oxygen in the feed water of an auxiliary boiler maintained at acceptable limits?
Response 1: Feed water is cycled through a DC heater.
Response 2: Feed water is treated with phosphates.
Response 3: Oxygen is liberated in the three-stages of feed water preheating.
Response 4: Oxygen is liberated by maintaining the highest practical feed water temperature.

Question: Why should hand hole gaskets not be allowed to leak on an auxiliary boiler?
Response 1: Water circulation in the boiler will be disrupted.
Response 2: The gasket and its seating surface may become wire drawn.
Response 3: The gasket material will become hardened.
Response 4: Scale and sediment will form on the gasket.

Question: The most common cause of scale formation in an auxiliary boiler is __________.
Response 1: concentrations of calcium sulfate in the boiler water
Response 2: fuel oil in the feed water
Response 3: improper treatment of the feed water with calcium sulfate

Question: Excessive alkalinity of the water in an auxiliary boiler can cause __________.
Response 1: caustic embrittlement of the boiler metal
Response 2: acidic corrosion of the boiler metal
Response 3: hard scale deposits on the boiler tubes
Response 4: etching of the heat exchange surfaces

Question: In readying an auxiliary water-tube boiler for a routine hydrostatic test which of the following procedures should be undertaken prior to filling the boiler with fresh water?
Response 1: The safety valve escape piping should be disconnected from the valve body and a blank inserted.
Response 2: The boiler vent valves should be opened.
Response 3: All hand hole/manhole covers should be tightened up as much as possible to preclude any leaks.

Question: When conducting a hydrostatic test on a water-tube auxiliary boiler the test water should be heated to a temperature of at least 70F. This is done to __________.
Response 1: minimize the coefficient of expansion within the varying types of metals used in boiler construction
Response 2: help prevent the formation of condensation on the tube exteriors
Response 3: eliminate oxygen being carried into the system

Question: When conducting a hydrostatic test on a water-tube auxiliary boiler the test water should be heated to a temperature of at least 70F (21C). This is done to __________.
Response 1: maximize the coefficient of expansion within the varying types of metals used in boiler construction
Response 2: help prevent the formation of condensation on the tube exteriors

Question: During maintenance inspections of a fire tube auxiliary boiler you should check for __________.
Response 1: metal deterioration of the tubes at the tube sheet

Question: Before any work is to be carried out on a burner in an automatically fired auxiliary boiler you should always __________.
Response 1: block all control system relays closed
Response 2: allow the boiler to cool completely
Response 3: close all manually operated fuel valves
Response 4: lock all safety interlock switches closed

Question: Before any work is to be carried out on a burner in an automatically fired auxiliary boiler you should always __________.
Response 1: allow the boiler to cool completely
Response 2: close all manually operated fuel valves
Response 3: lock all safety interlock switches closed
Response 4: block all control system relays closed

Question: Improper maintenance of an automatic auxiliary boiler oil burner could result in __________.
Improper maintenance of the fuel oil burners in an automatically fired auxiliary boiler could result in __________.
A burner responsible for producing black smoke in an automatic auxiliary boiler would be caused by a __________.
A dirty atomizer sprayer plate in the burner of an auxiliary boiler would be indicated by __________.
Heavy soot accumulations in an auxiliary boiler could be caused by __________.
If oil is dripping from the burner of a coil-type auxiliary steam generator the cause may be __________.
Response 1: the oil valve not seating properly
Response 3: carbon on the burner nozzle causing deflection of oil spray

Question: Excessive vibration from an auxiliary boiler could be caused by __________.
Excessive vibration of an automatically fired auxiliary boiler can be caused by __________.
Response 1: air or water in the furnace

Question: A pulsating flame accompanied by a burner developing black smoke in an auxiliary boiler is an indication that the __________.
Response 3: fuel oil pressure is too low

Question: A smoking burner with a pulsating flame in an auxiliary boiler is an indication that the __________.
Response 1: fuel oil supply temperature is normal

Question: Which of the following conditions could cause black smoke to be discharged from the stack of an auxiliary boiler equipped with turbine-driven rotary cup atomizers?
Response 1: Insufficient steam supply to the fuel oil heater.
Response 2: Excessive opening of the dampers in the combustion air inlet.
Response 3: Improper turbine shaft speed in the atomizer assembly.
Response 4: Low fuel oil viscosity being maintained.

Question: When an auxiliary boiler is panting and emitting black smoke you should __________.
Response 3: decrease the fuel oil supply pressure

Question: Which of the following conditions would cause 'panting' in a steaming auxiliary boiler?
Throttling a burner air register on an auxiliary boiler could result in __________.
If the fuel/air ratio in an automatically fired auxiliary boiler is insufficient the result could lead to __________.
If poor combustion occurs in an auxiliary boiler due to an air damper linkage being out of adjustment you would adjust the linkage and then __________.
Response 2: test the high and low fire solenoids
Response 3: check the photocell window for carbon deposits
Response 4: check the burner ignition electrode gap

Question: If the combustion control system of an automatically fired auxiliary boiler fails to relight the burner after a normal shutdown you should check for a/an __________.
Response 2: high voltage on the ignition electrode

Question: An automatically fired auxiliary boiler with carbon deposits formed on its burner electrodes will experience __________.
When lighting off an auxiliary boiler which of the problems listed could cause the burners to sputter?
In the event of a flame failure in an auxiliary water-tube boiler you must __________.
Response 1: relight the boiler immediately to prevent loss of steam pressure
Response 2: relight the fire off the brickwork as long as the bricks are cherry red
Response 3: purge the furnace of any combustible gases before attempting to relight the fire
Response 4: speed up the feed pump to prevent dry firing when the burner flame is reestablished

Question: If the fire goes out in an automatically fired auxiliary boiler and the burner continues to supply fuel there is a potential danger of __________.
A firebox explosion in an automatically fired auxiliary boiler may be the result of __________.
Response 3: a faulty transformer in the ignition circuit

Question: High stack temperature occurring in an auxiliary boiler could be a result of __________.
A burner producing black smoke in an automatic auxiliary boiler would be caused by a/an __________.
In a fire-tube auxiliary boiler you should expect to find the thickest scale on the waterside of the __________.
Waterside scale in a fire-tube boiler may cause __________.
A distorted furnace in a fire-tube auxiliary boiler may be the result of __________.
Response 1: firing for extended periods in the low fire mode
Response 3: varying the water level above the crown sheet
Response 4: carrying excessive alkalinity in the boiler water

Question: A feed pump for an auxiliary boiler might lose suction if the __________.
If the feed pump for an auxiliary boiler fails to deliver the feed water to the boiler the cause may be __________.
Response 1: high steam pressure in the boiler
Response 4: steam demand exceeding feed pump capacity

Question: Failure of the feed pump to deliver feed water to an auxiliary boiler could be caused by __________.
Response 3: grounded probes in the water level control

Question: If a tube ruptures in a water-tube auxiliary boiler due to low water you should ___________.
Response 1: secure the fires and maintain feed water to boiler to keep up the water level
Response 2: not secure the fires until water level falls out of sight in the gage glass
Response 3: secure both the fires and the feed inlet valve
Response 4: secure the fires when the pressure drops to 50% of the maximum allowable working pressure

Question: Which of the following conditions could cause the feed pump for an auxiliary boiler to lose suction?
Response 3: Pump recirculating line being open too much

Question: Which of the following actions should normally be taken during each watch when the auxiliary boiler is in operation?
Response 1: Clean the flame scanner photocell window.
Response 2: Inspect and clean all solenoid valves.
Response 3: Lift the safety valves by hand.
Response 4: Inspect for oil or water leaks.

Question: Which of the following actions should normally be taken during each watch when the auxiliary boiler is in operation?
Response 1: Vent air from the steam drum
Response 3: Lift the safety valves by hand
Response 4: Inspect and clean burner oil solenoid valves

Question: Which action should be taken when an auxiliary boiler is in operation?
Response 2: Lift the relief valves by hand.
Response 3: Inspect and clean all solenoid valves.
Response 4: Inspect for oil and water leaks.

Question: Which of the following actions should normally be taken during each watch when the auxiliary boiler is in operation?
Response 2: Inspect and clean burner fuel oil solenoid valves
Response 3: Lift the safety valves by hand
Response 4: Blow down the water gage glass

Question: The daily inspection of an operating auxiliary boiler should include __________.
Response 2: an examination of the boiler firesides
Response 3: checking for external fuel and water leaks

Question: When an auxiliary boiler is secured and you expect to relight the unit within six hours you should __________.
Response 1: maintain a head of steam not less than 10 psig
Response 2: completely fill the boiler with feed water
Response 3: flush the boiler and close the waterside airtight
Response 4: maintain steam pressure 10 psig below normal boiler load

Question: After lighting off a cold automatically fired auxiliary boiler as steam begins to form you should __________.
Response 2: give the boiler a bottom blow

Question: Prior to lighting off a cold automatically fired auxiliary boiler you should __________.
Response 1: check and regulate the water level
Response 2: close the air cock once fires are lit
Response 3: preheat the diesel oil to assist atomization
Response 4: tighten the steam stop to prevent steam leakage

Question: You are standing watch in the engine room with an auxiliary boiler. You should blow down a gage glass periodically to __________.
Response 1: remove any sediment from the glass
Response 2: maintain the proper water level in the steam drum
Response 3: provide water samples for the second assistant
Response 4: test the feed water stop-check valve

Question: A photoelectric cell is installed in an oil fired boiler safeguard system to introduce proper resistance values to the electronic control circuit. This device is primarily sensitive to __________.
Response 1: light emitted from the back wall incandescent brickwork
Response 2: light emitted from the front wall incandescent brickwork
Response 3: the orange portion of the flame spectrum
Response 4: the blue portion of the flame spectrum

Question: Combustion control systems on automatic boilers are designed to prevent immediate burner ignition after a normal or safety shutdown in order to allow time for __________.
Response 2: electric charge buildup in the igniter

Question: If the low water level alarm sounds on an automatically fired boiler and the low water cutout fails to function you must immediately __________.
Response 1: blow down the gage glass to determine where the water level is
Response 2: increase the feed water supply to maintain the water level
Response 3: start the emergency feed water injector to restore the normal water level
Response 4: secure the fires to minimize damage to the boiler tubes

Question: If an automatically fired burner ignites but repeatedly goes out within two seconds the cause could be a/an __________.
Response 1: faulty pressure signal to the time delay relay circuit
Response 3: burned out solenoid coil in the low fire oil valve

Question: In the water level electrode assembly shown in the illustration the feed pump should restart when the level of the water reaches the position indicated by arrow '____'. See illustration MO-0047.
In the water level electrode assembly shown in the illustration the leads indicated by letter "F" would be wired to the __________. See illustration MO-0047.
Response 3: feed pump controller and burner circuit
Response 4: burner circuit and feed water regulator

Question: Regarding the water level electrode assembly shown in the illustration normal water level would be indicated __________. See illustration MO-0047.
Regarding the water level electrode assembly shown in the illustration the normal water level will ordinarily rise and fall between __________. See illustration MO-0047.
Regarding the water level electrode assembly shown in the illustration arrow "C" indicates the point at which the __________. See illustration MO-0047.
The auxiliary boiler feed water level control shown in the illustration utilizes __________. See illustration MO-0047.
Response 4: proportional plus reset plus rate action

Question: An automatically fired auxiliary boiler is required by Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) to be shutdown as a result of __________.
Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require all automatically fired low pressure heating boilers to have an automatic __________.
Response 1: fuel cutoff as a result of low water

Question: Some automatically fired auxiliary boilers are equipped with the water level electrode assembly shown in the illustration. In this type of water level control the burner circuit is completed through the __________. See illustration MO-0047.
Response 1: third leg of the water level electrode assembly
Response 2: ungrounded neutral leg of the control circuit
Response 3: water in the boiler drum and electrode assembly
Response 4: magnetic field surrounding the water level electrode assembly

Question: The submerged electrode low water cutoff used in some automatically fired auxiliary boilers will secure the burner fuel supply if the boiler water level __________. See illustration MO-0047.
Response 1: touches the bottom of the electrode
Response 3: changes from low to high level

Question: The fuel supply system to an automatic auxiliary boiler will automatically shutdown if the boiler __________.
Two solenoid control valves are required on large automatic auxiliary boilers and will simultaneously shut off the fuel in the event of __________.
The fuel oil supply system to an automatic auxiliary boiler will automatically shutdown if the boiler __________.
Which of the following types of feed water regulators is commonly used with a water-tube natural circulation auxiliary boiler?
Constant capacity pressure atomizing fuel oil burners installed on automatically fired auxiliary boilers respond to variations in load demand by __________.
Response 2: automatically cycling the burner on and off
Response 3: responding to the boiler high and low water level limit switches
Response 4: regulating the fuel oil service pump discharge pressure

Question: Which of the following methods is used with a varying load on an auxiliary boiler equipped with the burner assembly shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0098.
Response 1: An oil control valve in the fuel return line controls the combustion rate.
Response 2: The burner is cycled 'on' and 'off' in response to boiler pressure.
Response 3: The ignition electrode is fired from a step up transformer.
Response 4: The triple nozzle assembly responds to a low steam pressure signal from a pyrostat.

Question: Automatic combustion control systems for auxiliary boilers are designed to cycle burners on and off in response to the __________.
Automatic combustion control systems for some auxiliary boilers are designed to cycle burners on in response to __________.
Automatic combustion control systems for some auxiliary boilers are designed to cycle burners on and off in response to __________.
When the steam pressure drops below a set value on an automatically fired auxiliary boiler fitted with rotary cup atomizers the combustion control system will __________.
Response 1: increase the fuel oil control valve opening
Response 3: decrease the back pressure regulating valve opening
Response 4: decrease the supply steam control valve opening

Question: The solenoid valves in the fuel oil supply line to an automatically fired auxiliary boiler are automatically closed by __________.
While an auxiliary boiler is operating at design load which of the following actions will occur if the automatic combustion control system detects a steam pressure drop?
Response 1: More burners will be lighted off.
Response 3: The fuel oil valve and air damper will open wider.
Response 4: The steam flow will be automatically regulated.

Question: On an automatically fired auxiliary boiler the steam pressure limit switch is wired into the burner electric circuit to __________.
Response 1: sound an alarm when the burner is shut off
Response 2: energized the flame scanner circuit when high boiler pressure is reached
Response 3: shut off the burner when the cutoff pressure is reached
Response 4: prevent burner operation in the event of low boiler water level

Question: Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) specify that the fuel oil ignition system on a small automatically fired auxiliary boiler shall be energized __________.
Response 1: only before or simultaneously with the opening of the fuel oil valve
Response 2: after the fuel oil valve opens
Response 3: after a prepurge of not less than 10 seconds
Response 4: before the trial for ignition period

Question: Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require that small automatic auxiliary boilers shall be equipped with a pre-purge programming control that will assure at least __________.
The primary function of a flame safeguard system as used on an automatically fired auxiliary boiler is to prevent __________.
Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require that the flame safeguard control system for an automatic boiler should __________.
Response 1: be designed to automatically relight the boiler fires after a low water shutdown
Response 2: incorporate an open bimetallic helix pyrostat stack switch
Response 3: be capable of closing the fuel valves in not more than 4 seconds after a flame failure
Response 4: provide a trial for ignition period of not more than 90 seconds

Question: A failure to any component of a flame safeguard control for an automatically fired auxiliary boiler will result in __________.
The flame safeguard controls of a large automatically fired auxiliary boiler may consist of a __________.
The purpose of a temperature sensing device installed in the stack of a small automatically fired auxiliary steam boiler is to secure the oil burner __________.
Response 1: in the event of a flame failure
Response 2: in the event of a stack fire
Response 3: when the water level reaches the crown sheet
Response 4: when the feed pump discharge pressure drops to a preset minimum

Question: Which of the listed sequence of events occurs when an automatic auxiliary boiler is pre-purged?
Response 1: The damper on the inlet side of the furnace is moved to the open position for a given number of seconds and then moved to the closed position.
Response 2: The damper on the inlet side of the furnace is moved to the open position for a given number of seconds and then moved to the low fire position.
Response 3: The damper is moved to the closed position for a given number of seconds and then moved to the low fire position.
Response 4: The damper in the uptakes is moved to the wide open position for a given number of seconds and then moved to the low firing rate position.

Question: The programmed control system of an automatic auxiliary boiler will terminate the light off process during the pre-purge period if air flow is not sensed and __________.
Response 1: the damper is not sufficiently open
Response 2: the damper is not fully closed

Question: After a normal or safety shutdown automatic combustion control systems for an auxiliary boiler are designed to prevent the immediate refiring of a burner in order for the __________.
Response 2: electric charge to buildup in the igniter

Question: At the beginning of the pre-purge period on an automatic auxiliary boiler equipped with a programmed control system the unit will not restart if airflow is not sensed and __________.
Response 1: the damper is not sufficiently opened
Response 2: the damper is not fully closed

Question: The purpose of the programmed purge cycle on an automatically fired auxiliary boiler is to __________.
Response 1: cool the furnace to prevent preignition
Response 2: remove explosive vapors from the furnace
Response 4: provide sufficient air in the furnace to allow ignition of the fuel

Question: Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) permit the use of which of the following fuel oil ignition methods on automatic auxiliary boilers?
Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require that the "trial for ignition period" on boilers must not exceed __________.
A photoelectric cell installed in an automatically fired auxiliary boiler burner management system __________.
Response 1: opens the burner circuit upon sensing a flame failure
Response 2: detects a flame failure by monitoring radiant heat from glowing refractory
Response 3: requires mechanical linkage to secure the burner fuel supply
Response 4: must be bypassed at low firing rates

Question: During unsafe firing conditions in a large automatic auxiliary boiler various control actuators are interlocked with the burner circuit to prevent start-up in addition to safety shutdown. These controls are referred to as __________.
Which of the listed types of control systems is required by Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) for large automatic auxiliary boiler heating equipment?
Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require the controls for automatically fired auxiliary boilers must be fitted with visible indicators to signal __________.
Response 1: fuel oil shutoff due to flameout
Response 2: low voltage in the flame scanner circuit

Question: The pressuretrol which is installed on an auxiliary boiler senses steam pressure changes and __________.
Response 1: controls the flow of feed water to the boiler
Response 2: monitors the boiler high water level
Response 3: secures the fires when a fusible plug burns out
Response 4: automatically regulates the quantity of oil and air flow to the burner

Question: In an automatically fired auxiliary boiler restarting from the normal shutdown cycle in response to steam demand is initiated by a/an __________.
Response 1: modulating pressuretrol sensing both steam pressure and temperature
Response 3: pressuretrol measuring only the steam pressure

Question: Which of the following statements is true concerning pressure limit switches and pressuretrols installed on auxiliary boilers?
Response 1: They are bimetallic elements sensing temperature differentials corresponding to pressure changes.
Response 2: They consist of a bellows assembly linked with a snap action switch through a pressure adjusting mechanism.
Response 3: They automatically relieve excessive steam pressure by acting as a pilot to the safety valve.
Response 4: They automatically restart the burner sequence via the high water level signal.

Question: Which of the following statements concerning the alarms for automatically controlled auxiliary boilers complies with applicable Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR).
Response 1: Shutdown due to the activation of a vital alarm will require a manual reset.
Response 2: Audible alarms shall not be silenced manually.
Response 3: Visible indicators are not required for low water shutdown.
Response 4: Failure of the flame safety system need not be monitored.

Question: Which of the following actions takes place in the control circuit of an automatically fired auxiliary boiler when the desired steam pressure is obtained?
Response 1: A temperature sensing device opens the circuit breaker in the burner motor.
Response 2: The high limit control secures power to the entire oil firing system.
Response 3: The stack relay actuates the low limit control which breaks the ignition circuit.
Response 4: The stack relay secures power to the high voltage side of the ignition transformer.

Question: The flame safeguard control system of a large automatic auxiliary boiler will provide fuel shut off in the case of high __________.
Control of the fuel oil metering valve in an automatically fired auxiliary boiler is accomplished by a __________.
Response 1: pressure magnifying device in the steam coil outlet
Response 2: steam pressure sensing device with linkage to the damper air vanes
Response 3: metering device in the air supply line
Response 4: signal from the feed water electrode

Question: Which of the automatic boiler controls listed should be tested prior to lighting off an auxiliary boiler?
Response 3: Voltage output of the ignition transformer
Response 4: Insulation resistance readings in the ignition system high tension leads

Question: Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require the programming control sequence for auxiliary boiler operation to include __________.
Response 1: prepurge period for one complete change of air
Response 2: ignition period to ignite the fuel 4 seconds after fuel delivery
Response 3: not to automatically increase the air flow after a safety trip

Question: All oil-fired boilers regardless of intended mode of operation with automatic safety control systems must automatically close the burner valve when___________.
Response 1: flame in boiler furnace is confirmed

Question: All oil-fired boilers regardless of intended mode of operation with automatic safety control systems must automatically close the burner valve when___________.
Response 1: flame in boiler furnace is confirmed

Question: To test the operation of the flame failure switch of an operating automatically fired auxiliary boiler you should __________.
Response 1: de-energize the high voltage ignition system
Response 2: move the igniter away from the normal firing position
Response 3: close the manual fuel valve with the burner firing
Response 4: shift the controls to low fire

Question: When an auxiliary boiler is on the line the output of the flame scanner can be checked by placing a microammeter in series with the photoelectric cell circuit. The readings on high fire should be __________.
Response 1: higher than those at low fire
Response 2: equal to those at low fire
Response 3: lower than those at low fire
Response 4: lower than those at low fire but the generated voltage will be higher

Question: In accordance with Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) water level controls utilized in a small automatically fired auxiliary heating boiler shall be tested __________.
Response 1: by simulation only to prevent possible boiler damage due to a low water condition
Response 2: every time the boiler is being secured for an extended lay up period
Response 3: with a stop watch to verify shutdown times
Response 4: by slowly lowering the boiler water level

Question: Flame failure in an automatically fired auxiliary boiler can result from a/an __________.
Flame failure in an operating automatically fired auxiliary boiler can result from a __________.
Response 2: faulty steam pressure signal to the trial for ignition circuit

Question: Burner ignition failure in an automatically fired auxiliary boiler would be caused by __________.
Response 1: a burned out solenoid in the oil supply valve
Response 3: incorrectly setting the hot well dump valve
Response 4: an incorrectly positioned burner snubber relay

Question: Failure of the burner flame in an automatic auxiliary boiler would probably be a result of __________.
Response 4: full fuel pressure at the nozzle

Question: When there is a flame failure in an automatically fired auxiliary boiler the __________.
If the combustion control system of an automatically fired auxiliary boiler fails to sustain burner ignition after a normal shutdown you should check for a/an __________.
Response 3: high voltage on the ignition electrode

Question: Ignition failure in an automatically controlled auxiliary boiler could be caused by __________.
Response 1: carbon deposits on the flame scanner

Question: Ignition failure in an auxiliary boiler can be caused by __________.
Response 3: excess fuel pressure at the nozzle

Question: Ignition failure in an automatically controlled auxiliary boiler can be caused by __________.
A sudden flame failure in an operating auxiliary boiler equipped with an automatic combustion control system and burning light fuel could be attributed to a __________.
Response 1: dead or malfunctioning step up transformer

Question: Under which of the following conditions must the combustion control system for a small automatic auxiliary boiler secure the burner?
A failure of any component of a flame safeguard control for an auxiliary boiler will result in __________.
If the combustion control system of an automatically fired auxiliary boiler fails to restart from the normal shutdown mode you should check for __________.
Response 1: broken or grounded high tension leads

Question: Which of the following conditions will cause only one of the burner solenoid valves to close on an automatically fired two burner unit auxiliary boiler?
Response 1: Loss of the forced draft fan
Response 4: A faulty coil in one of the solenoid valves

Question: If the flame of an automatically fired auxiliary boiler tends to move away from the burner tip when the firing rate is changed from low to high you should __________.
Response 2: adjust damper linkage to slow the opening rate of the dampers
Response 3: adjust damper linkage to lengthen the purge period
Response 4: adjust the photocell to observe the new flame position

Question: Automatic burner shutdown in an auxiliary boiler as a result of a component failure in the flame safeguard controls will __________.
Response 1: prevent the boiler from automatically relighting
Response 2: eliminate the need for furnace purging
Response 3: cause automatic restart after a purge period
Response 4: cause an explosion in the boiler furnace

Question: Over firing of a hot water boiler may be caused by __________.
What is the function of device "B" shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: It serves to cool incoming feed water.
Response 2: It condenses the vapors formed in section "G".
Response 3: It removes sensible heat from the jacket water.
Response 4: It serves to boil off incoming feed water.

Question: What is the function of device "C" shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: It removes moisture entrained in the vapors produced in section "G".
Response 2: It allows for access into section "F".
Response 3: It controls the amount of vapor produced in section "F".
Response 4: The division plate creates a pressure drop between the two stages.

Question: What is the function of item "D" shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: It heats the entering feed water.
Response 2: It heats the jacket water entering the device.
Response 3: It causes the jacket water to evaporate.

Question: Which of the following conditions occurs in the section labeled "F" of the device shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: Non-condensable vapors are removed and water vapors are preheated.
Response 2: The sea water flowing through device "I" is cooled.
Response 3: The jacket water flowing through device "I" is heated.
Response 4: The vapors produced in section "G" are condensed and the non-condensable gases are removed.

Question: What occurs in the space labeled "G" of the device shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: Jacket water is heated in the boiling chamber.
Response 2: The feed water enters the device and vaporizes under vacuum conditions.
Response 3: The feed water is cooled prior to being pumped into section "F".

Question: What occurs in the space labeled "D" of the device shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: Jacket water is heated in the boiling chamber.
Response 2: The feed water is cooled prior to being pumped into section "F".
Response 3: The feed water enters the device and vaporizes under vacuum conditions.
Response 4: Moisture is separated from the steam vapor.

Question: What occurs in the area labeled "G" of the device shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: Jacket water is heated in the boiling chamber.
Response 2: The feed water is vaporized under vacuum conditions.
Response 3: The feed water is cooled prior to being pumped into section "F".
Response 4: Water vapor is condensed and collected.

Question: What is the function of device "A" shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: It provides a conduit for incoming feed water.
Response 2: It is only used as a lifting beam during installation.
Response 3: It serves as a hinge for ease of opening the shell.
Response 4: It aids in removing condenser tube bundles.

Question: For the operation of the illustrated device what fluid flow would be expected at the connection labeled "I"? See illustration MO-0110.
Response 3: The sea water used for condensing the water vapor.

Question: The primary function of line "J" shown in the illustration is to __________. See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: remove air and non-condensable gases from the unit
Response 2: allow for removal of produced distillate
Response 4: remove condensable gases from the unit

Question: Line "K" shown in the illustration is the __________. See illustration MO-0110.
Item "M" shown in the illustration is the __________. See illustration MO-0110.
The function of device "O" shown in the illustration is to __________. See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: regulate the amount of brine entering the unit
Response 2: control the amount of brine exiting the evaporator
Response 3: control the amount of feed water entering the evaporator
Response 4: provide a positive suction head for the brine pump

Question: Which of the following is NOT a function of the water supply through item "P" shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: It supplies feed water to evaporator.
Response 2: It supplies the operating medium used in the removal of the distillate.
Response 3: It supplies the operating medium used in the removal of the brine.
Response 4: It supplies the operating medium used in the removal of air and non-condensable gases.

Question: Which of the listed fluids exits the flange labeled "Q" shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: Sea water from the condenser plate assembly.
Response 2: Sea water from the evaporator tube bundle.
Response 3: Jacket water from the condenser plate assembly.
Response 4: Sea water from the evaporator plate assembly.

Question: Which of the listed fluids exits the device at flange "R" shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0110.
Response 2: Sea water from the service system

Question: The line shown in the illustration identified by the letter "S" is the __________. See illustration MO-0110.
The pipe identified by the letter "J" shown in the illustration is __________. See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: attached to the outlet of the brine ejector
Response 2: directly connected to the feed water supply line
Response 3: directly connected to the jacket water supply line

Question: In an actual installation the flange identified by the letter "U" shown in the illustration can be directly connected from the brine ejector discharge to the __________. See illustration MO-0110.
In an actual installation the flange identified by the letter "U" shown in the illustration can be directly connected from the brine ejector discharge to the __________. See illustration MO-0110.
In an actual installation which of the flanges are connected to the condenser section of the water maker? See illustration MO-0110.
In an actual installation which of the flanges are connected to the engine jacket water system for the water maker shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0110.
The heat exchanger plates used in the device shown in the illustration are produced from which of the listed materials? See illustration MO-0110.
The heat exchanger plates used in the device shown in the illustration are produced from which of the listed materials? See illustration MO-0110.
Which of the following represents the motivating power fluid used in conjunction with the ejector pumps on evaporators? See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: The ejectors do not require a motive power.
Response 2: The motive power is the feed water supply.
Response 3: The motive power is the brine pump output prior to being discharged overboard.
Response 4: The motive power is the jacket water flowing through the ejectors.

Question: Failure to establish sufficient vacuum when starting up the unit shown in the illustration may be the result of __________. See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: improper operation of the brine pump
Response 2: improper operation of the distillate pump
Response 3: neglecting to close the vent shell
Response 4: neglecting to latch the dump valve

Question: What is the function of the device labeled "3" shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0111.
Response 1: The heat exchanger serves to heat the jacket water during cold water operation.
Response 2: The jacket water cooler is used to raise the temperature of the sea water flowing through it.
Response 3: The device specifically serves to remove the latent heat of vaporization from the jacket water.
Response 4: The cooler removes sensible heat from the jacket water.

Question: Excluding line losses how many distinct pressure drops will occur as sea water flows through all the heat exchangers in the cooling system shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0111.
What is the primary function of item '15' shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0111.
Response 1: It removes the vapor condensed in area "23".
Response 2: It removes the distillate condensed in area "24".
Response 3: It is the chemical cleaning pump used in conjunction with valve "12".
Response 4: It is used to empty the evaporator section when there is tube leakage while the unit is secured.

Question: The graphic dotted line between items "27" "12" "9" and "20" shown in the illustration is used to indicate the use of __________. See illustration MO-0111.
Which of the following statements represents the two major functions provided by the item labeled "20" shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0111.
Response 1: The pump supplies the motive force to the ejectors and removes the excess distillate.
Response 2: The pump is used to drain the shell when the unit is secured in addition to powering the ejectors.
Response 3: The pump provides for venting of associated equipment while also powering the ejectors.
Response 4: The pump supplies the motive fluid to the ejectors in addition to supplying the feed water to the distiller.

Question: The items labeled "21" and "22" shown in the illustration are used to remove __________. See illustration MO-0111.
Response 2: non-condensable gases from two separate sections of the distiller
Response 4: brine and jacket water from the condenser

Question: What occurs within the tubes of the device labeled "23" shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0111.
Response 1: The heat from the jacket water passing within the tubes is being transferred to the feed water on the outside of the tubes.
Response 2: The feed water flowing through the inside of the tubes is being heated by the jacket water on the outside of the tubes.
Response 3: The heat being transferred is subliminal therefore expansion is taking place within the tubes.
Response 4: The heat of combustion from the engine is being transferred azeotropically adding latent heat to the entering jacket water.

Question: Which of the following statements describes what will occur to the volume of water vapor as it is exposed to the lower temperatures existing in the device labeled "24" shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0111.
Response 1: The volume is increased as condensation occurs at the tube surfaces.
Response 2: The latent heat of condensation is removed causing the volume to increase.
Response 3: The volume will increase if the valve labeled "J" is opened excessively resulting in an increase of the distiller absolute pressure.
Response 4: The volume is greatly reduced contributing to condensation within the condenser.

Question: Device '27' shown in the illustration is used to __________. See illustration MO-0111.
Response 1: regulate maximum vacuum during normal operation
Response 2: purge the unit of non-condensable gases

Question: Which device is used to prevent over pressurization of the illustrated distiller? See illustration MO-0111.
Which of the valve arrangements listed would be correct for operating the distillation plant shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0111.
Excess brine accumulated in the distiller shown in the illustration is removed during normal operation by __________. See illustration MO-0111.
Response 2: opening the drain valve located to the left of orifice "19"
Response 4: orifice "19" regulating the amount of feed water entering the distiller thereby preventing excess brine accumulation

Question: During operation which device listed removes air and non-condensable gases from the unit shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0111.
Which of the following statements concerning the systems shown in the illustration is correct? See illustration MO-0111.
Response 1: The jacket water primarily looses its heat at the cooler and is further cooled in the evaporator section.
Response 2: The feed water acquires heat passing through devices "2" and "23".
Response 3: The jacket water absorbs heat in the evaporator section while giving up its heat in the distiller section.
Response 4: The feed water gains heat in section "23" while the vapor gives up heat in section "24".

Question: Which of the following statements concerning the systems shown in the illustration is correct? See illustration MO-0111.
Response 1: The jacket water primarily looses its heat at the cooler and is further heated in the evaporator section.
Response 2: The feed water acquires heat passing through devices "2" and "23".
Response 3: The jacket water absorbs heat in the evaporator section while giving up its heat in the distiller section.
Response 4: The feed water gains heat in section "23" while the vapor gives up heat in section "24".

Question: Which of the following statements describes the approximate relation between the feed water entering the unit shown in the illustration and brine being removed? See illustration MO-0111.
Response 1: The brine will be removed at a faster rate than feed water entering to prevent the possibility of flooding.
Response 2: Seventy-five percent of the feed water entering the unit is removed as brine.
Response 3: Twenty-five percent of the feed water entering the device is removed as brine.
Response 4: The amount of feed water entering the distiller is dependent upon the condition of device "7" while the amount of brine leaving is dependent upon the condition of device "21".

Question: Which set of valves will be opened intentionally to remove heat from the main engine jacket cooling water system shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0111.
Item "10" shown in the illustration is used to __________. See illustration MO-0111.
Response 1: prevent damage to device "9" by reducing turbulence
Response 2: cancel the effects of improper regulation developed by device "11"
Response 3: regulate flow from the drain pump
Response 4: direct the flow from the distillate pump

Question: If the demister used in the device shown in the illustration is improperly installed which of the following will occur? See illustration MO-0110.
Response 1: The vacuum of the device will increase.
Response 2: The temperature of the device will decrease.
Response 3: Interstage leakage will cause a decrease in output.
Response 4: There will be an increase of chlorides measured at the distillate pump salinity cell.

Question: If the wearing rings of device "7" shown in the illustration become worn how will the evaporation rate in "23" be affected? See illustration MO-0111.
Response 1: The rate of evaporation will decrease.
Response 2: The rate of evaporation is dependent on the level of vacuum maintained within the unit and not the flow of water to the unit.
Response 3: Device "7" does not use wearing rings as these are normally positive displacement pumps.
Response 4: The rate of evaporation will not be affected as the standby pump labeled "8" will be used instead.

Question: If valve "H" shown in the illustration is opened wide while the distiller is in operation __________. See illustration MO-0111.
Response 1: the absolute pressure of the unit will increase with an associated decrease in shell temperature.
Response 2: the absolute pressure of the unit will increase due to the increased affect of the air ejector.
Response 3: the absolute pressure of the unit will increase with an associated increase in shell temperature.
Response 4: the absolute pressure of the unit will not be affected but the rate of condensation will be decreased.

Question: What would be the first indication that a tube leak has occurred in area "23"? See illustration MO-0111.
Response 1: The level in area "1" would decrease.
Response 2: The level in area "1" would increase.
Response 3: The level in area "3" would increase.
Response 4: The level in area "3" would decrease.

Question: Which of the conditions listed would indicate a large condenser tube leak within the distiller shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0111.
Response 1: A decrease in the level of the main engine expansion tank as indicated by a low level alarm.
Response 2: An increase in distiller output resulting from the combination of jacket water and the distillate produced.
Response 3: A slow continuous rise in the lube oil cooler outlet temperature indicated at device "4".
Response 4: The activation of the salinity monitoring equipment's annunciator circuit.

Question: What would happen if valve '25' shown in the illustration vibrated open with the unit in operation? See illustration MO-0111.
Response 1: The unit would continue to operate with no adverse effects.
Response 2: Jacket water would be automatically by-passed around the distiller.
Response 3: The unit would automatically shut down due to the closing of the low pressure contacts.
Response 4: The absolute pressure of the unit would increase causing a decrease in distillate output.

Question: Irregular feeding or surging of the feed water supply to a low pressure distilling plant may be attributed to __________.

Response 2: a clogged vent line from the air eductor condenser
Response 3: excessive pressure in the seawater feed heater
Response 4: a dirty strainer in the saltwater feed pump suction line

Question: While standing watch underway you notice carryover occurring in a low pressure distilling plant. This can be a result of __________.

Question: The pipe identified by the letter "J" shown in the illustration is ______. See illustration MO-0110.

Response 4: directly connected to the feed water supply line

Question: What would happen if valve "25" shown in the illustration vibrated open with the unit in operation? See illustration MO-0111.

Response 2: The unit would automatically shut down due to the closing of the low pressure contacts.

Question: What is the function of the item "7" shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0111.

Question: The function of the device shown in the illustration is to __________. See illustration MO-0125.
Response 1: slide the camshafts to insure proper lubrication
Response 2: provide the engine with a braking device
Response 3: change the engines direction of rotation
Response 4: eliminate the need for mechanical interlocks

Question: The function of the device shown in the illustration is to __________. See illustration MO-0125.
Response 1: rotate the camshafts to insure proper lubrication
Response 2: provide the engine with a braking device
Response 3: slide the camshafts axially when changing engine rotation
Response 4: eliminate the need for mechanical interlocks

Question: The component labeled "A" on the engine reversing device shown in the illustration performs its function by transmitting _______. See illustration MO-0125.
Response 1: a hydraulic pressure which shifts an alternate set of camshaft followers to ride on the engine camshaft
Response 2: an electric voltage which energizes solenoids to de-clutch the engine
Response 3: a pneumatic signal which activates a hydraulic control cylinder allowing the camshaft to shift axially

Question: Which of the following should always be checked prior to starting a diesel engine?

Response 1: The expansion tank should be topped off.
Response 2: The thermostatic water regulating valves should be manually opened.
Response 3: The fuel filters should be changed.
Response 4: The engine should be turned over slowly with the indicator cocks open.

Question: Which of the listed diesel engine operating conditions should be checked immediately after any diesel engine is started?
Response 4: Water level in the expansion tank

Question: Immediately after starting a small high-speed diesel engine you should check the __________.
Which of the following operating procedures should be carried out immediately after any diesel engine is started?
Response 4: Check the water level in expansion tank

Question: As soon as a diesel engine has started which of the listed engine operating parameters should be checked FIRST?
When attempting to restart a warm high-speed engine which of the following reactions can you expect?
Response 2: Higher than normal temperatures for start up
Response 4: Higher than normal lube oil pressure

Question: Following an overhaul of a crosshead type diesel engine the engine is jacked over with the turning gear as part of the pre-start procedure. Which of the listed pre-start procedures should be carried out?
Response 1: Ensure proper cylinder lube oil flow.
Response 2: Open all air space drain cocks.

Question: Which of the listed pre-start procedures should be carried out prior to starting a crosshead type diesel engine after an overhaul?
Response 2: Open all air space drain cocks.

Question: Before starting a diesel engine that has an engine driven lube oil pump the engineer should __________.
Response 2: cut in the lube oil cooler
Response 3: pressurize the lube oil system with the pre-lube pump

Question: What could be the cause of inadequate starting speed during the cranking of a cold diesel engine?

Response 1: the type and size of the engine

Question: In the starting process of a diesel engine the main object is to attain the compression conditions sufficient to __________.

Response 2: use a higher than normal cranking speed
Response 4: use a fuel having a lower ignition temperature

Question: If a diesel engine can be turned over at normal cranking speed but fails to start the cause could be late fuel injection or __________.
Response 3: fuel oil trip has not been reset

Question: If a diesel engine turned over at normal cranking speed but failed to start the cause could be late fuel injection or __________.
A diesel engine may fail to start when being cranked due to __________.
If a diesel engine fails to start one of the likely causes is __________.
Response 4: high fuel oil booster pump pressure

Question: If while attempting to start a diesel engine the cranking speed is too low __________.
Response 1: the fuel timing will be too late
Response 2: the heat of compression will be insufficient to ignite the fuel
Response 3: the lube oil viscosity will be too low
Response 4: the spark will be too early for the fuel

Question: If cranking a diesel engine is too slow while attempting to start it will result in __________.
A diesel engine may fail to start due to __________.
Response 3: excessive fuel dilution of lube oil

Question: Which of the following statements is correct concerning available astern power for diesel main propulsion systems?
Response 1: Astern power is to be provided in a sufficient amount to secure proper control of the ship in all normal circumstances.
Response 2: The astern power of the main propelling machinery is to provide for continuous operation astern at 60% of the ahead rpm at rated speed.
Response 3: For main propulsion systems without reversing gears controllable pitch propellers or electric propulsion drive running astern is not to lead to overload conditions.
Response 4: Astern power available will be equal to ahead power when controllable pitch propellers are utilized thus discounting the need for increased operating parameters.

Question: Concerning diesel propelled vessels the astern power is to provide for continuous operation astern __________.
Response 1: equal to that available for ahead operation
Response 2: at 70 percent of the ahead rpm at rated speed
Response 3: while underway and under all normal conditions
Response 4: at 70 percent of the ahead rpm of average continuous sea speed

Question: The cylinders labeled "B" and "C" in the illustration are used to ______. See illustration MO-0125.
Response 2: supply a specific volume of oil to the engine governor
Response 3: provide the required quantity of grease at specified maintenance intervals
Response 4: supply the force required to shift the engine camshafts axially to reverse engine rotation

Question: The cylinders labeled "B" and "C" in the illustration are used to ______. See illustration MO-0125.
Response 1: supply a specific volume of oil to the engine governor
Response 3: provide the required quantity of grease at specified maintenance intervals
Response 4: supply the force required to shift the engine camshafts axially to reverse engine rotation

Question: Which of the routine maintenance procedures listed is required for starting air receivers?
Response 3: A close watch on temperature to prevent fluctuations in pressure.
Response 4: Frequent cleaning to remove oil and foreign matter.

Question: Starting systems for large direct reversing main propulsion diesel engines are usually __________.
Which of the following statements is true concerning the air starting valve labeled "III" as shown in the illustration? See illustration MO-0046.
Response 1: When starting the air starting valve is held open by air pressure.
Response 2: When starting air is secured the air starting valve is closed.
Response 3: The air starting valve is opened by cam action.

Question: The four cams shown in the illustration are in position with their respective pistons at top dead center. Which of the cams is the air starting cam? See illustration MO-0045.

Response 1: Abrupt lift with a short open period and abrupt valve seating.
Response 2: Gradual lift with a short fully open period and accelerated valve closing.
Response 3: Abrupt lift giving full valve opening for a long period with gradual valve seating.
Response 4: Gradual lift giving full valve opening for a long period with gradual valve seating.

Question: Which of the following methods is used to prevent throttling of compressed air through the diesel engine air starting valves?
Response 1: Holding the valve open for a long period
Response 2: Increasing the starting air pressure used
Response 3: Opening the starting air valve quickly
Response 4: Reducing the starting air valve size

Question: The pilot valves in an air pilot starting system for a two-stroke/cycle direct-reversing main propulsion diesel engine are operated by either a ported distributor disc or a/an __________.
Response 4: individual cam for each pilot valve

Question: The timing of diesel engine air starting valves is controlled by __________.
Response 1: the air start valve timing gears and rods

Question: Diesel engine air start valve timing is controlled by __________.

Response 1: During starting the starting valve is held opened by air pressure.
Response 2: When starting air is secured the air starting valve is closed.
Response 3: The starting air valve is opened by cam action during starting.
Response 4: During normal engine running the starting air valve opens and closes constantly due to cam action.

Question: During the starting of a diesel engine compression gases are prevented from backing into the air starting system shown in the illustration by the __________. See illustration MO-0046.

Question: The items shown in the illustration labeled "P" are __________. See illustration MO-0003.

Response 2: Direct mechanical type with check valve

Question: Starting air check valves are held firmly on their seats by __________.
Response 3: air pressure on top of the valve differential piston

Question: Diesel engine air start system check valves are opened by __________.
The air start check valve shown in the illustration is opened by __________. See illustration MO-0107.
A six-cylinder four-stroke/cycle diesel engine is fitted with a rotary distributor type air starting system. The speed of the rotating distributor disc is __________.
A six-cylinder two-stroke/cycle diesel engine is fitted with a rotary distributing air starting system. The speed of the rotating distributor disc is __________.

The admission valve shown in the illustration is fitted to an air supply manifold for opening and closing off the supply of compressed air to the starting valves as well as air distribution to the main propulsion diesel engine. The admission valve is opened by __________. See illustration MO-0055.
Response 1: vacuum on the control valve outlet
Response 2: control air pressure on the guide piston acting downward on the valve piston
Response 3: spring tension on the valve piston with a momentary interruption of reservoir air
Response 4: venting the starting system air distribution

Question: Which of the following statements best represents how the start air valve shown in the illustration operates to admit starting air to the main engine cylinder? See illustration MO-0054.
Response 1: The valve spring exerts downward force on the valve spindle.
Response 2: Air pressure from the starting air inlet is applied to the top of the starting valve piston.
Response 3: Control air pressure is applied to the top of the starting valve piston.
Response 4: The downward intake stroke of the main engine cylinder draws the starting valve open.

Question: The control air distributor shown in the illustration functions to __________. See illustration MO-0053.
Response 1: provide lube oil pressure to the engine governor
Response 2: provide hydraulic pressure for reversing the engine
Response 3: provide air pressure to open the appropriate air start valve in the engine
Response 4: control the opening and closing of the intake and exhaust valves in the engine

Question: In a direct cylinder admission air starting system once the engine begins to fire the air starting check valve illustrated is closed by __________. See illustration MO-0107.
Response 2: the spring force and cylinder pressure

Question: When an air started four-stroke/cycle diesel engine is being cranked over the starting air is admitted to each cylinder during the beginning of its __________.

Response 3: at the end of the power stroke
Response 4: at the start of the intake stroke

Question: In a medium-speed marine propulsion engine equipped with direct admission air starting valves the cylinders without air starting valves fire first because the __________.
Response 2: fuel is admitted only to these cylinders during cranking
Response 3: compression is released during starting by opening the exhaust valve
Response 4: cylinders are not chilled by the expansion of the starting air

Question: An eight cylinder air started two-stroke/cycle direct reversing marine diesel engine can be rotated from any crankshaft position by the air start system only if it has __________.
Response 1: each upper cylinder head equipped with reversible air start valves
Response 2: a minimum of five cylinders equipped with air start valves
Response 3: at least four cylinders equipped with air start valves
Response 4: the cylinders on opposite ends equipped with air start valves

Question: The air start timing in the system shown in the illustration can be advanced by __________. See illustration MO-0046.
Air motors used for starting some auxiliary diesel engines are generally the type known as a/an __________.
Air motors used for starting some auxiliary diesel engines are generally designed as __________.
Which internal combustion engine starting system uses a vane type fluid motor?
The diesel engine starting motor shown in the illustration is driven by __________. See illustration MO-0044.
In addition to the main starting air compressor another air compressor driven by a separate power source is installed to __________.
Response 3: supply a backup source of starting air
Response 4: supply the independent source of reversing air

Question: The starting air supply for a diesel engine is generally produced by a/an __________.
Where is the air charge for an air starting system stored?
Intercoolers installed on starting air compressors reduce the possibility of __________.
Intercoolers installed on starting air compressors reduce the possibility of __________.
The purpose of an intercooler installed on a high pressure starting air compressor is to _______.
Response 1: reduce the inlet air suction pressure drop
Response 2: absorb the heat of compression in the air charge formed in the first stage
Response 3: assist in cooling the first stage cylinder walls

Question: A two-stroke/cycle diesel engine requires less starting air than a four-stroke/cycle diesel engine of equal displacement because the two-stroke/cycle diesel engine __________.
Response 1: has little or no internal friction
Response 2: has a lower effective compression ratio
Response 3: operates with scavenge air under a positive pressure
Response 4: operates without energy absorbing intake and exhaust strokes

Question: The illustration is of a/an __________. See illustration MO-0044.
Response 1: power take-off driven vane type air compressor
Response 2: battery powered electric motor driven vane type hydraulic pump

Question: In the illustration pieces #31 and #29 have 16 and 55 teeth respectively. In order to start the engine the Bendix drive must turn 3000 RPM. Therefore the air motor assembly must rotate at __________. See illustration MO-0044.

Response 1: prevent damage to the air line lubricator

Response 4: increase the air charge density to the motor

Question: Which of the listed items should be secured before performing any maintenance on a solenoid operated air start valve?
Response 2: Lube oil standby pump and control air
Response 3: Hydraulic switch and engage jacking gear
Response 4: Motor drain and pneumatic control system power

Question: Which of the listed items should be secured before performing any maintenance on a solenoid operated air start valve?
Which of the following problems can occur if you continually fail to drain off condensate from a starting air receiver?
Response 1: Corrosion and eventual failure of the tank.
Response 2: Gumming of the tank relief valves.
Response 3: Immediate failure of components downstream of the compressed air system.
Response 4: Boiling of the water oil mixture as pressure is reduced.

Question: Which of the following problems can occur if accumulating condensate is not drained off from a starting air receiver?
Response 1: Internal corrosion and eventual failure of the tank.
Response 2: Gumming of the tank relief valves.
Response 4: Boiling of the water oil mixture as pressure is reduced.

Question: On a diesel engine with direct-cylinder admission air starting a leaking air starting valve would be indicated by __________.
Response 1: an overheated starting air supply pipe
Response 2: excessive smoke from the engine exhaust
Response 3: carbon deposit on the exhaust valves

Question: In an operating diesel engine which of the following conditions is an indication of a leaking air starting valve?
Response 1: Noise coming from that air starting valve.
Response 2: Continuous operation of the starting air compressor.
Response 3: Zero air pressure in the air starting system.
Response 4: Overheated starting air pipe to the cylinder head.

Question: Improper seating of an air starting check valve in an operating diesel engine is indicated by __________.
Response 1: noise coming from the air starting valve
Response 2: an overheated air supply pipe to the cylinder head
Response 3: continuous operation of the starting air compressor
Response 4: zero air pressure in the air starting system

Question: A pilot-operated main air starting valve begins leaking in one cylinder while the engine is operating. This malfunction is indicated by __________.
Response 1: an increase in the exhaust temperature reading for that cylinder
Response 2: an increase in the starting air manifold pressure
Response 4: an overheated air supply line to that cylinder

Question: On a diesel engine using a distributor type air starting system that is not running which of the following methods may be used to detect leaking air starting valves?
Response 1: Open the cylinder test cocks and check for blowing air.
Response 2: Check the position of the air start valve cams.
Response 3: Stop the air compressor and check for pressure drop throughout the system.
Response 4: Feel each air supply line to see which is warm from leaking air.

Question: Two air compressors are provided for the starting air system and should be capable of __________.
Response 1: charging the starting air containers within one hour
Response 2: providing the minimum quantity of starting air at all times
Response 3: supplying all the air necessary to start both the main engine and an auxiliary at the same time
Response 4: topping off all receivers at the required design pressures

Question: Air receivers installed in starting air systems are to be __________.
Response 1: cylindrical in shape with service connections located at the top and bottom
Response 2: opened and made available for inspection during biannual inspections
Response 3: provided with automatic drain traps for the removal of moisture
Response 4: so installed as to make the drain connections effective under extreme conditions of trim

Question: Each receiver in a starting air system which can be isolated from a relief valve __________.
Response 1: is to be provided with a suitable fusible plug to relieve the pressure in case of fire
Response 2: will incorporate the use of an automatic unloading device
Response 3: will not be approved for classification purposes
Response 4: and satisfy U.S.C.G. regulations shall be approved

Question: Vessels having main engines arranged for air starting are to be provided with at least __________.
Response 1: one automatic drain serving both containers
Response 2: two air starting containers of approximately equal size
Response 3: one control air container and one starting air container
Response 4: one additional means of starting the main engine

Question: The total starting air capacity required for reversible main engines is to be sufficient for a least __________.
