Response 1: to provide for intermittent starting procedures
Response 2: for continued operation of these systems after capacity for the required number of consecutive starts has been used
Response 3: to provide a nonreversible engine a minimum of twelve consecutive starts
Response 4: to enable six consecutive starts of a reversible engine

Question: What may be used to protect starting air mains against explosions arising from improperly functioning starting valves?
Response 1: The starting air main shall be protected by the use of a rupture disc.
Response 2: No protection is necessary because all starting air valves are designed similar to check valves.
Response 3: An isolation non-return valve is to be installed at the starting air supply connection to each engine.
Response 4: The materials used in the construction of the starting air mains will contain any explosion.

Question: Where engine bores exceed 230 mm a bursting disc or flame arrester is to be fitted __________.
Response 1: at the supply inlet to the control air manifold for non- reversing engines
Response 2: on the exhaust manifold prior to the inlet of the turbochargers
Response 3: on all devices subject to the by-products of combustion or lubrication system vapors
Response 4: in way of the starting valve of each cylinder for direct reversing engines having a main starting manifold

Question: Where engine bores exceed 230 mm a bursting disc or flame arrestor is fitted __________.
Response 1: at the supply inlet to the starting air manifold for non-reversing engines
Response 2: on the exhaust manifold prior to the inlet of the turbocharger
Response 3: on all devices subject to the by-products of combustion or lubrication system vapors
Response 4: in way of the control valve of each cylinder for direct reversing engines having a main starting manifold

Question: The illustration is of a/an ______. See illustration MO-0044.
Response 2: power take-off driven vane type air compressor
Response 4: battery powered electric motor driven vane type hydraulic pump

Question: Fluid type starting motors used for starting auxiliary diesel engines may either be of the piston type or the __________.

Question: The device used to store a charged pressure for an hydraulic starting system is called the __________.

Response 1: Reservoir "A" maintains pressure on the accumulator "E".
Response 2: The right end of the accumulator "E" is charged with nitrogen.
Response 3: This system cannot operate at temperatures below 32F.

Question: The accumulator shown in the illustration is pressurized by __________. See illustration MO-0049.

Response 1: hydraulic starters are the least expensive of all starting systems
Response 2: the system does not require high pressure piping
Response 3: hydraulic systems turn diesel engines at higher rates of speed than air starters
Response 4: the system can be manually recharged

Question: Which type of starter motor is normally used in a diesel engine hydraulic starting system?

Response 1: the immediate increase in hydraulic pressure
Response 4: the pivoting of the shaft from being engaged with the flywheel

Question: The purpose of the engine-driven hydraulic pump in an auxiliary diesel engine hydraulic starting system is to __________.
Response 1: restore hydraulic pressure in the accumulator after starting
Response 2: engage the starter motor with the flywheel
Response 3: fill the sump and prevent low level in the system
Response 4: bypass the hydraulic motor when the engine is running

Question: Before any auxiliary diesel engine hydraulic starting system is opened for servicing or repair you must __________.
Response 1: place all control levers in the 'HOLD' position
Response 2: ensure that the hydraulic fluid reservoir is full
Response 3: block all hydraulic hoses using high pressure covers
Response 4: bleed off all hydraulic pressure from the system

Question: The starter control valve in the hydraulic system shown in the illustration is malfunctioning. Before removing the valve you must first __________. See illustration MO-0049.
Response 2: remove all plugs from the system
Response 3: bleed off all accumulator pressure in "E"
Response 4: ensure that the accumulator piston is in the charged position

Question: If a hydraulic starting motor turns but the diesel engine does not the most likely cause is __________.
Response 1: excessive viscosity in the hydraulic fluid

Question: If a diesel engine hydraulic starting motor fails to disengage from the engine your FIRST check should be the __________.

Response 1: have a viscosity index number greater than 100
Response 2: have a flash point of not greater than 200F
Response 3: have a flash point of not less than 315F

Question: An auxiliary diesel engine may fail to start due to __________.

The pinion of an auxiliary diesel electric starting motor normally engages the flywheel ring gear by means of a/an __________.

Response 1: require a generator as a source of power
Response 2: will carry a 100% overload for a brief period
Response 3: require a current/voltage regulator for proper operation
Response 4: will overheat if operated continuously over 10 seconds

Question: Electric starting motors for small auxiliary diesel engines require high current for operation and __________.
Response 1: require a generator as a source of power
Response 3: require a current/voltage regulator for proper operation
Response 4: will carry a 100% overload for a brief period

Question: Electric starting motors for diesel engines require high current for their operation. As a result of this they __________.
Response 1: have a generator as a source of power
Response 2: need a current-voltage regulator for proper operation
Response 3: are designed as shunt type DC motors
Response 4: will carry a 100% overload for a brief period

Question: Auxiliary diesel engine electric starting motors use __________.
Response 3: low amperage high voltage AC power

Question: Diesel engine electric starting motors generally require heavier duty motors and operate at higher voltages than comparable starting motors for gasoline engines due to __________.
Which of the following conditions is most likely to occur if the electric starter motor pinion gear fails to disengage from the flywheel of a diesel engine after the engine has started?
Response 3: Starting motor will dangerously over speed
Response 4: Combustion gases will enter the air starting system

Question: A diesel engine electric starting motor is operated under a no-load condition. Continuing to operate the motor unloaded will __________.

Question: The illustrated diesel engine starting motor initially disengages the drive/clutch mechanism from the engine flywheel once the engine has started by __________. See illustration MO-0051.

Response 3: the mechanical interaction between the overrunning clutch and the splined sleeve
Response 4: centripetal force exerted by the rotating armature

Question: The diesel engine starting motor returns the drive/clutch mechanism to the position illustrated by __________. See illustration MO-0051.
Response 1: reversing the direction of the starting motor
Response 2: the higher peripheral speed of the flywheel
Response 3: the potential energy of spring "D" once the solenoid has been de-energized
Response 4: mechanical interaction of the left hand thread and the energy imparted by the rotation of the over-running clutch

Question: The illustrated starting motor disengages the drive/clutch mechanism after the engine has started due to __________. See illustration MO-0051.
Response 1: a centrifugal switch in the commutator
Response 2: the potential retraction energy of the armature
Response 3: the mechanical interaction between the overrunning clutch and the splined sleeve
Response 4: centripetal force exerted by the rotating armature

Question: The device used to engage a diesel engine starting motor with the flywheel ring gear is the __________. See illustration MO-0051.
The Bendix drive on the starting motor illustrated is indicated by piece number __________. See illustration MO-0044.
Marine auxiliary diesel engine starters utilizing Bendix drive gear are powered by an electric starting motor or __________.
The diesel engine starting motor shown in the illustration utilizes which of the following types of drive/clutch mechanisms? See illustration MO-0051.
An air starting motor for a diesel engine is protected from over speeding by __________.
In the overrunning clutch shown in the illustration if "A" was rotating faster than "B" the clutch is considered to be __________. See illustration MO-0034.
In a Bendix starter drive the pinion engagement with the flywheel ring gear is initiated by __________.

Response 1: shifting levers of solid mechanical linkage
Response 2: the shaft sleeve spiral helix and relative rotation between pinion and starter shaft
Response 4: electromotive force developed at the flywheel

Question: Which of the following operating characteristics of the Bendix drive friction clutch is associated with a Bendix drive starter?
Response 1: Helps absorb the shock when the pinion engages the flywheel ring gear.
Response 2: Disengages the pinion from the flywheel ring gear.
Response 3: Engages the pinion with the air start distributor.
Response 4: Prevents the pinion starter from overrunning on the starter shaft.

Question: In some Bendix drive electric starting systems the sudden shock of the pinion gear being engaged with the flywheel is absorbed by the __________.
Response 2: pinion when it engages the ring gear

Question: A bendix drive starting motor disengages the drive gear from the flywheel by __________.
Response 3: having the flywheel impart a torque to the starter pinion

Question: After an engine has been started using a Bendix drive unit the drive pinion disengages from the flywheel due to __________.
Response 3: the flywheel applying torque to the starter motor drive pinion

Question: If the diesel engine starter-drive mechanism fails to disengage after the engine starts which of the following situations will occur?
Response 2: The starter motor will have reverse current.
Response 3: The engine flywheel will be burred.
Response 4: The starter motor will over speed.

Question: Starting a large propulsion diesel engine using diesel fuel during cold weather conditions can be made easier by __________.
Response 1: increasing the quantity of starting air

Question: Starting a large low-speed propulsion diesel engine on diesel fuel during cold weather conditions will be made easier by __________.
Response 1: increasing the quantity of starting air

Question: Diesel engine starting difficulties due to cold intake air temperatures can be overcome by using a/an __________.
When starting a diesel engine at temperatures below 70F the frictional resistance to turning will be __________.
Response 1: reduced by increasing lube oil pressure
Response 2: controlled by reducing the compression ratio
Response 3: proportional to the lube oil viscosity
Response 4: eliminated by heating the intake air

Question: Cold weather starting of a diesel engine is more difficult than warm weather starting due to __________.
Response 1: use of low viscosity oil in cold weather
Response 2: increased moisture content of inlet air in cold weather
Response 3: increased drag of pistons and bearings due to increased oil viscosity
Response 4: higher compression pressures reached due to smaller clearances existing in the engine during cold weather

Question: Which of the listed diesel engine starting systems is most susceptible to difficulties in cold weather?
Which of the following effects will excessively cold lube oil have on the operation of a diesel engine?
Response 1: The engine will crank slowly and may fail to start.
Response 2: The engine will over speed when started.
Response 3: The fuel oil supply will become diluted resulting in rough running.
Response 4: The cooling system will overheat causing the engine to stall.

Question: An electric heater built into some smaller diesel engines is used to __________.
Response 1: raise lube oil viscosity for easier starting in cold weather
Response 4: increase jacket water temperature for easier starting in cold weather

Question: Which of the following precautions must be taken if an electric immersion heater is used to keep the coolant warm in a diesel engine when the engine is secured?
Response 1: The coolant temperature must be maintained at 180F.
Response 2: The thermostatic bypass valves must be manually opened before the engine is started.
Response 3: The pressure cap must be removed while the engine is secured.
Response 4: Electrical power to the heater must be secured if the cooling system is to be drained.

Question: With respect to diesel fuel the ease with which a cold engine will start is dependent upon the __________.
Response 2: high heating value of the fuel
Response 3: amount of carbon residue after combustion
Response 4: internal flow resistance in the injectors

Question: Starting aids such as glow plugs are usually installed on __________.
Response 2: diesel engines designed to burn residual fuels
Response 4: small diesel engines with electric motor starters

Question: Starting aids such as glow plugs are installed on __________.
Response 2: diesel engines designed to burn residual fuels
Response 4: small diesel engines utilizing electric starting equipment

Question: Which of the listed devices is the only method allowed by Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) to ease the starting of emergency generator engines?
Response 2: Steam or hot water lube oil heating.
Response 3: Thermostatically controlled electric water jacket heating.
Response 4: Electric resistance heaters in the air intake manifold.

Question: Cold weather starting of a diesel engine may be made easier by __________.
Response 2: using a special fuel having a high ignition temperature

Question: When inspecting pistons liners and rings of a large two-stroke/cycle diesel engine through the cylinder ports a wet piston crown would indicate a __________.
Which of the conditions listed could cause the cylinder relief valves on a large low-speed propulsion diesel engine to lift?
The most practical way of detecting an overload in one cylinder of an operating large low-speed main propulsion diesel engine is to __________.
Response 1: check the cylinder exhausts for black smoke
Response 2: listen for combustion knock in that cylinder
Response 3: isolate each cylinder and inspect the injector
Response 4: check the cylinder exhaust temperature frequently

Question: An indication of an overloaded main propulsion diesel engine is __________.
Which operating condition of a diesel engine is indicated by excessive firing pressures?
If it becomes necessary to cutout an individual cylinder of a large low-speed main propulsion diesel engine the fuel to that cylinder should be secured and its __________.
Response 1: fuel pump should be removed and all connections blanked off

Question: Which of the following procedures should be carried out when a large low-speed diesel engine is operated with one cylinder secured?

Question: If an auxiliary diesel engine will not crank but can be barred over the trouble may be in the __________.

Response 4: low oil level in the engine governor

Question: A sudden drop in compression pressure in one cylinder of a diesel engine can be caused by __________.

Response 1: carbon deposits on the piston crown

Question: The loss of the diesel engine cylinder air charge through leaky valves piston rings worn or scored liners would be indicated by which of the following sets of conditions?
Response 1: Low compression pressure and high exhaust temperature
Response 2: Low firing pressure and high mean effective pressure
Response 3: Low compression pressure and low exhaust temperature
Response 4: Low firing pressure and low exhaust temperature

Question: A drop in compression pressure in one cylinder of a diesel engine can be caused by __________.

Question: An increase in diesel engine crankcase pressure generally indicates excessive __________.

A 18 cylinder medium speed direct reversible main propulsion diesel engine is being operated with one cylinder secured. Response 2: Increase starting air pressure by small amounts until the air pressure is high enough to crank the engine over.

Response 4: Open the indicator cocks on those cylinders on compression and apply increased starting air pressure.

Question: If an auxiliary diesel engine equipped with an electric starting system cranks very slowly after repeated attempts to start the cause could be a/an __________.

Response 3: air bubbles in the fuel oil system

Response 1: a loose valve stem and guide

Question: If a diesel engine continues to run after attempting to shut it down the probable cause is __________.

Question: A large low speed main propulsion diesel engine may become overloaded by_______________.

Response 1: block the flow of air supply to the engine

Question: A normally operating diesel engine is shutdown by __________.

Response 4: To let the waste heat boiler reduce it's rate of steam generation.

Question: Before starting a diesel engine you should always __________.

Question: Which of the following precautions should be taken when troubleshooting various power circuits using an electronic voltage tester?
Response 1: Never use this tester on circuits of 60 Hz as the tester may not register the voltage.
Response 2: Always remember that the unit is polarity sensitive and if used on DC circuits reversing the leads may result in high temperatures within the tester.
Response 3: Never connect the device to circuits where potentials are greater than 120 volts.
Response 4: Always check a known power source of the same type and voltage before using it to troubleshoot electrical equipment.

Question: Which of the following precautions should be taken when troubleshooting various power circuits using an electronic solenoid type voltage tester?
Response 1: Never use this tester on circuits of 60 Hz as the tester may not register the voltage.
Response 2: Always remember that the unit is polarity sensitive and if used on DC circuits reversing the leads may result in high temperatures within the tester.
Response 3: Never connect the device to circuits where potentials are greater than 120 volts.

Question: Before working on an electric cargo winch master switch or controller what should be done?
Response 1: spray the gasket surface with a solvent

Question: In order to safely carry out repairs to a generator circuit breaker it must be isolated from the bus. How is this accomplished?
Response 3: opening the generator bus fuse connections

Question: When replacing fuses what practice should be observed?

Response 2: to use insulated pliers or screwdriver
Response 3: the fuse clips are straight tight and in good contact
Response 4: to increase the fuse rating 10% to guard against 'nuisance blowing'

Question: When working on a high voltage circuit you should always have another person present with you. What other knowledge is essential?
Response 1: working knowledge of the circuit being worked on and all means of isolation and grounding
Response 2: detailed knowledge of insulation dielectric strengths associated with the circuit being worked on
Response 3: working knowledge of the conductor ampacities associated with the circuit being worked on
Response 4: detailed knowledge of the insulation voltage ratings associated with circuit being worked on

Question: When working on electrical circuits containing large capacitors in addition to de-energizing the circuit which of the listed precautions should also be taken?
Response 3: Discharge the capacitor through a 50000 ohm resistor.

Question: When maintenance personnel are working on electrical equipment all supply switches should be secured in the open position and tagged. Who specifically should perform the lock-out/tag-out procedure?
Before touching a small capacitor connected to a de-energized circuit or even one that is completely disconnected you should do what FIRST?
Response 1: gently tap the body with a screwdriver
Response 2: tag it with a de-energized tag
Response 3: be equipped with an insulated fuse puller
Response 4: short circuit the terminals to make sure that the capacitor is discharged

Question: As shown in figure "A" of the illustration under what conditions is the test proving unit used in conjunction with the high voltage probe? See illustration EL-0158.
Response 1: before using the probe each time for detecting the presence of and verifying the absence of voltage only
Response 2: after using the probe each time for detecting the presence of and verifying the absence of voltage only
Response 3: before and after using the probe each time for detecting the presence of and verifying the absence of voltage only
Response 4: whenever it is suspected that the probe is not accurately detecting the presence of voltage

Question: As shown in figure "B" of the illustration after the high voltage circuit has been properly de-energized and isolated and tested for the absence of voltage what is the proper sequence for grounding high voltage motor terminals prior to commencing work? See illustration EL-0158.
Response 1: the motor terminal connections to the common ground connection should be made first and the common hull ground connection to the common ground connection should be made last
Response 2: the common hull ground connection to the common ground connection should be made first and the motor terminal connections to the common ground connection should be made last
Response 3: the common hull ground and the motor terminal connections should all be made to the common ground connection simultaneously
Response 4: the common hull ground and the motor terminal connections can be made to the common ground connection in any sequence

Question: As shown in figure "B" of the illustration what is the proper sequence for disconnecting the ground straps after completion of work on the high voltage motor? See illustration EL-0158.
Response 1: the motor terminal connections from the common ground connection should be disconnected first and the common hull ground connection from the common ground connection should be disconnected last
Response 2: the common hull ground connection from the common ground connection should be disconnected first and the motor terminal connections from the common ground connection should be disconnected last
Response 3: the common hull ground and the motor terminal connections should all be disconnected from the common ground connection simultaneously
Response 4: the common hull ground and the motor terminal connections can be disconnected from the common ground connection in any sequence

Question: Intrinsically safe equipment can be described as __________.
Response 1: an electrical circuit in which a spark is incapable of causing the ignition of a given explosive mixture
Response 4: an electrical circuit normally limited to instrumentation in hazardous areas

Question: At a minimum threshold how many milliamps of current through the body produces a painful sensation that most people would perceive as an electric shock?

At a minimum threshold how many milliamps of current through the body produces a condition where most people would be unable to let go of the energized electrical conductor due to involuntary muscular contraction?

At a minimum threshold how many milliamps of current through the body produces a condition where most people would experience respiratory paralysis and be unable to breathe while still in contact with the energized conductor?

At a minimum threshold how many milliamps of current through the body produces a condition where most people would suffer ventricular fibrillation and could only be resuscitated with a ventricular defibrillator?

With all other factors considered equal (such as voltage conducting path through the body and the duration of contact) contact with an energized electrical system conductor of which system type would produce the most damaging effect?
Response 4: All the above systems would be equally as damaging

Question: Before electrical work can be safely undertaken the equipment must be de-energized locked and tagged out and verification must be made that the circuit is actually dead. What testing device is most certain to reliably verify that a circuit is actually dead?
Which of the following devices would be forbidden to use as a primary means of electrical isolation?
Which of the following voltage testers would be associated with high quality be safe to use and minimize the electric shock hazard?
Response 1: a voltage tester with a low input voltage and a lower voltage rating than any expected measured voltage
Response 2: a voltage tester with a high input impedance and a voltage rating higher than any expected measured voltages
Response 3: a voltage tester with a low input impedance and a higher voltage rating than any expected measured voltages
Response 4: a voltage tester with a high input impedance and a lower voltage rating than any expected measured voltages

Question: What is the primary means by which an electrical maintenance worker is protected from electrical hazards while performing work on an electrical circuit?
Response 1: using the appropriate personal protective equipment

Question: After prior isolation and lockout/tagout procedures are performed which electrical device requires discharging any stored electrical energy before any work may safely begin?
Before work may safely commence on a high voltage system what must first be done after disconnection and isolation?
Response 1: The circuit must be grounded first then tested and proved dead with a live-line tester.
Response 2: The circuit must be grounded first then tested and proved dead with an off-line tester.
Response 3: The circuit must be tested and proved dead first with an off-line tester then grounded.
Response 4: The circuit must be tested and proved dead first with a live-line tester then grounded.

Question: In order for a live-line tester to be used to test and prove dead a high voltage circuit what must be done to verify the ability of the tester to detect a voltage?
Response 1: The live-line tester need not be checked prior to testing the circuit to be worked upon as long as it has not been declared inoperative.
Response 2: The live-line tester should be checked by connecting to a known high voltage source before and after the circuit to be worked upon is tested.
Response 3: The live-line tester should be checked by connecting to a known high voltage source only before testing the circuit to be worked upon.
Response 4: The live-line tester should be checked by connecting to a known high voltage source only after testing the circuit to be worked upon.

Question: What is the primary means by which an electrical maintenance worker is protected from electrical hazards while performing work on an electrical circuit?
Response 2: using the appropriate personal protective equipment

Question: Which of the following voltage testers would be associated with high quality be safe to use and minimize the electric shock hazard?
Response 1: a voltage tester with a high input impedance and a voltage rating higher than any expected measured voltages
Response 2: a voltage tester with a low input impedance and a higher voltage rating than any expected measured voltages
Response 3: a voltage tester with a low input voltage and a lower voltage rating than any expected measured voltage
Response 4: a voltage tester with a high input impedance and a lower voltage rating than any expected measured voltages

Question: Which of the following devices would be forbidden to use as a primary means of electrical isolation?

With all other factors considered equal (such as voltage conducting path through the body and the duration of contact) contact with an energized electrical system conductor of which system type would produce the most damaging effect?
Response 4: All the above systems would be equally as damaging

Question: At a minimum threshold how many milliamps of current through the body produces a condition where most people would suffer ventricular fibrillation and could only be resuscitated with a ventricular defibrillator?

At a minimum threshold how many milliamps of current through the body produces a condition where most people would experience respiratory paralysis and be unable to breathe while still in contact with the energized conductor?

At a minimum threshold how many milliamps of current through the body produces a condition where most people would be unable to let go of the energized electrical conductor due to involuntary muscular contraction?
After prior isolation and lockout/tagout procedures are performed which electrical device requires discharging any stored electrical energy before any work may safely begin?
At a minimum threshold how many milliamps of current through the body produces a painful sensation that most people would perceive as an electric shock?
Before work may safely commence on a high voltage system what must first be done after disconnection and isolation?
Response 1: The circuit must be grounded first then tested and proved dead with an off-line tester.
Response 2: The circuit must be grounded first then tested and proved dead with a live-line tester.
Response 3: The circuit must be tested and proved dead first with a live-line tester then grounded.
Response 4: The circuit must be tested and proved dead first with an off-line tester then grounded.

Question: In order for a live-line tester to be used to test and prove dead a high voltage circuit what must be done to verify the ability of the tester to detect a voltage?
Response 1: The live-line tester should be checked by connecting to a known high voltage source only before testing the circuit to be worked upon.
Response 2: The live-line tester need not be checked prior to testing the circuit to be worked upon as long as it has not been declared inoperative.
Response 3: The live-line tester should be checked by connecting to a known high voltage source before and after the circuit to be worked upon is tested.
Response 4: The live-line tester should be checked by connecting to a known high voltage source only after testing the circuit to be worked upon.

Question: What is the minimum threshold voltage at which the skin offers no appreciable resistance to electrical current flow and is known as the "skin-puncture voltage"?
Which activity or event accounts for the most electrical accidents resulting in injury?
Why should an electrical worker determine the nominal voltage of a circuit first before making contact with the circuit?
Response 1: So the worker can select the proper voltage tester to use before contact with the circuit is made.
Response 2: So the worker can select the proper PPE and voltage tester to use before contact with the circuit is made.
Response 3: So the worker can select the proper PPE to use before contact with the circuit is made.
Response 4: As long as the circuit is properly tagged/locked out no determination of the nominal voltage is necessary.

Question: When taking voltage measurements for reasons of electrical safety what should be the proper sequence of actions?
Response 1: When taking voltage measurements the sequence of steps is not critical as long as PPE is worn and a voltage tester is used. Voltage measurements can be taken with confidence.
Response 2: First measure the actual voltage. Next select the proper PPE and voltage tester to use based on this measured voltage. Finally take voltage measurements with confidence.
Response 3: First determine the nominal voltage from the nameplate. Next select the proper PPE and voltage tester to use based on this nameplate voltage. Finally take voltage measurements with confidence.
Response 4: First measure the actual voltage. Next select the proper voltage tester to use based on this measured voltage. Finally take voltage measurements with confidence.

Question: When performing an absence-of-voltage test before commencing repair work at the minimum where must the absence-of-voltage test be performed?
Response 1: At the main feeder circuit breaker
Response 2: At the point of contact where the work will take place
Response 4: At the source disconnect branch circuit breaker

Question: When performing an absence-of-voltage test a live-dead-live test may be required in conjunction with the absence-of-voltage test. What is the purpose of the live-dead-live test?
Response 1: The live-dead-live test proves the functional ability of the voltage tester to measure voltage prior to and after conducting the absence-of-voltage test which validates the results of the absence-of-voltage test.
Response 2: The live-dead-live test proves the functional ability of the voltage tester to measure voltage after conducting the absence-of-voltage test which validates the results of the absenceof- voltage test.
Response 3: The live-dead-live test proves the functional ability of the voltage tester to measure voltage prior to conducting the absence-of-voltage test which validates the results of the absence-ofvoltage test.
Response 4: The absence-of-voltage test proves the functional ability of the voltage tester to measure voltage prior to and after conducting the live-dead-live test which validates the results of the livedead- live test.

Question: What statement is true concerning temporary protective grounds used to establish an equipotential zone for the purposes of eliminating the electric shock hazard?
Response 1: A shock hazard exists only when there is a difference in potential between conductors.
Response 2: A shock hazard exists only when there is a difference in potential between a conductor and hull ground.
Response 3: A shock hazard exists when there is no difference in potential between conductors or a conductor and hull ground.
Response 4: A shock hazard exists when there is a difference in potential between conductors or a conductor and hull ground.

Question: RC time constant characteristics as shown in the illustration are important in which of the following applications? See illustration EL-0086.

Referring to figure "B" of the illustration what statement is true? See illustration EL-0020.
Response 1: The current drawn by the circuit will be inversely proportional to the total resistance of the entire circuit.
Response 2: If the resistance values of the individual resistors are uniquely different each resistor will have a uniquely different current draw.
Response 3: The current drawn by the circuit will be directly proportional to the total resistance of the entire circuit.
Response 4: The current drawn by an individual resistor will be proportional to the resistance of that resistor.

Question: Referring to figure "B" of the illustration what statement is true? See illustration EL-0020.
Response 1: The order of resistors connected in the series string has no impact on the total resistance. The total resistance of the circuit will be less than any one of the individual resistances.
Response 2: The order of resistors connected in the series string has an impact on the total resistance. If the largest resistance is last in the circuit the total resistance will be more than if it is not.
Response 3: The order of resistors connected in the series string has no impact on the total resistance. The sum of the resistances is the total resistance of the circuit.
Response 4: The order of resistors connected in the series string has an impact on the total resistance. If the largest resistance is first in the circuit the total resistance will be more than if it is not.

Question: What would be the voltage drop across the series string of the circuit shown in figure "A" of the illustration if the source voltage is 30 volts the resistance for R1 is 10 ohms the resistance for R2 is 10 ohms and the resistance for R3 is 10 ohms? See illustration EL-0032.

In referring to figure "E" of the illustration what statement is true concerning the functional purpose of the coupling transformer? See illustration EL-0075.
Response 1: The transformer functions as a filter by removing the DC component from the varying DC input to produce an AC output shifted 90o from the input.
Response 2: The transformer functions as a filter by removing the DC component from the varying DC input to produce an AC output in phase with the input.
Response 3: The transformer functions as a voltage transformer by changing the magnitude of the peak to peak AC voltage at the output proportional to the turns ratio.
Response 4: The transformer functions as a filter by removing the DC component from the varying DC input to produce an AC output shifted 180 from the input.

Question: In referring to figure "F" of the illustration what statement is true concerning the functional purpose of the RC coupling? See illustration EL-0075.
Response 1: The RC coupling functions as a filter by removing the DC component from the varying DC input to produce an AC output shifted 90from the input.
Response 2: The RC coupling functions as a filter by removing the DC component from the varying DC input to produce an AC output shifted 180 from the input.
Response 3: The RC coupling functions as a filter by removing the DC component from the varying DC input to produce an AC output in phase with the input.
Response 4: The RC coupling functions as a voltage transformer by changing the magnitude of the peak to peak AC voltage at the output proportional to the RC time constant.

Question: Which figure represents the schematic symbol shown in figure "2"? See illustration EL-0034.

Response 1: Multiply the amperage in one phase by three.
Response 2: Divide the total amperage in all phases by three.
Response 3: Multiply the amperage in one phase by the square root of three.
Response 4: Divide the total amperage in all phases by the square root of three.

Question: What statement is true concerning the total power consumed in a series circuit?
Response 1: Total power is the sum of the powers consumed by each load divided by the number of loads
Response 2: Total power is the sum of the powers consumed by each load
Response 3: Total power is always less than the power consumed by the smallest load
Response 4: Total power is never more than the power consumed by the largest load

Question: Which statement is true concerning the total power consumed in a parallel circuit?
Response 1: The total power is the sum of the powers consumed by each load (resistor) divided by the number of loads.
Response 2: The total power is always less than the power consumed by the smallest load.
Response 3: The total power is equal to the sum of the powers consumed by each individual load.
Response 4: The total power is never more than the power consumed by the largest load.

Question: Which of the following precautions should be observed when adding treatment chemicals to the boiler compound tank?
Response 1: Cool the feed water before it enters the tank.
Response 2: Ensure there is no pressure on the tank before opening it.
Response 3: Raise the boiler water level before adding chemicals.

Question: Treatment of boiler feed water for the control of hardness is necessary to prevent __________.
In a marine boiler maximum heat transfer rates can be obtained by __________.
Response 1: maintaining the recommended boiler water pH
Response 2: treating the boiler water with oxygen scavenging chemicals
Response 3: maintaining feed water temperature of 212F in the economizer
Response 4: keeping the watersides free from scale deposits

Question: Chemicals are added to boiler water to __________.
Response 1: eliminate the need for blow downs
Response 2: stabilize feed water if a boiler becomes salted up
Response 4: maintain an acidic condition in the feed water

Question: One of the purposes of chemically treating boiler water is to __________.
What is the purpose of chemically treating boiler water?
Response 1: To reduce formation of scale on the waterside of the boiler.
Response 2: To reduce to a minimum corrosion of boiler metal.
Response 3: To reduce foaming and moisture carryover.

Question: An adequate phosphate reserve should be maintained in boiler water to __________.
Excessive foaming in a steaming boiler can cause damage to the __________.
Foaming in boiler water is caused by __________.
Foaming in a boiler can be caused by __________.
The concentration of total dissolved solids in the boiler water can increase as a result of __________.
In a steaming boiler most dissolved chlorides tend to concentrate at or near the __________.
In a steaming boiler most dissolved chlorides tend to concentrate at or near the __________.
The major reason dissolved gases are removed from boiler feed water is because they may cause __________.
Response 4: vapor lock in the feed pumps

Question: To minimize metal corrosion boiler water is best kept __________.
Excessive alkalinity of boiler water will cause ________.
Response 4: sodium sulfite reacting with dissolved oxygen

Question: Dissolved oxygen entrained in the feed water entering a boiler can cause __________.
In a water-tube boiler waterside scale formation is caused by __________.
Scale formation on the waterside of boiler tubes is generally produced by __________.
Response 1: the salts of calcium and magnesium
Response 4: accumulations of phosphates in the feed water

Question: Failure to remove calcium and magnesium from feed water before it reaches the boiler can result in tube __________.
Boiler water hardness is increased by __________.
Response 2: scale forming salts in the feed water
Response 4: improper operation of the DC heater

Question: Carbon dioxide dissolved in boiler water is dangerous in a modern power boiler because the gas __________.
Response 1: forms carbonic acid which attacks the watersides
Response 2: breaks the magnetic iron oxide film inside boiler tubes
Response 3: combines with sulfates to cause severe waterside pitting
Response 4: combines with oxygen to cause severe waterside scaling

Question: The two most common causes of boiler corrosion attributable to boiler water are dissolved oxygen and __________.
The two common chemicals which are the primary cause of internal boiler corrosion are _______.
A sudden increase in boiler water hardness or chloride content could indicate __________.
Response 3: bilge water leaking into the makeup feed tanks

Question: Why are hard scale deposits on the inside of boiler tubes most objectionable?
Response 1: Flow of water within the tube is restricted.
Response 2: Poor heat transfer due to hard scale deposits overheats tubes.
Response 3: The metal of the tube interior is eaten away by scale.
Response 4: Hydroxyl ions liberated by the scaling process form acid in the boiler water.

Question: Excessive priming in a propulsion boiler can cause severe damage to the_________.
Oxygen corrosion in auxiliary boilers is prevented by treating the boiler feed tank with __________.
The bottom blow valve on a water-tube boiler is usually attached to the __________.
The purpose of the boiler bottom blow valve is to __________.
Response 1: remove scum from the steam drum during steaming
Response 2: control steam drum water level in an emergency
Response 3: remove heavy solids from the water drum

Question: The guarding valve installed in a boiler bottom blow line prevents __________.
Response 1: loss of steam and water from a steaming boiler due to a leaking bottom blow valve
Response 2: leakage from the blow line back to an idle boiler
Response 3: entry of seawater into idle boilers due to leaking skin and bottom blow valves

Question: The bottom blow valve should be used to remove sludge and solids which have settled out of circulation after the boiler __________.
Response 4: is being brought up to steaming pressure

Question: Before giving a boiler a bottom blow it should be taken off the line and then the __________.
Response 1: water level initially lowered below normal
Response 2: boiler steam pressure should be increased
Response 3: water level initially raise above normal
Response 4: boiler air cock should be cracked

Question: When is the best time to give a boiler a bottom blow?
Response 1: Just before placing it on the line.
Response 2: Just after placing it on the line.
Response 3: Just after taking it off the line.
Response 4: When the boiler pressure has dropped to zero.

Question: If it becomes necessary to remove water from a pressurized main boiler it should be directed __________.
Response 2: overboard through the bottom blow line

Question: Which of the precautions listed should be taken prior to blowing down a boiler water wall header?
Response 1: Relieve the pressure and cool down the boiler.
Response 2: Raise the water level above the surface blow.
Response 3: Take the boiler out of service.
Response 4: Reduce the firing rate of the boiler to its minimum.

Question: If a boiler is being steamed at a high firing rate blowing down a water wall header without taking any other precaution could result in __________.
Response 1: excessive strain on boiler blow down lines
Response 2: erratic operation of the automatic feed water regulating valve
Response 3: load imbalance between other boilers on the line

Question: Blowing down a water wall header while steaming a boiler at a high firing rate could result in __________.
Response 1: excessive strain on boiler blow down lines
Response 2: the thermo-hydraulic feed water regulator valve slamming closed
Response 3: a load imbalance between other boilers on the line
Response 4: an interruption in the water circulation

Question: Under what operating conditions may water wall header drains be used for blow down?
Response 1: Only if the fires are secured and no steam is being generated.
Response 2: During periods of carryover in the steam drum.
Response 3: When the water level is out of sight in the gage glass.
Response 4: When it is necessary for rapid drainage of the boiler.

Question: The proper way to quickly reduce high water level in a steaming boiler is to use the __________.
To safely reduce a high water level in a steaming boiler you should __________.
Before giving a boiler a surface blow you should __________.
Response 1: raise the water level 2 or 3 inches above normal
Response 2: lower the water level to the normal level
Response 3: reduce the boiler firing rate to the minimum
Response 4: take the boiler off the line and let it cool 1 hour

Question: Before commencing a surface blow the boiler __________.
Response 2: water level should be lowered to the surface blow line
Response 3: water drum should be checked for sludge
Response 4: water level should be raised 2 to 3 inches (5 to 7.6 cm) above normal

Question: Before giving a boiler a surface blow you must __________.
Response 1: open the skin valve on the blow down line
Response 2: secure the fires in the furnace
Response 3: lower the water level to a half glass
Response 4: increase the boiler steam pressure above normal

Question: Before giving a boiler a surface blow when underway at sea you should __________.
Response 1: raise the water level 2 or 3 inches above normal
Response 2: lower the water level 2 to 3 inches below normal
Response 3: increase forced draft air pressure to maximum
Response 4: temporarily secure all burners on that boiler

Question: Proper use of the boiler surface blow will __________.
Response 2: remove floating impurities from boiler water
Response 3: disrupt circulation in a steaming boiler
Response 4: have no effect on boiler alkalinity

Question: Which of the listed methods can be used to blow down a boiler without securing the fires?
Response 2: Bottom blow from the mud drum.
Response 3: Blow down the rear water wall header.
Response 4: Blow down the front water wall header.

Question: A continuous blow is used to __________.
Response 1: regulate the density or salinity of boiler water
Response 2: remove scum from the surface of boiler water
Response 3: permit air to escape while raising steam in a cold boiler
Response 4: remove sludge from the bottom of the water drum

Question: Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) state that main propulsion water-tube boilers are not required to be fitted with a surface blow off valve if the design pressure is __________.
Most marine main boilers are designed to produce __________.
In a water-tube boiler sludge is most likely to collect in the __________.
When the boiler is operating at high firing rates in addition to the generating tubes which of the following tubes will also function as generating tubes?
Response 2: Superheater support water screen and water wall tubes
Response 3: Water screen superheater support and economizer tubes
Response 4: Water wall water screen and economizer tubes

Question: When conducting a routine hydrostatic test on a water-tube boiler you should __________.
Response 1: raise the temperature of the boiler water to 180F
Response 2: apply hydrostatic pressure equal to the maximum allowable working pressure of the boiler
Response 3: have gags installed on all safety valves

Question: When a propulsion boiler is removed from service for an extended period why should the firesides be thoroughly dried after water washing?
Response 4: Reduce the possibility of thermal spalling.

Question: Maximum heat transfer rates in a marine boiler can be obtained by __________.
Response 1: maintaining the recommended boiler water pH
Response 2: treating the boiler water with oxygen scavenging chemicals
Response 3: maintaining the feed water temperature of 212F
Response 4: keeping the watersides free from scale deposits

Question: Which of the listed mediums should be used when water washing a boiler?
Which of the listed mediums should be used when water washing a boiler?
Which procedure should be followed to dry out the fireside of a boiler after water washing?
Response 1: Place trays of silica gel in the furnace.
Response 2: Alternately fire one burner for 15 minute intervals during a 5 hour period.
Response 3: Open the furnace registers and run the forced draft fans for 3 hours.
Response 4: Use a wire reinforced steam hose to put superheated steam in the furnace for 6 hours.

Question: When water washing a boiler the proper sequence for washing the sections should be the __________.
Response 1: generating tubes superheater and then economizer
Response 2: superheater economizer and then generating tubes
Response 3: screen tubes generating tubes and then superheater
Response 4: economizer superheater generating and then screen tubes

Question: When water washing the firesides of a boiler which of the listed procedures should be followed?
Response 1: Begin water washing while the brickwork is still warm.
Response 2: Begin the washing above the economizer and work down.
Response 3: Assure that the water stream impinges directly on the refractory to avoid tube damage.
Response 4: Dry the boiler by firing all burners at high rates to evaporate moisture rapidly.

Question: Improper water washing of the water-tube boiler firesides can cause __________.
Response 4: loss of ductility in boiler tubes

Question: The most important consideration to take into account when water washing the firesides of a water tube boiler is ________.
Response 1: the corrosive effects of sulfuric acid
Response 3: possible damage to the outer casing
Response 4: possible damage to the smoke periscope

Question: When cleaning the waterside of boiler tubes with a powered rotary brush the brush should kept in motion to __________.
Which of the listed operating practices is considered as safe and should be followed when opening and inspecting the waterside of a boiler?
Response 1: Open the water drum manhole before opening the steam drum manhole.
Response 2: Wire all valves closed that connect to other boilers.
Response 3: Remove hand hole plate dogs with a slugging wrench.
Response 4: Ventilate the waterside until completely dry.

Question: Which type of waterside deposits can normally be removed by chemically boiling out a boiler?
An accumulation of slag build up on the boiler furnace floor will cause __________.
Which of the following conditions in a water-tube boiler generating tube could cause tube failure even if the water gage glass shows the proper level?
One boiler of a two boiler plant has ruptured a tube and the water cannot be maintained in sight in the gage glass. After securing the fires your next action should be to __________.
Response 2: stop the fuel oil service pump
Response 3: secure the feed water supply to the boiler

Question: If a tube failure results from low water level and you cannot maintain water in sight in the gage glass you should __________.
Response 1: immediately secure the forced draft fans
Response 2: increase the feed pump speed to maximum
Response 3: immediately secure the fuel oil supply to the burners
Response 4: blow down the gage glass to verify a low water condition

Question: If a large number of tubes has failed you can minimize damage to a boiler by __________.
Response 1: securing the fires steam stops and relieving boiler pressure
Response 2: securing the fires feed stops and leaving the boiler cut on the line
Response 3: increasing the feed water supply to keep the boiler cool
Response 4: speeding up the forced draft fans to blow steam up the stack

Question: The boiler water level begins to fall very slowly due to the sudden failure of a water wall tube. In response to this situation you should continue the feed water supply and immediately __________.
Response 1: reduce the firing rate of the boiler
Response 3: secure the fires and secure the feed water when the level falls out of sight in the gage glass
Response 4: gag the drum safety valves to prevent loss of steam

Question: Which of the following actions should be carried out if the boiler water level is falling due to a tube failure?
Response 1: Secure the fires and try to maintain the water level.
Response 2: Speed up the feed pump to keep the water level up while firing the boiler.
Response 3: Open the auxiliary feed stop and check for extra feed.
Response 4: Start the standby feed pump and feed the boiler using two feed pumps.

Question: If a large number of tubes fail in a steaming boiler the __________.
Steam escaping from the boiler casing is a good indication of __________.
Response 4: all of the above are individually correct

Question: When the rate of heat transfer through tube walls is so reduced that the metal becomes overheated which of the following conditions will result in the boiler?
Boiler tube failures can result from __________.
Oil or scale deposits on boiler tube walls will cause __________.
If a boiler tube bank baffle carries away or burns through there will be __________.
Response 2: localized overheating of the water drum
Response 3: excessive gas turbulence in the furnace

Question: One factor for determining the minimum feed water inlet temperature to a boiler economizer is the __________.
Response 1: dew point temperature of the stack gases
Response 3: temperature of steam bled off the LP turbine

Question: While underway at sea the feed water inlet temperature to a boiler economizer is determined by the __________.
Response 1: dew point temperature of the stack gases
Response 3: temperature of the HP turbine bleed

Question: Gasket leakage around boiler hand holes may be caused by __________.
If while filling the boiler a newly installed gasket on a water-tube hand hole plate weeps you should __________.
Response 2: retighten the stud nut with an air wrench
Response 4: center and tighten with correct size wrench

Question: If manual control of the water level in a steaming boiler is required the proper method of control is with the auxiliary feed __________.
If a feed pump failure causes the boiler water to drop out of sight in the gage glass the engineer should FIRST __________.
Response 1: secure the fires steam stops and then add water
Response 2: secure the fires reduce steam load and start standby feed pump
Response 3: reduce the steaming rate and then cool the boiler with the force draft fan
Response 4: reduce the steaming rate and then add water

Question: After the main engine has reached full sea speed which of the following conditions could cause the water level in the boiler steam drum to keep falling?
Response 1: Open cutout valves on the boiler gage glasses.
Response 2: Condensate recirculating line is excessively open.
Response 3: Feed pump discharge pressure is set too low.
Response 4: Feed pump recirculating valve is closed.

Question: In order to test the lifting pressure of the deaerating feed heater relief valve you would __________.
46 CFR requires that __________.
Response 1: the OCMI be notified of repairs to boilers and unfired pressure vessels
Response 2: the fuel burned in boilers of tankships shall have a flash point of not less than 140F
Response 3: a half-pint sample of each load of fuel be drawn and sealed at the time of supply and preserved until that fuel is exhausted

Question: According to 46 CFR Parts 59 and 35 which of the following is true?
Response 1: The OCMI must be notified of emergency repairs to boilers and unfired pressure vessels.
Response 2: The fuel burned in boilers of tankships shall have a flash point of not less than 120F.
Response 3: A one gallon sample of each load of fuel oil shall be drawn and sealed at the time of supply and preserved until that fuel is exhausted.

Question: Which of the following actions should be taken FIRST when the boiler fires begin to sputter due to water in the fuel oil?
Response 1: Shift to the settler high suction valve.
Response 2: Shift to the settler low suction valve.
Response 3: Shift to the standby fuel oil heater.
Response 4: Shift to the standby fuel oil pump.

Question: If one burner of a group of operating steam atomizing burners in a steaming boiler is cut out the register doors for that burner should be __________.
When forced draft blowers are provided with high and low speed controls it is advisable to run the blowers at high speed during maneuvering to __________.
Response 1: keep the forced draft discharge dampers open wide
Response 2: permit full maneuvering capability without the necessity of changing blower speed
Response 4: ensure that all burners will remain ignited at low load

Question: When manually firing a main propulsion boiler an increase in boiler load should be accompanied by a/an _______.
Response 1: increase in the fuel oil flow before an increase in the forced draft pressure
Response 2: decrease in the forced draft air pressure before a decrease in the fuel oil flow
Response 3: increase in the forced draft air pressure before an increase in the fuel oil flow
Response 4: increase or a decrease in the fuel oil flow and forced draft air pressure simultaneously

Question: Which of the actions listed should be carried out immediately after securing the fires in one boiler of a two boiler ship?
Response 1: Relieve all fuel oil service pressure to that boiler.
Response 2: Open the air registers wide to cool the furnace.
Response 3: Drain and refill the boiler with cold water.

Question: Which of the following statements about boilers is correct?
Response 1: A hot boiler will continue to generate steam after the fires are secured.
Response 2: No boiler will continue to generate steam after the fires are secured.
Response 3: The water level in a properly operated boiler will not shrink or swell.
Response 4: Loss of water will not harm a boiler if the water level can be restored.

Question: A boiler is to be secured in port. After the burners have been secured the forced draft fan and air registers should be secured __________.
Response 1: immediately after carrying out the former procedures
Response 2: after any oil on the furnace floor has been burned off and cleared of combustion gases
Response 3: after 30 minutes has elapsed after carrying out these procedures
Response 4: after at least 1 hour has elapsed after carrying out these securing procedures

Question: When a boiler has been secured and is being initially cooled the water level showing in the steam drum gage glass should be __________.
Response 4: allowed to go out of sight

Question: The steam drum air cock is normally opened when cooling down a boiler to __________.
Response 1: relieve any residual air pressure in the drum
Response 2: prevent a vacuum forming in the steam drum
Response 3: reduce the pressure in the drum more rapidly

Question: If a boiler is brought on the line with its steam pressure much higher than that of the boiler already on the line there is danger of __________.
When raising steam on a cold boiler under normal conditions you should always __________.
Response 1: raise steam within one hour or less
Response 3: use a small orifice burner sprayer plate to start
Response 4: use a large orifice burner sprayer plate to start

Question: The time taken to raise steam on a cold boiler should always be __________.
Response 1: the time specified by the boiler manufacturer
Response 2: not less than a full 24 hour
Response 4: as short as possible to avoid over expansion

Question: When raising steam on an idle boiler and the steam pressure has risen to about 5 pounds more than the pressure of the boiler already on the line you can __________.
Response 3: put the boiler on the line

Question: When preparing to cut a boiler in on the line you determine that the steam pressure of the incoming boiler is about 5 psig above line pressure. Which of the following steps should you take next?
Prior to lighting a burner in a cold boiler you should __________.
Which of the following precautions should be taken prior to lighting off a boiler?
Response 1: Secure the main steam line drains.
Response 4: Purge the furnace of combustible gases.

Question: Why should a boiler furnace be purged before the first burner is lit off?
Response 1: To control air pressure in the windbox.
Response 2: To ensure a proper fuel to air ratio.
Response 3: To clear the furnace of any explosive gases.
Response 4: To make the fires easier to light.

Question: The possibility of a flareback in a boiler will be reduced if you __________.
Response 1: rotate the soot blower elements one complete revolution prior to lighting off
Response 2: maintain the fuel oil to the burner at the flash point
Response 3: supply a minimum of excess air
Response 4: purge the furnace with fresh air prior to lighting off

Question: Before lighting any burner in a cold boiler you should always __________.
If the fires to a steaming boiler have been accidently extinguished you should not relight any burner until __________.
Response 1: all burning embers in the furnace are extinguished
Response 2: the furnace refractory has cooled below ignition temperature
Response 3: the boiler furnace has been thoroughly purged
Response 4: all fuel has been recirculated from the burners

Question: Which normally closed valve would have to be at least partially open prior to actually lighting off a cold boiler as shown in the illustration? See illustration SG-0009.
When preparing to light off a cold boiler the fuel oil should be recirculated until it is __________.
Response 2: thoroughly cleaned by the fuel oil strainers

Question: When increasing the firing rate of a boiler which of the following should be carried out FIRST?
Response 1: Increasing of the forced draft air pressure.

Question: To safely increase the firing rate of a boiler you should always increase the forced draft pressure __________.
Response 3: by opening the burner register wider

Question: To safely decrease the boiler firing rate you should always reduce the fuel pressure __________.
Response 1: after reducing the forced draft pressure
Response 2: before reducing the forced draft pressure
Response 3: by opening the oil recirculating valve
Response 4: by opening the fuel pump relief valve

Question: Which of the following items should be checked each time the firing rate or forced draft pressure is adjusted?
The terms 'swell' and 'shrink' relate to a change in boiler water level which __________.
Response 1: results when the feed rate becomes erratic during maneuvering
Response 2: is due to steam bubbles below the surface occupying a smaller volume
Response 3: results from a change in steam flow or firing rate
Response 4: indicates a high chloride concentration in the boiler water

Question: The terms 'swell' and 'shrink' relate to a change in boiler water level which __________.
Response 1: results when the feed rate becomes erratic during maneuvering
Response 2: is due to the volumetric change in the size of the steam bubbles below the water surface
Response 3: result in a rapid change in fuel oil viscosity
Response 4: indicates a high chloride concentration in the boiler water

Question: The term 'shrink' relates to a change in boiler water level which __________.
Response 1: results when the feed rate becomes erratic during maneuvering
Response 2: is due to the steam bubbles below the surface occupying a smaller volume
Response 3: results in a rapid change of steam temperature
Response 4: indicates a high chloride concentration in the boiler water

Question: The term 'swell' relates to a change in boiler water level which __________.
Response 1: results when the feed rate becomes erratic during maneuvering
Response 2: is due to the steam bubbles below the surface occupying a larger volume
Response 3: is due to a rapid change of steam temperature during maneuvering operations
Response 4: indicates a high chloride concentration in the boiler water

Question: Which of the listed conditions causes shrinkage in boiler water levels?
Response 3: Sudden increase in feed water temperature

Question: The phenomenon called 'shrink' causes an apparent drop in the water level of a steaming boiler. This phenomenon is caused by a/an __________.
The effects of shrink and swell on boiler water levels can be minimized by __________.
Response 2: rapidly opening and closing the throttles during maneuvering
Response 3: avoiding rapid opening and closing of the throttles while answering bells
Response 4: installing an automatic single-element feed water regulator

Question: Which action should be taken if the water level in the boiler gage glass drops out of sight and the burners fail to secure automatically?
Boiler efficiency and its ability to absorb heat is limited by the need to __________.
Response 1: maintain an excess of CO during transient firing rates
Response 2: prevent excess air density at low load conditions
Response 3: protect the safety valves from excessive temperature
Response 4: maintain uptake gas temperature above the dew point

Question: A practical consideration to allow for when operating a boiler at low load with regard to heat absorption is the requirement to __________.
Response 1: maintain uptake gas temperature above the dew point
Response 3: protect the safety valves from excessive temperature

Question: Which of the problems listed will reduce boiler efficiency?
Response 3: Tolerating unacceptable levels of carbon monoxide in flue gas.

Question: Lower than normal steam pressure in an operating boiler may be caused by __________.
Response 1: a sudden drop in superheater outlet temperature
Response 3: a low water level in the steam drum

Question: If the water level cannot be seen in the lower part of the boiler gage glass which of the following actions must be carried out immediately?
Response 1: Increase the feed water going to the boiler.
Response 2: Check the DC heater water level.

Question: If the water level in a steaming boiler is dropping rapidly and cannot be kept at the normal level by standard practices you should __________.
Response 1: secure the fires and then secure the steam stop
Response 2: secure the steam stop and then secure the fires
Response 3: blow down the gauge glass to find the true water level
Response 4: speed up the feed pump to raise the water to normal

Question: If a vessel is steaming at a steady rate and the water level has dropped out of sight in the boiler gage glass the FIRST corrective action should be to __________.
Response 1: open the feed water bypass regulator
Response 2: blow down the boiler gauge glass

Question: Low steam pressure in a steaming boiler can be caused by __________.
If the water level in the boiler water gage glass is not in sight and the automatic feed water regulator is in the closed position the __________.
Response 1: safety valve should be lifted by hand

Question: If a tube failure results from low water level and the water level can not be maintained in sight in the gage glass you should __________.
Response 1: immediately secure the forced draft fans
Response 2: increase the feed pump speed to maximum
Response 3: immediately secure the fuel oil supply to the burners
Response 4: blow down the gage glass to verify a low water condition

Question: If the water level in one boiler of a two boiler plant rapidly falls out of sight which of the following actions should be carried out FIRST?
Response 1: Secure the fuel oil to that boiler.
Response 4: Secure the steam stop to that boiler.

Question: Your vessel is steaming full ahead and operating on both boilers. If the boiler water level of one boiler drops out of sight low in the sight glass and the burners have been secured besides slowing down the main engine what further action should be taken?
Response 2: manually feed the boiler to bring up the level

Question: The fireman/water tender secures the fires because there is no visible water level in the gage glasses of a steaming boiler. Upon inspection you observe condensate trickling down the inside of the gage glass. This indicates __________.
Response 4: steam binding of the feed water regulating valve sensing line from the top of the steam drum

Question: The water level in a steaming boiler has risen to within 2 inches of the top of the top gage glass. Your immediate action should be to __________.
Response 1: secure the fires and open the bottom blow valve
Response 2: reduce the feed water flow to the boiler
Response 3: secure the feed water flow to the boiler

Question: After restoring the normal water level in a boiler following a high water casualty you should __________.
Response 1: immediately put the boiler on the line
Response 3: blow down the water gage glass

Question: Vibration or panting of a boiler can be caused by __________.
Response 2: poor mixing of air and oil

Question: Pulsating boiler furnace fires can be caused by __________.
If a steaming boiler is not supplied with sufficient air for proper combustion the __________.
Panting or rumbling in a boiler furnace is usually caused by __________.
Panting in an oil fired marine boiler can be caused by __________.
If a steaming boiler begins 'panting' the probable cause is __________.
Response 1: too much air for proper combustion

Question: If a boiler begins to pant and vibrate you should __________.
Response 1: check the fuel oil service pumps

Question: Which actions listed should be taken if a boiler is panting?
Response 1: Decrease the air pressure to the burners.
Response 2: Increase the air pressure to the burners.

Question: If a boiler is panting which of the following actions should be taken?
Response 1: Decrease the air pressure to the burners.
Response 2: Increase the air pressure to the burners.

Question: When a boiler flareback occurs you should __________.
Response 1: reduce the forced draft blower speed
Response 2: close the master fuel oil valve
Response 3: take the boiler off the line
Response 4: increase the fuel oil supply pressure

Question: If a boiler fire is blown out by a flareback you should immediately __________.
Response 1: increase the forced draft blower speed
Response 2: start the standby fuel oil pump
Response 3: secure the fuel supply to the boiler burners
Response 4: relight the fires with a torch

Question: If a major flareback occurs to a boiler which of the following actions should be immediately taken?
Response 2: Secure the fuel to the burners.

Question: An explosion or flareback could occur in a boiler if __________.
Response 1: too much excess air were supplied for combustion
Response 2: the boiler firing rate exceeded the end point of circulation
Response 3: the fuel being burned had been heated to the flash point
Response 4: the firebox is not purged before attempting to light a fire

Question: If an oil fire occurs in the double casing of a steaming boiler you should __________.
Response 1: increase the forced draft fan speed
Response 2: secure the feed water supply to the boiler
Response 3: secure the fuel oil supply to the burners
Response 4: apply water with a smooth bore nozzle

Question: If an oil fire occurs in the double casing of a steaming boiler you should __________.
Response 1: increase the forced draft fan speed
Response 2: immediately secure the feed water supply to the boiler
Response 3: secure the fires and air supply and activate the steam smothering system
Response 4: apply water with a smooth bore nozzle

Question: Under normal firing rates which of the conditions listed could result in a low superheater outlet temperature?
If the boiler fires are extinguished by water contamination in the fuel oil you should FIRST __________.
Response 3: reduce the load on the boiler

Question: Water in the fuel supply to a steaming boiler can be detected by __________.
Response 1: observation of the fuel oil heater drains
Response 4: dense white smoke being observed in the periscope

Question: If the fires in a boiler furnace begin sputtering or hissing you should suspect __________.
Response 1: excessive fuel pressure at the burners
Response 4: water contamination of the fuel oil

Question: When sputtering is detected in the boiler fires indicating water in the fuel which of the procedures listed should be followed?
Response 1: Start the standby fuel service pump.
Response 2: Increase the fuel service pump speed.
Response 3: Increase the furnace air supply pressure.
Response 4: Shift to the settler high suction.

Question: When boiler fires begin sputtering indicating water in the fuel oil settling tank you should __________.
Response 1: start the alternate fuel oil service pump
Response 2: shift to the service pump low suction
Response 3: change suction to the alternate settling tank
Response 4: reduce the fuel pump operating speed

Question: When the fires begin to sputter you should __________.
Response 3: take suction from another settling tank

Question: If the fires in both boilers start to sputter you should immediately __________.
Response 1: shift feed suction to the double bottom
Response 2: speed up the fuel oil pump

Question: If the fires start sputtering while steaming under steady conditions which of the actions listed should be taken?
Response 1: Start the standby fuel oil service pump.
Response 3: Shift over to another fuel strainer.
Response 4: Shift suction to another settling tank.

Question: When slight sputtering is detected at the boiler atomizer you should __________.
Response 1: check for water in the fuel supply
Response 3: shut off the oil supply and purge the furnace
Response 4: close burner register shutters and increase fuel oil service pump speed

Question: Which of the listed absorbing agents could be used in a boiler during a dry lay up period?
A water-tube boiler can be laid up either wet or dry. If it is to be laid up wet you should __________.
Response 1: completely fill the boiler with water then blow down to steaming level
Response 2: completely fill the boiler with deaerated feed water and maintain a slight pressure
Response 3: drain and refill the boiler each week
Response 4: drain and refill the boiler when the pH goes above 6

Question: If boiler priming occurs you should immediately __________.
Response 2: reduce speed and open throttle drains
Response 3: lift the safety valves with the hand easing gear
Response 4: open the boiler bottom blow valve

Question: In a boiler equipped with an automatic feed water regulator erratic variations in the water level could be caused by __________.
Response 1: high solids content and foaming in the drum
Response 2: ruptured feed water control valve diaphragm

Question: If boiler water chemicals are decreasing in one boiler and increasing in the other boiler while both are steaming at normal rates a leak probably exists in the __________.
While standing your engine room watch at sea you notice the D.C. heater level is gradually dropping as indicated by the remote level indicator. Which of the following actions should you take?
Response 1: Do nothing as this is a common marine plant occurrence.
Response 2: Immediately open the automatic make-up feed bypass valve.
Response 3: Check the condensate level in both the main and auxiliary condenser hot wells.

Question: While standing your engine room watch at sea you notice the D.C. heater level dropping below the normal minimum level as indicated by the remote level indicator. Which of the following actions should be taken?
Response 2: Do nothing in particular as this is a common occurrence with steam propulsion plants.
Response 3: It is only necessary to immediately open the automatic make-up feed bypass valve.
Response 4: Open the make-up feed valve bypass valve and check the condenser and make-up feed tank levels immediately.

Question: While standing your engine room watch at sea you notice the D.C. heater level is dropping below normal as indicated by the remote level indicator. The boiler drum level is observed to be normal as is the main condensate pump discharge pressure. Therefore you should __________.
Response 3: reduce the feed water level set point
Response 4: open the make-up feed bypass valve

Question: When standing watch at sea steaming full ahead reducing the boiler forced draft pressure would also have a tendency to correct which discrepancy?
While standing watch at sea and steaming full ahead reducing the boiler forced draft pressure would also have a tendency to correct which discrepancy?
When standing watch at sea steaming full ahead reducing the boiler forced draft pressure would also have a tendency to correct which discrepancy?
When standing watch at sea steaming full ahead reducing the boiler forced draft pressure would also have a tendency to correct which discrepancy?
Response 3: White smoke coming out from the stack.

Question: An accumulation test is performed on the boiler to determine the suitability of the safety valves and the set points __________.
When using the universal color contrast-type dye penetrant to examine a boiler weldment any surface defect will appear __________.
Response 3: white against a dull red background
Response 4: bright red against a white background

Question: Should one boiler on a two boiler vessel suffer serious tube damage the Officer-in-Charge Marine Inspection may issue a permit (Form CG-948) to proceed to another port for repair __________.
Response 1: only if the vessel's Certificate of Inspection is valid and has not expired
Response 2: as long as no cargo or passengers are being carried
Response 3: only upon written application of the master owner or agent of the vessel

Question: In accordance with Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) the maximum allowable working pressure of a water-tube boiler must be stamped on the __________.
Which of the following statements is true concerning boiler inspections?
Response 1: The marine inspector may require any boiler to be drilled to determine its actual thickness any time its safety is in doubt.
