Response 2: At the first inspection for certification after a water-tube boiler has been installed for ten years it shall be gauged by drilling to determine the actual extent of deterioration.
Response 3: If the thickness found as a result of gauging is less than original thickness the boiler must be condemned.
Response 4: Any user of a nondestructive testing device must demonstrate that results with an accuracy of plus or minus one percent are consistently obtainable.

Question: Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) state that a marine inspector may require a boiler to be drilled or gaged to determine actual thickness __________.
Response 1: at the first inspection for certification
Response 3: at any time its safety is in doubt
Response 4: when boiler drum thickness has decreased by 5%

Question: According to Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) the studs and bolts on marine boiler mountings must be removed for examination at least every __________.
When conducting a periodic hydrostatic test of a boiler Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR Part 61) prohibit __________.
Response 2: removing the safety valves in order to perform the hydrostatic test
Response 3: a test pressure of less than 1 1/2 times the maximum allowable working pressure if testing a water-tube boiler
Response 4: the auxiliary stop valve from simultaneously having hydrostatic pressure on one side of the valve and steam pressure on the other side

Question: To comply with Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) which type of boiler listed shall be subjected to a hydrostatic test at one and one half times maximum allowable working pressure?
Response 1: All water-tube boilers once a year.
Response 2: All water-tube boilers once every 4 years.
Response 3: All water-tube boilers to which extensive repairs have been made.
Response 4: All fire-tube boilers once every 2 years.

Question: According to Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) periodic hydrostatic tests are required to be conducted without exception on all __________.
According to Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) what is the maximum time interval for hydrostatically testing boilers on a cargo vessel having water-tube boilers?

The maximum allowable working pressure of a particular boiler is 1050 psig (7340 kPa). The hydrostatic test pressure to be used during the Coast Guard required quadrennial inspection will be __________.
According to U. S. Coast Regulations (46 CFR) water-tube boilers shall be hydrostatically tested on passenger vessels every __________.
When preparing to hydrostatically test water-tube boilers you should __________.
Response 1: fill the boiler with water not less than 70F (21.1C) nor more than 160F (71.1C)
Response 2: make arrangements for simultaneously testing main and auxiliary steam stops with water and steam pressure
Response 3: remove all inspection plates and manhole covers as required by the marine inspector
Response 4: have the boiler warmed to a temperature not exceeding 100F (37.8C)

Question: When preparing water-tube boilers for hydrostatic testing they shall be filled with water at not __________.
Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require that in preparing a water-tube boiler for a hydrostatic test you should fill the boiler with water at a temperature of not less than __________.
According to Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) what action should be taken if the metal thickness of a marine boiler is found to be thinner than original specifications?
Response 1: Affected areas should be built up by welding.
Response 3: Drum should be renewed before the next biennial inspection.

Question: According to Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) which of the following steam piping conditions subjected to main boiler pressure is exempted from hydrostatic testing?
Response 1: All piping with a nominal size of 3 inches or less.
Response 2: All piping from the main steam stop to the throttle valve.
Response 3: All piping to the ship's service generators.
Response 4: All piping equipped with a safety or relief valve.

Question: Which of the Coast Guard publications listed contain the information regarding allowable repairs to boilers installed on cargo vessels?
Response 1: Rules and Regulations for Cargo and Miscellaneous Vessels

Question: Which of the items listed is required by Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR Part 54) to be stamped on a pressure vessel?

A periodic hydrostatic test is being performed on an oil-fired auxiliary water-tube boiler with a maximum allowable working pressure of 150 psig. In accordance with 46 CFR 61 what is the required hydrostatic test pressure for this procedure?
If a boiler is being prepared for a hydrostatic test as part of a periodic inspection in accordance with 46 CFR 61 which statement is true?
Response 1: Water-tube boilers should be filled with water from 70F to 160F and fire-tube boilers should be filled with water from 70F to 100F.
Response 2: Fire-tube boilers should be filled with water from 60F to 170F and water-tube boilers should be filled with water from 60F to 100F.
Response 3: Fire-tube boilers should be filled with water from 70F to 160F and water-tube boilers should be filled with water from 70F to 100F.
Response 4: Water-tube boilers should be filled with water from 60F to 170F and fire-tube boilers should be filled with water from 60F to 100F.

Question: In accordance with 46 CFR 61 what is the interval in years between when boiler drum safety valves must be tested on a fire-tube boiler operating at less than 150 psig as witnessed by a marine inspector?
Assuming the inspection interval for a boiler as specified by 46 CFR 61 is 2.5 years which statement is true?
Response 1: Two tests are required over a 5 year period and no more than 2 years can elapse between any test or inspection and its immediate predecessor.
Response 2: Three tests are required over a 5 year period and no more than 1 year can elapse between any test or inspection and its immediate predecessor.
Response 3: Three tests are required over a 5 year period and no more than 2 years can elapse between any test or inspection and its immediate predecessor.
Response 4: Two tests are required over a 5 year period and no more than 3 years can elapse between any test or inspection and its immediate predecessor.

Question: According to the Code of Federal Regulations (46 CFR) for General Cargo Vessels what determines the maximum allowable pressure that can be carried in a steam boiler?
Response 1: The hydrostatic test pressure of the boiler.
Response 2: The highest boiler safety valve setting.
Response 3: The maximum allowable working pressure stamped on the boiler nameplate.
Response 4: The maximum pressure specified by the certificate of inspection.

Question: Which of the figures illustrated correctly identifies the position the journal will assume in its bearing after it has attained operating speed? See illustration GS-0121.
A journal rotating in its bearing relies on hydrodynamic principles for lubrication. Under steady load conditions the journal rotating in the bearing will assume a position __________.
The relative position of the journal and bearing at operating speed is illustrated by figure __________. See illustration GS-0121.
Which of the figures illustrated correctly identifies the position of the journal while it is stopped? See illustration GS-0121.
Which of the figures illustrated correctly identifies the position of the journal shortly after it has begun to rotate? See illustration GS-0121.
The lubrication of a precision high speed bearing depends upon a system that produces __________.
Response 2: high detergent oil with pressure additives
Response 4: a minimum of 15 psi to all parts of the system

Question: If a continuous and steady flow of lube oil is provided which of the listed pressures represents the lowest supply pressure at which a small high-speed bearing can be safely lubricated?
Which of the listed types of bearings is an example of a half bearing?
The most practical method of determining the condition of a shaft bearing while the shaft is in operation is to __________.
Response 4: perform a carbon blot test on an oil sample from the bearing

Question: On a main propulsion turbine bearing the readings obtained with a bridge gage represent the __________.
Which of the devices listed can be used to determine bearing wear on a main propulsion turbine bearing?
A bridge gage is used to measure __________.
After one year of operating the bearing shown in the illustration the reading obtained at point "A" would always be equal to the __________. See illustration SE-0017.
Response 1: reading stamped on the gage only
Response 3: designed oil clearance plus the stamped bridge gage reading
Response 4: stamped bridge gage reading plus the bearing wear

Question: Reduction gear bearing bridge gage readings should be taken after __________.
Response 1: rotating the journal to the point of minimum oil clearance
Response 2: all bearing caps and all bearing halves are removed
Response 3: rotating the bearing shell so that the point of maximum bearing wear is directly at the bottom
Response 4: All of the above are correct.

Question: Bridge gage readings are to be taken on the bearing shown in the illustration. You would use the indicated 3 3/4"R to __________. See illustration SE-0017.
Response 4: measure the angle to bridge gauge

Question: To accurately measure the amount of wear on a high speed pinion journal bearing with a bridge gage you must __________.
Response 1: be sure that the area of greatest wear is at 90 to the measuring pin
Response 2: shift the journal to position the pinion off center in the bearing
Response 3: raise the journal to a height equal to the oil clearance
Response 4: roll the bearing shell until the wearing zone is at the bottom

Question: The original bridge gage reading for a reduction gear bearing was measured as .008 inches. A year later the bridge gage reading for the same bearing is .010 inches. This indicates __________.
Regarding the bearing shown in the illustration "X" represents the __________. See illustration SE-0017.
The maximum temperature rise of oil passing through any reduction gear set or bearing should not exceed __________.
The adjustable spherically seated self-aligning bearing housings used in main turbines are provided with oil deflector rings. The function of these rings is to __________.
Response 1: ensure efficient lubrication of the bearing
Response 2: prevent the leakage of main steam into the oil
Response 3: prevent the external leakage of oil out of the bearing housing
Response 4: direct the flow of oil through the bearing

Question: Which of the following types of bearing lubrication schemes can carry the highest unit loading?
The best indication that a bearing is being properly lubricated is by the __________.
Response 1: oil pressure at the lube oil pump discharge
Response 2: lube oil strainer condition during cleaning and inspection
Response 3: oil temperature indicated by the bearing thermometer
Response 4: oil temperature leaving the lube oil cooler

Question: Which of the following would cause the dowel or locking lip of a split-type precision insert main bearing to shear and allow the bearing to rotate with the journal?
Response 1: Unequal torque to any two adjacent bearing bolts
Response 4: Short periods of above normal operating speeds

Question: The following information was recorded after a recent L.P. turbine bearing installation. The bearing temperature was logged at the indicated time intervals as:
Hot running bearings can be caused by __________.
An overheated bearing in the main propulsion unit is indicated by __________.
Response 1: bubbles in the sight flow glasses
Response 2: sludge in the lube oil strainers
Response 3: high level in the lube oil sump
Response 4: high temperature of the lube oil leaving the bearing

Question: Which of the following types of bearings are used for the reduction gears in a marine steam turbine installation?
Babbitt is a metal alloy commonly used for lining __________.
Babbitt is a metal alloy commonly used for lining __________.
Main steam turbine bearings are lined with __________.
Babbitt metal is used to make __________.
In steam turbine main engine installations how are the main reduction gear bearings identical to other radial bearings?
Response 1: They are of the single casting type bearing.

Question: Chamfers located at the parting edges of horizontal split sleeve type bearings are used to facilitate oil storage and distribution. They are machined __________.
Response 1: radially the full length of the bearing
Response 2: axially the full length of the bearing
Response 3: radially to within 45 degrees of the normal bearing surface
Response 4: axially approaching but not extending to the end of the bearing

Question: Which of the following statements represents the reason why the Babbitt of a turbine journal bearing is relieved at the point of oil entry along the horizontal joint?
Response 1: To prevent oil from backing up in the supply line.
Response 2: To permit oil to discharge through the rear of the bearing.
Response 3: To prevent hydraulic pressure buildup when the journal rotates.
Response 4: To permit the rotor journal to draw oil around the shaft.

Question: Which of the following methods is used to securely fasten the Babbitt lining of a reduction gear bearing to its shell?
Response 1: The Babbitt is centrifugally spun into the bearings or cast under a pressure head.
Response 2: The Babbitt is relieved in way of the split and held in place by locking pins.
Response 3: The Babbitt is securely bonded to the shell by the pressure of the hydrodynamic oil wedge.
Response 4: The Babbitt has a crescent shaped pocket cast symmetrically about the bearing split.

Question: Journal bearings used with modern turbine rotors are manufactured in two halves in order to __________.
Response 1: permit removal of the bearing without removing the rotor from the turbine
Response 2: facilitate interchanging with other bearing halves
Response 3: maintain axial alignment and reduce thrust
Response 4: provide for positive oil flow at all loads

Question: Which of the following construction methods would apply to the Babbitt lined split-type reduction gear bearings?
Response 1: They are always mounted with the split in a horizontal plane.
Response 2: They are secured in their housing so pressure points will occur at the joint faces.
Response 3: They are split into four equal sized segments.
Response 4: They are rigidly mounted and dowelled in their housings.

Question: Which of the devices listed are used to rigidly mount reduction gear bearings in their housings?
Which of the journal bearings listed most easily accommodates the minor turbine shaft misalignment?
Which type of bearing lining material is most commonly used in modern precision split type bearings?
The splits located in the halves of main reduction gear bearings are aligned at an angle to the horizontal in order to resist __________.
A common cause of the Babbitt linings cracking in a turbine journal bearing is from ________.
If a turbine bearing high temperature alarm sounds you should immediately __________.
Rotor axial thrust developed in a reaction turbine is the result of a steam pressure drop across __________.
Response 4: both the moving and stationary blades

Question: For a large main propulsion turbine the most commonly used turbine thrust bearing is the __________.
Thrust bearings are installed in main propulsion turbines to __________.
Response 3: eliminate the need for dummy piston

Question: In order to reduce the oil clearance between the collar and the astern thrust element shown in the illustration you would __________. See illustration SE-0007.
Response 1: increase the thickness of the adjusting ring
Response 2: decrease the thickness of the adjusting ring
Response 3: increase the thickness of the filler piece
Response 4: decrease the thickness of the filler piece

Question: After setting the allowable end play of the thrust bearing shown you would establish the axial position of the turbine shaft by __________. See illustration SE-0007.
Response 1: increasing the thickness of the adjusting ring
Response 2: decreasing the thickness of the adjusting ring
Response 3: changing the thickness of the thrust collar
Response 4: changing the thickness of the filler piece

Question: The axial position of a turbine rotor is normally adjusted by varying the thickness of the __________.
The axial position of a turbine rotor is controlled by the thickness of the __________.
The thrust bearing wear on a turbine may be determined by checking the __________.
A rotor position micrometer on a main propulsion reaction turbine measures rotor __________.
Response 1: radial position relative to the casing
Response 2: radial position relative to the micrometer
Response 3: axial position relative to the casing
Response 4: axial position relative to the micrometer

Question: Thrust clearances indicated on a main propulsion turbine bearing clearance diagram are __________.
Response 1: normal clearances for operation under routine steaming conditions
Response 2: cold clearances to which the bearing was initially set
Response 3: minimum clearances that indicate when bearing renewal is necessary
Response 4: maximum clearances which should not be exceeded when the turbine is warmed up

Question: Sliding contact bearings are classified into two general categories: journal bearings and __________.
Which of the following types of bearings is designed to limit end movement and carry loads applied in the same direction as the shaft axis?
Which of the following bearings is designed to take loads applied to the axis of the shaft?
As found in a reduction gear drive system thrust bearings serve to __________.
Response 1: transmit the force produced by the propeller to the structure of the ship
Response 2: limit the radial movement of the shaft
Response 4: hold the main engine in place

Question: The purpose of a thrust bearing mounted between the engine and the propeller of a steam plant power train is to __________.
Response 2: transmit propeller thrust to the hull
Response 4: absorb gear thrust in double helical gears

Question: Which of the following statements describes the function of a ship's propulsion plant main reduction gear thrust bearing?
Response 1: Support the weight of the reduction gears.
Response 2: Absorb the transmitted power when radial thrust is developed.
Response 3: Absorb the axial thrust transmitted through the shaft from the propeller.
Response 4: To absorb only the thrust developed by the high pressure turbine.

Question: In a segmental pivoted-shoe thrust bearing the thrust load among the shoes is equalized by the __________.
Which of the features listed regarding the Kingsbury thrust bearing prevents the base ring from turning and secures it to its housing?
Response 3: A combination of pin and dowel

Question: Which component of a Kingsbury thrust bearing assembly transmits the thrust from the line shaft to the oil film and shoes?

Because the entire thrust bearing assembly is normally submerged in oil the pivoting shoe arrangement allows the formation of a continuous wedge shaped oil film shown in the illustration by arrow "B" between the __________. See illustration SE-0012.
The components in a Kingsbury thrust bearing assembly that are responsible for transmitting an equal thrust load to all the shoes are called the ______.
In the thrust bearing assembly illustrated the total oil clearance can be correctly decreased by __________. See illustration SE-0007.
Response 1: increasing the thickness of the adjusting ring
Response 2: increasing the thickness of the filler piece
Response 3: decreasing the thickness of the adjusting ring
Response 4: decreasing the thickness of the filler piece

Question: In the diagrammatic arrangement of the thrust bearing shown in the illustration the direction of shaft rotation and the direction of thrust are indicated respectively by arrows __________. See illustration SE-0012.
The base ring shown in the illustration is identified by the letter __________. See illustration SE-0012.
The disassembled thrust bearing shown in the illustration which of the listed parts is labeled "I"? See illustration SE-0014.

A Kingsbury or pivot shoe type thrust bearing can bear much greater loads per square inch of working surface than can parallel surface bearings because provisions are made in the Kingsbury bearing __________.
Response 1: for adjusting the filler piece thickness behind the pivotal-shoes to give a more accurate fit
Response 2: for automatically adjusting clearances to the correct value when wear occurs
Response 3: for the shoes to tilt slightly thereby allowing the formation of a wedge shaped oil film under a thrust load
Response 4: to allow the leveling plates to pivot on the collar when thrust loads are applied

Question: Which of the following enables a Kingsbury or any pivot shoe type thrust bearing to bear a much greater load per square inch of working surface than parallel surface bearings?
Response 1: The thickness of the filler piece behind the pivotal-shoes is adjusted to obtain a more accurate fit.
Response 2: Clearances are automatically adjusted to the correct value when wear occurs.
Response 3: The shoes tilt slightly thereby allowing the formation of a wedge shaped oil film under a thrust load.
Response 4: The shoes pivot thus remaining parallel with the collar when thrust loads are applied.

Question: Which of the following statements represents the principle of operation of the Kingsbury type thrust bearing?
Response 1: A flat film of oil is more readily formed and maintained than a wedge shaped oil film.
Response 2: A flat film of oil can carry heavier loads than a wedge shaped oil film.
Response 3: A wedge shaped film of oil absorbs less heat than a flat oil film.
Response 4: A wedge shaped film of oil is more readily formed and maintained than a flat oil film.

Question: Which of the listed parts of a Kingsbury thrust bearing tilts to permit the formation of a wedge shaped film of oil?
The Kingsbury bearing is equipped with pivoted shoes in order to __________.
In a Kingsbury thrust bearing the thrust shoes are __________.
Response 1: pivoted and the thrust collar turns with the shaft
Response 2: turned by the shaft and the thrust collar is stationary

Question: Kingsbury thrust bearings are lubricated by __________.
Response 1: flooding the thrust bearing assembly with oil
Response 2: submerging oil wiper rings in an oil bath
Response 4: spraying oil directly on the thrust collar and shoes

Question: Propeller shaft Kingsbury thrust bearings are normally lubricated by __________.
The upper leveling plates in a Kingsbury thrust bearing are held in place by __________.
Response 4: screw dowels in the base ring

Question: The base ring shown in the illustration is identified by the letter ______. See illustration SE-0012.
Superheated steam is provided to operate the main steam turbine instead of saturated steam due to its __________.
After the steam leaves the low pressure turbine it enters the __________.

A ship is equipped with the illustrated turbine gear set and a right hand turning propeller. When steam is admitted to the astern element with sternway on the high-speed gear on the high pressure side is__________. See illustration SE-0016.
Response 1: rotating the same direction as the low-speed pinion on the low pressure side.
Response 2: turning the same rotation of the high-speed pinion on the low pressure side.
Response 3: turning opposite to the rotation of the high-speed gear on the low pressure side.
Response 4: turning counter clockwise as viewed from the aft end of the reduction gear.

Question: A ship is equipped with the illustrated turbine gear set and a right hand turning propeller. When steam is admitted to the astern element with sternway on the high-speed gear on the high pressure side is__________. See illustration SE-0016.
Response 1: rotating in the opposite direction as the low-speed pinion on the low pressure side as viewed from the aft end of the reduction gear.
Response 2: turning clockwise as viewed from the forward end of the reduction gear.
Response 3: turning opposite to the rotation of the high-speed gear on the low pressure side.
Response 4: turning clockwise as viewed from the aft end of the reduction gear.

Question: A ship is equipped with the illustrated turbine gear set and a right hand turning propeller. When steam is admitted to the astern element with sternway on the high-speed pinion on the high pressure side is__________. See illustration SE-0016.
Response 1: rotating in the same direction as the low-speed pinion on the low pressure side.
Response 2: turning counter clockwise as viewed from the aft end of the reduction gear.
Response 3: turning the same direction as the high-speed gear on the low pressure side.
Response 4: turning the opposite direction as the low speed reduction gear.

Question: What is generally found at the end of the low pressure turbine rotor of a cross-compound turbine arrangement?
In a cross-compounded turbine propulsion plant steam enters the __________.
Response 1: high pressure intermediate and low pressure units simultaneously
Response 2: high pressure unit and then flows through a crossover to the low pressure unit
Response 3: high and low pressure units simultaneously
Response 4: high pressure unit and then cross-flows to the condenser

Question: The astern element of a main propulsion turbine is usually designed as a/an __________.
Which of the following methods is used to counter axial thrust in a single flow reaction turbine?
Response 1: A dummy piston and cylinder at the turbine inlet end
Response 2: Pressure equalizing holes in the individual rotor wheels

Question: The purpose of the reaction turbine dummy piston is to ________.
Response 1: counteract and balance axial thrust produced by the turbine rotor
Response 2: act in conjunction with gland seal steam to balance turbine thrust
Response 4: eliminate radial thrust caused by the pressure increases in the turbine stages

Question: In a multistage reaction turbine the dummy piston and cylinder function to __________.
Response 3: eliminate the pressure drop across the blades
Response 4: provide a means of measuring axial clearances

Question: The diameter of a dummy piston installed in a reaction turbine is determined by __________.
Response 1: rotor design and the amount of thrust to be counteracted
Response 3: the length and diameter of the equalizing line
Response 4: the volume of the exhaust trunk and pressure drop over the last stage

Question: Which of the parts listed for a reaction turbine serve the same function as the nozzles of an impulse turbine?
Which of the following reaction turbine components listed converts thermal energy into kinetic energy.
Which of the devices listed is used to convert thermal energy into rotor kinetic energy in a reaction turbine?
Which of the following reaction turbine components listed converts thermal energy into kinetic energy.
Where reaction turbine blading is fitted with shrouding of "end tightened" design which of the following operating parameters must be carefully monitored for efficient turbine operation?
Where reaction turbine blading is fitted with shrouding of "end tightened" design which of the following conditions will be the most critical to efficient turbine operation?
What happens to the steam as it moves across the moving blades in a reaction turbine?
Response 1: It gains velocity at constant pressure.
Response 2: It creates an axial thrust in the direction of the steam flow.
Response 3: It loses velocity at constant pressure.
Response 4: It creates an axial thrust opposing the direction of steam flow.

Question: Why do double flow reaction turbines produce very little axial thrust?
Response 1: Because there is no pressure drop across the blades.
Response 2: Because partially expanded steam is exhausted to the low pressure turbine where the expansion is completed.
Response 3: Because the axial thrust is developed on the rotor in opposite directions providing counterbalance.
Response 4: Because equalizing holes are provided in the turbine wheels.

Question: In a reaction turbine the fixed blades function to __________.
In modern reaction turbines thin tipping is a procedure designed to __________.
Leakage over the ends of the blade tips as a result of the pressure differential between each row of blades in a reaction turbine can be reduced with a blade design known as ________.
An increase in clearance between reaction blade tips and the turbine casing will result in __________.
Response 1: an increase in rotor thrust load
Response 2: an increased pressure drop across the blades

Question: An increase in clearance between reaction blade tips and the turbine casing will result in __________.
Response 1: an increase in rotor thrust load
Response 2: an increased pressure drop across the blades
Response 3: an increase in pressure in the following stage
Response 4: a decrease in pressure in the following stage

Question: Thin tipping is a type of turbine blade design primarily used to __________.
Response 1: increase the effective blade surface area without increasing blade weight
Response 2: prevent any pressure drop from occurring through the moving blades in an impulse turbine
Response 3: provide a means for mounting the shrouding on the blade tips
Response 4: reduce losses due to blade tip leakage in reaction turbines

Question: What is used to compensate for the increased possibility of blade vibration occurring with impulse turbine blading?
Response 1: The decreased pressure drop across the blade due to the thin tip design.
Response 3: Securing the blade tips with shrouding.
Response 4: Seal stripping the groove within the turbine casing.

Question: Which of the following occurs in a single stage of a simple impulse turbine?
Response 1: The steam experiences a single pressure drop through the nozzles and impinges on a row of moving impulse blades.
Response 2: Steam velocity and pressure decreases through the nozzles and impinge on a row of moving reaction blades.
Response 3: Steam expands through the nozzles and impinges on a row of reaction blading causing an additional pressure drop.
Response 4: Steam velocity decreases and pressure increases through the nozzles and impinges on a row of impulse blades.

Question: A pressure drop occurs across both the moving and fixed blades of a reaction turbine as a result of the __________.
Response 1: reversing blades causing a velocity drop with resultant pressure drop
Response 2: conversion of the thermal energy to pressure energy always resulting in a pressure drop
Response 3: interstage diaphragms creating a nozzle effect in the steam flow
Response 4: moving and fixed blades being shaped to act as nozzles

Question: The pressure drop that occurs across both the moving and fixed blades of a reaction turbine is the result of the __________.
Response 1: reversing blades causing a velocity drop with resultant pressure drop
Response 2: conversion of the thermal energy to pressure energy always resulting in a pressure drop
Response 3: interstage diaphragms creating a nozzle effect in the steam flow
Response 4: moving and fixed blades being shaped to act as nozzles

Question: Large temperature and pressure drops which occur in the first stage of a combination impulse and reaction turbine are caused by steam passing through __________.
Response 1: a nozzle diaphragm in the low pressure end of the turbine
Response 2: a single row of blades more than once
Response 3: a dummy piston and cylinder to offset axial thrust
Response 4: one or more velocity-compounded impulse stages at the high pressure end of the turbine

Question: An impulse-reaction turbine is characterized by which of the following arrangements?
Response 1: Reaction blading followed by impulse diaphragms.
Response 2: Stationary nozzles with impulse blading stages.
Response 3: Reaction stages followed by velocity-compounded blading.
Response 4: Velocity-compounded stages followed by reaction blading.

Question: Design characteristics of a velocity-compounded impulse turbine include the utilization of __________.
Response 1: one or more nozzles with one row of rotating blades
Response 2: a single pressure stage with two or more velocity stages
Response 3: a low velocity steam jet from a nozzle
Response 4: two or more simple impulse stages

Question: Which of the following statements represents the function the nozzle assembly performs in an impulse turbine?
Response 1: Converts the steam's thermal energy into kinetic energy by increasing its velocity and directing it against the rotor blades.
Response 2: Provides an area where the steam is prevented from expanding prior to being directed against the rotor blades.
Response 3: Increases the velocity of the steam without a pressure drop across the diaphragm.
Response 4: Converts the potential energy of steam into thermal energy by increasing its pressure and directing it against the turbine blades.

Question: Why are convergent-divergent nozzles used in high-pressure turbine applications?
Response 2: They are less susceptible to steam erosion than other nozzle types due to their shape.
Response 3: They produce a larger pressure drop and therefore are more efficient than other nozzle types.
Response 4: They direct the steam flow more efficiently than other nozzle types.

Question: A pressure-velocity compounded impulse turbine consists of __________.
Response 1: velocity compounding with reaction pressure compounding
Response 2: several rows of moving blades attached to diaphragms
Response 3: two or more stages of velocity compounding
Response 4: two or more rows of nozzles in which no pressure drop exists

Question: In what classification of steam turbines are the moving blades and the adjacent fixed rows of blades shaped to act as nozzles?
The type of turbine shown in the illustration is classified as a __________. See illustration SE-0003.
The type of turbine shown in the illustration is a __________. See illustration SE-0003.
How many Curtis stages are contained in the turbine shown in the illustration? See illustration SE-0003.
Response 4: only a reaction turbine stage is shown

Question: Which of the following descriptions best describes a basic Rateau turbine stage?
Response 1: One set of nozzles and two rows of moving blades.
Response 2: One set of nozzles and one row of moving blades.
Response 3: Two sets of nozzles and two rows of moving blades.
Response 4: Two sets of nozzles and one row of moving blades.

Question: Which of the following designs is an essential feature of the Rateau type turbine?
Response 1: A large pressure and temperature drop occurring in the first stage.
Response 2: The use of alternate rows of fixed and moving blades.
Response 3: The use of a velocity-compounded impulse stage installed at the high pressure end of the turbine.
Response 4: Two or more simple impulse stages aligned in tandem in one casing.

Question: Which of the following statements is correct regarding axial thrust in a high pressure velocity-compounded turbine?
Response 1: Most of the thrust produced is counter balanced by the action of a dummy piston.
Response 2: Only a small portion of the thrust produced is counter balanced by the action of a dummy piston.
Response 3: The thrust is minimized by equalizing holes drilled in the turbine wheels.
Response 4: The thrust is transmitted to and absorbed by the high speed pinion and gear.

Question: To minimize axial thrust in an impulse turbine equalizing holes are located __________.
Response 1: between the steam inlet and the front of the dummy piston
Response 2: between the exhaust outlet and the front of the dummy piston

Question: Steam passing through a multistage impulse turbine does not impart any appreciable axial thrust to the rotor. This is primarily due to the __________.
Response 1: pressure drop taking place through the moving blades
Response 3: equalizing holes provided in the turbine wheel
Response 4: steam velocity decreasing through the nozzle diaphragms

Question: In the turbine and gear set shown in the illustration when going astern the minimum tolerable clearance between the rotor and intermediate or guide blading is __________. See illustration SE-0016.
In an impulse turbine the fixed blades function to __________.
Response 2: change the direction of steam flow

Question: The designed function of fixed blades in an impulse turbine is to __________.
Response 4: change the direction of steam flow

Question: A nozzle in an impulse turbine functions to __________.
Response 2: guide the steam through the fixed blades
Response 3: convert the steam's thermal energy to kinetic energy
Response 4: convert the steam's kinetic energy to thermal energy

Question: Tenon peening is a technique employed by turbine manufacturers to __________.
Response 2: secure shroud bands to turbine blading.
Response 4: secure turbine blading to the rotor

Question: Which of the effects listed describes the changes in the velocity and pressure of the steam as it passes through a nozzle?
A convergent-divergent nozzle functions to __________.
Response 3: decrease steam velocity and increase steam pressure
Response 4: decrease the specific volume of steam

Question: How many pressure drops occur in the turbine stage shown in the illustration? See illustration SE-0003.
In addition to the direction of steam flow which of the descriptions listed may also be used to classify turbines?
Response 1: The method in which the steam causes the turbine rotor to rotate.
Response 2: The type of staging and compounding of steam pressures and velocities.
Response 3: The division of the steam flow.

Question: The factor which determines the minimum amount of steam superheat required at the steam chest inlet of a main propulsion turbine is the __________.
Response 3: moisture content in the steam at the LP end of the turbine
Response 4: specific volume of the steam in the low pressure end of the turbine

Question: Steam supplied to the main propulsion turbines is __________.
The type of turbine shown in the illustration is classified as a ______. See illustration SE-0003.
How many Curtis stages are contained in the turbine shown in the illustration? See illustration SE-0003.
Response 4: only a reaction turbine stage is shown

Question: Concerning the classification of steam turbines a cross compound designed unit __________.
Response 1: consists of reaction stages and a dummy piston
Response 2: consists of one Curtis stage and reaction blading
Response 3: consists of a high pressure turbine crossover pipe and low pressure turbine
Response 4: is made up of a varied assortment of impulse and reaction staging

Question: In a cross-compounded turbine operating at full load the total available steam energy is approximately divided between the HP and LP turbine in the ratio of __________.

A turbine assembly in which steam flows in series through a high pressure turbine and then on to a low pressure turbine with both turbines driving a common reduction gear through separate shafts is classified as _________.
Which of the following types of main propulsion turbines is most likely to require a dummy piston or cylinder arrangement to counterbalance axial thrust?
In a reaction turbine the axial thrust due to the reactive force on the rotor blading drives the rotor __________.
In a cross-compound main propulsion unit the astern turbine is usually installed at the __________.
Response 1: low pressure end of the low pressure turbine
Response 2: high pressure end of the low pressure turbine
Response 3: low pressure end of the high pressure turbine
Response 4: high pressure end of the high pressure turbine

Question: The reversing turbine is normally used for which of the following operations?
In which type of turbine does a pressure drop exist through the fixed blades and the moving blades?
In which type of turbine does the steam pass through reversing chambers machined on the inner surface of the casing causing the steam to be redirected back to the turbine wheel rim?
Response 3: Combination axial and radial flow turbine

Question: Packing rings installed on auxiliary turbines are generally lubricated by __________.
Most auxiliary turbines do not require an external source of gland sealing steam because they __________.
Response 2: exhaust to pressures above atmospheric pressure
Response 3: utilize carbon packing rings at the low pressure end
Response 4: operate with only a small amount of axial thrust

Question: When starting a turbo generator you must provide lube oil pressure to the governor power piston by means of __________.
Response 1: a line from the other generator
Response 2: a line from the gravity tank
Response 4: the hand operated or auxiliary lube oil pump

Question: Which of the following statements would best describe the purpose of operating the hand lube oil pump on an auxiliary turbo-generating unit?
Response 1: It supplements the main lube oil pump flow while paralleling the generators.
Response 2: It empties the governor control reserve prior to shutting down.
Response 3: It assists in opening the governor control valve while starting the unit.
Response 4: It permits the changeover of lube oil filters.

Question: When starting a turbo generator in an automated plant you must provide lube oil pressure to the unit by means of a/an __________.
Response 4: line from the main lube oil pump

Question: When starting a turbo generator in an automated plant you must provide lube oil pressure to the unit by means of __________.
Response 1: a line from the other generator
Response 2: a line from the gravity tank
Response 4: the hand operated or auxiliary lube oil pump

Question: When starting a turbo generator you must initially provide external governor lube oil pressure to ________.
Response 2: raise the nozzle valve lifting beam

Question: When starting a turbo generator in an automated plant you must provide external lube oil pressure to the unit for the purpose of _________.
Response 2: pressurizing the power piston to raise the nozzle lifting beam
Response 4: pressurizing the power piston to lower the nozzle lifting beam

Question: A turbo generator back pressure trip can be actuated as a result of __________.
Response 1: insufficient circulating water flow through the condenser
Response 2: a steam inlet valve being partially open
Response 3: an excessive pressure drop through the turbine

Question: A back pressure trip on an auxiliary turbo generator functions to secure the device if the __________.
Response 2: discharge pressure of a turbine driven pump is excessive
Response 3: gland seal leak off pressure is too high
Response 4: exhaust pressure rises above a preset limit

Question: The safety device provided on a turbo generator which closes the throttle automatically when the cooling water to the condenser is insufficient is called a/an __________.
To test an automatic low lube oil pressure trip on an idling turbo generator and at the same time prevent the chance of bearing damage you should __________.
Response 1: actuate the over speed trip making a note at what pressure the oil is dumped from under the operating piston
Response 2: close the generator steam throttle valve and then ensure a supply of oil through the hand or standby pump when the pressure drops to 5-6 psi
Response 3: secure the steam supply valve to the throttle valve and observe the oil pressure as the throttle trips during the slowdown and ensure a supply of oil with the hand or standby pump when the pressure drops to 2-3 psi
Response 4: ensure the standby lube oil pump if so equipped is properly lined up and set in the 'auto' mode or the hand pump is being operated and then actuate the emergency trip

Question: To test an automatic low lube oil pressure trip on an idling turbo generator and at the same time prevent the chance of bearing damage you should __________.
Response 1: secure the steam supply valve to the throttle valve and observe the lube oil pressure reading when the throttle trips while ensuring an adequate supply of oil with the hand or standby pump as the generator idles to a stop or drops below 3 psi
Response 2: ensure the standby lube oil pump if so equipped is properly lined up and set in the "auto" mode or the hand pump is being operated and then actuate the emergency trip
Response 3: close the generator steam throttle valve and then ensure a supply of oil through the hand or standby pump when the pressure drops to 5-6 psi
Response 4: actuate the over speed trip making a note at what pressure the oil is dumped from under the operating piston

Question: A back pressure trip on a ship's service turbo-generator functions to trip the turbine under what circumstance?
Response 1: lubricating oil pressure is too low
Response 2: amount of cooling water to the condenser is excessive
Response 3: gland seal leak off pressure is too high
Response 4: amount of cooling water to the condenser is insufficient

Question: During a maintenance inspection of a turbo generator the integral turbine wheels are tapped with a hammer. What condition may be indicated by a dull non-resonating sound?
During a maintenance inspection of a turbo generator the integral turbine wheels are tapped with a hammer. What condition may be indicated by a dull non-resonating sound?
Main propulsion steam turbine casing drains generally discharge to the ________.
An efficient seal is normally obtained between the upper and lower halves of a turbine casing by __________.
Turbine casing flanges are sometimes provided with a system of joint grooving to __________.
Response 1: form a labyrinth seal between the casing halves
Response 2: ensure perfect alignment of casing halves
Response 3: inject sealing compound between the casing halves
Response 4: increase contact pressure between the casing halves' flanges

Question: Which of the devices listed is found on an LP main propulsion steam turbine casing?
Labyrinth seals used to reduce leakage around a turbine shaft are constructed of __________.
Response 4: machined metallic packing strips or fins

Question: Where are moisture shields located in a main propulsion steam turbine?
Response 4: After the last stage of the ahead rotor blading

Question: Which of the following statements is true concerning the turbine shown in the illustration? See illustration SE-0016.
Response 1: The low pressure turbine is designed with reaction type stages
Response 2: The astern element is of the Curtis type consisting of two three-row stages
Response 3: A steam deflector is provided between the astern element and the ahead stages of the LP turbine.
Response 4: The ahead rotor can be classified as a helical flow Parsons type turbine

Question: Nozzle diaphragms are installed in pressure-compounded impulse turbines to __________.
Response 3: hold the nozzles of the stage and admit steam to moving blades

Question: The pressure drop existing across the diaphragm of a pressure compounded impulse turbine necessitates __________.
Response 1: installation of a dummy piston and equalizing line to reduce thrust
Response 2: installation of a diaphragm packing seal to minimize interstage leakage
Response 3: circumferential dovetailing to secure the rotor blades
Response 4: Seal stripping the tips of the turbine blades

Question: Because of the pressure drop existing across each diaphragm the flow of steam between the nozzle diaphragm and the rotor of the turbine is held to a minimum by __________.
A turbine diaphragm functions to __________.
Response 1: support moving blades and shrouding in an impulse turbine
Response 2: provide support for interstage packing in a reaction turbine
Response 3: support the nozzles and direct the flow of steam in an impulse turbine
Response 4: decrease steam velocity in the nozzles of an impulse turbine

Question: Shrouding on impulse turbine blading is held in place by __________.
Shrouding with regards to steam turbines is rolled to the curvature of the blade ends and fitted to the blade __________.
Which turbine blade is best suited for high pressure installations?
The correct radial clearances between the rotor and the casing in a propulsion turbine are maintained by the turbine __________.
Which of the bearings listed is used in some turbines to limit axial movement?
The purpose of shroud bands secured to the tips of the turbine blades is to __________.
Response 1: stiffen the blades to reduce vibration
Response 2: increase blade resistance to moisture in steam

Question: One method of securing shroud bands to the ends of the turbine blades is to __________.
Response 1: stiffen the blades to reduce vibration
Response 2: increase blade resistance to moisture in steam

Question: Allowance for axial expansion of the steam turbine due to temperature changes is provided for by the use of __________.
Response 3: a deep flexible I beam support

Question: What is normally used to compensate for thermal expansion and contraction of the main turbine casing?
Why is a flexible I-beam rigidly mounted at the forward end of the main turbine?
Response 1: To relieve stress on the hull.
Response 2: Allow for turbine casing expansion and contraction.
Response 3: To relieve stress at the light end of the turbine.
Response 4: Prevent the reaction developed within the turbine from being transmitted to the hull.

Question: Expansion and contraction of a propulsion turbine casing due to changes in operating temperature are normally compensated by _______.
Response 1: expansion bolts at the base of the steam line
Response 2: an expansion loop in the exhaust line
Response 3: supporting the forward end on a deep flexible I-beam

Question: The purpose of the sentinel valve installed on a turbine casing is to __________.
Response 1: warn the engineer of back flow of steam from the exhaust trunk
Response 2: warn the engineer of excessive pressure in the low pressure turbine casing
Response 3: relieve excess pressure to the turbine extraction points
Response 4: vent excess steam to the main condenser

Question: Which of the components listed is indicated by the "X" shown in the illustration? See illustration SE-0010.
The purpose of oil deflector rings for turbine shafts include __________.
Response 2: preventing oil leakage along the shaft
Response 3: forming the lube oil spray pattern
Response 4: removing emulsified lube oil from the sump

Question: The gland exhaust fan draws steam and non-condensable vapors from the gland exhaust condenser and discharges to the __________.
Which of the listed conditions aids in directing gland leak off steam from the low pressure propulsion turbine to pass through the gland exhaust condenser?
Response 1: Steam pressure from the low pressure turbine.
Response 2: Steam pressure from the high pressure turbine.
Response 3: Compressed air in the air pilot.
Response 4: The use of a gland exhauster fan.

Question: Which of the following statements represents the function of a turbine gland exhaust condenser?
Response 1: Assists in preheating the condensate before it enters the DC heater.
Response 2: Recovers condensate formed at the gland seal exhaust leak off.
Response 3: Directs the gland exhaust from the turbine sealing glands to the air ejector suction.
Response 4: Recovers condensate from the gland leakage around the ahead and astern throttle valves.

Question: Carbon ring packing segments are secured in a shaft gland assembly of a steam turbo generator by means of __________.
When turbine rotor shafts extend through the casing an external source of sealing steam is used in conjunction with labyrinth packing to __________.
Response 2: seal the casing during periods of low casing pressure
Response 3: seal the casing during periods of high casing pressure
Response 4: provide a constant flow to the gland leak off condenser

Question: An intermediate chamber is used in conjunction with labyrinth packing on main turbine shaft glands to provide a __________.
Response 1: pressure relief during periods of low internal vacuum
Response 2: sealing steam supply during periods of low internal pressure
Response 3: sealing steam flow to the throttle
Response 4: suction path to the air ejectors

Question: The labyrinth seals used on rotating steam turbine shafts reduces external leakage by causing __________.
Response 1: successive pressure drops through the seal stages
Response 2: successive temperature drops through the seal stages
Response 3: pressure increases through successive seal stages
Response 4: increased turbulence through successively larger labyrinth clearances

Question: Labyrinth packing rings are installed on turbine diaphragms to minimize __________.
Response 1: interstage steam leakage along the turbine rotor
Response 2: air leakage from entering the turbine casing
Response 3: pressure buildup on both sides of the diaphragm
Response 4: steam from escaping to the atmosphere

Question: When fitting new carbon ring packing on a turbine rotor shaft carefully filing the ends of the segments will ______.
Response 1: reduce the ring segment end clearance
Response 2: reduce the clearance between the assembled ring segments and shaft
Response 3: reduce the possibility of scoring the shaft
Response 4: provide for a greater oil wedge pressure

Question: The labyrinth packing ring in an interstage diaphragm of an impulse turbine is prevented from rotating by _______.
Response 1: a horizontal key joint extending into a slot
Response 2: spring tension exerted on retaining rings
Response 3: steam pressure exerted on the packing segments
Response 4: the weight of the diaphragm acting on the packing ring

Question: Gland sealing steam is used on propulsion turbines to prevent __________.
Response 2: steam leakage through the casing drains
Response 4: reversed steam flow at interstage bleeds

Question: Gland sealing steam is used during steam turbine operation to prevent the loss of __________.
Low pressure steam is used to keep air from leaking into turbine casing along the turbine shaft. For this purpose which of the following steam systems is used?
Response 1: Direct admission of 35 psi (241.3 kPa) auxiliary steam

Question: When a high pressure turbine is operating at sea speed the pressure of the steam leaking through the shaft gland packing may be slightly higher than the pressure setting of the gland seal regulator. In this situation the excess steam at the regulator is directed to the __________.
How is an excess of turbine gland seal steam remedied?
Response 2: It drains to the makeup feed tank.
Response 3: It is directed to the gland exhaust condenser.
Response 4: It is recirculated via the loop seal.

Question: In what positions will the air-operated regulating valves shown in the illustration be in when the steam in the gland seal supply line is excessive? See illustration SE-0020.
Response 3: The excess steam unloading valve is open and the supply pressure control valve is shut.
Response 4: The excess steam unloading valve is shut and the supply pressure control valve is open.

Question: If the gland assembly shown in the illustration is located at the forward end of the high pressure turbine and the vessel is operating at full speed ahead __________. See illustration SE-0006.
Response 1: A slight vacuum would exist at "E"
Response 2: sealing steam would only enter at "F"
Response 3: sealing steam would enter at "E" and "F" from the LP turbine
Response 4: this gland would be self sealing and provide sealing steam to the other glands

Question: If the gland assembly shown in the illustration is located at the forward end of the high pressure turbine and the vessel is operating at minimum maneuvering speeds which of the following statements is true? See illustration SE-0006.
Response 3: Sealing steam would enter at "E" and "F".
Response 4: This gland would be self sealing and provide sealing steam to the other glands.

Question: During maneuvering a vessel has just reached full ahead from a dead slow condition. Which of the following actions reflects the first operation of the gland seal regulator shown in the illustration? See illustration SE-0004.
Response 1: Pilot valve bushing would move downward.
Response 3: Bellows and connecting link would move upward.
Response 4: Needle valve would automatically become seated.

Question: During maneuvering a vessel has just proceeded from full ahead to a dead slow condition. Which of the following actions reflects the first response of the gland seal regulator shown in the illustration? See illustration SE-0004.
Response 3: Bellows and connecting link would move upward.

Question: In the illustrated hydraulically operated turbine gland seal regulator the exhaust dump valve is closed as a result of the piston being actuated by a/an___________. See illustration SE-0019.
In the hydraulically operated turbine gland seal regulator illustrated the device used as the gland seal pressure sensing unit is called a/an __________. See illustration SE-0019.
In the illustration of a hydraulically operated turbine gland seal regulator the gland seal pressure sensing line is labeled ____. See illustration SE-0019.
In the illustration of a hydraulically operated turbine gland seal regulator the gland seal pressure dump valve is labeled ____. See illustration SE-0019.
The main turbine gland sealing system is designed to ______.
Response 1: seal the turbine shaft against air leakage into the turbine casing
Response 2: allow minimal steam leakage out of the gland
Response 3: regulate steam pressure to the glands when the main turbine is operating at reduced speeds

Question: According to illustration piston "F" in the gland seal regulator is moved upward by ________. See illustration SE-0019.
According to the illustration bellows "I" in the gland seal regulator is actuated by ________. See illustration SE-0019.
As shown in the illustration live steam is supplied to the gland seal regulator via ________. See illustration SE-0019.
In the event of failure of the bellows "I" shown in the illustration ________. See illustration SE-0019.
Response 1: piston "F" moves upward to open the exhaust valve and close the makeup steam valve.
Response 2: piston "F" moves upward to close the exhaust valve and open the makeup steam valve
Response 3: piston "F" moves downward to close the exhaust valve and open the steam makeup valve
Response 4: piston 'F" moves downward to open the exhaust valve and close the steam makeup valve

Question: For the gland seal regulator shown in the illustration a decrease in gland seal pressure will result in a ________. See illustration SE-0019.
Response 1: decrease of pressure on the bellows and the pivot rod will move downward
Response 2: increase of pressure on the bellows and the pivot rod will move downward
Response 3: increase of pressure on the bellows and the pivot rod will move upward
Response 4: decrease of pressure on the bellows and the pivot rod will move upward

Question: For the gland seal regulator shown in the illustration an increase in gland seal pressure will result in ________. See illustration SE-0019.
Response 1: piston "F" moving downward to shut the makeup steam valve "B" and open the exhaust valve "E"
Response 2: piston 'F" moving upward to shut the makeup steam valve "B" and open the exhaust valve "E"
Response 3: piston 'F" moving downward to open the makeup steam valve "B" and close the exhaust valve "E"
Response 4: piston "F" moving upward to open the makeup steam valve "B" and close the exhaust valve "E"

Question: When securing a main propulsion turbine equipped with carbon packing glands the vacuum should always be broken before securing the gland seal steam because __________.
Response 1: the turbine rotor expands faster than the gland casing
Response 2: cold air rapidly entering the gland may result in damage to the carbon segments and sealing surfaces
Response 3: loop seal will flood the after condenser
Response 4: gland seal leak off lines will flood with water

Question: Which of the following conditions is indicated by the necessity of providing excessive gland sealing steam pressure to maintain the normal operating conditions of the main propulsion unit?
Response 1: Vacuum leak in the condenser shell.
Response 4: Restriction in the gland leak off piping.

Question: If an operating propulsion unit requires excessive quantities of gland sealing steam you should suspect a __________.
Response 1: vacuum leak in the condenser shell
Response 4: restriction in the gland leak off piping

Question: While a vessel is underway one of the FIRST indications of the failure of the gland leak off exhaust fan motor is __________.
Response 1: loss of vacuum at the turbine
Response 3: water knock in the turbine gland steam header
Response 4: excessive steam leakage at the turbine glands

Question: While a vessel is underway one of the FIRST indications of the failure of the gland leak off exhaust fan motor is __________.
Response 1: excessive steam leakage at the turbine glands
Response 2: loss of vacuum at the turbine
Response 4: water knock on the turbine gland steam header

Question: Which type of packing is primarily utilized to control steam leakage from the casing of a modern auxiliary turbine?
Most auxiliary turbine feed pumps do not require an external source of gland sealing steam because they __________.
Response 2: exhaust to pressures above atmospheric pressure
Response 3: utilize carbon packing rings at the low pressure end
Response 4: operate with only a small amount of axial thrust

Question: A cloudy or milky appearing lube oil sample taken from the main lubricating oil system could be caused by __________.
Response 1: insufficient cooling water to the lube oil cooler
Response 2: excessive cooling water to the lube oil cooler

Question: As shown in the illustration live steam is supplied to the gland seal regulator via ______. See illustration SE-0019.
For the gland seal regulator shown in the illustration an increase in gland seal pressure will result in ______. See illustration SE-0019.
Response 1: piston 'F" moving upward to shut the makeup steam valve "B" and open the exhaust valve "E"
Response 2: piston "F" moving downward to shut the makeup steam valve "B" and open the exhaust valve "E"
Response 3: piston "F" moving upward to open the makeup steam valve "B" and close the exhaust valve "E"
Response 4: piston 'F" moving downward to open the makeup steam valve "B" and close the exhaust valve "E"

Question: An excessive power loss in a straight reaction turbine is commonly caused by __________.
An energy loss associated with a reaction turbine but not an impulse turbine is __________.
The general method of reducing turbine reaction blade vibration is by the use of _______.
Which of the steam losses listed would be associated with a multistage impulse turbine rather than a multistage reaction turbine?
In comparison to a reaction turbine a steam loss specific to an impulse turbine is known as __________.
During an inspection of the main turbine you notice flow marks or discoloration across the diaphragm joints. This condition indicates __________.
Response 1: normal wear for a high temperature unit
Response 3: improper seating of the diaphragm joint
Response 4: excessive chemical treatment of the boiler water

Question: Turbine blade erosion is accelerated by __________.
If the main propulsion turbine begins to vibrate severely while you are increasing speed you should __________.
Response 1: open the throttle wider to pass through the critical speed
Response 2: hold the turbine at that speed until vibration stops
Response 3: stop the turbine and not answer any more bells
Response 4: immediately slow the turbine to see if the vibration will stop

Question: Vibration in main propulsion turbines could be caused by __________.
Response 2: high pressure steam in the first-stage
Response 3: high vacuum in the main condenser

Question: Which of the conditions listed is the most common source of torsional vibration in a geared turbine drive?
What should you do if you detect an abnormal vibration in the operating main propulsion turbine?
Response 1: Notify the chief engineer and stand by the throttles.
Response 2: Immediately slow the turbine until the vibration ceases.
Response 4: Open the turbine drains until the vibration ceases.

Question: Turbine throttling losses can best be described as a loss of energy occurring __________.
Response 1: as a result of friction created when steam passes through the nozzle block
Response 2: whenever there is leakage of steam from one stage to another through the throttle valve packing gland
Response 3: as a result of fluid friction caused by frequently throttling the turbine wheel and blade speed
Response 4: as steam passes through the steam admission valve and there is a drop in pressure without the performance of work

Question: Which of the following statements represents an example of a throttling loss in a turbine?
Response 1: Friction as steam passes over the walls of the nozzles.
Response 2: Steam leaving the last stages of the turbine.
Response 3: Steam passing through a steam admission valve.
Response 4: Steam leaking over the tips of fixed and moving blades.

Question: If a line shaft bearing begins to overheat the shaft speed should be reduced. If overheating persists you should then __________.
Response 1: increase lube oil pressure to the bearing
Response 2: decrease lube oil pressure to the bearing
Response 3: apply emergency cooling water externally to the bearing
Response 4: flood the bearing with a higher viscosity oil to provide emergency lubrication and cooling

Question: Which of the following types of bearings are used as line shaft bearings?
How are line shaft bearings usually lubricated?
Which immediate action should you take when the temperature of one line shaft bearing increases above its normal operating temperature?
Response 1: Stop the unit and carefully inspect the bearing.
Response 2: Stop the unit and replace the bearing.
Response 3: Check the bearing for proper lubrication.
Response 4: Check for proper water circulation to the lube oil coolers.

Question: If a spring bearing begins to run at an abnormally high temperature you should __________.
Response 1: increase the water flow to the main lube oil cooler
Response 2: immediately stop the shaft to prevent seizing
Response 3: reduce the shaft speed and supply emergency cooling water to the spring bearing housing
Response 4: reverse direction of the shaft to flush out the bearing

Question: What statement is true concerning the lubrication of line shaft bearings?
Response 1: Line shaft bearings are generally lubricated by wick lubrication.
Response 2: Line shaft bearing are generally lubricated by force-feed lubrication.
Response 3: Line shaft bearings are generally lubricated by gravity feed lubrication.
Response 4: Line shaft bearings are generally lubricated by oiling rings or discs

Question: What statement is true concerning the ability of a line shaft bearing to adapt to shaft misalignment as the ship's hull flexes?
Response 1: Some line shaft bearings may have only a bottom half bearing shell which allows for deflection upwards only. Other line shaft bearings may be spherically-seated self-aligning bearings or conventional non-aligning type bearings.
Response 2: All line shaft bearings have only a top half bearing shell which allows for deflection downwards only. As such no provision is made for allowing for deflection in other directions.
Response 3: All line shaft bearings have only a bottom half bearing shell which allows for deflection upwards only. As such no provision is made for allowing for deflection in other directions.
Response 4: Some line shaft bearings may have only a top half bearing shell which allows for deflection downwards only. Other line shaft bearings may be spherically-seated self-aligning bearings or conventional non-aligning type bearings.

Question: Which line shaft bearing is most likely to have both upper and lower half bearing shells on merchant ships?
Response 2: The forward most line shaft bearing.
Response 3: All line shaft bearings have only a lower bearing shell.

Question: Concerning the arrangements of a disk-oiled line shaft bearing what statement is true?
Response 1: The disk is clamped to the shaft with the lowermost part immersed in oil and the distribution of the oil to the bearing is by the action of an oil wick.
Response 2: The disk fits loosely on the shaft with the lowermost part immersed in oil and the distribution of the oil to the bearing is by wick action
Response 3: The disk is clamped to the shaft with the lowermost part immersed in oil and the distribution of the oil to the bearing is by the action of an oil scraper.
Response 4: The disk fits loosely on the shaft with the lowermost part immersed in oil and the distribution of the oil to the bearing is similar to the action of oiling rings.

Question: What statement is true concerning the arrangement of line shaft bearing housings?
Response 1: Line shaft bearing housings are typically split half pedestal type bearing housings.
Response 2: Line shaft bearing housings are typically single-piece pedestal type bearing housings.
Response 3: Line shaft bearing housings are typically single-piece flange type bearing housings.
Response 4: Line shaft bearing housings are typically split half flange type bearing housings.

Question: Concerning the proper lubrication of a ring-oiled line shaft bearing what statement is true?
Response 1: The oil level should be maintained high enough so that some oil is seen exiting the bearing along the shaft.
Response 2: The oil level should be high enough so that the oiling rings dip into the oil but the rings must not be allowed to freely rotate with the shaft.
Response 3: The oil level should be high enough so that the oiling rings dip into the oil and the rings must freely rotate with the shaft.
Response 4: The oil level should be maintained high enough so that the entire bearing is continuously flooded.

Question: According to regulations (46 CFR) who may grant an extension of the tailshaft examination interval?
Response 1: Officer in Charge Marine Inspection office
Response 3: Authorized Representative of the American Bureau of Shipping
Response 4: Official Representative of the Naval Pollution Control Office

Question: Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) permit the interval required for drawing certain tailshafts to be extended by the __________.
Which of the following statements best describes an oil lubricated stern tube bearing installation?
Response 1: It receives its oil supply from a branch line of the main lube oil system.
Response 2: No shaft liner is needed in the area of the babbitted bearing surface.
Response 3: The system pressure must be lowered when maneuvering in port to prevent blowing the outer oil seal.
Response 4: For precise regulation of the bearing temperature the system is required to have its own oil cooler.

Question: Which of the following statements best describes an oil lubricated stern tube bearing installation?
Response 1: It receives its oil supply from a branch line of the main lube oil system.
Response 2: No shaft liner is needed in the area of the babbitted bearing surface.
Response 3: The system pressure must be lowered when maneuvering in port to prevent blowing the outer oil seal.
Response 4: Oil lubricated stern tube bearings operate partially submerged in oil at low propeller speeds.

Question: Stern tube and strut bearings lined with hardwood or rubber composition materials are lubricated with __________.
Which of the following statements represents an operating characteristic of neoprene or rubber stern tube bearings?
Response 2: The bearing is normally lubricated by seawater.
Response 3: Cathodic protection for the propeller is not required.
Response 4: Neoprene and rubber bearings require oil lubrication.

Question: Which of the following statements describes the purpose of the split inflatable seal installed aft of the primary seal assembly for the propeller shaft?
Response 1: To serve as a seal when adding packing to the stuffing box.
Response 2: To allow repair or replacement of the primary seal elements when the ship is waterborne.
Response 3: To eliminate leakage via the propeller shaft when the shaft is not rotating.
Response 4: To provide a ready means for the entry of cooling water.

Question: Shown in the illustration is a mechanical shaft seal providing constant surface contact regardless of hull deflections draft or sea conditions while underway. This is ensured by the __________. See illustration GS-0135.
The device used to retain the packing that keeps water from entering the ship through the opening where the propeller shaft passes through the hull is called a __________.
An excessive amount of water is prevented from entering a vessel using a water lubricated stern tube bearing by the use of the __________.
Which of the devices listed prevents water from entering a ship's hull via the propulsion shaft?
Response 1: Stern tube packing or mechanical shaft seal

Question: The tail shaft of an ocean going vessel is usually supported by the __________.

In a water cooled stern tube a slight leakage of water across the packing gland is provided to __________.
Response 1: flush all dirt and grit from the gland
Response 2: flush all dirt and grit from the bearing staves
Response 4: keep the stern tube fair water cool

Question: When a vessel is underway a small amount of water is allowed to leak through the water lubricated stern tube stuffing box in order to __________.

Response 3: ensure positive coolant flow through the strut bearings
Response 4: prevent seizing of the rubber strips in the bearing bushing

Question: In order to prevent overheating of the packing in the stern tube stuffing box __________.
Response 1: the gland is properly adjusted to permit a slight leakage of sea water
Response 3: cooling water is supplied from the fresh water cooling system
Response 4: the gland nuts must be tightly taken up to prevent any water leakage

Question: Some vessels are equipped with a water lubricated stern tube. When at sea operating under normal conditions the water service valve from the ship's saltwater system to the bearing should be __________.
Response 1: closed and no leakage permitted across the shaft packing
Response 2: closed and only slight leakage permitted across the shaft packing
Response 3: open and no leakage permitted across the shaft packing
Response 4: open and only slight leakage permitted across the shaft packing

Question: Water leaking through the stern tube stuffing box is used to accomplish which of the following actions?

Response 1: assist in flushing out all packing strips when renewing packing underway
Response 2: provide a positive flow of water through the stern tube for lubricating cooling and flushing when required
Response 3: flush out brackish water resulting from extended in port operation
Response 4: serve as the only source of supply of water for the stern tube bearing

Question: The exposed portion of the outboard propeller shaft is protected against seawater corrosion by __________.
Response 2: a covering of plastic rubber or shrunk-on composition sleeve
Response 4: a layer of oxidation formed when the metal of the shaft is exposed to seawater

Question: Which of the following actions pertaining to saltwater lubricated stern tube stuffing boxes is usually observed when the ship is expected to be in port for an extended period?
Response 1: The stuffing box is continually flushed.
Response 2: The drain connection is left opened.
Response 3: The stuffing box gland is tightened.

Question: The lignum vitae in a stern tube bearing is normally lubricated with __________.

Response 2: Stress relief grooves at the forward end of the propeller and aft end of the liner.

Question: According to 46 CFR the tailshafts of a twin screw ocean going vessel must be examined and inspected in the presence of a marine inspector ______.
Response 1: each time the vessel is dry-docked

Question: When the tail shaft is drawn from a vessel in dry-dock which of the following inspections is required to be carried out?

Response 4: The shaft liner should be removed and inspected for cracks.

Question: Coast Guard Regulations (46 CFR) require a single tail shaft with water lubricated tail shaft bearings stress-relieved keyway and fabricated from materials resistant to corrosion by sea water to be drawn and examined once in every __________.

The vessel has its propulsion machinery located amidships using a water lubricated stern tube bearing to carry a tail shaft of a 15 inch (38.1 cm) diameter. During the inspection the wear between the stern tube and the bearing surface was measured as 1/4 inch (.635 cm). Which of the following actions should be carried out as a result of this measurement?
Response 1: Pull tail shaft and replace the bronze liner.
Response 2: Pull tail shaft and replace the lignum vitae.
Response 3: Pull tail shaft and buildup the bronze liner.

Question: According to 46 CFR Part 61 what is the maximum allowable permitted wear on a stern tube bushing for a vessel that has its propelling machinery located amidships with a water lubricated stern tube bearing carrying a 12 inch diameter shaft ?

Response 1: An increase in sea water temperature.
Response 2: The entry of sea water into the system.
Response 3: An increase in the stern bearing operating temperature.
Response 4: A worn or damaged stern tube seal.

Question: Which letter represents the gear tooth working depth of the gear set illustrated? See illustration GS-0111.

Question: In herringbone helical gear sets the tooth contact loading __________.
Response 1: is both a sliding and rolling action
Response 2: is distributed over several teeth simultaneously
Response 3: is distributed between two opposing helices

Question: Helical gears are preferred over spur gears for reduction gear units due to they fact that they __________.

Question: The gear drive shown in the illustration can have the backlash determined best by using a __________. See illustration MO-0091.

What is an example of an epicyclic gear?
Which of the listed reduction gear sets has the input and output shafts in-line with one another?
What is a shipboard application for a worm gear drive?
In a double articulated reduction gear system the component labeled "2" would be identified as the _________? See illustration SE-0005.
In a double articulated reduction gear system the component labeled "3" would be identified as the _______. See illustration SE-0005.
In a double articulated reduction gear system the component labeled "1" would be identified as the _________? See illustration SE-0005.
From the data shown in the illustration what would be the speed of the L.P. turbine rotor if the propeller shaft was turning at 90 RPM? See illustration SE-0022.
Which of the following operational practices is helpful in avoiding the accumulation of condensate in the main reduction gear casing?
Response 1: Always ensure that the lubricating oil pressure is 14-17 psi when operating in unusually cold waters.
Response 2: The temperature of the lubricating oil should not exceed the gear manufacturer's recommendation when the unit is operating at full load.
